stanzas.sanskrit: सोम॑स्य मा त॒वसं॒ वक्ष्य॑ग्ने॒ वह्निं॑ चकर्थ वि॒दथे॒ यज॑ध्यै दे॒वाँ अच्छा॒ दीद्य॑द्यु॒ञ्जे अद्रिं॑ शमा॒ये अ॑ग्ने त॒न्वं॑ जुषस्व
stanzas.transliteration: sómasya mā tavásaṃ vákṣy agne váhniṃ cakartha vidáthe yájadhyai devā́m̐ áchā dī́dyad yuñjé ádriṃ śamāyé agne tanvàṃ juṣasva
stanzas.translation: THOU, Agni, who wilt have the strong, hast made me the Soma's priest, to worship in assembly. Thou shinest to the Gods, I set the pressstones. I toil; be joyful in thyself, O Agni.

translations.griffith: THOU, Agni, who wilt have the strong, hast made me the Soma's priest, to worship in assembly. Thou shinest to the Gods, I set the pressstones. I toil; be joyful in thyself, O Agni.
translations.oldenberg: Thou wilt have me, O Agni, as a strong (master) of Soma 1: therefore thou hast made me the carrier (of the gods?) to perform worship at the sacrifice 2. Sending my thoughts to the gods 3 I make the (press-) stone ready 4; I toil, O Agni: find thou pleasure in thy own body 5.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्राञ्चं॑ य॒ज्ञं च॑कृम॒ वर्ध॑तां॒ गीः स॒मिद्भि॑र॒ग्निं नम॑सा दुवस्यन् दि॒वः श॑शासुर्वि॒दथा॑ कवी॒नां गृत्सा॑य चित्त॒वसे॑ गा॒तुमी॑षुः
stanzas.transliteration: prā́ñcaṃ yajñáṃ cakr̥ma várdhatāṃ gī́ḥ samídbhir agníṃ námasā duvasyan diváḥ śaśāsur vidáthā kavīnā́ṃ gŕ̥tsāya cit taváse gātúm īṣuḥ
stanzas.translation: East have we turned the rite; may the hymn aid it. With wood and worship shall they honour Agni. From heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it: c'en for the quick and strong they seek advancement.

translations.griffith: East have we turned the rite; may the hymn aid it. With wood and worship shall they honour Agni. From heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it: c'en for the quick and strong they seek advancement.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Eastward we have turned the sacrifice 2; may the prayer increase. They honoured Agni with fuel and adoration. They have taught (him) the sacrificial ordinances of the sages of Heaven 3. Though he (Agni) is clever and strong, they have sought a way for him.

stanzas.sanskrit: मयो॑ दधे॒ मेधि॑रः पू॒तद॑क्षो दि॒वः सु॒बन्धु॑र्ज॒नुषा॑ पृथि॒व्याः अवि॑न्दन्नु दर्श॒तम॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तर्दे॒वासो॑ अ॒ग्निम॒पसि॒ स्वसॄ॑णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: máyo dadhe médhiraḥ pūtádakṣo diváḥ subándhur janúṣā pr̥thivyā́ḥ ávindann u darśatám apsv àntár devā́so agním apási svásr̥̄ṇām
stanzas.translation: The Prudent, he whose will is pure, brought welfare, allied by birth to Heaven and Earth in kinship. The Gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful Agni with the Sisters' labour.

translations.griffith: The Prudent, he whose will is pure, brought welfare, allied by birth to Heaven and Earth in kinship. The Gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful Agni with the Sisters' labour.
translations.oldenberg: He has conceived freshness 1, the wise one of pure 2 powers, he who is by his birth well allied with Heaven and Earth. The gods have found Agni the conspicuous one in the waters, in the work 3 of the sisters.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑र्धयन्त्सु॒भगं॑ स॒प्त य॒ह्वीः श्वे॒तं ज॑ज्ञा॒नम॑रु॒षं म॑हि॒त्वा शिशुं॒ न जा॒तम॒भ्या॑रु॒रश्वा॑ दे॒वासो॑ अ॒ग्निं जनि॑मन्वपुष्यन्
stanzas.transliteration: ávardhayan subhágaṃ saptá yahvī́ḥ śvetáṃ jajñānám aruṣám mahitvā́ śíśuṃ ná jātám abhy ā̀rur áśvāḥ- devā́so agníṃ jániman vapuṣyan
stanzas.translation: Him, Blessed One, the Seven strong Floods augmented, him white at birth and red when waxen mighty. As mother mares run to their new-born you ling, so at his birth the Gods wondered at Agni.

translations.griffith: Him, Blessed One, the Seven strong Floods augmented, him white at birth and red when waxen mighty. As mother mares run to their new-born you ling, so at his birth the Gods wondered at Agni.
translations.oldenberg: The seven young (wives) 1 made the blessed one grow who had been born white, ruddy in his growth. They ran up to him like mares 2 to a newborn foal. The gods wondered at Agni at his birth.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒क्रेभि॒रङ्गै॒ रज॑ आतत॒न्वान्क्रतुं॑ पुना॒नः क॒विभिः॑ प॒वित्रैः॑ शो॒चिर्वसा॑नः॒ पर्यायु॑र॒पां श्रियो॑ मिमीते बृह॒तीरनू॑नाः
stanzas.transliteration: śukrébhir áṅgai rája ātatanvā́n krátum punānáḥ kavíbhiḥ pavítraiḥ śocír vásānaḥ páry ā́yur apā́ṃ śríyo mimīte br̥hatī́r ánūnāḥ
stanzas.translation: Spreading with radiant limbs throughout the region, purging his power with wise purifications, Robing himself in light, the life of waters, lie spreads abroad his high and perfect glories.

translations.griffith: Spreading with radiant limbs throughout the region, purging his power with wise purifications, Robing himself in light, the life of waters, lie spreads abroad his high and perfect glories.
translations.oldenberg: Spreading with his bright limbs to the aerial space, purifying his power 1 by wise purifications, clothing himself in light, the life of the waters 2, he creates mighty, perfect beauty.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒व्राजा॑ सी॒मन॑दती॒रद॑ब्धा दि॒वो य॒ह्वीरव॑साना॒ अन॑ग्नाः सना॒ अत्र॑ युव॒तयः॒ सयो॑नी॒रेकं॒ गर्भं॑ दधिरे स॒प्त वाणीः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vavrā́jā sīm ánadatīr ádabdhāḥ- divó yahvī́r ávasānā ánagnāḥ sánā átra yuvatáyaḥ sáyonīr ékaṃ gárbhaṃ dadhire saptá vā́ṇīḥ
stanzas.translation: He sought heaven's Mighty Ones, the unconsuming, the unimpaired, not clothed and yet not naked. Then they, ancient and young, who dwell together, Seven sounding Rivers, as one germ received him.

translations.griffith: He sought heaven's Mighty Ones, the unconsuming, the unimpaired, not clothed and yet not naked. Then they, ancient and young, who dwell together, Seven sounding Rivers, as one germ received him.
translations.oldenberg: He has gone to (the waters) who do not eat, the undeceived ones, the young (daughters) of Heaven who are not clothed and (yet) are not naked. Here the former young (women) having the same origin, the seven sounds 1 have conceived one germ.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्ती॒र्णा अ॑स्य सं॒हतो॑ वि॒श्वरू॑पा घृ॒तस्य॒ योनौ॑ स्र॒वथे॒ मधू॑नाम् अस्थु॒रत्र॑ धे॒नवः॒ पिन्व॑माना म॒ही द॒स्मस्य॑ मा॒तरा॑ समी॒ची
stanzas.transliteration: stīrṇā́ asya saṃháto viśvárūpāḥ- ghr̥tásya yónau sraváthe mádhūnām ásthur átra dhenávaḥ pínvamānāḥ- mahī́ dasmásya mātárā samīcī́
stanzas.translation: His piles, assuming every form, are scattered where flow sweet waters, at the spring of fatness; There stood the milch-kine with full-laden udders, and both paired Mighty Mothers of the Wondrous.

translations.griffith: His piles, assuming every form, are scattered where flow sweet waters, at the spring of fatness; There stood the milch-kine with full-laden udders, and both paired Mighty Mothers of the Wondrous.
translations.oldenberg: His compact masses assuming every shape are spread in the womb of ghee, in the streaming of honey. There the swelling milch-cows have stationed themselves. Great are the parents of the wonderfully mighty (Agni) who are turned towards each other 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब॒भ्रा॒णः सू॑नो सहसो॒ व्य॑द्यौ॒द्दधा॑नः शु॒क्रा र॑भ॒सा वपूं॑षि श्चोत॑न्ति॒ धारा॒ मधु॑नो घृ॒तस्य॒ वृषा॒ यत्र॑ वावृ॒धे काव्ये॑न
stanzas.transliteration: babhrāṇáḥ sūno sahaso vy àdyaud dádhānaḥ śukrā́ rabhasā́ vápūṃṣi ścótanti dhā́rā mádhuno ghr̥tásya vŕ̥ṣā yátra vāvr̥dhé kā́vyena
stanzas.translation: Carefully cherished, Son of Strength, thou shoncst assuming lasting and refulgent beauties. Full streams of fatness and sweet juice descended, there where the Mighty One grew strong by wisdom.

translations.griffith: Carefully cherished, Son of Strength, thou shoncst assuming lasting and refulgent beauties. Full streams of fatness and sweet juice descended, there where the Mighty One grew strong by wisdom.
translations.oldenberg: Having been carried (in the waters) thou hast shone forth, O son of strength, assuming wonderful shapes brilliant and fierce. The streams of honey and ghee drip, where the male has grown by wisdom.

stanzas.sanskrit: पि॒तुश्चि॒दूध॑र्ज॒नुषा॑ विवेद॒ व्य॑स्य॒ धारा॑ असृज॒द्वि धेनाः॑ गुहा॒ चर॑न्तं॒ सखि॑भिः शि॒वेभि॑र्दि॒वो य॒ह्वीभि॒र्न गुहा॑ बभूव
stanzas.transliteration: pitúś cid ū́dhar janúṣā viveda vy àsya dhā́rā asr̥jad ví dhénāḥ gúhā cárantaṃ sákhibhiḥ śivébhir divó yahvī́bhir ná gúhā babhūva
stanzas.translation: From birth he knew even his Father's bosom, he set his voices and his streams in motion; Knew him who moved with blessed Friends in secret, with the young Dames of heaven. He stayed not hidden.

translations.griffith: From birth he knew even his Father's bosom, he set his voices and his streams in motion; Knew him who moved with blessed Friends in secret, with the young Dames of heaven. He stayed not hidden.
translations.oldenberg: By (his) nature he has found his father's udder 1; he has sent forth his streams and his showers 2. Walking 3 hidden to his dear friends he has not been hidden to the young (daughters) of Heaven 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: पि॒तुश्च॒ गर्भं॑ जनि॒तुश्च॑ बभ्रे पू॒र्वीरेको॑ अधय॒त्पीप्या॑नाः वृष्णे॑ स॒पत्नी॒ शुच॑ये॒ सब॑न्धू उ॒भे अ॑स्मै मनु॒ष्ये॒३॒॑ नि पा॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: pitúś ca gárbhaṃ janitúś ca babhre pūrvī́r éko adhayat pī́pyānāḥ vŕ̥ṣṇe sapátnī śúcaye sábandhū ubhé asmai manuṣyè ní pāhi
stanzas.translation: He nursed the Infant of the Sire and Maker: alone the Babe sucked many a teeming bosom. Guard, for the Bright and Strong, the fellow-spouses friendly to men and bound to him in kinship.

translations.griffith: He nursed the Infant of the Sire and Maker: alone the Babe sucked many a teeming bosom. Guard, for the Bright and Strong, the fellow-spouses friendly to men and bound to him in kinship.
translations.oldenberg: He bore (in his womb) the germ of the sire, of the father who begat him 1. He, being one, sucked many (nurses) rich in milk 2. Observe for this manly, bright one the two wives bound in kinship, belonging to men 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒रौ म॒हाँ अ॑निबा॒धे व॑व॒र्धापो॑ अ॒ग्निं य॒शसः॒ सं हि पू॒र्वीः ऋ॒तस्य॒ योना॑वशय॒द्दमू॑ना जामी॒नाम॒ग्निर॒पसि॒ स्वसॄ॑णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: uraú mahā́m̐ anibādhé vavardha- -ā́po agníṃ yaśásaḥ sáṃ hí pūrvī́ḥ r̥tásya yónāv aśayad dámūnāḥ- jāmīnā́m agnír apási svásr̥̄ṇām
stanzas.translation: The Mighty One increased in space unbounded; full many a glorious flood gave strength to Agni. Friend of the house, within the lap of Order lay Agni, in the Sister Rivers' service.

translations.griffith: The Mighty One increased in space unbounded; full many a glorious flood gave strength to Agni. Friend of the house, within the lap of Order lay Agni, in the Sister Rivers' service.
translations.oldenberg: The great one has grown up in the wide unbounded space 1. The Waters (have made) Agni (grow): for many glorious ones 2 (have come) together 3. He lay in the womb of Rita, the domestic (god) Agni, in the work 4 of the uterine sisters.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒क्रो न ब॒भ्रिः स॑मि॒थे म॒हीनां॑ दिदृ॒क्षेयः॑ सू॒नवे॒ भाऋ॑जीकः उदु॒स्रिया॒ जनि॑ता॒ यो ज॒जाना॒पां गर्भो॒ नृत॑मो य॒ह्वो अ॒ग्निः
stanzas.transliteration: akró ná babhríḥ samithé mahī́nāṃ didr̥kṣéyaḥ sūnáve bhā́r̥jīkaḥ úd usríyā jánitā yó jajā́na- -apā́ṃ gárbho nŕ̥tamo yahvó agníḥ
stanzas.translation: As keen supporter where great waters gather, light-shedder whom the brood rejoice to look on; He who begat, and will beget, the dawnlights, most manly, Child of Floods, is youthful Agni.

translations.griffith: As keen supporter where great waters gather, light-shedder whom the brood rejoice to look on; He who begat, and will beget, the dawnlights, most manly, Child of Floods, is youthful Agni.
translations.oldenberg: Like a horse that carries (the prize), in the assembly of the great (waters) 1, visible to his son 2, he whose … is light 3: he who as father begat the ruddy cows 4, he the son of the waters is the most manly, restless 5 Agni.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒पां गर्भं॑ दर्श॒तमोष॑धीनां॒ वना॑ जजान सु॒भगा॒ विरू॑पम् दे॒वास॑श्चि॒न्मन॑सा॒ सं हि ज॒ग्मुः पनि॑ष्ठं जा॒तं त॒वसं॑ दुवस्यन्
stanzas.transliteration: apā́ṃ gárbhaṃ darśatám óṣadhīnām vánā jajāna subhágā vírūpam devā́saś cin mánasā sáṃ hí jagmúḥ pániṣṭhaṃ jātáṃ tavásaṃ duvasyan
stanzas.translation: Him, varied in his form, the lovely Infant of floods and plants the blessed wood hath gendered. Gods even, moved in spirit, came around him, and served him at his birth, the Strong, the Wondrous.

translations.griffith: Him, varied in his form, the lovely Infant of floods and plants the blessed wood hath gendered. Gods even, moved in spirit, came around him, and served him at his birth, the Strong, the Wondrous.
translations.oldenberg: To him, the glorious son of the waters and of the plants, the blessed wood 1 has given birth, in his many shapes. Even the gods, for they agreed in their mind, honoured him who had been born the most wonderful and strong.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृ॒हन्त॒ इद्भा॒नवो॒ भाऋ॑जीकम॒ग्निं स॑चन्त वि॒द्युतो॒ न शु॒क्राः गुहे॑व वृ॒द्धं सद॑सि॒ स्वे अ॒न्तर॑पा॒र ऊ॒र्वे अ॒मृतं॒ दुहा॑नाः
stanzas.transliteration: br̥hánta íd bhānávo bhā́r̥jīkam agníṃ sacanta vidyúto ná śukrā́ḥ gúheva vr̥ddháṃ sádasi své antár apārá ūrvé amŕ̥taṃ dúhānāḥ
stanzas.translation: Like brilliant lightnings, mighty luminaries accompany the light-diffusing Agni, Waxen, as 'twere in secret, in his dwelling, while in the boundless stall they milk out Amrit.

translations.griffith: Like brilliant lightnings, mighty luminaries accompany the light-diffusing Agni, Waxen, as 'twere in secret, in his dwelling, while in the boundless stall they milk out Amrit.
translations.oldenberg: Mighty rays of light like brilliant lightnings, milking (the sap of) immortality in the boundless stable, accompanied Agni whose … is light 1, who had grown up in his own house, as it were in secret.

stanzas.sanskrit: ईळे॑ च त्वा॒ यज॑मानो ह॒विर्भि॒रीळे॑ सखि॒त्वं सु॑म॒तिं निका॑मः दे॒वैरवो॑ मिमीहि॒ सं ज॑रि॒त्रे रक्षा॑ च नो॒ दम्ये॑भि॒रनी॑कैः
stanzas.transliteration: ī́ḷe ca tvā yájamāno havírbhir ī́ḷe sakhitváṃ sumatíṃ níkāmaḥ devaír ávo mimīhi sáṃ jaritré rákṣā ca no dámyebhir ánīkaiḥ
stanzas.translation: I sacrificing serve thee with oblations and crave with longing thy good-will and friendship. Grant, with the Gods, thy grace to him who lauds thee, protect us with thy rays that guard the homestead.

translations.griffith: I sacrificing serve thee with oblations and crave with longing thy good-will and friendship. Grant, with the Gods, thy grace to him who lauds thee, protect us with thy rays that guard the homestead.
translations.oldenberg: I magnify thee, worshipping thee with offerings; I magnify (thee) desirous of thy friendship, of thy favour. Together with the gods give help to him who praises thee, and protect us with thy domestic faces.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒प॒क्षे॒तार॒स्तव॑ सुप्रणी॒तेऽग्ने॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ धन्या॒ दधा॑नाः सु॒रेत॑सा॒ श्रव॑सा॒ तुञ्ज॑माना अ॒भि ष्या॑म पृतना॒यूँरदे॑वान्
stanzas.transliteration: upakṣetā́ras táva supraṇīte- -ágne víśvāni dhányā dádhānāḥ surétasā śrávasā túñjamānāḥ- abhí ṣyāma pr̥tanāyū́m̐r ádevān
stanzas.translation: May we, O Agni, thou who leadest wisely, thy followers and masters of all treasures, Strong in the glory of our noble offspring, subdue the godless when they seek the battle.

translations.griffith: May we, O Agni, thou who leadest wisely, thy followers and masters of all treasures, Strong in the glory of our noble offspring, subdue the godless when they seek the battle.
translations.oldenberg: As thy followers, O Agni, best leader, winning all precious (treasures), pressing onward with fertile glory, may we overcome the godless who seek to combat us.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ दे॒वाना॑मभवः के॒तुर॑ग्ने म॒न्द्रो विश्वा॑नि॒ काव्या॑नि वि॒द्वान् प्रति॒ मर्ताँ॑ अवासयो॒ दमू॑ना॒ अनु॑ दे॒वान्र॑थि॒रो या॑सि॒ साध॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ devā́nām abhavaḥ ketúr agne mandró víśvāni kā́vyāni vidvā́n práti mártām̐ avāsayo dámūnāḥ- ánu devā́n rathiró yāsi sā́dhan
stanzas.translation: Ensign of Gods hast thou become, O Agni, joy-giver, knower of all secret wisdom. Friend of the homestead, thou hast lightened mortals: carborne thou goest to the Gods, fulfilling.

translations.griffith: Ensign of Gods hast thou become, O Agni, joy-giver, knower of all secret wisdom. Friend of the homestead, thou hast lightened mortals: carborne thou goest to the Gods, fulfilling.
translations.oldenberg: Thou hast been here as the banner of the gods, Agni, joy-giving, knowing all wisdom. As the domestic (god) thou hast harboured the mortals. As the charioteer thou goest along straightway after the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि दु॑रो॒णे अ॒मृतो॒ मर्त्या॑नां॒ राजा॑ ससाद वि॒दथा॑नि॒ साध॑न् घृ॒तप्र॑तीक उर्वि॒या व्य॑द्यौद॒ग्निर्विश्वा॑नि॒ काव्या॑नि वि॒द्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: ní duroṇé amŕ̥to mártyānāṃ rā́jā sasāda vidáthāni sā́dhan ghr̥tápratīka urviyā́ vy àdyaud agnír víśvāni kā́vyāni vidvā́n
stanzas.translation: Within the house hath sate the King immortal of mortals, filling full their sacred synods. Bedewed with holy oil he shineth widely, Agni, the knower of all secret wisdom.

translations.griffith: Within the house hath sate the King immortal of mortals, filling full their sacred synods. Bedewed with holy oil he shineth widely, Agni, the knower of all secret wisdom.
translations.oldenberg: The immortal, the king, has sat down in the dwelling of the mortals, performing the sacrifices 1. He the ghee-faced one has shone forth widely, Agni knowing all wisdom.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ गहि स॒ख्येभिः॑ शि॒वेभि॑र्म॒हान्म॒हीभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ सर॒ण्यन् अ॒स्मे र॒यिं ब॑हु॒लं संत॑रुत्रं सु॒वाचं॑ भा॒गं य॒शसं॑ कृधी नः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no gahi sakhyébhiḥ śivébhir mahā́n mahī́bhir ūtíbhiḥ saraṇyán asmé rayím bahuláṃ sáṃtarutraṃ suvā́cam bhāgáṃ yaśásaṃ kr̥dhī naḥ
stanzas.translation: Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, come speeding, Mighty, with thy mighty succours. Grant us abundant wealth that saves from danger, that brings a good repute, a glorious portion.

translations.griffith: Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, come speeding, Mighty, with thy mighty succours. Grant us abundant wealth that saves from danger, that brings a good repute, a glorious portion.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Come to us with thy gracious friendship, speeding, great, with thy great blessings. Bestow on us plentiful victorious wealth; make our share glorious and adorned with fine speech.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ता ते॑ अग्ने॒ जनि॑मा॒ सना॑नि॒ प्र पू॒र्व्याय॒ नूत॑नानि वोचम् म॒हान्ति॒ वृष्णे॒ सव॑ना कृ॒तेमा जन्म॑ञ्जन्म॒न्निहि॑तो जा॒तवे॑दाः
stanzas.transliteration: etā́ te agne jánimā sánāni prá pūrvyā́ya nū́tanāni vocam mahā́nti vŕ̥ṣṇe sávanā kr̥témā́ jánmañ-janman níhito jātávedāḥ
stanzas.translation: To thee who art of old these songs, O Agni, have I declared, the ancient and the later. These great libations to the Strong are offiered: in every birth is Jâtavedas stablished.

translations.griffith: To thee who art of old these songs, O Agni, have I declared, the ancient and the later. These great libations to the Strong are offiered: in every birth is Jâtavedas stablished.
translations.oldenberg: These old births of thine, O Agni, and the recent ones I have told forth to thee the ancient one. These great libations (of Soma) have been prepared for the manly one; generation by generation Gâtavedas has been placed (on the altar).

stanzas.sanskrit: जन्म॑ञ्जन्म॒न्निहि॑तो जा॒तवे॑दा वि॒श्वामि॑त्रेभिरिध्यते॒ अज॑स्रः तस्य॑ व॒यं सु॑म॒तौ य॒ज्ञिय॒स्यापि॑ भ॒द्रे सौ॑मन॒से स्या॑म
stanzas.transliteration: jánmañ-janman níhito jātávedāḥ viśvā́mitrebhir idhyate ájasraḥ tásya vayáṃ sumataú yajñíyasya- -ápi bhadré saumanasé syāma
stanzas.translation: Stablished in every birth is Jâtavedas, kindled perpetual by the Viṣvâmitras. May we rest ever in the loving-kindness, in the auspicious grace of him the Holy.

translations.griffith: Stablished in every birth is Jâtavedas, kindled perpetual by the Viṣvâmitras. May we rest ever in the loving-kindness, in the auspicious grace of him the Holy.
translations.oldenberg: Gâtavedas, placed (on the altar) generation after generation, is kindled by the Visvâmitras, the indefatigable (or everlasting). May we dwell in the grace of him the worshipful, yea, in his blissful kindness.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं य॒ज्ञं स॑हसाव॒न्त्वं नो॑ देव॒त्रा धे॑हि सुक्रतो॒ ररा॑णः प्र यं॑सि होतर्बृह॒तीरिषो॒ नोऽग्ने॒ महि॒ द्रवि॑ण॒मा य॑जस्व
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ yajñáṃ sahasāvan tváṃ no devatrā́ dhehi sukrato rárāṇaḥ prá yaṃsi hotar br̥hatī́r íṣo naḥ- -ágne máhi dráviṇam ā́ yajasva
stanzas.translation: This sacrifice of ours do thou, O Mighty, O truly Wise, bear to the Gods rejoicing. Grant us abundant food, thou priestly Herald, vouchsafe to give us ample wealth, O Agni.

translations.griffith: This sacrifice of ours do thou, O Mighty, O truly Wise, bear to the Gods rejoicing. Grant us abundant food, thou priestly Herald, vouchsafe to give us ample wealth, O Agni.
translations.oldenberg: Bring thou, O strong one, this sacrifice of ours to the gods, O wise one, as a liberal giver. Bestow on us, O Hotri, abundant food; Agni, obtain by sacrificing mighty wealth for us.

stanzas.sanskrit: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā- -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé
stanzas.translation: As holy food, Agni, to thine'invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us he born a son, and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

translations.griffith: As holy food, Agni, to thine'invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us he born a son, and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.
translations.oldenberg: Procure, O Agni, for ever, to him who implores thee, (the gift of) nourishment 1, the wonderful acquiring of the cow. May a son be ours, offspring that continues our race. Agni, may this favour of thine abide with us!

stanzas.sanskrit: वै॒श्वा॒न॒राय॑ धि॒षणा॑मृता॒वृधे॑ घृ॒तं न पू॒तम॒ग्नये॑ जनामसि द्वि॒ता होता॑रं॒ मनु॑षश्च वा॒घतो॑ धि॒या रथं॒ न कुलि॑शः॒ समृ॑ण्वति
stanzas.transliteration: vaiśvānarā́ya dhiṣáṇām r̥tāvŕ̥dhe ghr̥táṃ ná pūtám agnáye janāmasi dvitā́ hótāram mánuṣaś ca vāgháto dhiyā́ ráthaṃ ná kúliśaḥ sám r̥ṇvati
stanzas.translation: To him, Vaiṣvânara, who strengthens Holy Law, to Agni we present our praise like oil made pure. With thoughtful insight human priests bring him anear, our Herald from of old, as an axe forms a car.

translations.griffith: To him, Vaiṣvânara, who strengthens Holy Law, to Agni we present our praise like oil made pure. With thoughtful insight human priests bring him anear, our Herald from of old, as an axe forms a car.
translations.oldenberg: For Vaisvânara, the increaser of Rita, for Agni we produce 1 a Dhishanâ 2 like purified ghee. And verily 3 by their prayer the invoking men (accomplish) him, the Hotri, as the axe accomplishes a chariot.

stanzas.sanskrit: स रो॑चयज्ज॒नुषा॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे स मा॒त्रोर॑भवत्पु॒त्र ईड्यः॑ ह॒व्य॒वाळ॒ग्निर॒जर॒श्चनो॑हितो दू॒ळभो॑ वि॒शामति॑थिर्वि॒भाव॑सुः
stanzas.transliteration: sá rocayaj janúṣā ródasī ubhé sá mātrór abhavat putrá ī́ḍyaḥ havyavā́ḷ agnír ajáraś cánohito dūḷábho viśā́m átithir vibhā́vasuḥ
stanzas.translation: He made the heaven and earth resplendent by his birth: Child of two Mothers he was meet to be implored, Agni, oblation-bearer, gracious, ever-young, infallible, rich in radiant light, the guest of men.

translations.griffith: He made the heaven and earth resplendent by his birth: Child of two Mothers he was meet to be implored, Agni, oblation-bearer, gracious, ever-young, infallible, rich in radiant light, the guest of men.
translations.oldenberg: By his birth he has given splendour to both worlds (Heaven and Earth). He became the praiseworthy son of his parents, Agni, the carrier of oblations, never ageing, with satisfied mind, undeceivable, the guest of men, rich in light.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्रत्वा॒ दक्ष॑स्य॒ तरु॑षो॒ विध॑र्मणि दे॒वासो॑ अ॒ग्निं ज॑नयन्त॒ चित्ति॑भिः रु॒रु॒चा॒नं भा॒नुना॒ ज्योति॑षा म॒हामत्यं॒ न वाजं॑ सनि॒ष्यन्नुप॑ ब्रुवे
stanzas.transliteration: krátvā dákṣasya táruṣo vídharmaṇi devā́so agníṃ janayanta cíttibhiḥ rurucānám bhānúnā jyótiṣā mahā́m átyaṃ ná vā́jaṃ saniṣyánn úpa bruve
stanzas.translation: Within the range of their surpassinq power, by might, the Gods created Agni with inventive thought. I, eager to win strength, address him, like a steed, resplendent with his brilliance, with his ample light.

translations.griffith: Within the range of their surpassinq power, by might, the Gods created Agni with inventive thought. I, eager to win strength, address him, like a steed, resplendent with his brilliance, with his ample light.
translations.oldenberg: Through the power of their mind, within the sphere of their superior strength the gods have procreated Agni by their thoughts. Desirous of winning the prize 1 I address Him who shines with his splendour, who is great in his light, as (one who desires to win the prize addresses his) race-horse.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ म॒न्द्रस्य॑ सनि॒ष्यन्तो॒ वरे॑ण्यं वृणी॒महे॒ अह्र॑यं॒ वाज॑मृ॒ग्मिय॑म् रा॒तिं भृगू॑णामु॒शिजं॑ क॒विक्र॑तुम॒ग्निं राज॑न्तं दि॒व्येन॑ शो॒चिषा॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ mandrásya saniṣyánto váreṇyaṃ vr̥ṇīmáhe áhrayaṃ vā́jam r̥gmíyam rātím bhŕ̥gūṇām uśíjaṃ kavíkratum agníṃ rā́jantaṃ divyéna śocíṣā
stanzas.translation: Eager to gain, we crave from him the friendly God strength confident, choiceworthy meet to be extolled: The Bhr̥igus' bounty, willing, strong with sages' lore, even Agni shining forth with light that comes from heaven.

translations.griffith: Eager to gain, we crave from him the friendly God strength confident, choiceworthy meet to be extolled: The Bhr̥igus' bounty, willing, strong with sages' lore, even Agni shining forth with light that comes from heaven.
translations.oldenberg: Desirous of winning the choice, glorious, and praiseworthy prize (which is the gift) of the joy-giver, we choose the boon of the Bhrigus 1, the Usig 2, who has the mind of a sage, Agni, who reigns with his heavenly light.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं सु॒म्नाय॑ दधिरे पु॒रो जना॒ वाज॑श्रवसमि॒ह वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषः य॒तस्रु॑चः सु॒रुचं॑ वि॒श्वदे॑व्यं रु॒द्रं य॒ज्ञानां॒ साध॑दिष्टिम॒पसा॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ sumnā́ya dadhire puró jánāḥ- vā́jaśravasam ihá vr̥ktábarhiṣaḥ yatásrucaḥ surúcaṃ viśvádevyaṃ rudráṃ yajñā́nāṃ sā́dhadiṣṭim apásām
stanzas.translation: For happiness, men, having trimmed the sacred grass, set Agni glorious for his strength before them here; Yea, with raised ladles, him bright, dear to all the Gods, perfecting aims of works, Rudra of solemn rites.

translations.griffith: For happiness, men, having trimmed the sacred grass, set Agni glorious for his strength before them here; Yea, with raised ladles, him bright, dear to all the Gods, perfecting aims of works, Rudra of solemn rites.
translations.oldenberg: Men, having spread the sacrificial grass, holding the sacrificial ladle, have placed here in front (as Purohita), for the sake of (the divine) blessing, Agni renowned for strength, with great splendour, united with all the gods, the Rudra of sacrifices 1, who accomplishes the oblations of active (worshippers).

stanzas.sanskrit: पाव॑कशोचे॒ तव॒ हि क्षयं॒ परि॒ होत॑र्य॒ज्ञेषु॑ वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषो॒ नरः॑ अग्ने॒ दुव॑ इ॒च्छमा॑नास॒ आप्य॒मुपा॑सते॒ द्रवि॑णं धेहि॒ तेभ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: pā́vakaśoce táva hí kṣáyam pári hótar yajñéṣu vr̥ktábarhiṣo náraḥ ágne dúva ichámānāsa ā́pyam úpāsate dráviṇaṃ dhehi tébhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Around thy dwelling-place, O brightly-shining Priest, are men at sacrifice, whose sacred grass is trimmed. Wishing to do thee service, Agni, they are there, desirous of thy friendship grant them store of wealth.

translations.griffith: Around thy dwelling-place, O brightly-shining Priest, are men at sacrifice, whose sacred grass is trimmed. Wishing to do thee service, Agni, they are there, desirous of thy friendship grant them store of wealth.
translations.oldenberg: O (Agni) whose flame is purifying, around thy dwelling, O Hotri, the men who at the sacrifices have spread the sacrificial grass, O Agni, seeking (how to do) honour (to thee), and (desiring) thy friendship, surround thee (reverentially);—bestow thou wealth on them!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ रोद॑सी अपृण॒दा स्व॑र्म॒हज्जा॒तं यदे॑नम॒पसो॒ अधा॑रयन् सो अ॑ध्व॒राय॒ परि॑ णीयते क॒विरत्यो॒ न वाज॑सातये॒ चनो॑हितः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇad ā́ svàr maháj jātáṃ yád enam apáso ádhārayan só adhvarā́ya pári ṇīyate kavír átyo ná vā́jasātaye cánohitaḥ
stanzas.translation: He hath filled heaven and earth and the great realm of light, when at his birth the skilful held him in their hold. He like a horse is led forth to the sacrifice Sage, graciously inclined, that he may win us strength.

translations.griffith: He hath filled heaven and earth and the great realm of light, when at his birth the skilful held him in their hold. He like a horse is led forth to the sacrifice Sage, graciously inclined, that he may win us strength.
translations.oldenberg: He has filled the two worlds (Heaven and Earth) and the great Sun, when the active ones (i. e. the priests) held him fast who had been born. He the sage is led round for the performance of worship, like a racer for the winning of the prize 1, with satisfied mind.

stanzas.sanskrit: न॒म॒स्यत॑ ह॒व्यदा॑तिं स्वध्व॒रं दु॑व॒स्यत॒ दम्यं॑ जा॒तवे॑दसम् र॒थीर्ऋ॒तस्य॑ बृह॒तो विच॑र्षणिर॒ग्निर्दे॒वाना॑मभवत्पु॒रोहि॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: namasyáta havyádātiṃ svadhvaráṃ duvasyáta dámyaṃ jātávedasam rathī́r r̥tásya br̥ható vícarṣaṇir agnír devā́nām abhavat puróhitaḥ
stanzas.translation: Honour the oblation-bearer, him who knows fair rites, serve ye the Household Friend who knows all things that be. He drives the chariot of the lofty ordinance: Agni most active, is the great High Priest of Gods.

translations.griffith: Honour the oblation-bearer, him who knows fair rites, serve ye the Household Friend who knows all things that be. He drives the chariot of the lofty ordinance: Agni most active, is the great High Priest of Gods.
translations.oldenberg: Adore ye him, the giver of offerings, the best performer of worship; honour ye him the domestic Gâtavedas. Agni, the charioteer of the mighty Rita, he who dwells among manifold tribes, has become the Purohita of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: ति॒स्रो य॒ह्वस्य॑ स॒मिधः॒ परि॑ज्मनो॒ऽग्नेर॑पुनन्नु॒शिजो॒ अमृ॑त्यवः तासा॒मेका॒मद॑धु॒र्मर्त्ये॒ भुज॑मु लो॒कमु॒ द्वे उप॑ जा॒मिमी॑यतुः
stanzas.transliteration: tisró yahvásya samídhaḥ párijmano -agnér apunann uśíjo ámr̥tyavaḥ tā́sām ékām ádadhur mártye bhújam ulokám u dvé úpa jāmím īyatuḥ
stanzas.translation: They who are free from death, fain for him, purified three splendours of the mighty Agni, circling all. To man, for his enjoyment, one of these they gave: the other two have passed into the sister sphere.

translations.griffith: They who are free from death, fain for him, purified three splendours of the mighty Agni, circling all. To man, for his enjoyment, one of these they gave: the other two have passed into the sister sphere.
translations.oldenberg: The immortal Usigs have purified three logs for the vigorous 1 Agni 2 who wanders round the earth 3: of these they have placed one among the mortals for their enjoyment; two have passed into the sister world 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒शां क॒विं वि॒श्पतिं॒ मानु॑षी॒रिषः॒ सं सी॑मकृण्व॒न्त्स्वधि॑तिं॒ न तेज॑से स उ॒द्वतो॑ नि॒वतो॑ याति॒ वेवि॑ष॒त्स गर्भ॑मे॒षु भुव॑नेषु दीधरत्
stanzas.transliteration: viśā́ṃ kavíṃ viśpátim mā́nuṣīr íṣaḥ sáṃ sīm akr̥ṇvan svádhitiṃ ná téjase sá udváto niváto yāti véviṣat sá gárbham eṣú bhúvaneṣu dīdharat
stanzas.translation: Man's sacrificial food hath sharpened like an axe, for brightness, him the Sage of men, the people's Lord, Busied with sacred rites he mounts and he descends. He hath laid down his vital germ within these worlds.

translations.griffith: Man's sacrificial food hath sharpened like an axe, for brightness, him the Sage of men, the people's Lord, Busied with sacred rites he mounts and he descends. He hath laid down his vital germ within these worlds.
translations.oldenberg: The food offered by men has sharpened him, the sage of the tribes, the lord of the tribes, as an axe. Busily he goes to the heights and to the depths. He has held fast the germ in these worlds.

stanzas.sanskrit: स जि॑न्वते ज॒ठरे॑षु प्रजज्ञि॒वान्वृषा॑ चि॒त्रेषु॒ नान॑द॒न्न सिं॒हः वै॒श्वा॒न॒रः पृ॑थु॒पाजा॒ अम॑र्त्यो॒ वसु॒ रत्ना॒ दय॑मानो॒ वि दा॒शुषे॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá jinvate jaṭháreṣu prajajñivā́n vŕ̥ṣā citréṣu nā́nadan ná siṃháḥ vaiśvānaráḥ pr̥thupā́jā ámartyo vásu rátnā dáyamāno ví dāśúṣe
stanzas.translation: He stirs with life in wombs dissimilar in kind, born as a Lion or a loudly-bellowing Bull: Vaiṣvânara immortal with wide-reaching might, bestowing goods and wealth on him who offiers gifts.

translations.griffith: He stirs with life in wombs dissimilar in kind, born as a Lion or a loudly-bellowing Bull: Vaiṣvânara immortal with wide-reaching might, bestowing goods and wealth on him who offiers gifts.
translations.oldenberg: He the generator, the strong one, stirs in the resplendent bellies like a roaring lion, Vaisvânara with his broad stream of light, the immortal, distributing goods and treasures to his worshipper.

stanzas.sanskrit: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रः प्र॒त्नथा॒ नाक॒मारु॑हद्दि॒वस्पृ॒ष्ठं भन्द॑मानः सु॒मन्म॑भिः स पू॑र्व॒वज्ज॒नय॑ञ्ज॒न्तवे॒ धनं॑ समा॒नमज्मं॒ पर्ये॑ति॒ जागृ॑विः
stanzas.transliteration: vaiśvānaráḥ pratnáthā nā́kam ā́ruhad divás pr̥ṣṭhám bhándamānaḥ sumánmabhiḥ sá pūrvaváj janáyañ jantáve dhánaṃ samānám ájmam páry eti jā́gr̥viḥ
stanzas.translation: Vaiṣvânara, as of old, mounted the cope of heaven, heaven's ridge, well greeted, by those skilled in noble songs. He, as of old, producing riches for the folk, still watchful, traversesthe common way again.

translations.griffith: Vaiṣvânara, as of old, mounted the cope of heaven, heaven's ridge, well greeted, by those skilled in noble songs. He, as of old, producing riches for the folk, still watchful, traversesthe common way again.
translations.oldenberg: Vaisvânara has mounted the firmament, the back of heaven, as of old, glorified by those who are rich in good thoughts. He, creating wealth for the creatures as of old, goes watchful round the common course.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तावा॑नं य॒ज्ञियं॒ विप्र॑मु॒क्थ्य१॒॑मा यं द॒धे मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑ दि॒वि क्षय॑म् तं चि॒त्रया॑मं॒ हरि॑केशमीमहे सुदी॒तिम॒ग्निं सु॑वि॒ताय॒ नव्य॑से
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tā́vānaṃ yajñíyaṃ vípram ukthyàm ā́ yáṃ dadhé mātaríśvā diví kṣáyam táṃ citráyāmaṃ hárikeśam īmahe sudītím agníṃ suvitā́ya návyase
stanzas.translation: For new prosperity we seek to Agni, him whose course is splendid, gold-haired, excellently bright, Whom Mâtariṣvan stablished, dweller in the heaven, meet for high praise and holy, sage and true to Law.

translations.griffith: For new prosperity we seek to Agni, him whose course is splendid, gold-haired, excellently bright, Whom Mâtariṣvan stablished, dweller in the heaven, meet for high praise and holy, sage and true to Law.
translations.oldenberg: The righteous, worshipful priest deserving of praise, the dweller in heaven 1 whom Mâtarisvan has established (on earth): him we approach whose way is bright and hair golden, the resplendent Agni, for the sake of ever new welfare.

stanzas.sanskrit: शुचिं॒ न याम॑न्निषि॒रं स्व॒र्दृशं॑ के॒तुं दि॒वो रो॑चन॒स्थामु॑ष॒र्बुध॑म् अ॒ग्निं मू॒र्धानं॑ दि॒वो अप्र॑तिष्कुतं॒ तमी॑महे॒ नम॑सा वा॒जिनं॑ बृ॒हत्
stanzas.transliteration: śúciṃ ná yā́mann iṣiráṃ svardŕ̥śaṃ ketúṃ divó rocanasthā́m uṣarbúdham agním mūrdhā́naṃ divó ápratiṣkutaṃ tám īmahe námasā vājínam br̥hát
stanzas.translation: As pure and swift of course, beholder of the light, who stands in heaven's bright sphere a sign, who wakes at dawn, Agni, the head of heaven, whom none may turn aside-to him the Powerful with mighty prayer we seek.

translations.griffith: As pure and swift of course, beholder of the light, who stands in heaven's bright sphere a sign, who wakes at dawn, Agni, the head of heaven, whom none may turn aside-to him the Powerful with mighty prayer we seek.
translations.oldenberg: Like the flaming one (the sun?) on his way, the quick one, of sun-like aspect, the banner of heaven, who dwells in light, who wakes at dawn—Agni the head of heaven, the unrepressed, him we approach with adoration, the strong one mightily.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒न्द्रं होता॑रं॒ शुचि॒मद्व॑याविनं॒ दमू॑नसमु॒क्थ्यं॑ वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिम् रथं॒ न चि॒त्रं वपु॑षाय दर्श॒तं मनु॑र्हितं॒ सद॒मिद्रा॒य ई॑महे
stanzas.transliteration: mandráṃ hótāraṃ śúcim ádvayāvinaṃ dámūnasam ukthyàṃ viśvácarṣaṇim ráthaṃ ná citráṃ vápuṣāya darśatám mánurhitaṃ sádam íd rāyá īmahe
stanzas.translation: The cheerful Priest, the pure, in whom no guile is found, Friend of the House, praise-worthy, dear to all mankind, Fair to behold for beauty like a splendid car,– Agni the Friend of men we ever seek for wealth.

translations.griffith: The cheerful Priest, the pure, in whom no guile is found, Friend of the House, praise-worthy, dear to all mankind, Fair to behold for beauty like a splendid car,– Agni the Friend of men we ever seek for wealth.
translations.oldenberg: The joy-giving, bright Hotri, in whom is no falsehood, the domestic, praiseworthy dweller among all tribes, like a splendid chariot, wonderful to behold, established by Manus: him we constantly approach for the sake of wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: वै॒श्वा॒न॒राय॑ पृथु॒पाज॑से॒ विपो॒ रत्ना॑ विधन्त ध॒रुणे॑षु॒ गात॑वे अ॒ग्निर्हि दे॒वाँ अ॒मृतो॑ दुव॒स्यत्यथा॒ धर्मा॑णि स॒नता॒ न दू॑दुषत्
stanzas.transliteration: vaiśvānarā́ya pr̥thupā́jase vípo rátnā vidhanta dharúṇeṣu gā́tave agnír hí devā́m̐ amŕ̥to duvasyáti- áthā dhármāṇi sanátā ná dūduṣat
stanzas.translation: To him who shines afar, Vaiṣvânara, shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths: For Agni the Immortal serves the Deities, and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws.

translations.griffith: To him who shines afar, Vaiṣvânara, shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths: For Agni the Immortal serves the Deities, and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws.
translations.oldenberg: They have worshipped Vaisvânara with his broad stream of light with prayers 1 and treasures in order that he may walk on firm ground. For immortal Agni honours the gods, and from of old he has not violated the laws.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒न्तर्दू॒तो रोद॑सी द॒स्म ई॑यते॒ होता॒ निष॑त्तो॒ मनु॑षः पु॒रोहि॑तः क्षयं॑ बृ॒हन्तं॒ परि॑ भूषति॒ द्युभि॑र्दे॒वेभि॑र॒ग्निरि॑षि॒तो धि॒याव॑सुः
stanzas.transliteration: antár dūtó ródasī dasmá īyate hótā níṣatto mánuṣaḥ puróhitaḥ kṣáyam br̥hántam pári bhūṣati dyúbhir devébhir agnír iṣitó dhiyā́vasuḥ
stanzas.translation: He, wondrous envoy, goes between the earth and heaven, firm seated as the Herald, great High Priest of men. He compassethwith rays the lofty dwelling-place, Agni, sent forward by the Gods, enriched with piayer.

translations.griffith: He, wondrous envoy, goes between the earth and heaven, firm seated as the Herald, great High Priest of men. He compassethwith rays the lofty dwelling-place, Agni, sent forward by the Gods, enriched with piayer.
translations.oldenberg: The wonderful messenger goes between the two worlds (heaven and earth), the Hotri who has sat down, the Purohita of Manus. He takes care of his wide dwelling day by day, Agni who, incited by the gods, gives wealth for our prayers.

stanzas.sanskrit: के॒तुं य॒ज्ञानां॑ वि॒दथ॑स्य॒ साध॑नं॒ विप्रा॑सो अ॒ग्निं म॑हयन्त॒ चित्ति॑भिः अपां॑सि॒ यस्मि॒न्नधि॑ संद॒धुर्गिर॒स्तस्मि॑न्त्सु॒म्नानि॒ यज॑मान॒ आ च॑के
stanzas.transliteration: ketúṃ yajñā́nāṃ vidáthasya sā́dhanaṃ víprāso agním mahayanta cíttibhiḥ ápāṃsi yásminn ádhi saṃdadhúr gíras tásmin sumnā́ni yájamāna ā́ cake
stanzas.translation: Sages shall glorify Agni with earnest thoughts, ensign of sacrifice, who fills the synod full: In whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness.

translations.griffith: Sages shall glorify Agni with earnest thoughts, ensign of sacrifice, who fills the synod full: In whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness.
translations.oldenberg: The priests have exalted with their thoughts Agni, the banner of sacrifices, the achiever of sacrifice 1. From him in whom they have put together their (sacrificial) works and their prayers, the sacrificer desires blessings.

stanzas.sanskrit: पि॒ता य॒ज्ञाना॒मसु॑रो विप॒श्चितां॑ वि॒मान॑म॒ग्निर्व॒युनं॑ च वा॒घता॑म् आ वि॑वेश॒ रोद॑सी॒ भूरि॑वर्पसा पुरुप्रि॒यो भ॑न्दते॒ धाम॑भिः क॒विः
stanzas.transliteration: pitā́ yajñā́nām ásuro vipaścítāṃ vimā́nam agnír vayúnaṃ ca vāghátām ā́ viveśa ródasī bhū́rivarpasā purupriyó bhandate dhā́mabhiḥ kavíḥ
stanzas.translation: The Sire of sacrifice, great God of holy bards, Agni, the measure and the symbol of the priests, Hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form: the Sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might.

translations.griffith: The Sire of sacrifice, great God of holy bards, Agni, the measure and the symbol of the priests, Hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form: the Sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might.
translations.oldenberg: The father of sacrifices, the miraculous lord of those who know prayers (?) 1, Agni, is the measure and rule 2 of the sacrificers; he has entered the two manifold-shaped worlds; the sage beloved by many people is glorified in his foundations.

stanzas.sanskrit: च॒न्द्रम॒ग्निं च॒न्द्रर॑थं॒ हरि॑व्रतं वैश्वान॒रम॑प्सु॒षदं॑ स्व॒र्विद॑म् वि॒गा॒हं तूर्णिं॒ तवि॑षीभि॒रावृ॑तं॒ भूर्णिं॑ दे॒वास॑ इ॒ह सु॒श्रियं॑ दधुः
stanzas.transliteration: candrám agníṃ candrárathaṃ hárivrataṃ vaiśvānarám apsuṣádaṃ svarvídam vigāháṃ tū́rṇiṃ táviṣībhir ā́vr̥tam bhū́rṇiṃ devā́sa ihá suśríyaṃ dadhuḥ
stanzas.translation: Bright Agni with the bright car, Lord of green domains, Vaiṣvânara dweller in the floods, who finds the light, Pervading, swift and wild, encompassed round with powers, him very glorious have the Gods established here.

translations.griffith: Bright Agni with the bright car, Lord of green domains, Vaiṣvânara dweller in the floods, who finds the light, Pervading, swift and wild, encompassed round with powers, him very glorious have the Gods established here.
translations.oldenberg: The gods have established here in great beauty Agni the bright with his bright chariot, whose every law is golden 1, Vaisvânara who dwells in the waters, who finds the sun, the diver, the swift one covered with strength, the quick one.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्दे॒वेभि॒र्मनु॑षश्च ज॒न्तुभि॑स्तन्वा॒नो य॒ज्ञं पु॑रु॒पेश॑सं धि॒या र॒थीर॒न्तरी॑यते॒ साध॑दिष्टिभिर्जी॒रो दमू॑ना अभिशस्ति॒चात॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: agnír devébhir mánuṣaś ca jantúbhis tanvānó yajñám purupéśasaṃ dhiyā́ rathī́r antár īyate sā́dhadiṣṭibhir jīró dámūnā abhiśasticā́tanaḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, together with the Gods and Manu's folk by thought extending sacrifice in varied form, Goes, car-borne, to and fro with those who crown each rite, the fleet, the Household Friend, who turns the curse aside.

translations.griffith: Agni, together with the Gods and Manu's folk by thought extending sacrifice in varied form, Goes, car-borne, to and fro with those who crown each rite, the fleet, the Household Friend, who turns the curse aside.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, spreading out with his thought the manifold-adorned sacrifice, together with the gods and with the people of Manus, goes as a charioteer to and fro with (gods and men) who accomplish the sacrifice, the quick, domestic (god), the dispeller of curses.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ जर॑स्व स्वप॒त्य आयु॑न्यू॒र्जा पि॑न्वस्व॒ समिषो॑ दिदीहि नः वयां॑सि जिन्व बृह॒तश्च॑ जागृव उ॒शिग्दे॒वाना॒मसि॑ सु॒क्रतु॑र्वि॒पाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ágne járasva svapatyá ā́yuni- ūrjā́ pinvasva sám íṣo didīhi naḥ váyāṃsi jinva br̥hatáś ca jāgr̥ve- uśíg devā́nām ási sukrátur vipā́m
stanzas.translation: Sing, Agni, for long life to us and noble sons: teem thou with plenty, shine upon us store of food. Increase the great man's strength, thou ever-vigilant: thou, longing for the Gods, knowest their hymns full well.

translations.griffith: Sing, Agni, for long life to us and noble sons: teem thou with plenty, shine upon us store of food. Increase the great man's strength, thou ever-vigilant: thou, longing for the Gods, knowest their hymns full well.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, be wakeful 1 in our life which may be blessed with offspring; swell with sap; shine upon us (plenty of) food. Stir up vigour and the great ones, O watchful (god). Thou art the Usig (or willing one) of the gods, the good-minded (lord) of prayers.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒श्पतिं॑ य॒ह्वमति॑थिं॒ नरः॒ सदा॑ य॒न्तारं॑ धी॒नामु॒शिजं॑ च वा॒घता॑म् अ॒ध्व॒राणां॒ चेत॑नं जा॒तवे॑दसं॒ प्र शं॑सन्ति॒ नम॑सा जू॒तिभि॑र्वृ॒धे
stanzas.transliteration: viśpátiṃ yahvám átithiṃ náraḥ sádā yantā́raṃ dhīnā́m uśíjaṃ ca vāghátām adhvarā́ṇāṃ cétanaṃ jātávedasam prá śaṃsanti námasā jūtíbhir vr̥dhé
stanzas.translation: The Mighty One, Lord of the people and their guest, the leader of their thoughts, devoted Friend of priests, Our solemn rites' announcer, Jâtavedas, men with worship ever praise, with urgings for their weal.

translations.griffith: The Mighty One, Lord of the people and their guest, the leader of their thoughts, devoted Friend of priests, Our solemn rites' announcer, Jâtavedas, men with worship ever praise, with urgings for their weal.
translations.oldenberg: The lord of the tribe, the vigorous 1 guest, the guider of prayers, the Usig (or willing one) of those who invoke him, Gâtavedas, the light of worship—him men constantly praise with adoration, with solicitations for their welfare.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒भावा॑ दे॒वः सु॒रणः॒ परि॑ क्षि॒तीर॒ग्निर्ब॑भूव॒ शव॑सा सु॒मद्र॑थः तस्य॑ व्र॒तानि॑ भूरिपो॒षिणो॑ व॒यमुप॑ भूषेम॒ दम॒ आ सु॑वृ॒क्तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vibhā́vā deváḥ suráṇaḥ pári kṣitī́r agnír babhūva śávasā sumádrathaḥ tásya vratā́ni bhūripoṣíṇo vayám úpa bhūṣema dáma ā́ suvr̥ktíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni the God resplendent, giver of great joy, hath on his lovely car compassed the lands with, might. Let us with pure laudations in his house approach the high laws of the nourisher of multitudes.

translations.griffith: Agni the God resplendent, giver of great joy, hath on his lovely car compassed the lands with, might. Let us with pure laudations in his house approach the high laws of the nourisher of multitudes.
translations.oldenberg: The resplendent, joyous god, Agni on his chariot, has with his might encompassed the dwellings. May we honour in our house with beautiful prayers 1 his commands who is rich in manifold prosperity.

stanzas.sanskrit: वैश्वा॑नर॒ तव॒ धामा॒न्या च॑के॒ येभिः॑ स्व॒र्विदभ॑वो विचक्षण जा॒त आपृ॑णो॒ भुव॑नानि॒ रोद॑सी॒ अग्ने॒ ता विश्वा॑ परि॒भूर॑सि॒ त्मना॑
stanzas.transliteration: vaíśvānara táva dhā́māny ā́ cake yébhiḥ svarvíd ábhavo vicakṣaṇa jātá ā́pr̥ṇo bhúvanāni ródasī ágne tā́ víśvā paribhū́r asi tmánā
stanzas.translation: I celebrate thy glories, O Vaiṣvânara, wherewith thou, O farsighted God, has found the light. Thou filledst at thy birth both worlds, the earth and heaven: all this, O Agni, hast thou compassed of thyself.

translations.griffith: I celebrate thy glories, O Vaiṣvânara, wherewith thou, O farsighted God, has found the light. Thou filledst at thy birth both worlds, the earth and heaven: all this, O Agni, hast thou compassed of thyself.
translations.oldenberg: O Vaisvânara, I love thy statutes by which thou hast found the sun, O far-seeing one. When born thou hast filled the worlds, heaven and earth; Agni, thou encompassest all these (beings) by thyself.

stanzas.sanskrit: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रस्य॑ दं॒सना॑भ्यो बृ॒हदरि॑णा॒देकः॑ स्वप॒स्यया॑ क॒विः उ॒भा पि॒तरा॑ म॒हय॑न्नजायता॒ग्निर्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी भूरि॑रेतसा
stanzas.transliteration: vaiśvānarásya daṃsánābhyo br̥hád áriṇād ékaḥ svapasyáyā kavíḥ ubhā́ pitárā maháyann ajāyata- -agnír dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ bhū́riretasā
stanzas.translation: By his great skill the Sage alone hath brought to pass a great deed, mightier than Vaiṣvânara's wondrous acts. Agni sprang into being, magnifying both his Parents, Heaven and Earth, rich in prolific seed.

translations.griffith: By his great skill the Sage alone hath brought to pass a great deed, mightier than Vaiṣvânara's wondrous acts. Agni sprang into being, magnifying both his Parents, Heaven and Earth, rich in prolific seed.
translations.oldenberg: For Vaisvânara's wonderful deeds he the sage alone has by his great skill mightily 1 let loose (his powers?). Agni has been born exalting. both his parents, Heaven and Earth, rich in seed.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मित्स॑मित्सु॒मना॑ बोध्य॒स्मे शु॒चाशु॑चा सुम॒तिं रा॑सि॒ वस्वः॑ आ दे॑व दे॒वान्य॒जथा॑य वक्षि॒ सखा॒ सखी॑न्त्सु॒मना॑ यक्ष्यग्ने
stanzas.transliteration: samít-samit sumánā bodhy asmé śucā́-śucā sumatíṃ rāsi vásvaḥ ā́ deva devā́n yajáthāya vakṣi sákhā sákhīn sumánā yakṣy agne
stanzas.translation: BE friendly with each kindled log of fuel, with every flash bestow the boon of riches. Bring thou the Gods, O God, unto our worship: serve, well-inclined, as Friend thy friends, O Agni.

translations.griffith: BE friendly with each kindled log of fuel, with every flash bestow the boon of riches. Bring thou the Gods, O God, unto our worship: serve, well-inclined, as Friend thy friends, O Agni.
translations.oldenberg: Log by log 1 be kind towards us. Flash by flash grant us thy, the Vasu's, favour 2. Bring hither, O god, the gods that we may sacrifice. Sacrifice, O Agni, as a kind friend to thy friends.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं दे॒वास॒स्त्रिरह॑न्ना॒यज॑न्ते दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निः सेमं य॒ज्ञं मधु॑मन्तं कृधी न॒स्तनू॑नपाद्घृ॒तयो॑निं वि॒धन्त॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ devā́sas trír áhann āyájante divé-dive váruṇo mitró agníḥ sémáṃ yajñám mádhumantaṃ kr̥dhī nas tánūnapād ghr̥táyoniṃ vidhántam
stanzas.translation: Agni whom daily Varuṇa and Mitra the Gods bring thrice a day to this our worship, Tanûnapât, enrich with meath our service that dwells with holy oil, that offers honour.

translations.griffith: Agni whom daily Varuṇa and Mitra the Gods bring thrice a day to this our worship, Tanûnapât, enrich with meath our service that dwells with holy oil, that offers honour.
translations.oldenberg: Thou whom the gods, Varuna, Mitra, Agni, thrice every day bring hither by sacrifice day by day, Tanûnapât, make this our sacrifice honey-sweet, having its abode in ghee 1, (this sacrifice) which worships (the gods).

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र दीधि॑तिर्वि॒श्ववा॑रा जिगाति॒ होता॑रमि॒ळः प्र॑थ॒मं यज॑ध्यै अच्छा॒ नमो॑भिर्वृष॒भं व॒न्दध्यै॒ स दे॒वान्य॑क्षदिषि॒तो यजी॑यान्
stanzas.transliteration: prá dī́dhitir viśvávārā jigāti hótāram iḷáḥ prathamáṃ yájadhyai áchā námobhir vr̥ṣabháṃ vandádhyai sá devā́n yakṣad iṣitó yájīyān
stanzas.translation: The thought that bringeth every boon proceedeth to worship first the Priest of the libation, That we may greet the Strong One with our homage. Urged, may he bring the Gods, best Sacrificer.

translations.griffith: The thought that bringeth every boon proceedeth to worship first the Priest of the libation, That we may greet the Strong One with our homage. Urged, may he bring the Gods, best Sacrificer.
translations.oldenberg: (Our adoring) thought rich in all boons goes forward for worshipping as the first the Hotri of the sacred food (il), for saluting the strong bull with adoration and homage. May he, the best sacrificer, incited (by our prayers) sacrifice to the gods 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊ॒र्ध्वो वां॑ गा॒तुर॑ध्व॒रे अ॑कार्यू॒र्ध्वा शो॒चींषि॒ प्रस्थि॑ता॒ रजां॑सि दि॒वो वा॒ नाभा॒ न्य॑सादि॒ होता॑ स्तृणी॒महि॑ दे॒वव्य॑चा॒ वि ब॒र्हिः
stanzas.transliteration: ūrdhvó vāṃ gātúr adhvaré akāri- ūrdhvā́ śocī́ṃṣi prásthitā rájāṃsi divó vā nā́bhā ny àsādi hótā str̥ṇīmáhi devávyacā ví barhíḥ
stanzas.translation: On high your way to sacrifice was made ready; the radiant flames went upward to the regions. Full in the midst of heaven the Priest is seated: sirew we the sacred grass where Gods may rest them.

translations.griffith: On high your way to sacrifice was made ready; the radiant flames went upward to the regions. Full in the midst of heaven the Priest is seated: sirew we the sacred grass where Gods may rest them.
translations.oldenberg: Upwards your 1 course has been directed at the worship; upwards (your) flames 2 are gone; ready (for receiving you) is the air 3. Or the Hotri has sat down at heaven's navel. We spread out the sacrificial grass which receives the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒प्त हो॒त्राणि॒ मन॑सा वृणा॒ना इन्व॑न्तो॒ विश्वं॒ प्रति॑ यन्नृ॒तेन॑ नृ॒पेश॑सो वि॒दथे॑षु॒ प्र जा॒ता अ॒भी॒३॒॑मं य॒ज्ञं वि च॑रन्त पू॒र्वीः
stanzas.transliteration: saptá hotrā́ṇi mánasā vr̥ṇānā́ḥ- ínvanto víśvam práti yann r̥téna nr̥péśaso vidátheṣu prá jātā́ḥ- abhī̀máṃ yajñáṃ ví caranta pūrvī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Claiming in mind the seven priests' burntoblations, inciting all, they came in settled order. To this our sacrifice approach the many who show in hero beauty at assemblies.

translations.griffith: Claiming in mind the seven priests' burntoblations, inciting all, they came in settled order. To this our sacrifice approach the many who show in hero beauty at assemblies.
translations.oldenberg: Choosing in their mind the sevenfold work of the Hotris 2, enlivening everything (the gods) came hither in the right way. (The divine doors 3) with men as their ornaments 4, born at the sacrifices 5, have come hither and thither to this sacrifice, many of them.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ भन्द॑माने उ॒षसा॒ उपा॑के उ॒त स्म॑येते त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ विरू॑पे यथा॑ नो मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो॒ जुजो॑ष॒दिन्द्रो॑ म॒रुत्वाँ॑ उ॒त वा॒ महो॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ bhándamāne uṣásā úpāke utá smayete tanvā̀ vírūpe yáthā no mitró váruṇo jújoṣad índro marútvām̐ utá vā máhobhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Night and Dawn, lauded, hither come together, both smiling, different are their forms in colour, That Varuṇa and Mitra may accept us, and Indra, girt by Maruts, with his glories.

translations.griffith: Night and Dawn, lauded, hither come together, both smiling, different are their forms in colour, That Varuṇa and Mitra may accept us, and Indra, girt by Maruts, with his glories.
translations.oldenberg: Hither (shall come) the two Dawns 1, the neighbourly (goddesses) of glorious appearance 2. Of different forms, they both smile. (They shall come) that Mitra and Varuna may be satisfied with us, and Indra accompanied by the Maruts with their powers 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: दैव्या॒ होता॑रा प्रथ॒मा न्यृ॑ञ्जे स॒प्त पृ॒क्षासः॑ स्व॒धया॑ मदन्ति ऋ॒तं शंस॑न्त ऋ॒तमित्त आ॑हु॒रनु॑ व्र॒तं व्र॑त॒पा दीध्या॑नाः
stanzas.transliteration: daívyā hótārā prathamā́ ny r̥̀ñje saptá pr̥kṣā́saḥ svadháyā madanti r̥táṃ śáṃsanta r̥tám ít tá āhur ánu vratáṃ vratapā́ dī́dhyānāḥ
stanzas.translation: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner. These speak of truth, praising the truth eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.

translations.griffith: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner. These speak of truth, praising the truth eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.
translations.oldenberg: I catch hold of the two divine Hotris first. The seven strong ones 1 rejoice according to their wont. Teaching the right, they proclaim the right, the guardians of law, contemplating the law.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ भार॑ती॒ भार॑तीभिः स॒जोषा॒ इळा॑ दे॒वैर्म॑नु॒ष्ये॑भिर॒ग्निः सर॑स्वती सारस्व॒तेभि॑र॒र्वाक्ति॒स्रो दे॒वीर्ब॒र्हिरेदं स॑दन्तु
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ bhā́ratī bhā́ratībhiḥ sajóṣāḥ- íḷā devaír manuṣyèbhir agníḥ sárasvatī sārasvatébhir arvā́k tisró devī́r barhír édáṃ sadantu
stanzas.translation: May Bhâratî with all her Sisters, Iḷâ accordant with the Gods, with mortalls Agni, Sarasvatî with all her kindred Rivers, come to this grass, Three Goddesses, and seat them.

translations.griffith: May Bhâratî with all her Sisters, Iḷâ accordant with the Gods, with mortalls Agni, Sarasvatî with all her kindred Rivers, come to this grass, Three Goddesses, and seat them.
translations.oldenberg: 1 May Bhâratî, in concord with the Bhâratîs, Ilâ with the gods, Agni with men, Sarasvatî with all (beings) belonging to Sarasvatî (come) hither; may the three goddesses sit down on this sacrificial grass.

stanzas.sanskrit: तन्न॑स्तु॒रीप॒मध॑ पोषयि॒त्नु देव॑ त्वष्ट॒र्वि र॑रा॒णः स्य॑स्व यतो॑ वी॒रः क॑र्म॒ण्यः॑ सु॒दक्षो॑ यु॒क्तग्रा॑वा॒ जाय॑ते दे॒वका॑मः
stanzas.transliteration: tán nas turī́pam ádha poṣayitnú déva tvaṣṭar ví rarāṇáḥ syasva yáto vīráḥ karmaṇyàḥ sudákṣo yuktágrāvā jā́yate devákāmaḥ
stanzas.translation: Well pleased with us do thou O God, O Tvashṭar, give ready issue to our procreant vigour, Whence springs the hero, powerful, skilled in action, lover of Gods, adjuster of the press-stones.

translations.griffith: Well pleased with us do thou O God, O Tvashṭar, give ready issue to our procreant vigour, Whence springs the hero, powerful, skilled in action, lover of Gods, adjuster of the press-stones.
translations.oldenberg: O divine Tvashtri, grant us and send forth this our seed which is to thrive: (the seed) from which a manly son is born able and skilful, who sets to work the press-stones, loving the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: वन॑स्प॒तेऽव॑ सृ॒जोप॑ दे॒वान॒ग्निर्ह॒विः श॑मि॒ता सू॑दयाति सेदु॒ होता॑ स॒त्यत॑रो यजाति॒ यथा॑ दे॒वानां॒ जनि॑मानि॒ वेद॑
stanzas.transliteration: vánaspaté 'va sr̥jópa devā́n agnír havíḥ śamitā́ sūdayāti séd u hótā satyátaro yajāti yáthā devā́nāṃ jánimāni véda
stanzas.translation: Send to the Gods the oblation, Lord of Forests; and let the Immolator, Agni, dress it. He as the truer Priest shall offer worship, for the Gods' generations well he knoweth.

translations.griffith: Send to the Gods the oblation, Lord of Forests; and let the Immolator, Agni, dress it. He as the truer Priest shall offer worship, for the Gods' generations well he knoweth.
translations.oldenberg: O tree 1, send (the offering) forth to the gods. May Agni the slaughterer make the offering ready. May the same, the very true Hotri, sacrifice according as he knows the generations of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ या॑ह्यग्ने समिधा॒नो अ॒र्वाङिन्द्रे॑ण दे॒वैः स॒रथं॑ तु॒रेभिः॑ ब॒र्हिर्न॑ आस्ता॒मदि॑तिः सुपु॒त्रा स्वाहा॑ दे॒वा अ॒मृता॑ मादयन्ताम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yāhy agne samidhānó arvā́ṅ índreṇa devaíḥ saráthaṃ turébhiḥ barhír na āstām áditiḥ suputrā́ svā́hā devā́ amŕ̥tā mādayantām
stanzas.translation: Come thou to us, O Agni, duly kindled, together with the potent Gods and Indra. On this our grass sit Aditi, happy Mother, and let our Hail delight the Gods Immortal.

translations.griffith: Come thou to us, O Agni, duly kindled, together with the potent Gods and Indra. On this our grass sit Aditi, happy Mother, and let our Hail delight the Gods Immortal.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, being kindled, come hither, on one chariot with Indra, with the quick gods. May Aditi, the mother of noble sons, sit down on our sacrificial grass. With Svâhâ may the immortal gods rejoice.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रत्य॒ग्निरु॒षस॒श्चेकि॑ता॒नोऽबो॑धि॒ विप्रः॑ पद॒वीः क॑वी॒नाम् पृ॒थु॒पाजा॑ देव॒यद्भिः॒ समि॒द्धोऽप॒ द्वारा॒ तम॑सो॒ वह्नि॑रावः
stanzas.transliteration: práty agnír uṣásaś cékitānaḥ- -ábodhi vípraḥ padavī́ḥ kavīnā́m pr̥thupā́jā devayádbhiḥ sámiddhaḥ- -ápa dvā́rā támaso váhnir āvaḥ
stanzas.translation: AGNI who shines against the Dawns is wakened. The holy Singer who precedes the sages. With far-spread lustre, kindled by the pious, the Priest hath thrown both gates of darkness open.

translations.griffith: AGNI who shines against the Dawns is wakened. The holy Singer who precedes the sages. With far-spread lustre, kindled by the pious, the Priest hath thrown both gates of darkness open.
translations.oldenberg: Shining Agni has awoke over against the Dawns, the priest who traces the footsteps of the sages 1. With his broad stream of light kindled by the pious, the carrier (of the gods) has opened the two doors of darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रेद्व॒ग्निर्वा॑वृधे॒ स्तोमे॑भिर्गी॒र्भिः स्तो॑तॄ॒णां न॑म॒स्य॑ उ॒क्थैः पू॒र्वीर्ऋ॒तस्य॑ सं॒दृश॑श्चका॒नः सं दू॒तो अ॑द्यौदु॒षसो॑ विरो॒के
stanzas.transliteration: préd v agnír vāvr̥dhe stómebhir gīrbhí stotr̥̄ṇā́ṃ namasyà ukthaíḥ pūrvī́r r̥tásya saṃdŕ̥śaś cakānáḥ sáṃ dūtó adyaud uṣáso viroké
stanzas.translation: Agni hath waxen mighty by laudations, to be adored with hymns of those who praise him. Loving the varied shows of holy Order at the first flush of dawn he shines as envoy.

translations.griffith: Agni hath waxen mighty by laudations, to be adored with hymns of those who praise him. Loving the varied shows of holy Order at the first flush of dawn he shines as envoy.
translations.oldenberg: Agni has grown strong by praises, by the speeches of the praisers, by hymns, the adorable one. Loving many aspects of Rita the messenger has shone up at the bursting forth of the Dawn.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॑य्य॒ग्निर्मानु॑षीषु वि॒क्ष्व१॒॑पां गर्भो॑ मि॒त्र ऋ॒तेन॒ साध॑न् आ ह॑र्य॒तो य॑ज॒तः सान्व॑स्था॒दभू॑दु॒ विप्रो॒ हव्यो॑ मती॒नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ádhāyy agnír mā́nuṣīṣu vikṣú- -apā́ṃ gárbho mitrá r̥téna sā́dhan ā́ haryató yajatáḥ sā́nv asthād ábhūd u vípro hávyo matīnā́m
stanzas.translation: Amid men's homes hath Agni been established, fulfilling with the Law, Friend, germ of waters. Loved and adored, the height he hath ascended, the Singer, object of our invocations.

translations.griffith: Amid men's homes hath Agni been established, fulfilling with the Law, Friend, germ of waters. Loved and adored, the height he hath ascended, the Singer, object of our invocations.
translations.oldenberg: Agni has been established among the tribes of men, the son of the waters, Mitra 1, acting in the right way. The delightful, worshipful one has reached the top; the priest has become one who should be invoked by prayers.

stanzas.sanskrit: मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निर्भ॑वति॒ यत्समि॑द्धो मि॒त्रो होता॒ वरु॑णो जा॒तवे॑दाः मि॒त्रो अ॑ध्व॒र्युरि॑षि॒रो दमू॑ना मि॒त्रः सिन्धू॑नामु॒त पर्व॑तानाम्
stanzas.transliteration: mitró agnír bhavati yát sámiddho mitró hótā váruṇo jātávedāḥ mitró adhvaryúr iṣiró dámūnāḥ- mitráḥ síndhūnām utá párvatānām
stanzas.translation: Agni is Mitra when enkindled duly, Mitra as Priest, Varuṇa, Jâtavedas; Mitra as active minister, and House-Friend, Mitra of flowing rivers and of mountains.

translations.griffith: Agni is Mitra when enkindled duly, Mitra as Priest, Varuṇa, Jâtavedas; Mitra as active minister, and House-Friend, Mitra of flowing rivers and of mountains.
translations.oldenberg: Agni becomes Mitra 1, when he has been kindled; he the Hotri (Agni becomes) Mitra; he, Gâtavedas, (becomes) Varuna. The quick Adhvaryu, the domestic (god, Agni, becomes) Mitra, the Mitra (i. e. friend or ally) of the rivers and of the mountains.

stanzas.sanskrit: पाति॑ प्रि॒यं रि॒पो अग्रं॑ प॒दं वेः पाति॑ य॒ह्वश्चर॑णं॒ सूर्य॑स्य पाति॒ नाभा॑ स॒प्तशी॑र्षाणम॒ग्निः पाति॑ दे॒वाना॑मुप॒माद॑मृ॒ष्वः
stanzas.transliteration: pā́ti priyáṃ ripó ágram padáṃ véḥ pā́ti yahváś cáraṇaṃ sū́ryasya pā́ti nā́bhā saptáśīrṣāṇam agníḥ pā́ti devā́nām upamā́dam r̥ṣváḥ
stanzas.translation: The Earth's, the Bird's dear lofty place he guardeth, he guardeth in his might the course of Sûrya, Guardeth the Seven-headed in the centre, guardeth sublime the Deities enjoyment.

translations.griffith: The Earth's, the Bird's dear lofty place he guardeth, he guardeth in his might the course of Sûrya, Guardeth the Seven-headed in the centre, guardeth sublime the Deities enjoyment.
translations.oldenberg: He observes the deceiver's dear summit 1, the footstep of the bird 1; the vigorous one 2 observes the course of the Sun. Agni observes at his (?) navel the seven-headed (song?) 3; tall (Agni) observes the enjoyment of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒भुश्च॑क्र॒ ईड्यं॒ चारु॒ नाम॒ विश्वा॑नि दे॒वो व॒युना॑नि वि॒द्वान् स॒सस्य॒ चर्म॑ घृ॒तव॑त्प॒दं वेस्तदिद॒ग्नी र॑क्ष॒त्यप्र॑युच्छन्
stanzas.transliteration: r̥bhúś cakra ī́ḍyaṃ cā́ru nā́ma víśvāni devó vayúnāni vidvā́n sasásya cárma ghr̥távat padáṃ vés tád íd agnī́ rakṣaty áprayuchan
stanzas.translation: The skilful God who knows all forms of knowledge made for himself a fair form, meet for worship. This Agni guards with care that never ceases the Sonia's skin, the Bird's place rich in fatness.

translations.griffith: The skilful God who knows all forms of knowledge made for himself a fair form, meet for worship. This Agni guards with care that never ceases the Sonia's skin, the Bird's place rich in fatness.
translations.oldenberg: The Ribhu 1 has created for himself a good name worthy of being magnified, he, the god who knows all laws. The skin of the herbs 2, the bird's footstep 3 rich in ghee: Agni watches (all) that, never failing.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ योनि॑म॒ग्निर्घृ॒तव॑न्तमस्थात्पृ॒थुप्र॑गाणमु॒शन्त॑मुशा॒नः दीद्या॑नः॒ शुचि॑र्ऋ॒ष्वः पा॑व॒कः पुनः॑पुनर्मा॒तरा॒ नव्य॑सी कः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yónim agnír ghr̥távantam asthāt pr̥thúpragāṇam uśántam uśānáḥ dī́dyānaḥ śúcir r̥ṣváḥ pāvakáḥ púnaḥ-punar mātárā návyasī kaḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni hath entered longingly the longing shrine rich with fatness, giving easy access. Resplendent, pure, sublime and purifying, again, again he renovates his Mothers.

translations.griffith: Agni hath entered longingly the longing shrine rich with fatness, giving easy access. Resplendent, pure, sublime and purifying, again, again he renovates his Mothers.
translations.oldenberg: Agni has approached the place 1 rich in ghee (the altar), with broad passages, (the place) longing (for him), longing (himself). He the resplendent, bright, tall purifier has made his two parents 2 new again and again.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒द्यो जा॒त ओष॑धीभिर्ववक्षे॒ यदी॒ वर्ध॑न्ति प्र॒स्वो॑ घृ॒तेन॑ आप॑ इव प्र॒वता॒ शुम्भ॑माना उरु॒ष्यद॒ग्निः पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थे॑
stanzas.transliteration: sadyó jātá óṣadhībhir vavakṣe yádī várdhanti prasvò ghr̥téna ā́pa iva pravátā śúmbhamānāḥ- uruṣyád agníḥ pitrór upásthe
stanzas.translation: Born suddenly, by plants he grew to greatness, when tender shoots with holy oil increased him, Like waters lovely when they hasten downward may Agni in his Parents' lap protect us.

translations.griffith: Born suddenly, by plants he grew to greatness, when tender shoots with holy oil increased him, Like waters lovely when they hasten downward may Agni in his Parents' lap protect us.
translations.oldenberg: As soon as born he has grown by the grass 1, when the sprouting (grass-)blades strengthen him with ghee. Like waters beautiful on their precipitous path, Agni, being in the lap of his parents, has escaped into wide space.

stanzas.sanskrit: उदु॑ ष्टु॒तः स॒मिधा॑ य॒ह्वो अ॑द्यौ॒द्वर्ष्म॑न्दि॒वो अधि॒ नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्याः मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निरीड्यो॑ मात॒रिश्वा दू॒तो व॑क्षद्य॒जथा॑य दे॒वान्
stanzas.transliteration: úd u ṣṭutáḥ samídhā yahvó adyaud várṣman divó ádhi nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ḥ mitró agnír ī́ḍyo mātaríśvā́ dūtó vakṣad yajáthāya devā́n
stanzas.translation: Extolled, the Strong shone forth with kindled fuel to the earth's centre, to the height of heaven. May Agni, Friend, adorable Mâtariṣvan, as envoy bring the Gods unto our worship.

translations.griffith: Extolled, the Strong shone forth with kindled fuel to the earth's centre, to the height of heaven. May Agni, Friend, adorable Mâtariṣvan, as envoy bring the Gods unto our worship.
translations.oldenberg: Receiving praise the vigorous one 1 has shone forth with his fuel, on heaven's summit, on the earth's navel. May Agni worthy of being magnified, (being) Mitra and Mâtarisvan, the messenger, carry hither the gods that they may receive our sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: उद॑स्तम्भीत्स॒मिधा॒ नाक॑मृ॒ष्वो॒३॒॑ऽग्निर्भव॑न्नुत्त॒मो रो॑च॒नाना॑म् यदी॒ भृगु॑भ्यः॒ परि॑ मात॒रिश्वा॒ गुहा॒ सन्तं॑ हव्य॒वाहं॑ समी॒धे
stanzas.transliteration: úd astambhīt samídhā nā́kam r̥ṣváḥ- -agnír bhávann uttamó rocanā́nām yádī bhŕ̥gubhyaḥ pári mātaríśvā gúhā sántaṃ havyavā́haṃ samīdhé
stanzas.translation: Best of all luminaries lofty Agni supported with his flame the height of heaven, When, far from Bhr̥igus, Mâtariṣvan kindled the oblation-bearer where he lay in secret.

translations.griffith: Best of all luminaries lofty Agni supported with his flame the height of heaven, When, far from Bhr̥igus, Mâtariṣvan kindled the oblation-bearer where he lay in secret.
translations.oldenberg: The tall one has, by (receiving) fuel, upheld the firmament, Agni, becoming the highest of lights, when Mâtarisvan for the sake of the Bhrigus 1 kindled the carrier of oblations, (Agni) who dwelt in secret.

stanzas.sanskrit: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā- -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé
stanzas.translation: As holy food, Agni to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-word.

translations.griffith: As holy food, Agni to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-word.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र का॑रवो मन॒ना व॒च्यमा॑ना देव॒द्रीचीं॑ नयत देव॒यन्तः॑ द॒क्षि॒णा॒वाड्वा॒जिनी॒ प्राच्ये॑ति ह॒विर्भर॑न्त्य॒ग्नये॑ घृ॒ताची॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá kāravo mananā́ vacyámānāḥ- devadrī́cīṃ nayata devayántaḥ dakṣiṇāvā́ḍ vājínī prā́cy eti havír bháranty agnáye ghr̥tā́cī
stanzas.translation: URGED on by deep devotion, O ye singers, bring, pious ones, the God-approaching ladle. Borne onward to the right it travels eastward, and, filled with oil, to Agni bears oblation.

translations.griffith: URGED on by deep devotion, O ye singers, bring, pious ones, the God-approaching ladle. Borne onward to the right it travels eastward, and, filled with oil, to Agni bears oblation.
translations.oldenberg: Bring forward, ye pious singers, stirred in your thoughts 1, (the ladle) which is turned towards the gods. Carrying (the sacrificial butter) from left to right 2 it turns eastward, rich in strength, bringing the offering to Agni, full of ghee.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ रोद॑सी अपृणा॒ जाय॑मान उ॒त प्र रि॑क्था॒ अध॒ नु प्र॑यज्यो दि॒वश्चि॑दग्ने महि॒ना पृ॑थि॒व्या व॒च्यन्तां॑ ते॒ वह्न॑यः स॒प्तजि॑ह्वाः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇā jā́yamānaḥ- utá prá rikthā ádha nú prayajyo diváś cid agne mahinā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ- vacyántāṃ te váhnayaḥ saptájihvāḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou at thy birth didst fill both earth and heaven, yea, Most Adorable, thou didst exceed them. Even through the heaven's and through the earth's expanses let thy swift seventongued flames roll on, O Agni.

translations.griffith: Thou at thy birth didst fill both earth and heaven, yea, Most Adorable, thou didst exceed them. Even through the heaven's and through the earth's expanses let thy swift seventongued flames roll on, O Agni.
translations.oldenberg: When born thou hast filled the two worlds, nay thou hast even exceeded them, O friend of sacrifices 1. May, O Agni, thy seven-tongued horses 2 move along, by the greatness of heaven and earth 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यौश्च॑ त्वा पृथि॒वी य॒ज्ञिया॑सो॒ नि होता॑रं सादयन्ते॒ दमा॑य यदी॒ विशो॒ मानु॑षीर्देव॒यन्तीः॒ प्रय॑स्वती॒रीळ॑ते शु॒क्रम॒र्चिः
stanzas.transliteration: dyaúś ca tvā pr̥thivī́ yajñíyāso ní hótāraṃ sādayante dámāya yádī víśo mā́nuṣīr devayántīḥ práyasvatīr ī́ḷate śukrám arcíḥ
stanzas.translation: Both Heaven and Earth and Gods who should be worshipped establish thee as Priest for every dwelling, Whenever human families, God-devoted, bringing oblations; laud thy splendid lustre.

translations.griffith: Both Heaven and Earth and Gods who should be worshipped establish thee as Priest for every dwelling, Whenever human families, God-devoted, bringing oblations; laud thy splendid lustre.
translations.oldenberg: Heaven and Earth the worshipful 1 establish thee as Hotri for the house, whenever the pious human tribes offering food magnify the bright light.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हान्त्स॒धस्थे॑ ध्रु॒व आ निष॑त्तो॒ऽन्तर्द्यावा॒ माहि॑ने॒ हर्य॑माणः आस्क्रे॑ स॒पत्नी॑ अ॒जरे॒ अमृ॑क्ते सब॒र्दुघे॑ उरुगा॒यस्य॑ धे॒नू
stanzas.transliteration: mahā́n sadhásthe dhruvá ā́ níṣatto -antár dyā́vā mā́hine háryamāṇaḥ ā́skre sapátnī ajáre ámr̥kte sabardúghe urugāyásya dhenū́
stanzas.translation: Firm in the Gods' home is the Mighty seated, between vast Heaven and Earth the well-beloved- Those Cows who yield, unharmed, their nectar, Spouses of the Far-Strider, everyoung, united.

translations.griffith: Firm in the Gods' home is the Mighty seated, between vast Heaven and Earth the well-beloved- Those Cows who yield, unharmed, their nectar, Spouses of the Far-Strider, everyoung, united.
translations.oldenberg: (Thou art) seated, the great one, in a firm place 1, between the two mighty Heavens 2, thou who art longed for—(between) the two united 3 never-ageing, inviolable wives, the two juice-yielding milch-cows 4 of the far-reigning one 5.

stanzas.sanskrit: व्र॒ता ते॑ अग्ने मह॒तो म॒हानि॒ तव॒ क्रत्वा॒ रोद॑सी॒ आ त॑तन्थ त्वं दू॒तो अ॑भवो॒ जाय॑मान॒स्त्वं ने॒ता वृ॑षभ चर्षणी॒नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: vratā́ te agne maható mahā́ni táva krátvā ródasī ā́ tatantha tváṃ dūtó abhavo jā́yamānas tváṃ netā́ vr̥ṣabha carṣaṇīnā́m
stanzas.translation: Great are the deeds of thee, the Great, O Agni: thou by thy power hast spread out earth and heaven. As soon as thou wast born thou wast an envoy, thou, Mighty One, was Leader of the people.

translations.griffith: Great are the deeds of thee, the Great, O Agni: thou by thy power hast spread out earth and heaven. As soon as thou wast born thou wast an envoy, thou, Mighty One, was Leader of the people.
translations.oldenberg: Thy, the great (god's) laws, O Agni, are great. Through the power of thy mind thou hast spread out the two worlds. Thou hast become a messenger at thy birth, thou, O bull, the leader of the tribes.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तस्य॑ वा के॒शिना॑ यो॒ग्याभि॑र्घृत॒स्नुवा॒ रोहि॑ता धु॒रि धि॑ष्व अथा व॑ह दे॒वान्दे॑व॒ विश्वा॑न्त्स्वध्व॒रा कृ॑णुहि जातवेदः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tásya vā keśínā yogyā́bhir ghr̥tasnúvā róhitā dhurí dhiṣva áthā́ vaha devā́n deva víśvān svadhvarā́ kr̥ṇuhi jātavedaḥ
stanzas.translation: Bind to the pole with cords of holy Order the long-maned ruddy steeds who sprinkle fatness. Bring hithier, O thou God, all Gods together: provide them noble worship, Jâtavedas.

translations.griffith: Bind to the pole with cords of holy Order the long-maned ruddy steeds who sprinkle fatness. Bring hithier, O thou God, all Gods together: provide them noble worship, Jâtavedas.
translations.oldenberg: Or bind to the pole by means of thy (art of) harnessing the two long-maned, red (horses) of Rita, that swim in ghee 1, and carry hither, O god, all gods; perform splendid worship, O Gâtavedas!

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वश्चि॒दा ते॑ रुचयन्त रो॒का उ॒षो वि॑भा॒तीरनु॑ भासि पू॒र्वीः अ॒पो यद॑ग्न उ॒शध॒ग्वने॑षु॒ होतु॑र्म॒न्द्रस्य॑ प॒नय॑न्त दे॒वाः
stanzas.transliteration: diváś cid ā́ te rucayanta rokā́ḥ- uṣó vibhātī́r ánu bhāsi pūrvī́ḥ apó yád agna uśádhag váneṣu hótur mandrásya panáyanta devā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Even from the sky thy brilliant lights shone hither: still hast thou beamed through many a radiant morning, That the Gods praised their joyous Herald's labour eagerly burning, Agni, in the forests.

translations.griffith: Even from the sky thy brilliant lights shone hither: still hast thou beamed through many a radiant morning, That the Gods praised their joyous Herald's labour eagerly burning, Agni, in the forests.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Even from heaven thy shining lights have shone; thy splendour follows many resplendent dawns, when the gods, O Agni, praised the cheerful Hotri's work 2 who eagerly burns in the forests 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒रौ वा॒ ये अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ मद॑न्ति दि॒वो वा॒ ये रो॑च॒ने सन्ति॑ दे॒वाः ऊमा॑ वा॒ ये सु॒हवा॑सो॒ यज॑त्रा आयेमि॒रे र॒थ्यो॑ अग्ने॒ अश्वाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: uraú vā yé antárikṣe mádanti divó vā yé rocané sánti devā́ḥ ū́mā vā yé suhávāso yájatrāḥ- āyemiré rathyò agne áśvāḥ
stanzas.translation: The Gods who take delight in air's wide region, or those the dwellers in heaven's realm of brightness, Or those, the Holy, prompt to hear, our helpers, who, carborne, turn their horses hither, Agni---

translations.griffith: The Gods who take delight in air's wide region, or those the dwellers in heaven's realm of brightness, Or those, the Holy, prompt to hear, our helpers, who, carborne, turn their horses hither, Agni---
translations.oldenberg: Whether it be the gods who rejoice in the wide air, or those who dwell in the heavenly light, or those who are helpful 1, ready to hear our call, and worshipful; or whether the horses of thy chariot, O Agni, have turned themselves hither—

stanzas.sanskrit: ऐभि॑रग्ने स॒रथं॑ याह्य॒र्वाङ्ना॑नार॒थं वा॑ वि॒भवो॒ ह्यश्वाः॑ पत्नी॑वतस्त्रिं॒शतं॒ त्रीँश्च॑ दे॒वान॑नुष्व॒धमा व॑ह मा॒दय॑स्व
stanzas.transliteration: aíbhir agne saráthaṃ yāhy arvā́ṅ nānāratháṃ vā vibhávo hy áśvāḥ pátnīvatas triṃśátaṃ trī́ṃś ca devā́n anuṣvadhám ā́ vaha mādáyasva
stanzas.translation: With these, borne on one ear, Agni, approach us, or borne on many, for thy steeds are able. Bring, with their Dames, the Gods, the Three and-Thirty, after thy Godlike nature, and be joyful.

translations.griffith: With these, borne on one ear, Agni, approach us, or borne on many, for thy steeds are able. Bring, with their Dames, the Gods, the Three and-Thirty, after thy Godlike nature, and be joyful.
translations.oldenberg: Come hither with them, O Agni, on one chariot or on many chariots, for thy horses are powerful. Bring hither, after thy nature, the thirty and the three gods with their wives, and rejoice (in the Soma).

stanzas.sanskrit: स होता॒ यस्य॒ रोद॑सी चिदु॒र्वी य॒ज्ञंय॑ज्ञम॒भि वृ॒धे गृ॑णी॒तः प्राची॑ अध्व॒रेव॑ तस्थतुः सु॒मेके॑ ऋ॒ताव॑री ऋ॒तजा॑तस्य स॒त्ये
stanzas.transliteration: sá hótā yásya ródasī cid urvī́ yajñáṃ-yajñam abhí vr̥dhé gr̥ṇītáḥ prā́cī adhvaréva tasthatuḥ suméke r̥tā́varī r̥tájātasya satyé
stanzas.translation: He is the Priest at whose repeated worship even wide Heaven and Earth sing out for increase. They fair and true and holy coming forward stand at his sacrifice who springs from Order.

translations.griffith: He is the Priest at whose repeated worship even wide Heaven and Earth sing out for increase. They fair and true and holy coming forward stand at his sacrifice who springs from Order.
translations.oldenberg: He is the Hotri whose sacrifice even the two wide worlds salute over and over again for the sake of prosperity. Turned to the east 1, the two well-established 2 (goddesses, Heaven and Earth), the righteous, true ones stand as at the sacrifice 3 of (Agni) the right-born.

stanzas.sanskrit: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā- -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé
stanzas.translation: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.

translations.griffith: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र य आ॒रुः शि॑तिपृ॒ष्ठस्य॑ धा॒सेरा मा॒तरा॑ विविशुः स॒प्त वाणीः॑ प॒रि॒क्षिता॑ पि॒तरा॒ सं च॑रेते॒ प्र स॑र्स्राते दी॒र्घमायुः॑ प्र॒यक्षे॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá yá ārúḥ śitipr̥ṣṭhásya dhāsér ā́ mātárā viviśuḥ saptá vā́ṇīḥ parikṣítā pitárā sáṃ carete prá sarsrāte dīrghám ā́yuḥ prayákṣe
stanzas.translation: THE seven tones risen from the whitebacked viand have made their way between the pair of Mothers. Both circumjacent Parents come together to yield us length of days they hasten forward.

translations.griffith: THE seven tones risen from the whitebacked viand have made their way between the pair of Mothers. Both circumjacent Parents come together to yield us length of days they hasten forward.
