translations.oldenberg: They who have risen out of the drink of the white-backed one, have entered the two parents, the seven sounds. The (all-)encompassing parents come together; they go forth to aspire after long life 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वक्ष॑सो धे॒नवो॒ वृष्णो॒ अश्वा॑ दे॒वीरा त॑स्थौ॒ मधु॑म॒द्वह॑न्तीः ऋ॒तस्य॑ त्वा॒ सद॑सि क्षेम॒यन्तं॒ पर्येका॑ चरति वर्त॒निं गौः
stanzas.transliteration: divákṣaso dhenávo vŕ̥ṣṇo áśvāḥ- devī́r ā́ tasthau mádhumad váhantīḥ r̥tásya tvā sádasi kṣemayántam páry ékā carati vartaníṃ gaúḥ
stanzas.translation: The Male who dwells in heaven hath Mares and Milchkine: he came to Goddesses who bring sweet treasure. To thee safe resting in the seat of Order the Cow alone upon her way proceedeth.

translations.griffith: The Male who dwells in heaven hath Mares and Milchkine: he came to Goddesses who bring sweet treasure. To thee safe resting in the seat of Order the Cow alone upon her way proceedeth.
translations.oldenberg: The milch-cows dwelling in heaven 1 are the mares of the manly one. He has bestridden the goddesses who carry the sweet (food) 2. Thee who livest in peace in the abode of Rita, the one cow 3 circumambulates, making her way.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ सी॑मरोहत्सु॒यमा॒ भव॑न्तीः॒ पति॑श्चिकि॒त्वान्र॑यि॒विद्र॑यी॒णाम् प्र नील॑पृष्ठो अत॒सस्य॑ धा॒सेस्ता अ॑वासयत्पुरु॒धप्र॑तीकः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ sīm arohat suyámā bhávantīḥ pátiś cikitvā́n rayivíd rayīṇā́m prá nī́lapr̥ṣṭho atasásya dhāsés tā́ avāsayat purudhápratīkaḥ
stanzas.translation: Wise Master, wealthy finder-out of riches, he mounted those who may with case be guided. He, dark-backed, manifold with varied aspect, hath made them burst forth from their food the brushwood.

translations.griffith: Wise Master, wealthy finder-out of riches, he mounted those who may with case be guided. He, dark-backed, manifold with varied aspect, hath made them burst forth from their food the brushwood.
translations.oldenberg: He has mounted the (mares) 1 that became well-manageable, the wise lord, the finder of riches. He with the dark blue back, with many faces, has made them depart from the drink of the brush-wood 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: महि॑ त्वा॒ष्ट्रमू॒र्जय॑न्तीरजु॒र्यं स्त॑भू॒यमा॑नं व॒हतो॑ वहन्ति व्यङ्गे॑भिर्दिद्युता॒नः स॒धस्थ॒ एका॑मिव॒ रोद॑सी॒ आ वि॑वेश
stanzas.transliteration: máhi tvāṣṭrám ūrjáyantīr ajuryáṃ stabhūyámānaṃ vaháto vahanti vy áṅgebhir didyutānáḥ sadhásthe- ékām iva ródasī ā́ viveśa
stanzas.translation: Strength-giving streams bear hither him eternal, fain to support the mighty work. of Tvashṭar. He, flashing in his home with all his members, hath entered both the worlds as they were single.

translations.griffith: Strength-giving streams bear hither him eternal, fain to support the mighty work. of Tvashṭar. He, flashing in his home with all his members, hath entered both the worlds as they were single.
translations.oldenberg: Giving mighty vigour to the never-ageing son of Tvashtri 1, the streams 2 carry Him the firmly fixed one. Flashing in his abode with his limbs he has entered upon the two worlds as if they were one.

stanzas.sanskrit: जा॒नन्ति॒ वृष्णो॑ अरु॒षस्य॒ शेव॑मु॒त ब्र॒ध्नस्य॒ शास॑ने रणन्ति दि॒वो॒रुचः॑ सु॒रुचो॒ रोच॑माना॒ इळा॒ येषां॒ गण्या॒ माहि॑ना॒ गीः
stanzas.transliteration: jānánti vŕ̥ṣṇo aruṣásya śévam utá bradhnásya śā́sane raṇanti divorúcaḥ surúco rócamānāḥ- íḷā yéṣāṃ gáṇyā mā́hinā gī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: They know the red Bull's blessing, and are joyful under the flaming-coloured Lord's dominion: They who give shine from heavenwith fair effulgence, whose lofty song like Iḷâ must be honoured.

translations.griffith: They know the red Bull's blessing, and are joyful under the flaming-coloured Lord's dominion: They who give shine from heavenwith fair effulgence, whose lofty song like Iḷâ must be honoured.
translations.oldenberg: They know friendship towards the manly, the red one, and they delight in the command of ruddy (Agni), (the gods) shining from heaven, resplendent with bright shine, to whose host Ilâ belongs, the mighty praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒तो पि॒तृभ्यां॑ प्र॒विदानु॒ घोषं॑ म॒हो म॒हद्भ्या॑मनयन्त शू॒षम् उ॒क्षा ह॒ यत्र॒ परि॒ धान॑म॒क्तोरनु॒ स्वं धाम॑ जरि॒तुर्व॒वक्ष॑
stanzas.transliteration: utó pitŕ̥bhyām pravídā́nu ghóṣam mahó mahádbhyām anayanta śūṣám ukṣā́ ha yátra pári dhā́nam aktór ánu sváṃ dhā́ma jaritúr vavákṣa
stanzas.translation: Yea, by tradition from the ancient sages they brought great strength from the two mighty Parents, To where the singer's Bull, the night's dispeller, after his proper law hath waxen stronger.

translations.griffith: Yea, by tradition from the ancient sages they brought great strength from the two mighty Parents, To where the singer's Bull, the night's dispeller, after his proper law hath waxen stronger.
translations.oldenberg: And finding it out by following the noise they brought to the great one's great parents a song of praise, when the bull about nightfall (?) has grown strong according to the singer's own law 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ध्व॒र्युभिः॑ प॒ञ्चभिः॑ स॒प्त विप्राः॑ प्रि॒यं र॑क्षन्ते॒ निहि॑तं प॒दं वेः प्राञ्चो॑ मदन्त्यु॒क्षणो॑ अजु॒र्या दे॒वा दे॒वाना॒मनु॒ हि व्र॒ता गुः
stanzas.transliteration: adhvaryúbhiḥ pañcábhiḥ saptá víprāḥ priyáṃ rakṣante níhitam padáṃ véḥ prā́ñco madanty ukṣáṇo ajuryā́ḥ- devā́ devā́nām ánu hí vratā́ gúḥ
stanzas.translation: Seven holy singers guard with five Adhvaryus the Bird's beloved firmly-settled station. The willing Bulls, untouched by old, rejoice them: as Gods themselves the ways of Gods they follow.

translations.griffith: Seven holy singers guard with five Adhvaryus the Bird's beloved firmly-settled station. The willing Bulls, untouched by old, rejoice them: as Gods themselves the ways of Gods they follow.
translations.oldenberg: With the five Adhvaryus the seven priests watch the beloved footstep which the bird has made 1. Turned forwards the never-ageing bulls 2 rejoice: for they, being gods, have followed the laws of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: दैव्या॒ होता॑रा प्रथ॒मा न्यृ॑ञ्जे स॒प्त पृ॒क्षासः॑ स्व॒धया॑ मदन्ति ऋ॒तं शंस॑न्त ऋ॒तमित्त आ॑हु॒रनु॑ व्र॒तं व्र॑त॒पा दीध्या॑नाः
stanzas.transliteration: daívyā hótārā prathamā́ ny r̥̀ñje saptá pr̥kṣā́saḥ svadháyā madanti r̥táṃ śáṃsanta r̥tám ít tá āhur ánu vratáṃ vratapā́ dī́dhyānāḥ
stanzas.translation: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner. These speak of truth, praising the Truth Eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.

translations.griffith: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner. These speak of truth, praising the Truth Eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृ॒षा॒यन्ते॑ म॒हे अत्या॑य पू॒र्वीर्वृष्णे॑ चि॒त्राय॑ र॒श्मयः॑ सुया॒माः देव॑ होतर्म॒न्द्रत॑रश्चिकि॒त्वान्म॒हो दे॒वान्रोद॑सी॒ एह व॑क्षि
stanzas.transliteration: vr̥ṣāyánte mahé átyāya pūrvī́r vŕ̥ṣṇe citrā́ya raśmáyaḥ suyāmā́ḥ déva hotar mandrátaraś cikitvā́n mahó devā́n ródasī éhá vakṣi
stanzas.translation: The many seek the great Steed as a stallion: the reins obey the Lord of varied colour. O heavenly Priest, most pleasant, full of wisdom, bring the great Gods to us, and Earth and Heaven.

translations.griffith: The many seek the great Steed as a stallion: the reins obey the Lord of varied colour. O heavenly Priest, most pleasant, full of wisdom, bring the great Gods to us, and Earth and Heaven.
translations.oldenberg: The many (mares) are full of desire for the mighty stallion. For the manly, bright one, the reins easily direct (the horses) 1. Divine Hotri! Thou who art a great joy-giver and wise, bring hither the great gods and the two worlds 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: पृ॒क्षप्र॑यजो द्रविणः सु॒वाचः॑ सुके॒तव॑ उ॒षसो॑ रे॒वदू॑षुः उ॒तो चि॑दग्ने महि॒ना पृ॑थि॒व्याः कृ॒तं चि॒देनः॒ सं म॒हे द॑शस्य
stanzas.transliteration: pr̥kṣáprayajo draviṇaḥ suvā́caḥ suketáva uṣáso revád ūṣuḥ utó cid agne mahinā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ kr̥táṃ cid énaḥ sám mahé daśasya
stanzas.translation: Rich Lord, the Mornings have gleamed forth in splendour, fair-rayed, fair-speaking, worshipped with all viands, Yea, with the glory of the earth, O Agni. Forgive us, for our weal, e'en sin cornmitted.

translations.griffith: Rich Lord, the Mornings have gleamed forth in splendour, fair-rayed, fair-speaking, worshipped with all viands, Yea, with the glory of the earth, O Agni. Forgive us, for our weal, e'en sin cornmitted.
translations.oldenberg: The dawns, O wealth-giver, the mighty sacrificers 1, well spoken and bright have shone with wealth. And by the earth's greatness 2, O Agni, forgive us even committed sin 3, that we may be great.

stanzas.sanskrit: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā- -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé
stanzas.translation: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son, and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.

translations.griffith: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son, and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ञ्जन्ति॒ त्वाम॑ध्व॒रे दे॑व॒यन्तो॒ वन॑स्पते॒ मधु॑ना॒ दैव्ये॑न यदू॒र्ध्वस्तिष्ठा॒ द्रवि॑णे॒ह ध॑त्ता॒द्यद्वा॒ क्षयो॑ मा॒तुर॒स्या उ॒पस्थे॑
stanzas.transliteration: añjánti tvā́m adhvaré devayánto vánaspate mádhunā daívyena yád ūrdhvás tíṣṭhā dráviṇehá dhattād yád vā kṣáyo mātúr asyā́ upásthe
stanzas.translation: GOD-SERVING men, O Sovran of the Forest, with heavenly meath at sacrifice anoint thee. Grant wealth to us when thou art standing upright as when reposing on this Mother's bosom.

translations.griffith: GOD-SERVING men, O Sovran of the Forest, with heavenly meath at sacrifice anoint thee. Grant wealth to us when thou art standing upright as when reposing on this Mother's bosom.
translations.oldenberg: The worshippers of the gods anoint thee at the sacrifice, O lord of the forest 1, with heavenly honey 2. When standing upright bestow wealth (on us) here, or when abiding in this mother's lap 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: समि॑द्धस्य॒ श्रय॑माणः पु॒रस्ता॒द्ब्रह्म॑ वन्वा॒नो अ॒जरं॑ सु॒वीर॑म् आ॒रे अ॒स्मदम॑तिं॒ बाध॑मान॒ उच्छ्र॑यस्व मह॒ते सौभ॑गाय
stanzas.transliteration: sámiddhasya śráyamāṇaḥ purástād bráhma vanvānó ajáraṃ suvī́ram āré asmád ámatim bā́dhamānaḥ- úc chrayasva mahaté saúbhagāya
stanzas.translation: Set up to eastward of the fire enkindled, accepting prayer that wastes not, rich in hero. Driving far from us poverty and famine, lift thyself up to bring us great good fortune.

translations.griffith: Set up to eastward of the fire enkindled, accepting prayer that wastes not, rich in hero. Driving far from us poverty and famine, lift thyself up to bring us great good fortune.
translations.oldenberg: Situated in front of the kindled (fire), accepting our sacred spell which protects from old age and gives valiant offspring, driving away far from us lack of thoughts 1, rise up 2 for the sake of great prosperity.

stanzas.sanskrit: उच्छ्र॑यस्व वनस्पते॒ वर्ष्म॑न्पृथि॒व्या अधि॑ सुमि॑ती मी॒यमा॑नो॒ वर्चो॑ धा य॒ज्ञवा॑हसे
stanzas.transliteration: úc chrayasva vanaspate várṣman pr̥thivyā́ ádhi súmitī mīyámāno várco dhā yajñávāhase
stanzas.translation: Lord of the Forest, raise. thyself up on the loftiest spot of earth. Give splendour, fixt and measured well, to him who brings the sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Lord of the Forest, raise. thyself up on the loftiest spot of earth. Give splendour, fixt and measured well, to him who brings the sacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: Rise up, O lord of the forest, on the summit of the earth. Erected by skilful erection bestow splendour on (the worshipper) who fits out the sacrifice as a vehicle 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: युवा॑ सु॒वासाः॒ परि॑वीत॒ आगा॒त्स उ॒ श्रेया॑न्भवति॒ जाय॑मानः तं धीरा॑सः क॒वय॒ उन्न॑यन्ति स्वा॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ मन॑सा देव॒यन्तः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yúvā suvā́sāḥ párivīta ā́gāt sá u śréyān bhavati jā́yamānaḥ táṃ dhī́rāsaḥ kaváya ún nayanti svādhyò mánasā devayántaḥ
stanzas.translation: Well-robed, enveloped he is come, the youthful: springing to life his glory waxeth greater. Contemplative in mind and God-adoring, sages of high intelligence upraise him.

translations.griffith: Well-robed, enveloped he is come, the youthful: springing to life his glory waxeth greater. Contemplative in mind and God-adoring, sages of high intelligence upraise him.
translations.oldenberg: A well-clothed youth dressed has come hither. He becomes more excellent when born 1. Wise sages full of pious thoughts, longing for the gods in their mind, bring him forth.

stanzas.sanskrit: जा॒तो जा॑यते सुदिन॒त्वे अह्नां॑ सम॒र्य आ वि॒दथे॒ वर्ध॑मानः पु॒नन्ति॒ धीरा॑ अ॒पसो॑ मनी॒षा दे॑व॒या विप्र॒ उदि॑यर्ति॒ वाच॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: jātó jāyate sudinatvé áhnāṃ samaryá ā́ vidáthe várdhamānaḥ punánti dhī́rā apáso manīṣā́ devayā́ vípra úd iyarti vā́cam
stanzas.translation: Sprung up he rises in the days' fair weather, increasing in the men-frequented synod. With song the wise and skilful consecrate him: his voice the God-adoring singer utters.

translations.griffith: Sprung up he rises in the days' fair weather, increasing in the men-frequented synod. With song the wise and skilful consecrate him: his voice the God-adoring singer utters.
translations.oldenberg: He who has been born is born 1 in the auspiciousness of days, growing up in the assembly and at the sacrifice 2. Wise, active men purify him by pious thoughts; the priest approaching the gods raises his voice 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: यान्वो॒ नरो॑ देव॒यन्तो॑ निमि॒म्युर्वन॑स्पते॒ स्वधि॑तिर्वा त॒तक्ष॑ ते दे॒वासः॒ स्वर॑वस्तस्थि॒वांसः॑ प्र॒जाव॑द॒स्मे दि॑धिषन्तु॒ रत्न॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yā́n vo náro devayánto nimimyúr vánaspate svádhitir vā tatákṣa té devā́saḥ sváravas tasthivā́ṃsaḥ prajā́vad asmé didhiṣantu rátnam
stanzas.translation: , Ye whom religious men have firmly planted; thou Forest Sovran whom the axe hath fashioned,– Let those the Stakes divine which here are standing be fain to grant us wealth with store of children.

translations.griffith: , Ye whom religious men have firmly planted; thou Forest Sovran whom the axe hath fashioned,– Let those the Stakes divine which here are standing be fain to grant us wealth with store of children.
translations.oldenberg: You whom the worshippers of the gods have fastened down (in the earth), or whom the axe has fashioned, O lord of the forest: may those divine posts 1 standing (here) take care to bestow on us treasures with offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये वृ॒क्णासो॒ अधि॒ क्षमि॒ निमि॑तासो य॒तस्रु॑चः ते नो॑ व्यन्तु॒ वार्यं॑ देव॒त्रा क्षे॑त्र॒साध॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: yé vr̥kṇā́so ádhi kṣámi nímitāso yatásrucaḥ té no vyantu vā́ryaṃ devatrā́ kṣetrasā́dhasaḥ
stanzas.translation: O men who lift the ladles up, these hewn and planted in the ground, Bringing a blessing to the field, shall bear our precious gift to Gods.

translations.griffith: O men who lift the ladles up, these hewn and planted in the ground, Bringing a blessing to the field, shall bear our precious gift to Gods.
translations.oldenberg: (The posts) which have been hewn on the earth and fastened down, and to which the sacrificial ladles have been raised 1: may they, giving bliss to our fields 2, eagerly seek precious goods for us among the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒दि॒त्या रु॒द्रा वस॑वः सुनी॒था द्यावा॒क्षामा॑ पृथि॒वी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम् स॒जोष॑सो य॒ज्ञम॑वन्तु दे॒वा ऊ॒र्ध्वं कृ॑ण्वन्त्वध्व॒रस्य॑ के॒तुम्
stanzas.transliteration: ādityā́ rudrā́ vásavaḥ sunīthā́ḥ- dyā́vākṣā́mā pr̥thivī́ antárikṣam sajóṣaso yajñám avantu devā́ḥ- ūrdhváṃ kr̥ṇvantv adhvarásya ketúm
stanzas.translation: Âdityas, Rudras, Vasus, careful leaders, Earth, Heaven, and Pr̥ithivî and Air's mid-region, Accordant Deities shall bless our worship and make our sacrifice's ensign lofty.

translations.griffith: Âdityas, Rudras, Vasus, careful leaders, Earth, Heaven, and Pr̥ithivî and Air's mid-region, Accordant Deities shall bless our worship and make our sacrifice's ensign lofty.
translations.oldenberg: May the Âdityas, the Rudras, the Vasus, the good leaders, Heaven and Earth, the Earth 1 and the Air—may the gods unanimously bless this sacrifice; may they raise up the banner of the sacrifice (the Yûpa).

stanzas.sanskrit: हं॒सा इ॑व श्रेणि॒शो यता॑नाः शु॒क्रा वसा॑नाः॒ स्वर॑वो न॒ आगुः॑ उ॒न्नी॒यमा॑नाः क॒विभिः॑ पु॒रस्ता॑द्दे॒वा दे॒वाना॒मपि॑ यन्ति॒ पाथः॑
stanzas.transliteration: haṃsā́ iva śreṇiśó yátānāḥ śukrā́ vásānāḥ sváravo na ā́guḥ unnīyámānāḥ kavíbhiḥ purástād devā́ devā́nām ápi yanti pā́thaḥ
stanzas.translation: Like swan's that flee in lengthened line, the Pillars have come to us arrayed in brilliant coIour. They, lifted up on high, by sages, eastward, go forth as Gods to the God's dwelling-places.

translations.griffith: Like swan's that flee in lengthened line, the Pillars have come to us arrayed in brilliant coIour. They, lifted up on high, by sages, eastward, go forth as Gods to the God's dwelling-places.
translations.oldenberg: Like swans ranging themselves in rows, arraying themselves in brightness the sacrificial posts have come to us. Led up by the sages they go forward as gods to the abode of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: शृङ्गा॑णी॒वेच्छृ॒ङ्गिणां॒ सं द॑दृश्रे च॒षाल॑वन्तः॒ स्वर॑वः पृथि॒व्याम् वा॒घद्भि॑र्वा विह॒वे श्रोष॑माणा अ॒स्माँ अ॑वन्तु पृत॒नाज्ये॑षु
stanzas.transliteration: śŕ̥ṅgāṇīvéc chr̥ṅgíṇāṃ sáṃ dadr̥śre caṣā́lavantaḥ sváravaḥ pr̥thivyā́m vāghádbhir vā vihavé śróṣamāṇāḥ- asmā́m̐ avantu pr̥tanā́jyeṣu
stanzas.translation: Those Stakes upon the earth with rings that deck them seem to the eye like horns of horned creatures; Or, as upraised by priests in invocation, let them assist us in the rush to battle.

translations.griffith: Those Stakes upon the earth with rings that deck them seem to the eye like horns of horned creatures; Or, as upraised by priests in invocation, let them assist us in the rush to battle.
translations.oldenberg: Like horns of horned animals the sacrificial posts with their head-pieces 1 are seen on the earth. Hearing (us) in the emulating call of the invoking (priests) may they protect us in the racings of battles.

stanzas.sanskrit: वन॑स्पते श॒तव॑ल्शो॒ वि रो॑ह स॒हस्र॑वल्शा॒ वि व॒यं रु॑हेम यं त्वाम॒यं स्वधि॑ति॒स्तेज॑मानः प्रणि॒नाय॑ मह॒ते सौभ॑गाय
stanzas.transliteration: vánaspate śatávalśo ví roha sahásravalśā ví vayáṃ ruhema yáṃ tvā́m ayáṃ svádhitis téjamānaḥ praṇinā́ya mahaté saúbhagāya
stanzas.translation: Lord of the Wood, rise with a hundred branches. with thousand branches may we rise to greatness, Tlou whom this hatchct, with an edge well whetted for great felicity, hath brought before us.

translations.griffith: Lord of the Wood, rise with a hundred branches. with thousand branches may we rise to greatness, Tlou whom this hatchct, with an edge well whetted for great felicity, hath brought before us.
translations.oldenberg: O lord of the forest, rise with a hundred branches; may we rise with a thousand branches (offspring)—thou whom this sharpened axe has led forward to great prosperity.

stanzas.sanskrit: सखा॑यस्त्वा ववृमहे दे॒वं मर्ता॑स ऊ॒तये॑ अ॒पां नपा॑तं सु॒भगं॑ सु॒दीदि॑तिं सु॒प्रतू॑र्तिमने॒हस॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sákhāyas tvā vavr̥mahe devám mártāsa ūtáye apā́ṃ nápātaṃ subhágaṃ sudī́ditiṃ suprátūrtim anehásam
stanzas.translation: WE as thy friends have chosen thee, mortals a God, to be our help, The Waters' Child, the blessed, the resplendent One, victorious and beyond compare.

translations.griffith: WE as thy friends have chosen thee, mortals a God, to be our help, The Waters' Child, the blessed, the resplendent One, victorious and beyond compare.
translations.oldenberg: We, thy friends 1, have chosen thee for our protection, (we) the mortals (thee) the god, the offspring of the Waters, the blessed one with fine splendour 2, who gloriously advances, the unmenaced one.

stanzas.sanskrit: काय॑मानो व॒ना त्वं यन्मा॒तॄरज॑गन्न॒पः न तत्ते॑ अग्ने प्र॒मृषे॑ नि॒वर्त॑नं॒ यद्दू॒रे सन्नि॒हाभ॑वः
stanzas.transliteration: kā́yamāno vanā́ tváṃ yán mātr̥̄́r ájagann apáḥ ná tát te agne pramŕ̥ṣe nivártanaṃ yád dūré sánn ihā́bhavaḥ
stanzas.translation: Since thou delighting in the woods hast gone unto thy mother streams, Not to be scorned, Agni, is that return of thine when from afar thou now art here.

translations.griffith: Since thou delighting in the woods hast gone unto thy mother streams, Not to be scorned, Agni, is that return of thine when from afar thou now art here.
translations.oldenberg: When thou, finding pleasure in the wood, hast gone to thy mothers, the Waters, that return of thine, Agni, (to this world) should not be slighted, when dwelling afar thou hast come hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: अति॑ तृ॒ष्टं व॑वक्षि॒थाथै॒व सु॒मना॑ असि प्रप्रा॒न्ये यन्ति॒ पर्य॒न्य आ॑सते॒ येषां॑ स॒ख्ये असि॑ श्रि॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: áti tr̥ṣṭáṃ vavakṣitha- -áthaivá sumánā asi prá-prānyé yánti páry anyá āsate yéṣāṃ sakhyé ási śritáḥ
stanzas.translation: O'er pungent smoke host thou prevailed, and thus art thou benevolent. Some go before, and others round about thee sit, they in whose friendship thou hast place.

translations.griffith: O'er pungent smoke host thou prevailed, and thus art thou benevolent. Some go before, and others round about thee sit, they in whose friendship thou hast place.
translations.oldenberg: High above (all) pungent sharpness thou hast grown up 1, and verily thou art kind-hearted. Some go forward here and there; others sit around thee, in whose friendship thou abidest 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: ई॒यि॒वांस॒मति॒ स्रिधः॒ शश्व॑ती॒रति॑ स॒श्चतः॑ अन्वी॑मविन्दन्निचि॒रासो॑ अ॒द्रुहो॒ऽप्सु सिं॒हमि॑व श्रि॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: īyivā́ṃsam áti srídhaḥ śáśvatīr áti saścátaḥ ánv īm avindan nicirā́so adrúho -apsú siṃhám iva śritám
stanzas.translation: Him who had passed beyond his foes, beyond continual pursuits, Him the unerring Ones, observant, found in floods, couched like a lion in his lair.

translations.griffith: Him who had passed beyond his foes, beyond continual pursuits, Him the unerring Ones, observant, found in floods, couched like a lion in his lair.
translations.oldenberg: He who has passed beyond (all) failures, beyond all hindrances 1, the guileless, watchful ones 2 have found him as a lion (is found), when he had gone into the Waters;

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒सृ॒वांस॑मिव॒ त्मना॒ग्निमि॒त्था ति॒रोहि॑तम् ऐनं॑ नयन्मात॒रिश्वा॑ परा॒वतो॑ दे॒वेभ्यो॑ मथि॒तं परि॑
stanzas.transliteration: sasr̥vā́ṃsam iva tmánā- -agním itthā́ tiróhitam aínaṃ nayan mātaríśvā parāváto devébhyo mathitám pári
stanzas.translation: Him wandering at his own free will, Agni here hidden from our view, Him Mâtariṣvan brought to us from far away produced by friction, from the Gods.

translations.griffith: Him wandering at his own free will, Agni here hidden from our view, Him Mâtariṣvan brought to us from far away produced by friction, from the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: He who had run as it were by his own might, Agni, who thus dwelt in concealment—Him Mâtarisvan brought hither from afar, from the gods, when he had been produced by attrition (of the woods).

stanzas.sanskrit: तं त्वा॒ मर्ता॑ अगृभ्णत दे॒वेभ्यो॑ हव्यवाहन विश्वा॒न्यद्य॒ज्ञाँ अ॑भि॒पासि॑ मानुष॒ तव॒ क्रत्वा॑ यविष्ठ्य
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ tvā mártā agr̥bhṇata devébhyo havyavāhana víśvān yád yajñā́m̐ abhipā́si mānuṣa táva krátvā yaviṣṭhya
stanzas.translation: O Bearer of Oblations, thus mortals received thee from the Gods, Whilst thou, the Friend of man, guardest each sacrifice with thine own power, Most Youthful One.

translations.griffith: O Bearer of Oblations, thus mortals received thee from the Gods, Whilst thou, the Friend of man, guardest each sacrifice with thine own power, Most Youthful One.
translations.oldenberg: (And thus) the mortals have taken thee up, O carrier of sacrificial food towards the gods 1, because thou, O (god) belonging to Manus, protectest all sacrifices by the power of thy mind, O youngest one!

stanzas.sanskrit: तद्भ॒द्रं तव॑ दं॒सना॒ पाका॑य चिच्छदयति त्वां यद॑ग्ने प॒शवः॑ स॒मास॑ते॒ समि॑द्धमपिशर्व॒रे
stanzas.transliteration: tád bhadráṃ táva daṃsánā pā́kāya cic chadayati tvā́ṃ yád agne paśávaḥ samā́sate sámiddham apiśarvaré
stanzas.translation: Amid thy wonders this is good, yea, to the simple is it clear, When gathered round about thee, Agni, lie the herds where thou art kindled in the morn.

translations.griffith: Amid thy wonders this is good, yea, to the simple is it clear, When gathered round about thee, Agni, lie the herds where thou art kindled in the morn.
translations.oldenberg: 1 This is something glorious; herein thy wonderful power shows itself even to the simple, that the cattle lie down round about thee when thou hast been kindled, O Agni, at the approach of darkness 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ जु॑होता स्वध्व॒रं शी॒रं पा॑व॒कशो॑चिषम् आ॒शुं दू॒तम॑जि॒रं प्र॒त्नमीड्यं॑ श्रु॒ष्टी दे॒वं स॑पर्यत
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ juhotā svadhvaráṃ śīrám pāvakáśociṣam āśúṃ dūtám ajirám pratnám ī́ḍyaṃ śruṣṭī́ deváṃ saparyata
stanzas.translation: Offer to him who knows fair rites, who burns with purifying glow, Swift envoy, active, ancient, and adorable: serve ye the God attentively.

translations.griffith: Offer to him who knows fair rites, who burns with purifying glow, Swift envoy, active, ancient, and adorable: serve ye the God attentively.
translations.oldenberg: Make your offerings in (Agni), the best performer of worship, the sharp one who purifies with his flames 1. Serve ye, obediently the god, the quick messenger, the agile, the old, the adorable.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रीणि॑ श॒ता त्री स॒हस्रा॑ण्य॒ग्निं त्रिं॒शच्च॑ दे॒वा नव॑ चासपर्यन् औक्ष॑न्घृ॒तैरस्तृ॑णन्ब॒र्हिर॑स्मा॒ आदिद्धोता॑रं॒ न्य॑सादयन्त
stanzas.transliteration: trī́ṇi śatā́ trī́ sahásrāṇy agníṃ triṃśác ca devā́ náva cāsaparyan aúkṣan ghr̥taír ástr̥ṇan barhír asmai- ā́d íd dhótāraṃ ny àsādayanta
stanzas.translation: Three times a hundred Gods and thrice a thousand, and three times ten and nine have worshipped Agni, For him spread sacred grass, with oil bedewed him, and stablished him as Priest and Sacrificer.

translations.griffith: Three times a hundred Gods and thrice a thousand, and three times ten and nine have worshipped Agni, For him spread sacred grass, with oil bedewed him, and stablished him as Priest and Sacrificer.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Three hundred and three thousand gods and thirty and nine did service to Agni. They sprinkled him with ghee and spread out for him the sacrificial grass: then they made him sit down as a Hotri.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने मनी॒षिणः॑ स॒म्राजं॑ चर्षणी॒नाम् दे॒वं मर्ता॑स इन्धते॒ सम॑ध्व॒रे
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne manīṣíṇaḥ samrā́jaṃ carṣaṇīnā́m devám mártāsa indhate sám adhvaré
stanzas.translation: THEE Agni, God, Imperial Lord of all mankind, do mortal men With understanding kindle at thesacrifice.

translations.griffith: THEE Agni, God, Imperial Lord of all mankind, do mortal men With understanding kindle at thesacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Thee, O Agni, the highest king of human tribes, the god, thoughtful mortals kindle at their worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां य॒ज्ञेष्वृ॒त्विज॒मग्ने॒ होता॑रमीळते गो॒पा ऋ॒तस्य॑ दीदिहि॒ स्वे दमे॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ yajñéṣv r̥tvíjam ágne hótāram īḷate gopā́ r̥tásya dīdihi své dáme
stanzas.translation: They laud thee in their solemn rites, Agni, as Minister and Priest, Shine forth in thine own home as guardian of the Law.

translations.griffith: They laud thee in their solemn rites, Agni, as Minister and Priest, Shine forth in thine own home as guardian of the Law.
translations.oldenberg: Thee, O Agni, the Ritvig, the Hotri, they magnify at the sacrifices. Shine as the guardian of Rita in thy own house 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: स घा॒ यस्ते॒ ददा॑शति स॒मिधा॑ जा॒तवे॑दसे सो अ॑ग्ने धत्ते सु॒वीर्यं॒ स पु॑ष्यति
stanzas.transliteration: sá ghā yás te dádāśati samídhā jātávedase só agne dhatte suvī́ryaṃ sá puṣyati
stanzas.translation: He, verily, who honours thee with fuel, Knower of all life, He, Agni! wins heroic might, he prospers well.

translations.griffith: He, verily, who honours thee with fuel, Knower of all life, He, Agni! wins heroic might, he prospers well.
translations.oldenberg: He indeed who may worship thee, the Gâtavedas, with fuel, acquires abundance in valiant men, O Agni; he will prosper.

stanzas.sanskrit: स के॒तुर॑ध्व॒राणा॑म॒ग्निर्दे॒वेभि॒रा ग॑मत् अ॒ञ्जा॒नः स॒प्त होतृ॑भिर्ह॒विष्म॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: sá ketúr adhvarā́ṇām agnír devébhir ā́ gamat añjānáḥ saptá hótr̥bhir havíṣmate
stanzas.translation: Ensign of sacrifices, he, Agni, with Gods is come to us, Decked by the seven priests, to him who bringeth gifts.

translations.griffith: Ensign of sacrifices, he, Agni, with Gods is come to us, Decked by the seven priests, to him who bringeth gifts.
translations.oldenberg: May He, the banner of the sacrifices, Agni, come hither with the gods, anointed by the seven Hotris 1 for the sake of the man who offers sacrificial food.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र होत्रे॑ पू॒र्व्यं वचो॒ऽग्नये॑ भरता बृ॒हत् वि॒पां ज्योतीं॑षि॒ बिभ्र॑ते॒ न वे॒धसे॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá hótre pūrvyáṃ váco -agnáye bharatā br̥hát vipā́ṃ jyótīṃṣi bíbhrate ná vedháse
stanzas.translation: ToAgni, the Invoking Priest, offer your best, your lofty speech, To him Ordainer-like who brings the light of songs.

translations.griffith: ToAgni, the Invoking Priest, offer your best, your lofty speech, To him Ordainer-like who brings the light of songs.
translations.oldenberg: Bring ye forward an ancient, mighty speech to Agni, the Hotri, who is like a worshipper bearing the lights of prayers 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं व॑र्धन्तु नो॒ गिरो॒ यतो॒ जाय॑त उ॒क्थ्यः॑ म॒हे वाजा॑य॒ द्रवि॑णाय दर्श॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ vardhantu no gíro yáto jā́yata ukthyàḥ mahé vā́jāya dráviṇāya darśatáḥ
stanzas.translation: Let these our hymns make Agni grow, whence, meet for laud, he springs to life, To mighty strength and great possession, fair to see.

translations.griffith: Let these our hymns make Agni grow, whence, meet for laud, he springs to life, To mighty strength and great possession, fair to see.
translations.oldenberg: May our prayers increase Agni, since he is born deserving of praises, the conspicuous one, for the sake of great strength and wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ यजि॑ष्ठो अध्व॒रे दे॒वान्दे॑वय॒ते य॑ज होता॑ म॒न्द्रो वि रा॑ज॒स्यति॒ स्रिधः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne yájiṣṭho adhvaré devā́n devayaté yaja hótā mandró ví rājasi- áti srídhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Best Sacrificer, bring the Gods, O Agni, to the pious man: A joyful Priest, thy splendour drive our foes afar

translations.griffith: Best Sacrificer, bring the Gods, O Agni, to the pious man: A joyful Priest, thy splendour drive our foes afar
translations.oldenberg: 1 May Agni, as the best sacrificer at the worship (of men), perform the sacrifice to the gods for the man devoted to the gods. As a joyous Hotri thou reignest (passing) beyond (all) failures.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नः॑ पावक दीदिहि द्यु॒मद॒स्मे सु॒वीर्य॑म् भवा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ अन्त॑मः स्व॒स्तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyumád asmé suvī́ryam bhávā stotŕ̥bhyo ántamaḥ svastáye
stanzas.translation: As such, O Purifier, shine on us heroic glorious might: Be nearest Friend to those who laud thee, for their weal.

translations.griffith: As such, O Purifier, shine on us heroic glorious might: Be nearest Friend to those who laud thee, for their weal.
translations.oldenberg: Thus, O purifier, shine on us glorious abundance in heroes. Be the nearest (friend) to those who praise thee, for their welfare.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं त्वा॒ विप्रा॑ विप॒न्यवो॑ जागृ॒वांसः॒ समि॑न्धते ह॒व्य॒वाह॒मम॑र्त्यं सहो॒वृध॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ tvā víprā vipanyávo jāgr̥vā́ṃsaḥ sám indhate havyavā́ham ámartyaṃ sahovŕ̥dham
stanzas.translation: So, wakeful, versed in sacred hymns, the holy singers kindly thee. Oblation-bearer, deathless, cherisher of strength.

translations.griffith: So, wakeful, versed in sacred hymns, the holy singers kindly thee. Oblation-bearer, deathless, cherisher of strength.
translations.oldenberg: Thus the priests full of admiring praise, having awoke, kindle thee, the immortal carrier of sacrificial food, the increaser of strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्होता॑ पु॒रोहि॑तोऽध्व॒रस्य॒ विच॑र्षणिः स वे॑द य॒ज्ञमा॑नु॒षक्
stanzas.transliteration: agnír hótā puróhito -adhvarásya vícarṣaṇiḥ sá veda yajñám ānuṣák
stanzas.translation: AGNI is Priest, the great High Priest of sacrifice, most swift in act: He knows the rite in constant course.

translations.griffith: AGNI is Priest, the great High Priest of sacrifice, most swift in act: He knows the rite in constant course.
translations.oldenberg: Agni is the Hotri, the Purohita of our worship, he who dwells among many tribes, He knows the sacrifice in due order.

stanzas.sanskrit: स ह॑व्य॒वाळम॑र्त्य उ॒शिग्दू॒तश्चनो॑हितः अ॒ग्निर्धि॒या समृ॑ण्वति
stanzas.transliteration: sá havyavā́ḷ ámartyaḥ- uśíg dūtáś cánohitaḥ agnír dhiyā́ sám r̥ṇvati
stanzas.translation: Oblation-bearer, deathless, well inclined, an eager messenger, Agni comes nigh us with the thought.

translations.griffith: Oblation-bearer, deathless, well inclined, an eager messenger, Agni comes nigh us with the thought.
translations.oldenberg: He, the immortal carrier of oblations, the Usig 1, the messenger, with satisfied mind, Agni sets himself in motion 2 (incited) by the thought (of praying men?).

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्धि॒या स चे॑तति के॒तुर्य॒ज्ञस्य॑ पू॒र्व्यः अर्थं॒ ह्य॑स्य त॒रणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: agnír dhiyā́ sá cetati ketúr yajñásya pūrvyáḥ árthaṃ hy àsya taráṇi
stanzas.translation: Ensign of sacrifice from of old, Agni well knoweth with his thought To prosper this man's aim and hope.

translations.griffith: Ensign of sacrifice from of old, Agni well knoweth with his thought To prosper this man's aim and hope.
translations.oldenberg: Agni takes heed 1 (of us) by the thought (the prayer?), the banner of the sacrifice, the ancient one; for his purpose triumphs 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं सू॒नुं सन॑श्रुतं॒ सह॑सो जा॒तवे॑दसम् वह्निं॑ दे॒वा अ॑कृण्वत
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ sūnúṃ sánaśrutaṃ sáhaso jātávedasam váhniṃ devā́ akr̥ṇvata
stanzas.translation: Agni, illustrious from old time, the Son of Strength who knows all life, The Gods have made to their Priest.

translations.griffith: Agni, illustrious from old time, the Son of Strength who knows all life, The Gods have made to their Priest.
translations.oldenberg: The gods have made Agni, the old-renowned son of strength, the Gâtavedas, their carrier (towards the sacrifice) 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अदा॑भ्यः पुरए॒ता वि॒शाम॒ग्निर्मानु॑षीणाम् तूर्णी॒ रथः॒ सदा॒ नवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádābhyaḥ puraetā́ viśā́m agnír mā́nuṣīṇām tū́rṇī ráthaḥ sádā návaḥ
stanzas.translation: Infallible is Agni, he who goes before the tribes of men, A chariot swift and ever new.

translations.griffith: Infallible is Agni, he who goes before the tribes of men, A chariot swift and ever new.
translations.oldenberg: Agni the undeceivable one who goes before the human tribes, he is the quick chariot 1, ever new.

stanzas.sanskrit: सा॒ह्वान्विश्वा॑ अभि॒युजः॒ क्रतु॑र्दे॒वाना॒ममृ॑क्तः अ॒ग्निस्तु॒विश्र॑वस्तमः
stanzas.transliteration: sāhvā́n víśvā abhiyújaḥ krátur devā́nām ámr̥ktaḥ agnís tuvíśravastamaḥ
stanzas.translation: Strength of the Gods which none may harm, subduing all his enemies, Agni is mightiest in fame.

translations.griffith: Strength of the Gods which none may harm, subduing all his enemies, Agni is mightiest in fame.
translations.oldenberg: Overcoming all attacks, He, the uninjured mind (power) of the gods, Agni, is most mightily renowned.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि प्रयां॑सि॒ वाह॑सा दा॒श्वाँ अ॑श्नोति॒ मर्त्यः॑ क्षयं॑ पाव॒कशो॑चिषः
stanzas.transliteration: abhí práyāṃsi vā́hasā dāśvā́m̐ aśnoti mártyaḥ kṣáyam pāvakáśociṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: By offering sacred food to him the mortal worshipper obtains. A home from him whose light makes pure.

translations.griffith: By offering sacred food to him the mortal worshipper obtains. A home from him whose light makes pure.
translations.oldenberg: Through the vehicle 1 (which carries the gods) towards the delights (of sacrifice), the worshipping mortal attains the dwelling-place 2 of (Agni) whose flames are purifying.

stanzas.sanskrit: परि॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ सुधि॑ता॒ग्नेर॑श्याम॒ मन्म॑भिः विप्रा॑सो जा॒तवे॑दसः
stanzas.transliteration: pári víśvāni súdhitā- -agnér aśyāma mánmabhiḥ víprāso jātávedasaḥ
stanzas.translation: From Agni, by our hymns, may we gain all things that bring happiness, Singers of him who knows all life.

translations.griffith: From Agni, by our hymns, may we gain all things that bring happiness, Singers of him who knows all life.
translations.oldenberg: May we, the priests, by our prayers obtain all the blissful gifts of Agni Gâtavedas.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ वार्या॒ वाजे॑षु सनिषामहे त्वे दे॒वास॒ एरि॑रे
stanzas.transliteration: ágne víśvāni vā́ryā vā́jeṣu saniṣāmahe tvé devā́sa érire
stanzas.translation: O Agni, in our deeds of might may we obtain all precious things: Tle Gods are centred all in thee.

translations.griffith: O Agni, in our deeds of might may we obtain all precious things: Tle Gods are centred all in thee.
translations.oldenberg: Agni! May we win all the best things in (the trials of) strength. In thee the gods have established them 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ आ ग॑तं सु॒तं गी॒र्भिर्नभो॒ वरे॑ण्यम् अ॒स्य पा॑तं धि॒येषि॒ता
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī ā́ gataṃ sutáṃ gīrbhír nábho váreṇyam asyá pātaṃ dhiyéṣitā́
stanzas.translation: MOVED, Indra-Agni, by our hymn, come to the juice, the precious dew: Dr.ink ye thereof, impelled by song.

translations.griffith: MOVED, Indra-Agni, by our hymn, come to the juice, the precious dew: Dr.ink ye thereof, impelled by song.
translations.oldenberg: Indra-Agni, in consequence of our prayers come hither to the pressed (Soma), to the precious cloud 1. Drink of it incited by our thoughts (i. e. by our prayers).

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी जरि॒तुः सचा॑ य॒ज्ञो जि॑गाति॒ चेत॑नः अ॒या पा॑तमि॒मं सु॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī jaritúḥ sácā yajñó jigāti cétanaḥ ayā́ pātam imáṃ sutám
stanzas.translation: O Indra-Agni, with the man who lauds you comes the wakening rite: So drink ye both this juice assured.

translations.griffith: O Indra-Agni, with the man who lauds you comes the wakening rite: So drink ye both this juice assured.
translations.oldenberg: Indra-Agni, the brilliant 1 sacrifice of him who praises you goes forward together (with the Soma libations, the praises, &c.). Thus drink this pressed (Soma)!

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑म॒ग्निं क॑वि॒च्छदा॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑ जू॒त्या वृ॑णे ता सोम॑स्ये॒ह तृ॑म्पताम्
stanzas.transliteration: índram agníṃ kavichádā yajñásya jūtyā́ vr̥ṇe tā́ sómasyehá tr̥mpatām
stanzas.translation: Through force of sacrifice I choose Indra-Agni who love the wise: With Sorna let these sate them here.

translations.griffith: Through force of sacrifice I choose Indra-Agni who love the wise: With Sorna let these sate them here.
translations.oldenberg: By this stirring sacrifice I choose Indra and Agni who show themselves as sages 1; may they here satiate themselves with Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: तो॒शा वृ॑त्र॒हणा॑ हुवे स॒जित्वा॒नाप॑राजिता इ॒न्द्रा॒ग्नी वा॑ज॒सात॑मा
stanzas.transliteration: tośā́ vr̥traháṇā huve sajítvānā́parājitā indrāgnī́ vājasā́tamā
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni I invoke, joint-victors, bounteous, unsubdued, Foe-slayers, best to win the spoil.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni I invoke, joint-victors, bounteous, unsubdued, Foe-slayers, best to win the spoil.
translations.oldenberg: I call the bounteous 1, the killers of foes 2, the united conquerors, unconquered, Indra-Agni, the greatest winners of booty.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वा॑मर्चन्त्यु॒क्थिनो॑ नीथा॒विदो॑ जरि॒तारः॑ इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ इष॒ आ वृ॑णे
stanzas.transliteration: prá vām arcanty ukthíno nīthāvído jaritā́raḥ índrāgnī íṣa ā́ vr̥ṇe
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, singers skilled in melody hymn you, bringing lauds: I choose you for the sacred food.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, singers skilled in melody hymn you, bringing lauds: I choose you for the sacred food.
translations.oldenberg: The praisers rich in hymns, knowing all the ways (of the sacrifice), laud you. Indra-Agni, I choose the food (which you give).

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी नव॒तिं पुरो॑ दा॒सप॑त्नीरधूनुतम् सा॒कमेके॑न॒ कर्म॑णा
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī navatím púro dāsápatnīr adhūnutam sākám ékena kármaṇā
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, ye cast down the ninety forts which Dâsas held, Together, with one mighty deed.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, ye cast down the ninety forts which Dâsas held, Together, with one mighty deed.
translations.oldenberg: Indra-Agni, you have hurled down by one deed the ninety strongholds together of which the Dâsas were the lords.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ अप॑स॒स्पर्युप॒ प्र य॑न्ति धी॒तयः॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ अनु॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī ápasas pári- úpa prá yanti dhītáyaḥ r̥tásya pathyā̀ ánu
stanzas.translation: To Indra-Agni eeverent thoughts go forward from the holy task Along the path of sacred Law.

translations.griffith: To Indra-Agni eeverent thoughts go forward from the holy task Along the path of sacred Law.
translations.oldenberg: Indra-Agni, the thoughts (of the worshippers) go forward towards (you) from the work (of sacrifice) along the paths of Rita.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी तवि॒षाणि॑ वां स॒धस्था॑नि॒ प्रयां॑सि च यु॒वोर॒प्तूर्यं॑ हि॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī taviṣā́ṇi vāṃ sadhásthāni práyāṃsi ca yuvór aptū́ryaṃ hitám
stanzas.translation: O Indra-Agni, powers are yours, and dwellings and delightful food Good is your readiness to act.

translations.griffith: O Indra-Agni, powers are yours, and dwellings and delightful food Good is your readiness to act.
translations.oldenberg: Indra and Agni, yours are powerful abodes and delights. You cross the waters: this is the deed which belongs to you 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी रोच॒ना दि॒वः परि॒ वाजे॑षु भूषथः तद्वां॑ चेति॒ प्र वी॒र्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī rocanā́ diváḥ pári vā́jeṣu bhūṣathaḥ tád vāṃ ceti prá vīryàm
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, in your deeds of might ye deck heaven's lucid realms: Famed is that hero strength of yours.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, in your deeds of might ye deck heaven's lucid realms: Famed is that hero strength of yours.
translations.oldenberg: Indra and Agni, you display the lights of heaven in your deeds of strength; that mighty deed of yours has been known far and wide.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वो॑ दे॒वाया॒ग्नये॒ बर्हि॑ष्ठमर्चास्मै गम॑द्दे॒वेभि॒रा स नो॒ यजि॑ष्ठो ब॒र्हिरा स॑दत्
stanzas.transliteration: prá vo devā́yāgnáye bárhiṣṭham arcāsmai gámad devébhir ā́ sá no yájiṣṭho barhír ā́ sadat
stanzas.translation: To Agni, to this God of yours I sing aloud with utmost power. May he come to us with the Gods, and sit, best Offerer, on the grass.

translations.griffith: To Agni, to this God of yours I sing aloud with utmost power. May he come to us with the Gods, and sit, best Offerer, on the grass.
translations.oldenberg: To this god Agni I sing 1 for you most powerfully. May he come to us with the gods; may he, the best sacrificer, sit down on the sacrificial grass.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तावा॒ यस्य॒ रोद॑सी॒ दक्षं॒ सच॑न्त ऊ॒तयः॑ ह॒विष्म॑न्त॒स्तमी॑ळते॒ तं स॑नि॒ष्यन्तोऽव॑से
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tā́vā yásya ródasī dákṣaṃ sácanta ūtáyaḥ havíṣmantas tám īḷate táṃ saniṣyántó 'vase
stanzas.translation: The Holy, whose are earth and heaven, and succour waits upon his strength; Him men who bring oblations laud, and they who wish to gain, for grace.

translations.griffith: The Holy, whose are earth and heaven, and succour waits upon his strength; Him men who bring oblations laud, and they who wish to gain, for grace.
translations.oldenberg: The righteous one to whose skill the two worlds (Heaven and Earth) and (all) blessings cling—Him the men rich in offerings magnify, Him those who long for gain, that they may obtain his blessing.

stanzas.sanskrit: स य॒न्ता विप्र॑ एषां॒ स य॒ज्ञाना॒मथा॒ हि षः अ॒ग्निं तं वो॑ दुवस्यत॒ दाता॒ यो वनि॑ता म॒घम्
stanzas.transliteration: sá yantā́ vípra eṣāṃ sá yajñā́nām áthā hí ṣáḥ agníṃ táṃ vo duvasyata dā́tā yó vánitā maghám
stanzas.translation: He is the Sage who guides these men, Leader of sacred rites is he. Him your own Agni, serve ye well, who winneth and bestoweth wealth.

translations.griffith: He is the Sage who guides these men, Leader of sacred rites is he. Him your own Agni, serve ye well, who winneth and bestoweth wealth.
translations.oldenberg: He, the priest, is the guide of these (men) 1, and he indeed (is the guide) of sacrifices. Praise ye this Agni who is the giver, the winner of wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नः॒ शर्मा॑णि वी॒तये॒ऽग्निर्य॑च्छतु॒ शंत॑मा यतो॑ नः प्रु॒ष्णव॒द्वसु॑ दि॒वि क्षि॒तिभ्यो॑ अ॒प्स्वा
stanzas.transliteration: sá naḥ śármāṇi vītáye -agnír yachatu śáṃtamā yáto naḥ pruṣṇávad vásu diví kṣitíbhyo apsv ā́
stanzas.translation: So may the gracious Agni grant most goodly shelter for our use; Whence in the heavens or in the floods he shall pour wealth upon our lands.

translations.griffith: So may the gracious Agni grant most goodly shelter for our use; Whence in the heavens or in the floods he shall pour wealth upon our lands.
translations.oldenberg: May this Agni give us most blissful shelter for our (sacrificial) feast, whence he may shower wealth on us in heaven, the (human) dwellings 1, and in the waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: दी॒दि॒वांस॒मपू॑र्व्यं॒ वस्वी॑भिरस्य धी॒तिभिः॑ ऋक्वा॑णो अ॒ग्निमि॑न्धते॒ होता॑रं वि॒श्पतिं॑ वि॒शाम्
stanzas.transliteration: dīdivā́ṃsam ápūrvyaṃ vásvībhir asya dhītíbhiḥ ŕ̥kvāṇo agním indhate hótāraṃ viśpátiṃ viśā́m
stanzas.translation: The singers kindle him, the Priest, Agni the Lord of tribes of men, Resplendent and without a peer through his own excellent designs.

translations.griffith: The singers kindle him, the Priest, Agni the Lord of tribes of men, Resplendent and without a peer through his own excellent designs.
translations.oldenberg: The singers kindle Agni, the Hotri, the lord of the tribes, the brilliant, the wonderful, with his excellent thoughts 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त नो॒ ब्रह्म॑न्नविष उ॒क्थेषु॑ देव॒हूत॑मः शं नः॑ शोचा म॒रुद्वृ॒धोऽग्ने॑ सहस्र॒सात॑मः
stanzas.transliteration: utá no bráhmann aviṣaḥ- ukthéṣu devahū́tamaḥ śáṃ naḥ śocā marúdvr̥dhaḥ- -ágne sahasrasā́tamaḥ
stanzas.translation: Help us, thou Brahman, best of all invokers of the Gods in song. Beam, Friend of Maruts, bliss on us, O Agni, a most liberal God.

translations.griffith: Help us, thou Brahman, best of all invokers of the Gods in song. Beam, Friend of Maruts, bliss on us, O Agni, a most liberal God.
translations.oldenberg: And mayst thou, the best invoker of the gods, help us in our spell, in our hymns. Shine bliss on us, Agni whom the Maruts strengthen 1, the greatest winner of thousandfold (wealth).

stanzas.sanskrit: नू नो॑ रास्व स॒हस्र॑वत्तो॒कव॑त्पुष्टि॒मद्वसु॑ द्यु॒मद॑ग्ने सु॒वीर्यं॒ वर्षि॑ष्ठ॒मनु॑पक्षितम्
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ no rāsva sahásravat tokávat puṣṭimád vásu dyumád agne suvī́ryaṃ várṣiṣṭham ánupakṣitam
stanzas.translation: Yea, grant us treasure thousandfold with children and with nourishment, And, Agni, splendid hero strength, exalted, wasting not away.

translations.griffith: Yea, grant us treasure thousandfold with children and with nourishment, And, Agni, splendid hero strength, exalted, wasting not away.
translations.oldenberg: Now bestow on us thousandfold wealth with offspring and prosperity, splendid, most powerful, and undecaying abundance in heroes, O Agni!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ होता॑ म॒न्द्रो वि॒दथा॑न्यस्थात्स॒त्यो यज्वा॑ क॒वित॑मः॒ स वे॒धाः वि॒द्युद्र॑थः॒ सह॑सस्पु॒त्रो अ॒ग्निः शो॒चिष्के॑शः पृथि॒व्यां पाजो॑ अश्रेत्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ hótā mandró vidáthāny asthāt satyó yájvā kavítamaḥ sá vedhā́ḥ vidyúdrathaḥ sáhasas putró agníḥ śocíṣkeśaḥ pr̥thivyā́m pā́jo aśret
stanzas.translation: THE pleasant Priest is come into the synod, true, skilled in sacrifice, most wise, Ordainer. Agni, the Son of Strength, whose car is lightning, whose hair is flame, hath shown on earth his lustre.

translations.griffith: THE pleasant Priest is come into the synod, true, skilled in sacrifice, most wise, Ordainer. Agni, the Son of Strength, whose car is lightning, whose hair is flame, hath shown on earth his lustre.
translations.oldenberg: The joy-giving Hotri has taken his place at the sacrifices 1, He the true, the sacrificer, the highest sage, the worshipper. Agni whose chariot is lightning, the son of strength, whose hair is flame, has spread forth his light over the earth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अया॑मि ते॒ नम॑उक्तिं जुषस्व॒ ऋता॑व॒स्तुभ्यं॒ चेत॑ते सहस्वः वि॒द्वाँ आ व॑क्षि वि॒दुषो॒ नि ष॑त्सि॒ मध्य॒ आ ब॒र्हिरू॒तये॑ यजत्र
stanzas.transliteration: áyāmi te námaÅktiṃ juṣasva ŕ̥tāvas túbhyaṃ cétate sahasvaḥ vidvā́m̐ ā́ vakṣi vidúṣo ní ṣatsi mádhya ā́ barhír ūtáye yajatra
stanzas.translation: To thee I offer reverent speech: accept it: to thee who markest it, victorious, faithful! Bring, thou who knowest, those who know, and seat thee amid the sacred grass, for help, O Holy.

translations.griffith: To thee I offer reverent speech: accept it: to thee who markest it, victorious, faithful! Bring, thou who knowest, those who know, and seat thee amid the sacred grass, for help, O Holy.
translations.oldenberg: It 1 has been offered to thee—be pleased with the adoring speech 2—to thee who is observant of it, O righteous, strong one. Bring hither thou who art wise, the wise (gods). Sit down on the sacrificial grass in the middle (of it) for bliss, O worshipful one!

stanzas.sanskrit: द्रव॑तां त उ॒षसा॑ वा॒जय॑न्ती॒ अग्ने॒ वात॑स्य प॒थ्या॑भि॒रच्छ॑ यत्सी॑म॒ञ्जन्ति॑ पू॒र्व्यं ह॒विर्भि॒रा व॒न्धुरे॑व तस्थतुर्दुरो॒णे
stanzas.transliteration: drávatāṃ ta uṣásā vājáyantī ágne vā́tasya pathyā̀bhir ácha yát sīm añjánti pūrvyáṃ havírbhir ā́ vandhúreva tasthatur duroṇé
stanzas.translation: The Two who show their vigour, Night and Morning, by the wind's paths shall haste to thee O Agni. When men adorn the Ancient with oblations, these seek, as on two chariot-seats, the dwelling.

translations.griffith: The Two who show their vigour, Night and Morning, by the wind's paths shall haste to thee O Agni. When men adorn the Ancient with oblations, these seek, as on two chariot-seats, the dwelling.
translations.oldenberg: To thee, Agni, Night and Dawn who further thy strength 1, shall hasten on the paths of the wind. When (the mortals) anoint the ancient one 2 with offerings, they 3 stand in the house as on a chariot-seat 4.

stanzas.sanskrit: मि॒त्रश्च॒ तुभ्यं॒ वरु॑णः सह॒स्वोऽग्ने॒ विश्वे॑ म॒रुतः॑ सु॒म्नम॑र्चन् यच्छो॒चिषा॑ सहसस्पुत्र॒ तिष्ठा॑ अ॒भि क्षि॒तीः प्र॒थय॒न्त्सूर्यो॒ नॄन्
stanzas.transliteration: mitráś ca túbhyaṃ váruṇaḥ sahasvaḥ- -ágne víśve marútaḥ sumnám arcan yác chocíṣā sahasas putra tíṣṭhāḥ- abhí kṣitī́ḥ pratháyan sū́ryo nr̥̄́n
stanzas.translation: To thee, strong Agni! Varuṇa and Mitra and all the Maruts sang a song of triumph, What time unto the people's lands thou camest, spreading them as the Sun of men, with lustre.

translations.griffith: To thee, strong Agni! Varuṇa and Mitra and all the Maruts sang a song of triumph, What time unto the people's lands thou camest, spreading them as the Sun of men, with lustre.
translations.oldenberg: Mitra and Varuna, O strong Agni, and all the Maruts shall sing to thee a pleasant song, when thou, O son of strength, standest with thy flames, a sun spreading out men 1 over the (terrestrial) dwellings.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यं ते॑ अ॒द्य र॑रि॒मा हि काम॑मुत्ता॒नह॑स्ता॒ नम॑सोप॒सद्य॑ यजि॑ष्ठेन॒ मन॑सा यक्षि दे॒वानस्रे॑धता॒ मन्म॑ना॒ विप्रो॑ अग्ने
stanzas.transliteration: vayáṃ te adyá rarimā́ hí kā́mam uttānáhastā námasopasádya yájiṣṭhena mánasā yakṣi devā́n ásredhatā mánmanā vípro agne
stanzas.translation: Approaching with raised hands and adoration, we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing. Worship the Gods with most devoted spirit, a Priest with no unfriendly thought, O Agni.

translations.griffith: Approaching with raised hands and adoration, we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing. Worship the Gods with most devoted spirit, a Priest with no unfriendly thought, O Agni.
translations.oldenberg: We have given thee thy desire to-day, sitting down near thee adoringly with outstretched hands 1: sacrifice thou to the gods as a priest with thy mind most skilled in sacrifice, with unerring thoughts, O Agni!

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वद्धि पु॑त्र सहसो॒ वि पू॒र्वीर्दे॒वस्य॒ यन्त्यू॒तयो॒ वि वाजाः॑ त्वं दे॑हि सह॒स्रिणं॑ र॒यिं नो॑ऽद्रो॒घेण॒ वच॑सा स॒त्यम॑ग्ने
stanzas.transliteration: tvád dhí putra sahaso ví pūrvī́r devásya yánty ūtáyo ví vā́jāḥ tváṃ dehi sahasríṇaṃ rayíṃ no -adroghéṇa vácasā satyám agne
stanzas.translation: For, Son of Strength, from thee come many succours, and powers abundant that a God possesses. Agni, to us with speech that hath no falsehood grant riches, real, to be told in thousands.

translations.griffith: For, Son of Strength, from thee come many succours, and powers abundant that a God possesses. Agni, to us with speech that hath no falsehood grant riches, real, to be told in thousands.
translations.oldenberg: From thee indeed, O son of strength, proceed manifold divine blessings and gains 1. Give us thousandfold true wealth according to thy guileless word, O Agni!

stanzas.sanskrit: तुभ्यं॑ दक्ष कविक्रतो॒ यानी॒मा देव॒ मर्ता॑सो अध्व॒रे अक॑र्म त्वं विश्व॑स्य सु॒रथ॑स्य बोधि॒ सर्वं॒ तद॑ग्ने अमृत स्वदे॒ह
stanzas.transliteration: túbhyaṃ dakṣa kavikrato yā́nīmā́ déva mártāso adhvaré ákarma tváṃ víśvasya suráthasya bodhi sárvaṃ tád agne amr̥ta svadehá
stanzas.translation: Whatever, God, in sacrifice we mortals have wrought is all for thee, strong, wise of purpose! Be thou the Friend of each good chariot's master. All this enjoy thou here, immortal Agni.

translations.griffith: Whatever, God, in sacrifice we mortals have wrought is all for thee, strong, wise of purpose! Be thou the Friend of each good chariot's master. All this enjoy thou here, immortal Agni.
translations.oldenberg: What we have done here for thee at this sacrifice, we mortals, O skilful and thoughtful god, take thou notice of all that, O (god) with the good chariot 1; make all this (sacrificial food) here savoury, immortal Agni!

stanzas.sanskrit: वि पाज॑सा पृ॒थुना॒ शोशु॑चानो॒ बाध॑स्व द्वि॒षो र॒क्षसो॒ अमी॑वाः सु॒शर्म॑णो बृह॒तः शर्म॑णि स्याम॒ग्नेर॒हं सु॒हव॑स्य॒ प्रणी॑तौ
stanzas.transliteration: ví pā́jasā pr̥thúnā śóśucāno bā́dhasva dviṣó rakṣáso ámīvāḥ suśármaṇo br̥hatáḥ śármaṇi syām agnér aháṃ suhávasya práṇītau
stanzas.translation: RESPLENDENT with thy wide-extending lustre, dispel the terrors of the fiends who hate us May lofty Agni be my guide and shelter, the easily-invoked, the good Protector.

translations.griffith: RESPLENDENT with thy wide-extending lustre, dispel the terrors of the fiends who hate us May lofty Agni be my guide and shelter, the easily-invoked, the good Protector.
translations.oldenberg: Flaming with thy broad stream of light beat away fiends, sorcerers, plagues. May I dwell in the protection of the great, well-protecting (god), under the guidance of Agni who readily listens to our call.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं नो॑ अ॒स्या उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ॒ त्वं सूर॒ उदि॑ते बोधि गो॒पाः जन्मे॑व॒ नित्यं॒ तन॑यं जुषस्व॒ स्तोमं॑ मे अग्ने त॒न्वा॑ सुजात
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ no asyā́ uṣáso vyùṣṭau tváṃ sū́ra údite bodhi gopā́ḥ jánmeva nítyaṃ tánayaṃ juṣasva stómam me agne tanvā̀ sujāta
stanzas.translation: Be thou To us, while now the morn is breaking, be thou a guardian when the Sun hath mounted.. Accept, as men accept a true-born infant, my laud, O Agni nobly born in body.

translations.griffith: Be thou To us, while now the morn is breaking, be thou a guardian when the Sun hath mounted.. Accept, as men accept a true-born infant, my laud, O Agni nobly born in body.
translations.oldenberg: Be thou our protector when this dawn shines forth, he thou (our protector) when the sun has risen. Cherish, O Agni, well-born in body, this praise of mine as (a man rejoices) in the birth (of a son), in his own offspring 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं नृ॒चक्षा॑ वृष॒भानु॑ पू॒र्वीः कृ॒ष्णास्व॑ग्ने अरु॒षो वि भा॑हि वसो॒ नेषि॑ च॒ पर्षि॒ चात्यंहः॑ कृ॒धी नो॑ रा॒य उ॒शिजो॑ यविष्ठ
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ nr̥cákṣā vr̥ṣabhā́nu pūrvī́ḥ kr̥ṣṇā́sv agne aruṣó ví bhāhi váso néṣi ca párṣi cā́ty áṃhaḥ kr̥dhī́ no rāyá uśíjo yaviṣṭha
stanzas.translation: Bull, who beholdest men, through many mornings, among the dark ones shine forth red, O Agni. Lead us, good Lord, and bear us over trouble: Help us who long, Most Youthful God, to riches.

translations.griffith: Bull, who beholdest men, through many mornings, among the dark ones shine forth red, O Agni. Lead us, good Lord, and bear us over trouble: Help us who long, Most Youthful God, to riches.
translations.oldenberg: Beholding men, shine thou after many (dawns) 1, O bull, Agni, red in the dark (nights). O Vasu! Lead us and bring us across anguish. Help us, the Usigs 2, to wealth 3, thou youngest (of the gods)!

stanzas.sanskrit: अषा॑ळ्हो अग्ने वृष॒भो दि॑दीहि॒ पुरो॒ विश्वाः॒ सौभ॑गा संजिगी॒वान् य॒ज्ञस्य॑ ने॒ता प्र॑थ॒मस्य॑ पा॒योर्जात॑वेदो बृह॒तः सु॑प्रणीते
stanzas.transliteration: áṣāḷho agne vr̥ṣabhó didīhi púro víśvāḥ saúbhagā saṃjigīvā́n yajñásya netā́ prathamásya pāyór jā́tavedo br̥hatáḥ supraṇīte
stanzas.translation: Shine forth, a Bull invincible, O Agni, winning by conquest all the forts and treasures, Thou Jâtavedas who art skilled in guiding, the chief high saving sacrifice's Leader.

translations.griffith: Shine forth, a Bull invincible, O Agni, winning by conquest all the forts and treasures, Thou Jâtavedas who art skilled in guiding, the chief high saving sacrifice's Leader.
translations.oldenberg: Shine, O Agni, thou the invincible bull, who hast conquered all strongholds and all delights, the leader of the first, the protecting 1, mighty sacrifice, O Gâtavedas, best guide.

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छि॑द्रा॒ शर्म॑ जरितः पु॒रूणि॑ दे॒वाँ अच्छा॒ दीद्या॑नः सुमे॒धाः रथो॒ न सस्नि॑र॒भि व॑क्षि॒ वाज॒मग्ने॒ त्वं रोद॑सी नः सु॒मेके॑
stanzas.transliteration: áchidrā śárma jaritaḥ purū́ṇi devā́m̐ áchā dī́dyānaḥ sumedhā́ḥ rátho ná sásnir abhí vakṣi vā́jam ágne tváṃ ródasī naḥ suméke
stanzas.translation: Lighting Gods hither, Agni, wisest Singer, bring thou to us many and flawless shelters. Bring vigour, like a car that gathers booty: bring us, O Agni, beauteous.Rarth and Heaven.

translations.griffith: Lighting Gods hither, Agni, wisest Singer, bring thou to us many and flawless shelters. Bring vigour, like a car that gathers booty: bring us, O Agni, beauteous.Rarth and Heaven.
translations.oldenberg: O singer, thou who art wise, brightly shining towards the gods 1, bring to us thy many perfect shelters, and gain like a victorious car 2; Agni, (carry) thou (hither) towards us the two well-established 3 worlds (Heaven and Earth).

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र पी॑पय वृषभ॒ जिन्व॒ वाजा॒नग्ने॒ त्वं रोद॑सी नः सु॒दोघे॑ दे॒वेभि॑र्देव सु॒रुचा॑ रुचा॒नो मा नो॒ मर्त॑स्य दुर्म॒तिः परि॑ ष्ठात्
stanzas.transliteration: prá pīpaya vr̥ṣabha jínva vā́jān ágne tváṃ ródasī naḥ sudóghe devébhir deva surúcā rucānó mā́ no mártasya durmatíḥ pári ṣṭhāt
stanzas.translation: Swell, O thou Bull and give those powers an impulse, e'en Earth and Heaven who yield their milk in plenty, Shining, O God, with Gods in clear effulgence. Let not a mortal's evil will obstruct us.

translations.griffith: Swell, O thou Bull and give those powers an impulse, e'en Earth and Heaven who yield their milk in plenty, Shining, O God, with Gods in clear effulgence. Let not a mortal's evil will obstruct us.
translations.oldenberg: O bull, increase and rouse our gains. Agni! (Increase) for us the two worlds (Heaven and Earth) rich in milk, O god together with the gods, shining with beautiful shine! May a mortal's hatred never enclose us.

stanzas.sanskrit: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā- -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé
stanzas.translation: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading ofrspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

translations.griffith: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading ofrspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यम॒ग्निः सु॒वीर्य॒स्येशे॑ म॒हः सौभ॑गस्य रा॒य ई॑शे स्वप॒त्यस्य॒ गोम॑त॒ ईशे॑ वृत्र॒हथा॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ayám agníḥ suvī́ryasya- -ī́śe maháḥ saúbhagasya rāyá īśe svapatyásya gómataḥ- ī́śe vr̥traháthānām
stanzas.translation: THIS Agni is the Lord of great felicity and hero Strength; Lord of wealth in herds of kine; Lord of the battles with the foe.

translations.griffith: THIS Agni is the Lord of great felicity and hero Strength; Lord of wealth in herds of kine; Lord of the battles with the foe.
translations.oldenberg: This Agni rules over abundance in valiant men, over great happiness. He rules over wealth consisting in offspring and cows; he rules over the killing of foes.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं न॑रो मरुतः सश्चता॒ वृधं॒ यस्मि॒न्रायः॒ शेवृ॑धासः अ॒भि ये सन्ति॒ पृत॑नासु दू॒ढ्यो॑ वि॒श्वाहा॒ शत्रु॑माद॒भुः
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ naro marutaḥ saścatā vŕ̥dhaṃ yásmin rā́yaḥ śévr̥dhāsaḥ abhí yé sánti pŕ̥tanāsu dūḍhyò viśvā́hā śátrum ādabhúḥ
stanzas.translation: Wait, Maruts, Heroes, upon him the Prosperer in whom is bliss-increasing wealth; Who in fights ever conquer evil-hearted men, who overcome the enemy.

translations.griffith: Wait, Maruts, Heroes, upon him the Prosperer in whom is bliss-increasing wealth; Who in fights ever conquer evil-hearted men, who overcome the enemy.
translations.oldenberg: O Maruts 1, ye men, cling to this furtherer 2 who possesses joy-furthering boons—(the Maruts) who 3 in battles overcome ill-minded (foes), who have deceived the enemy 4 day by day.

stanzas.sanskrit: स त्वं नो॑ रा॒यः शि॑शीहि॒ मीढ्वो॑ अग्ने सु॒वीर्य॑स्य तुवि॑द्युम्न॒ वर्षि॑ष्ठस्य प्र॒जाव॑तोऽनमी॒वस्य॑ शु॒ष्मिणः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá tváṃ no rāyáḥ śiśīhi mī́ḍhvo agne suvī́ryasya túvidyumna várṣiṣṭhasya prajā́vato -anamīvásya śuṣmíṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: As such, O Agni, deal us wealth and hero might, O Bounteous One! Most lofty, very glorious, rich in progeny, free from disease and full of power.

translations.griffith: As such, O Agni, deal us wealth and hero might, O Bounteous One! Most lofty, very glorious, rich in progeny, free from disease and full of power.
translations.oldenberg: As such, O bounteous Agni, prepare 1 us riches 2 and wealth in valiant men, which, O highly glorious one, may be most exalted, rich in offspring, free from plagues, and powerful.

stanzas.sanskrit: चक्रि॒र्यो विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒भि सा॑स॒हिश्चक्रि॑र्दे॒वेष्वा दुवः॑ आ दे॒वेषु॒ यत॑त॒ आ सु॒वीर्य॒ आ शंस॑ उ॒त नृ॒णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: cákrir yó víśvā bhúvanābhí sāsahíś cákrir devéṣv ā́ dúvaḥ ā́ devéṣu yátata ā́ suvī́rye- ā́ śáṃsa utá nr̥ṇā́m
stanzas.translation: He who made all that lives, who passes all in might, who orders service to the Gods, He works among the Gods, he works in hero strength, yea, also in the praise of men.

translations.griffith: He who made all that lives, who passes all in might, who orders service to the Gods, He works among the Gods, he works in hero strength, yea, also in the praise of men.
translations.oldenberg: The maker who victoriously (stands) over all beings, the maker who makes the praise arrive among the gods 1: he stands firm among the gods, among the host of heroes, firm also in the praise of men.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा नो॑ अ॒ग्नेऽम॑तये॒ मावीर॑तायै रीरधः मागोता॑यै सहसस्पुत्र॒ मा नि॒देऽप॒ द्वेषां॒स्या कृ॑धि
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ no agné 'mataye mā́vī́ratāyai rīradhaḥ mā́gótāyai sahasas putra mā́ nidé -ápa dvéṣāṃsy ā́ kr̥dhi
stanzas.translation: Give us not up to indigence, Agni, nor want of hero sons, Nor, Son of Strength, to lack of cattle, nor to blame. Drive. thou our enemies away.

translations.griffith: Give us not up to indigence, Agni, nor want of hero sons, Nor, Son of Strength, to lack of cattle, nor to blame. Drive. thou our enemies away.
translations.oldenberg: Give us not up, Agni, to want of thought 1 nor to want of heroes nor to want of cows, O son of strength, nor to the scoffer. Drive away hostile powers 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: श॒ग्धि वाज॑स्य सुभग प्र॒जाव॒तोऽग्ने॑ बृह॒तो अ॑ध्व॒रे सं रा॒या भूय॑सा सृज मयो॒भुना॒ तुवि॑द्युम्न॒ यश॑स्वता
stanzas.transliteration: śagdhí vā́jasya subhaga prajā́vataḥ- -ágne br̥ható adhvaré sáṃ rāyā́ bhū́yasā sr̥ja mayobhúnā túvidyumna yáśasvatā
stanzas.translation: Help us to strength, blest Agni! rich in progeny, abundant, in our sacrifice. Flood us with riches yet more plenteous, bringing weal, with high renown, most Glorious One!

translations.griffith: Help us to strength, blest Agni! rich in progeny, abundant, in our sacrifice. Flood us with riches yet more plenteous, bringing weal, with high renown, most Glorious One!
translations.oldenberg: Help us at this sacrifice, O blessed one, with mighty gain which is accompanied by offspring, O Agni! Let us be united with greater, gladdening, glorious wealth, O thou of mighty splendour!

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मि॒ध्यमा॑नः प्रथ॒मानु॒ धर्मा॒ सम॒क्तुभि॑रज्यते वि॒श्ववा॑रः शो॒चिष्के॑शो घृ॒तनि॑र्णिक्पाव॒कः सु॑य॒ज्ञो अ॒ग्निर्य॒जथा॑य दे॒वान्
stanzas.transliteration: samidhyámānaḥ prathamā́nu dhármā sám aktúbhir ajyate viśvávāraḥ śocíṣkeśo ghr̥tánirṇik pāvakáḥ suyajñó agnír yajáthāya devā́n
stanzas.translation: DULY enkindled after ancient customs, bringing all treasures, he is balmed with unguents,– Flame-haired, oil-clad, the purifying Agni, skilled in fair rites, to bring the Gods for worship.

translations.griffith: DULY enkindled after ancient customs, bringing all treasures, he is balmed with unguents,– Flame-haired, oil-clad, the purifying Agni, skilled in fair rites, to bring the Gods for worship.
translations.oldenberg: He who is inflamed after the primitive ordinances, is anointed with ointments 1, the giver of all treasures, he whose hair is flame, whose stately robe is ghee, the purifier, skilled in sacrifice, Agni—that he may sacrifice to the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: यथाय॑जो हो॒त्रम॑ग्ने पृथि॒व्या यथा॑ दि॒वो जा॑तवेदश्चिकि॒त्वान् ए॒वानेन॑ ह॒विषा॑ यक्षि दे॒वान्म॑नु॒ष्वद्य॒ज्ञं प्र ति॑रे॒मम॒द्य
stanzas.transliteration: yáthā́yajo hotrám agne pr̥thivyā́ḥ- yáthā divó jātavedaś cikitvā́n evā́néna havíṣā yakṣi devā́n manuṣvád yajñám prá tiremám adyá
stanzas.translation: As thou, O Agni, skilful Jâtavedas, hast sacrificed as Priest of Earth, of Heaven, So with this offering bring the Gods, and prosper this sacrifice today as erst for Manu.

translations.griffith: As thou, O Agni, skilful Jâtavedas, hast sacrificed as Priest of Earth, of Heaven, So with this offering bring the Gods, and prosper this sacrifice today as erst for Manu.
translations.oldenberg: As thou hast performed, O Agni, the Hotri's duty for the Earth, as thou hast done it for Heaven, O Gâtavedas, full of intelligence, in the same way sacrifice with this offering to the gods. Prosper this sacrifice to-day as thou hast done for Manus.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रीण्यायूं॑षि॒ तव॑ जातवेदस्ति॒स्र आ॒जानी॑रु॒षस॑स्ते अग्ने ताभि॑र्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ यक्षि वि॒द्वानथा॑ भव॒ यज॑मानाय॒ शं योः
stanzas.transliteration: trī́ṇy ā́yūṃṣi táva jātavedas tisrá ājā́nīr uṣásas te agne tā́bhir devā́nām ávo yakṣi vidvā́n áthā bhava yájamānāya śáṃ yóḥ
stanzas.translation: Three are thy times of life, O Jâtavedas, and the three mornings are thy births, O Agni. With these, well-knowing, grant the Gods' kind favour, and help in stir aiid stress the man who worships.

translations.griffith: Three are thy times of life, O Jâtavedas, and the three mornings are thy births, O Agni. With these, well-knowing, grant the Gods' kind favour, and help in stir aiid stress the man who worships.
translations.oldenberg: Thou hast three lives, O Gâtavedas, and three births from the Dawn 1, O Agni! Being wise, sacrifice with these to the favour of the gods, and bring luck and welfare to the sacrificer.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं सु॑दी॒तिं सु॒दृशं॑ गृ॒णन्तो॑ नम॒स्याम॒स्त्वेड्यं॑ जातवेदः त्वां दू॒तम॑र॒तिं ह॑व्य॒वाहं॑ दे॒वा अ॑कृण्वन्न॒मृत॑स्य॒ नाभि॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ sudītíṃ sudŕ̥śaṃ gr̥ṇánto namasyā́mas tvéḍyaṃ jātavedaḥ tvā́ṃ dūtám aratíṃ havyavā́haṃ devā́ akr̥ṇvann amŕ̥tasya nā́bhim
stanzas.translation: Agni most bright and fair with song we honour, yea, the adorable, O Jâtavedas. Thee, envoy, messenger, oblation-bearer, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.

translations.griffith: Agni most bright and fair with song we honour, yea, the adorable, O Jâtavedas. Thee, envoy, messenger, oblation-bearer, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.
translations.oldenberg: Praising Agni full of splendour, full of beauty, we adore thee, O Gâtavedas, deserving to be magnified. Thee the gods have made their messenger, their steward 1, and carrier of offerings, the navel of immortality.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्त्वद्धोता॒ पूर्वो॑ अग्ने॒ यजी॑यान्द्वि॒ता च॒ सत्ता॑ स्व॒धया॑ च श॒म्भुः तस्यानु॒ धर्म॒ प्र य॑जा चिकि॒त्वोऽथा॑ नो धा अध्व॒रं दे॒ववी॑तौ
stanzas.transliteration: yás tvád dhótā pū́rvo agne yájīyān dvitā́ ca sáttā svadháyā ca śambhúḥ tásyā́nu dhárma prá yajā cikitvaḥ- -áthā no dhā adhvaráṃ devávītau
stanzas.translation: That Priest before thee, yet more skilled in worship, stablished of old, healthgiver by his nature,– After his custom offer, thou who knowest, and lay our sacrifice where Gods may taste it.

translations.griffith: That Priest before thee, yet more skilled in worship, stablished of old, healthgiver by his nature,– After his custom offer, thou who knowest, and lay our sacrifice where Gods may taste it.
translations.oldenberg: O Agni, the Hotri who before thee was an excellent sacrificer, who verily 1 sat down and brought luck by himself 2 sacrifice according to his rules, O intelligent one, and set down our sacrifice at the feast of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: भवा॑ नो अग्ने सु॒मना॒ उपे॑तौ॒ सखे॑व॒ सख्ये॑ पि॒तरे॑व सा॒धुः पु॒रु॒द्रुहो॒ हि क्षि॒तयो॒ जना॑नां॒ प्रति॑ प्रती॒चीर्द॑हता॒दरा॑तीः
stanzas.transliteration: bhávā no agne sumánā úpetau sákheva sákhye pitáreva sādhúḥ purudrúho hí kṣitáyo jánānām práti pratīcī́r dahatād árātīḥ
stanzas.translation: AGNI, be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend, as sire and mother. The races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us.

translations.griffith: AGNI, be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend, as sire and mother. The races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us.
translations.oldenberg: Be kind, O Agni, when we approach thee, as a friend a friend, as parents 1, a straight leader. For full of deceit are the tribes of men: burn thou against (all) malign powers so that they turn back.

stanzas.sanskrit: तपो॒ ष्व॑ग्ने॒ अन्त॑राँ अ॒मित्रा॒न्तपा॒ शंस॒मर॑रुषः॒ पर॑स्य तपो॑ वसो चिकिता॒नो अ॒चित्ता॒न्वि ते॑ तिष्ठन्ताम॒जरा॑ अ॒यासः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tápo ṣv àgne ántarām̐ amítrān tápā śáṃsam áraruṣaḥ párasya tápo vaso cikitānó acíttān ví te tiṣṭhantām ajárā ayā́saḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, burn up the unfriendly who are near us, burn thou the foeman's curse who pays no worship. Burn, Vasu, thou who markest well, the foolish: let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee.

translations.griffith: Agni, burn up the unfriendly who are near us, burn thou the foeman's curse who pays no worship. Burn, Vasu, thou who markest well, the foolish: let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee.
translations.oldenberg: Burn, O Agni, the nearer enemies, burn the curse of the distant evil-doer. Burn, O Vasu, seeing the unseen ones. May thy never-ageing, never-tiring flames 1 spread out.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ध्मेना॑ग्न इ॒च्छमा॑नो घृ॒तेन॑ जु॒होमि॑ ह॒व्यं तर॑से॒ बला॑य याव॒दीशे॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ वन्द॑मान इ॒मां धियं॑ शत॒सेया॑य दे॒वीम्
stanzas.transliteration: idhménāgna ichámāno ghr̥téna juhómi havyáṃ tárase bálāya yā́vad ī́śe bráhmaṇā vándamānaḥ- imā́ṃ dhíyaṃ śataséyāya devī́m
stanzas.translation: With fuel, Agni, and with oil, desirous, mine offering I present for strength and conquest, With prayer, so far as I have power, adoring-this hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures.

translations.griffith: With fuel, Agni, and with oil, desirous, mine offering I present for strength and conquest, With prayer, so far as I have power, adoring-this hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures.
translations.oldenberg: Wishing for (thy blessings), O Agni, by fuel and ghee I offer this sacrificial food for (the attainment of) advancing power and of strength; worshipping thee with my spell as far as I have power (I offer) this divine prayer for the attainment of hundred(fold blessings).

stanzas.sanskrit: उच्छो॒चिषा॑ सहसस्पुत्र स्तु॒तो बृ॒हद्वयः॑ शशमा॒नेषु॑ धेहि रे॒वद॑ग्ने वि॒श्वामि॑त्रेषु॒ शं योर्म॑र्मृ॒ज्मा ते॑ त॒न्वं१॒॑ भूरि॒ कृत्वः॑
stanzas.transliteration: úc chocíṣā sahasas putra stutó br̥hád váyaḥ śaśamānéṣu dhehi revád agne viśvā́mitreṣu śáṃ yór marmr̥jmā́ te tanvàm bhū́ri kŕ̥tvaḥ
stanzas.translation: Give with thy glow, thou Son of Strength, when lauded, great vital power to those who toil to serve thee. Give richly, Agni, to the Viṣvâmitras in rest and stir. Oft have we decked thy body.

translations.griffith: Give with thy glow, thou Son of Strength, when lauded, great vital power to those who toil to serve thee. Give richly, Agni, to the Viṣvâmitras in rest and stir. Oft have we decked thy body.
translations.oldenberg: (Shining) forth with thy flame, O son of strength, praised (by us), bestow mighty vigour on those who toil for thee, bright luck and welfare, O Agni, on the Visvâmitras! We have cleaned thy body many times.

stanzas.sanskrit: कृ॒धि रत्नं॑ सुसनित॒र्धना॑नां॒ स घेद॑ग्ने भवसि॒ यत्समि॑द्धः स्तो॒तुर्दु॑रो॒णे सु॒भग॑स्य रे॒वत्सृ॒प्रा क॒रस्ना॑ दधिषे॒ वपूं॑षि
stanzas.transliteration: kr̥dhí rátnaṃ susanitar dhánānāṃ sá ghéd agne bhavasi yát sámiddhaḥ stotúr duroṇé subhágasya revát sr̥prā́ karásnā dadhiṣe vápūṃṣi
stanzas.translation: Give us, O liberal Lord, great gtore of riches, for, Agni, such art thou when duly kindled. Thou in the happy singer's home bestowest, amply with arms extended, things of beauty.

translations.griffith: Give us, O liberal Lord, great gtore of riches, for, Agni, such art thou when duly kindled. Thou in the happy singer's home bestowest, amply with arms extended, things of beauty.
translations.oldenberg: Give us treasures, O best gainer of riches: such indeed art thou, Agni, when thou hast been kindled. In the blessed praiser's house thou hast placed, together with wealth, thy mighty(?) arms 1, thy marvellous shapes.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं होता॑रं॒ प्र वृ॑णे मि॒येधे॒ गृत्सं॑ क॒विं वि॑श्व॒विद॒ममू॑रम् स नो॑ यक्षद्दे॒वता॑ता॒ यजी॑यान्रा॒ये वाजा॑य वनते म॒घानि॑
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ hótāram prá vr̥ṇe miyédhe gŕ̥tsaṃ kavíṃ viśvavídam ámūram sá no yakṣad devátātā yájīyān rāyé vā́jāya vanate maghā́ni
stanzas.translation: Aow, quick, sage, infallible, all-knowing, I choose to be our Priest at this oblation. In our Gods' service he, best skilled, shall worship: may he obtain us boons for strength and riches.

translations.griffith: Aow, quick, sage, infallible, all-knowing, I choose to be our Priest at this oblation. In our Gods' service he, best skilled, shall worship: may he obtain us boons for strength and riches.
translations.oldenberg: I choose Agni as Hotri at this sacrificial meal, the clever sage all-knowing and not foolish. May he, the excellent sacrificer, sacrifice for us amid the host of the gods; may he obtain liberal boons (for us) for the sake of wealth and strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ते॑ अग्ने ह॒विष्म॑तीमिय॒र्म्यच्छा॑ सुद्यु॒म्नां रा॒तिनीं॑ घृ॒ताची॑म् प्र॒द॒क्षि॒णिद्दे॒वता॑तिमुरा॒णः सं रा॒तिभि॒र्वसु॑भिर्य॒ज्ञम॑श्रेत्
stanzas.transliteration: prá te agne havíṣmatīm iyarmi- áchā sudyumnā́ṃ rātínīṃ ghr̥tā́cīm pradakṣiṇíd devátātim urāṇáḥ sáṃ rātíbhir vásubhir yajñám aśret
stanzas.translation: Agni, to thee I lift the oil-fed ladle, bright, with an offering, bearing our oblation. From the right hand, choosing the Gods' attendance, he with rich presents hath arranged the worship.

translations.griffith: Agni, to thee I lift the oil-fed ladle, bright, with an offering, bearing our oblation. From the right hand, choosing the Gods' attendance, he with rich presents hath arranged the worship.
translations.oldenberg: To thee, O Agni, I stretch forth the (ladle) rich in sacrificial food, splendid, full of gifts, full of ghee. From left to right, choosing the host of the gods 1, he has established the sacrifice with gifts and goods 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: स तेजी॑यसा॒ मन॑सा॒ त्वोत॑ उ॒त शि॑क्ष स्वप॒त्यस्य॑ शि॒क्षोः अग्ने॑ रा॒यो नृत॑मस्य॒ प्रभू॑तौ भू॒याम॑ ते सुष्टु॒तय॑श्च॒ वस्वः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá téjīyasā mánasā tvóta utá śikṣa svapatyásya śikṣóḥ ágne rāyó nŕ̥tamasya prábhūtau bhūyā́ma te suṣṭutáyaś ca vásvaḥ
stanzas.translation: Of keenest spirit is the man thou aidest give us good offspring, thou who givest freely. In power of wealth most rich in men. O Agni, of thee, the Good, may we sing forth fair praises.

translations.griffith: Of keenest spirit is the man thou aidest give us good offspring, thou who givest freely. In power of wealth most rich in men. O Agni, of thee, the Good, may we sing forth fair praises.
translations.oldenberg: Whoever is favoured by thee, is blessed with the sharpest spirit. Favour him with good offspring, O god rich in favours 1! Agni, may we, (dwelling) in the copiousness of manliest wealth, be rich in perfect praise of thee, the Vasu.

stanzas.sanskrit: भूरी॑णि॒ हि त्वे द॑धि॒रे अनी॒काग्ने॑ दे॒वस्य॒ यज्य॑वो॒ जना॑सः स आ व॑ह दे॒वता॑तिं यविष्ठ॒ शर्धो॒ यद॒द्य दि॒व्यं यजा॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: bhū́rīṇi hí tvé dadhiré ánīkā- -ágne devásya yájyavo jánāsaḥ sá ā́ vaha devátātiṃ yaviṣṭha śárdho yád adyá divyáṃ yájāsi
stanzas.translation: Men as they worship thee the God, O Agni, have set on thee full many a brilliant, aspect. So bring Most Youthful One, the Gods' asserrigly, the Heavenly Host which thou to-day shalt honour.

translations.griffith: Men as they worship thee the God, O Agni, have set on thee full many a brilliant, aspect. So bring Most Youthful One, the Gods' asserrigly, the Heavenly Host which thou to-day shalt honour.
translations.oldenberg: On thee indeed, O Agni, sacrificing men have put many faces of (thee) the god 1. Bring hither then the host of the gods, O youngest one, when thou wilt sacrifice to-day to the divine host 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्त्वा॒ होता॑रम॒नज॑न्मि॒येधे॑ निषा॒दय॑न्तो य॒जथा॑य दे॒वाः स त्वं नो॑ अग्नेऽवि॒तेह बो॒ध्यधि॒ श्रवां॑सि धेहि नस्त॒नूषु॑
stanzas.transliteration: yát tvā hótāram anájan miyédhe niṣādáyanto yajáthāya devā́ḥ sá tváṃ no agne 'vitéhá bodhi- ádhi śrávāṃsi dhehi nas tanū́ṣu
stanzas.translation: When Gods anoint thee Priest at their oblation, and seat thee for thy task as Sacrificer, O Agni, be thou here our kind defender, and to ourselves vouchsafe the gift of glory.

translations.griffith: When Gods anoint thee Priest at their oblation, and seat thee for thy task as Sacrificer, O Agni, be thou here our kind defender, and to ourselves vouchsafe the gift of glory.
translations.oldenberg: When the gods will anoint thee as the Hotri at the sacrificial meal making thee sit down for the sacrifice, be thou here, O Agni, our furtherer, and bestow glory on our bodies.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निमु॒षस॑म॒श्विना॑ दधि॒क्रां व्यु॑ष्टिषु हवते॒ वह्नि॑रु॒क्थैः सु॒ज्योति॑षो नः शृण्वन्तु दे॒वाः स॒जोष॑सो अध्व॒रं वा॑वशा॒नाः
