stanzas.transliteration: agním uṣásam aśvínā dadhikrā́ṃ vyùṣṭiṣu havate váhnir ukthaíḥ sujyótiṣo naḥ śr̥ṇvantu devā́ḥ sajóṣaso adhvaráṃ vāvaśānā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: WITH lauds at break of morn the priest invoketh Agni, Dawn, Dadhikrâs, and both the Aṣvins. With one consent the Gods whose light is splendid, longing to taste our sacrifice, shall hear us.

translations.griffith: WITH lauds at break of morn the priest invoketh Agni, Dawn, Dadhikrâs, and both the Aṣvins. With one consent the Gods whose light is splendid, longing to taste our sacrifice, shall hear us.
translations.oldenberg: The carrier (of the gods) 1 calls by his hymns Agni, Ushas (dawn), the two Asvins, Dadhikrâ 2 at daybreak. May the gods rich in light, unanimously longing for our sacrifice, hear us.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ त्री ते॒ वाजि॑ना॒ त्री ष॒धस्था॑ ति॒स्रस्ते॑ जि॒ह्वा ऋ॑तजात पू॒र्वीः ति॒स्र उ॑ ते त॒न्वो॑ दे॒ववा॑ता॒स्ताभि॑र्नः पाहि॒ गिरो॒ अप्र॑युच्छन्
stanzas.transliteration: ágne trī́ te vā́jinā trī́ ṣadhásthā tisrás te jihvā́ r̥tajāta pūrvī́ḥ tisrá u te tanvò devávātās tā́bhir naḥ pāhi gíro áprayuchan
stanzas.translation: Three are thy powers, O Agni, three thy stations, three are thy tongues, yea, many, Child of Order! Three bodies hast thou which the Gods delight in: with these protect our hymns with care unceasing.

translations.griffith: Three are thy powers, O Agni, three thy stations, three are thy tongues, yea, many, Child of Order! Three bodies hast thou which the Gods delight in: with these protect our hymns with care unceasing.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, threefold is thy strength; three are thy abodes; three are thy many tongues, O thou who art born in Rita! And three, O Agni, are thy bodies beloved by the gods. With these protect our prayers unremittingly.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ भूरी॑णि॒ तव॑ जातवेदो॒ देव॑ स्वधावो॒ऽमृत॑स्य॒ नाम॑ याश्च॑ मा॒या मा॒यिनां॑ विश्वमिन्व॒ त्वे पू॒र्वीः सं॑द॒धुः पृ॑ष्टबन्धो
stanzas.transliteration: ágne bhū́rīṇi táva jātavedo déva svadhāvo 'mŕ̥tasya nā́ma yā́ś ca māyā́ māyínāṃ viśvaminva tvé pūrvī́ḥ saṃdadhúḥ pr̥ṣṭabandho
stanzas.translation: O Agni, many are the names thou bearest, immortal, God, Divine, and Jâtavedas. And many charms of charmers, All-Inspirer! have they laid in thee, Lord of true attendants!

translations.griffith: O Agni, many are the names thou bearest, immortal, God, Divine, and Jâtavedas. And many charms of charmers, All-Inspirer! have they laid in thee, Lord of true attendants!
translations.oldenberg: 1 Agni! Many are the names, O Gâtavedas, of thee the immortal one, O self-dependent god! And whatever the secret powers of the powerful 2 are, thou all-enlivener, in thee they have placed together (those) many (powers), O (god) after whose relations men ask 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्ने॒ता भग॑ इव क्षिती॒नां दैवी॑नां दे॒व ऋ॑तु॒पा ऋ॒तावा॑ स वृ॑त्र॒हा स॒नयो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दाः॒ पर्ष॒द्विश्वाति॑ दुरि॒ता गृ॒णन्त॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: agnír netā́ bhága iva kṣitīnā́ṃ daívīnāṃ devá r̥tupā́ r̥tā́vā sá vr̥trahā́ sanáyo viśvávedāḥ párṣad víśvā́ti duritā́ gr̥ṇántam
stanzas.translation: Agni, like Bhaga, leads the godly people, he who is true to Law and guards the seasons. Ancient, all-knowing, he the Vr̥itra-slayer shall bear the singer safe through every trouble.

translations.griffith: Agni, like Bhaga, leads the godly people, he who is true to Law and guards the seasons. Ancient, all-knowing, he the Vr̥itra-slayer shall bear the singer safe through every trouble.
translations.oldenberg: Agni is the divine leader of the divine tribes like Bhaga, the guardian of the seasons 1, the righteous. May He, the killer of Vritra 2, the ancient one, the possessor of all wealth, bring the singer across all troubles.

stanzas.sanskrit: द॒धि॒क्राम॒ग्निमु॒षसं॑ च दे॒वीं बृह॒स्पतिं॑ सवि॒तारं॑ च दे॒वम् अ॒श्विना॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णा॒ भगं॑ च॒ वसू॑न्रु॒द्राँ आ॑दि॒त्याँ इ॒ह हु॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: dadhikrā́m agním uṣásaṃ ca devī́m bŕ̥haspátiṃ savitā́raṃ ca devám aśvínā mitrā́váruṇā bhágaṃ ca vásūn rudrā́m̐ ādityā́m̐ ihá huve
stanzas.translation: I call on Savitar the God, on Morning, Br̥ihaspati, and Dadhikrâs, and Agni, On Varuṇa and Mitra, on the Aṣvins, Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras and Âdityas.

translations.griffith: I call on Savitar the God, on Morning, Br̥ihaspati, and Dadhikrâs, and Agni, On Varuṇa and Mitra, on the Aṣvins, Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras and Âdityas.
translations.oldenberg: I invite hither 1 Dadhikrâ 2, Agni, and the goddess Ushas, Brihaspati and the god Savitri, the Asvins, Mitra and Varuna and Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras, and Âdityas.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं नो॑ य॒ज्ञम॒मृते॑षु धेही॒मा ह॒व्या जा॑तवेदो जुषस्व स्तो॒काना॑मग्ने॒ मेद॑सो घृ॒तस्य॒ होतः॒ प्राशा॑न प्रथ॒मो नि॒षद्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ no yajñám amŕ̥teṣu dhehi- -imā́ havyā́ jātavedo juṣasva stokā́nām agne médaso ghr̥tásya hótaḥ prā́śāna prathamó niṣádya
stanzas.translation: SET this our sacrifice among the Immortals: be pleased with these our presents, Jâtavedas. O Priest, O Agni, sit thee down before us, and first enjoy the drops of oil and fatness.

translations.griffith: SET this our sacrifice among the Immortals: be pleased with these our presents, Jâtavedas. O Priest, O Agni, sit thee down before us, and first enjoy the drops of oil and fatness.
translations.oldenberg: Take this our sacrifice to the immortals; accept graciously these offerings, O Gâtavedas. O Agni, partake of the drops of fat and ghee, O Hotri, having sat down as the first.

stanzas.sanskrit: घृ॒तव॑न्तः पावक ते स्तो॒काः श्चो॑तन्ति॒ मेद॑सः स्वध॑र्मन्दे॒ववी॑तये॒ श्रेष्ठं॑ नो धेहि॒ वार्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ghr̥távantaḥ pāvaka te stokā́ ścotanti médasaḥ svádharman devávītaye śréṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vā́ryam
stanzas.translation: For thee, O Purifier, flow the drops of fatness rich in oil. After thy wont vouchsafe to us the choicest boon that Gods may feast.

translations.griffith: For thee, O Purifier, flow the drops of fatness rich in oil. After thy wont vouchsafe to us the choicest boon that Gods may feast.
translations.oldenberg: To thee, O purifier, the drops of fat mixed with ghee drip down. O (god) who followest thy own ordinances, give us the best boon for this feast to which the gods come eagerly.

stanzas.sanskrit: तुभ्यं॑ स्तो॒का घृ॑त॒श्चुतोऽग्ने॒ विप्रा॑य सन्त्य ऋषिः॒ श्रेष्ठः॒ समि॑ध्यसे य॒ज्ञस्य॑ प्रावि॒ता भ॑व
stanzas.transliteration: túbhyaṃ stokā́ ghr̥taścútaḥ- -ágne víprāya santya ŕ̥ṣiḥ śréṣṭhaḥ sám idhyase yajñásya prāvitā́ bhava
stanzas.translation: Agni, Most Excellent! for thee the Sage are drops that drip with oil. Thou art enkindled as the best of Seers. Help thou the sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Agni, Most Excellent! for thee the Sage are drops that drip with oil. Thou art enkindled as the best of Seers. Help thou the sacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: To thee, the priest, O Agni, (belong) the drops dripping with ghee, O good one! Thou art kindled as the best Rishi. Be a furtherer of our sacrifice!

stanzas.sanskrit: तुभ्यं॑ श्चोतन्त्यध्रिगो शचीवः स्तो॒कासो॑ अग्ने॒ मेद॑सो घृ॒तस्य॑ क॒वि॒श॒स्तो बृ॑ह॒ता भा॒नुनागा॑ ह॒व्या जु॑षस्व मेधिर
stanzas.transliteration: túbhyaṃ ścotanty adhrigo śacīvaḥ- stokā́so agne médaso ghr̥tásya kaviśastó br̥hatā́ bhānúnā́gāḥ- havyā́ juṣasva medhira
stanzas.translation: To thee, O Agni, mighty and resistless, to thee stream forth the drops of oil and fatness. With great light art thou come, O praised by poets! Accept our offering, O thou Sage.

translations.griffith: To thee, O Agni, mighty and resistless, to thee stream forth the drops of oil and fatness. With great light art thou come, O praised by poets! Accept our offering, O thou Sage.
translations.oldenberg: For thee, O liberal one 1, full of power, the drops of fat and ghee drip down, O Agni! Praised by the sages thou hast come hither with mighty light. Accept graciously the offerings, O wise one!

stanzas.sanskrit: ओजि॑ष्ठं ते मध्य॒तो मेद॒ उद्भृ॑तं॒ प्र ते॑ व॒यं द॑दामहे श्चोत॑न्ति ते वसो स्तो॒का अधि॑ त्व॒चि प्रति॒ तान्दे॑व॒शो वि॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: ójiṣṭhaṃ te madhyató méda údbhr̥tam prá te vayáṃ dadāmahe ścótanti te vaso stokā́ ádhi tvací práti tā́n devaśó vihi
stanzas.translation: Fatness exceeding rich, extracted from the midst,– this as our gift we offer thee. Excellent God, the drops run down upon thy skin. Deal them to each among the Gods.

translations.griffith: Fatness exceeding rich, extracted from the midst,– this as our gift we offer thee. Excellent God, the drops run down upon thy skin. Deal them to each among the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: For thee the richest fat 1 has been taken out from the midst. We give it to thee. On thy skin, O Vasu, the drops drip down. Accept them eagerly for each of the gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं सो अ॒ग्निर्यस्मि॒न्त्सोम॒मिन्द्रः॑ सु॒तं द॒धे ज॒ठरे॑ वावशा॒नः स॒ह॒स्रिणं॒ वाज॒मत्यं॒ न सप्तिं॑ सस॒वान्त्सन्त्स्तू॑यसे जातवेदः
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ só agnír yásmin sómam índraḥ sutáṃ dadhé jaṭháre vāvaśānáḥ sahasríṇaṃ vā́jam átyaṃ ná sáptiṃ sasavā́n sán stūyase jātavedaḥ
stanzas.translation: THIS is that Agni whence the longing Indra took the pressed Soma deep within his body. Winner of spoils in thousands, like a courser, with praise art thou exalted, Jâtavedas.

translations.griffith: THIS is that Agni whence the longing Indra took the pressed Soma deep within his body. Winner of spoils in thousands, like a courser, with praise art thou exalted, Jâtavedas.
translations.oldenberg: This is that Agni with whom the desiring Indra took the pressed Soma into his body. Having obtained thousandfold strength like a horse, a racer 1, thou art praised, O Gâtavedas!

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ यत्ते॑ दि॒वि वर्चः॑ पृथि॒व्यां यदोष॑धीष्व॒प्स्वा य॑जत्र येना॒न्तरि॑क्षमु॒र्वा॑त॒तन्थ॑ त्वे॒षः स भा॒नुर॑र्ण॒वो नृ॒चक्षाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne yát te diví várcaḥ pr̥thivyā́ṃ yád óṣadhīṣv apsv ā́ yajatra yénāntárikṣam urv ā̀tatántha tveṣáḥ sá bhānúr arṇavó nr̥cákṣāḥ
stanzas.translation: That light of thine in heaven and earth, O Agni, in plants, O Holy One, and in the waters, Wherewith thou hast spread wide the air's mid-region-bright is that splendour, wavy, manbeholding.

translations.griffith: That light of thine in heaven and earth, O Agni, in plants, O Holy One, and in the waters, Wherewith thou hast spread wide the air's mid-region-bright is that splendour, wavy, manbeholding.
translations.oldenberg: 1 Thy splendour, O Agni, which dwells in heaven and on earth, in the plants, O worshipful one, and in the waters, wherewith thou hast spread through the wide air—that light of thine is fierce, waving 2, man-beholding.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ दि॒वो अर्ण॒मच्छा॑ जिगा॒स्यच्छा॑ दे॒वाँ ऊ॑चिषे॒ धिष्ण्या॒ ये या रो॑च॒ने प॒रस्ता॒त्सूर्य॑स्य॒ याश्चा॒वस्ता॑दुप॒तिष्ठ॑न्त॒ आपः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne divó árṇam áchā jigāsi- áchā devā́m̐ ūciṣe dhíṣṇyā yé yā́ rocané parástāt sū́ryasya yā́ś cāvástād upatíṣṭhanta ā́paḥ
stanzas.translation: O Agni, to the sea of heaven thou goest: thou hast called hither Gods beheld in spirit. The waters, too, come hither, those up yonder in the Sun's realm of light, and those beneath it.

translations.griffith: O Agni, to the sea of heaven thou goest: thou hast called hither Gods beheld in spirit. The waters, too, come hither, those up yonder in the Sun's realm of light, and those beneath it.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, thou goest to the floods of heaven. Thou hast spoken to the gods who are liberal (?) 1. (Thou goest) to the waters which (dwell) on high in the ether of the sun, and to those which approach below.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒री॒ष्या॑सो अ॒ग्नयः॑ प्राव॒णेभिः॑ स॒जोष॑सः जु॒षन्तां॑ य॒ज्ञम॒द्रुहो॑ऽनमी॒वा इषो॑ म॒हीः
stanzas.transliteration: purīṣyā̀so agnáyaḥ prāvaṇébhiḥ sajóṣasaḥ juṣántāṃ yajñám adrúho -anamīvā́ íṣo mahī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Let fires that dwell in mist, combined with those that have their home in floods, Guileless accept our sacrifice, great viands free from all disease.

translations.griffith: Let fires that dwell in mist, combined with those that have their home in floods, Guileless accept our sacrifice, great viands free from all disease.
translations.oldenberg: May the fires of the soil united with those on the hill-sides 1, without guile graciously accept our sacrifice and plentiful food free from all plague.

stanzas.sanskrit: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā- -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé
stanzas.translation: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

translations.griffith: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

stanzas.sanskrit: निर्म॑थितः॒ सुधि॑त॒ आ स॒धस्थे॒ युवा॑ क॒विर॑ध्व॒रस्य॑ प्रणे॒ता जूर्य॑त्स्व॒ग्निर॒जरो॒ वने॒ष्वत्रा॑ दधे अ॒मृतं॑ जा॒तवे॑दाः
stanzas.transliteration: nírmathitaḥ súdhita ā́ sadhásthe yúvā kavír adhvarásya praṇetā́ jū́ryatsv agnír ajáro váneṣu- átrā dadhe amŕ̥taṃ jātávedāḥ
stanzas.translation: RUBBED into life, well stablished in the dwelling, Leader of sacrifice, the Sage, the youthful, Here in the wasting fuel Jâtavedas, eternal, hath assumed immortal being.

translations.griffith: RUBBED into life, well stablished in the dwelling, Leader of sacrifice, the Sage, the youthful, Here in the wasting fuel Jâtavedas, eternal, hath assumed immortal being.
translations.oldenberg: Produced by attrition, well preserved in his abode, the young sage, the leader of worship, Agni ever young in the forests 1 that grow old—Gâtavedas, has here assumed immortality 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: अम॑न्थिष्टां॒ भार॑ता रे॒वद॒ग्निं दे॒वश्र॑वा दे॒ववा॑तः सु॒दक्ष॑म् अग्ने॒ वि प॑श्य बृह॒ताभि रा॒येषां नो॑ ने॒ता भ॑वता॒दनु॒ द्यून्
stanzas.transliteration: ámanthiṣṭām bhā́ratā revád agníṃ deváśravā devávātaḥ sudákṣam ágne ví paśya br̥hatā́bhí rāyā́- -iṣā́ṃ no netā́ bhavatād ánu dyū́n
stanzas.translation: Both Bharatas, Devaṣravas, Devavâta, have strongly rubbed to life effectual Agni. O Agni, look thou forth with ample riches: be, every day, bearer of food to feed us.

translations.griffith: Both Bharatas, Devaṣravas, Devavâta, have strongly rubbed to life effectual Agni. O Agni, look thou forth with ample riches: be, every day, bearer of food to feed us.
translations.oldenberg: The two Bharatas 1, Devasravas and Devavâta, in the midst of wealth have produced by attrition Agni the skilful (god). Agni, look forth with mighty wealth, and then be 2 for us a guide of food day by day.

stanzas.sanskrit: दश॒ क्षिपः॑ पू॒र्व्यं सी॑मजीजन॒न्त्सुजा॑तं मा॒तृषु॑ प्रि॒यम् अ॒ग्निं स्तु॑हि दैववा॒तं दे॑वश्रवो॒ यो जना॑ना॒मस॑द्व॒शी
stanzas.transliteration: dáśa kṣípaḥ pūrvyáṃ sīm ajījanan sújātam mātŕ̥ṣu priyám agníṃ stuhi daivavātáṃ devaśravo yó jánānām ásad vaśī́
stanzas.translation: Him nobly born of old the fingers ten produced, him whom his Mothers counted dear. Praise Devavâta's Agni, thou Devaṣravas, him who shall be the people's Lord.

translations.griffith: Him nobly born of old the fingers ten produced, him whom his Mothers counted dear. Praise Devavâta's Agni, thou Devaṣravas, him who shall be the people's Lord.
translations.oldenberg: 1 The ten fingers have brought him to the birth, the ancient, beloved (Agni), well born in his mothers 2. Praise, O Devasravas, the Agni of Devavâta who 3 should be the lord of people.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि त्वा॑ दधे॒ वर॒ आ पृ॑थि॒व्या इळा॑यास्प॒दे सु॑दिन॒त्वे अह्ना॑म् दृ॒षद्व॑त्यां॒ मानु॑ष आप॒यायां॒ सर॑स्वत्यां रे॒वद॑ग्ने दिदीहि
stanzas.transliteration: ní tvā dadhe vára ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ- íḷāyās padé sudinatvé áhnām dr̥ṣádvatyām mā́nuṣa āpayā́yāṃ sárasvatyāṃ revád agne didīhi
stanzas.translation: He set thee in the earth's most lovely station, in Iḷâ's place, in days of fair bright weather. On man, on Âpayâ, Agni! on the rivers Dr̥ishadvatî, Sarasvatî, shine richly.

translations.griffith: He set thee in the earth's most lovely station, in Iḷâ's place, in days of fair bright weather. On man, on Âpayâ, Agni! on the rivers Dr̥ishadvatî, Sarasvatî, shine richly.
translations.oldenberg: I have laid 1 thee 2 down in the best (place) of the earth 3, in the place of Ilâ 3, in the auspiciousness of days. O Agni, as the god who has belonged to Manus 4, shine with wealth on the Drishadvatî, on the Âpayâ, on the Sarasvatî.

stanzas.sanskrit: इळा॑मग्ने पुरु॒दंसं॑ स॒निं गोः श॑श्वत्त॒मं हव॑मानाय साध स्यान्नः॑ सू॒नुस्तन॑यो वि॒जावाग्ने॒ सा ते॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: íḷām agne purudáṃsaṃ saníṃ góḥ śaśvattamáṃ hávamānāya sādha syā́n naḥ sūnús tánayo vijā́vā- -ágne sā́ te sumatír bhūtv asmé
stanzas.translation: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward

translations.griffith: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ सह॑स्व॒ पृत॑ना अ॒भिमा॑ती॒रपा॑स्य दु॒ष्टर॒स्तर॒न्नरा॑ती॒र्वर्चो॑ धा य॒ज्ञवा॑हसे
stanzas.transliteration: ágne sáhasva pŕ̥tanāḥ- abhímātīr ápāsya duṣṭáras tárann árātīr várco dhā yajñávāhase
stanzas.translation: AGNI, subdue opposing bands, and drive our enemies away. Invincible, slay godless foes: give splendour to the worshipper.

translations.griffith: AGNI, subdue opposing bands, and drive our enemies away. Invincible, slay godless foes: give splendour to the worshipper.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, be victorious in battles; thrust away the plotters. Difficult to overcome, overcoming malign powers, bestow splendour on (the worshipper) who fits out the sacrifice as a vehicle 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्न॑ इ॒ळा समि॑ध्यसे वी॒तिहो॑त्रो॒ अम॑र्त्यः जु॒षस्व॒ सू नो॑ अध्व॒रम्
stanzas.transliteration: ágna iḷā́ sám idhyase vītíhotro ámartyaḥ juṣásva sū́ no adhvarám
stanzas.translation: Lit with libation, Agni, thou, deathless, who callest Gods to feast, Accept our sacrifice with joy.

translations.griffith: Lit with libation, Agni, thou, deathless, who callest Gods to feast, Accept our sacrifice with joy.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, thou art kindled with nourishment 1, the immortal offerer of a feast (to the gods). Accept graciously our worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ द्यु॒म्नेन॑ जागृवे॒ सह॑सः सूनवाहुत एदं ब॒र्हिः स॑दो॒ मम॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne dyumnéna jāgr̥ve sáhasaḥ sūnav āhuta édám barhíḥ sado máma
stanzas.translation: With splendour, Agni, Son of Strength, thou who art worshipped, wakeful One. Seat thee on this my sacred grass.

translations.griffith: With splendour, Agni, Son of Strength, thou who art worshipped, wakeful One. Seat thee on this my sacred grass.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, wakeful one, son of strength, into whom offerings are poured, sit down with thy splendour on this sacrificial grass of mine.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ विश्वे॑भिर॒ग्निभि॑र्दे॒वेभि॑र्महया॒ गिरः॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॒ य उ॑ चा॒यवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne víśvebhir agníbhir devébhir mahayā gíraḥ yajñéṣu yá u cāyávaḥ
stanzas.translation: With all thy fires, with all the Gods, Agni, exalt the songs we sing. And living men in holy rites.

translations.griffith: With all thy fires, with all the Gods, Agni, exalt the songs we sing. And living men in holy rites.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, together with all Agnis, with the gods exalt our prayers and those who are respectful at the sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ दा दा॒शुषे॑ र॒यिं वी॒रव॑न्तं॒ परी॑णसम् शि॒शी॒हि नः॑ सूनु॒मतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne dā́ dāśúṣe rayíṃ vīrávantam párīṇasam śiśīhí naḥ sūnumátaḥ
stanzas.translation: Grant, Agni, to the worshipper wealth rich in heroes, plenteous store, Make thou us rich with many sons.

translations.griffith: Grant, Agni, to the worshipper wealth rich in heroes, plenteous store, Make thou us rich with many sons.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, give wealth to the worshipper, abundance in valiant men; further us 1 that we may be rich in sons.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ दि॒वः सू॒नुर॑सि॒ प्रचे॑ता॒स्तना॑ पृथि॒व्या उ॒त वि॒श्ववे॑दाः ऋध॑ग्दे॒वाँ इ॒ह य॑जा चिकित्वः
stanzas.transliteration: ágne diváḥ sūnúr asi prácetās tánā pr̥thivyā́ utá viśvávedāḥ ŕ̥dhag devā́m̐ ihá yajā cikitvaḥ
stanzas.translation: THOU art the sapient Son of Dyaus, O Agni, yes and the Child of Earth, who knowest all things. Bring the Gods specially, thou Sage, for worship.

translations.griffith: THOU art the sapient Son of Dyaus, O Agni, yes and the Child of Earth, who knowest all things. Bring the Gods specially, thou Sage, for worship.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, thou art for ever the wise son of Heaven and of the Earth, the all-wealthy one. In thy peculiar way 1 sacrifice here to the gods, O intelligent one!

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निः स॑नोति वी॒र्या॑णि वि॒द्वान्त्स॒नोति॒ वाज॑म॒मृता॑य॒ भूष॑न् स नो॑ दे॒वाँ एह व॑हा पुरुक्षो
stanzas.transliteration: agníḥ sanoti vīryā̀ṇi vidvā́n sanóti vā́jam amŕ̥tāya bhū́ṣan sá no devā́m̐ éhá vahā purukṣo
stanzas.translation: Agni the wise bestows the might of heroes grants strengthening food, preparing it for nectar. Thou who art rich in food bring the Gods hither.

translations.griffith: Agni the wise bestows the might of heroes grants strengthening food, preparing it for nectar. Thou who art rich in food bring the Gods hither.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, the knowing, obtains (for his worshipper) heroic powers; he obtains (for him) strength, being busy for the sake of immortality. Bring then the gods hither, O (Agni), rich in food.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वि॒श्वज॑न्ये॒ आ भा॑ति दे॒वी अ॒मृते॒ अमू॑रः क्षय॒न्वाजैः॑ पुरुश्च॒न्द्रो नमो॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: agnír dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ viśvájanye ā́ bhāti devī́ amŕ̥te ámūraḥ kṣáyan vā́jaiḥ puruścandró námobhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, infallible, lights Earth and Heaven, immortal Goddesses gracious to all men,– Lord through his strength, splendid through adorations.

translations.griffith: Agni, infallible, lights Earth and Heaven, immortal Goddesses gracious to all men,– Lord through his strength, splendid through adorations.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, the wise, shines on Heaven and Earth, the two immortal goddesses who encompass all people—he who rules through his strength, and who is full of light through adoration.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्न॒ इन्द्र॑श्च दा॒शुषो॑ दुरो॒णे सु॒ताव॑तो य॒ज्ञमि॒होप॑ यातम् अम॑र्धन्ता सोम॒पेया॑य देवा
stanzas.transliteration: ágna índraś ca dāśúṣo duroṇé sutā́vato yajñám ihópa yātam ámardhantā somapéyāya devā
stanzas.translation: Come to the sacrifice, Agni and Indra come to the offerer's house who hath the Soma. Come, friendly-minded, Gods, to drink the Soma.

translations.griffith: Come to the sacrifice, Agni and Indra come to the offerer's house who hath the Soma. Come, friendly-minded, Gods, to drink the Soma.
translations.oldenberg: Agni and Indra, come hither to the sacrifice in the house of the worshipper rich in pressed (Soma), never failing, ye two gods, at the drink of Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ अ॒पां समि॑ध्यसे दुरो॒णे नित्यः॑ सूनो सहसो जातवेदः स॒धस्था॑नि म॒हय॑मान ऊ॒ती
stanzas.transliteration: ágne apā́ṃ sám idhyase duroṇé nítyaḥ sūno sahaso jātavedaḥ sadhásthāni maháyamāna ūtī́
stanzas.translation: In the floods' home art thou enkindled, Agni, O Jâtavedas, Son of Strength, eternal, Exalting with thine help the gatheringplaces.

translations.griffith: In the floods' home art thou enkindled, Agni, O Jâtavedas, Son of Strength, eternal, Exalting with thine help the gatheringplaces.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, thou art kindled in the house of the waters, (our) own (god), O son of strength, Gâtavedas, who exaltest the abodes (in which thou dwellest) by thy blessing.

stanzas.sanskrit: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रं मन॑सा॒ग्निं नि॒चाय्या॑ ह॒विष्म॑न्तो अनुष॒त्यं स्व॒र्विद॑म् सु॒दानुं॑ दे॒वं र॑थि॒रं व॑सू॒यवो॑ गी॒र्भी र॒ण्वं कु॑शि॒कासो॑ हवामहे
stanzas.transliteration: vaiśvānarám mánasāgníṃ nicā́yyā havíṣmanto anuṣatyáṃ svarvídam sudā́nuṃ deváṃ rathiráṃ vasūyávo gīrbhī́ raṇváṃ kuśikā́so havāmahe
stanzas.translation: REVERING in our heart Agni Vaiṣvânara, the finder of the light, whose promises are true, The liberal, gladsome, car-borne God we Kuṣikas invoke him with oblation, seeking wealth with songs.

translations.griffith: REVERING in our heart Agni Vaiṣvânara, the finder of the light, whose promises are true, The liberal, gladsome, car-borne God we Kuṣikas invoke him with oblation, seeking wealth with songs.
translations.oldenberg: With our offerings revering in our mind Agni Vaisvânara, the follower of truth, the finder of the sun—we, the Kusikas 1, desirous of goods, call with our prayers the god who gives rain, the charioteer, the, cheerful.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं शु॒भ्रम॒ग्निमव॑से हवामहे वैश्वान॒रं मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑नमु॒क्थ्य॑म् बृह॒स्पतिं॒ मनु॑षो दे॒वता॑तये॒ विप्रं॒ श्रोता॑र॒मति॑थिं रघु॒ष्यद॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ śubhrám agním ávase havāmahe vaiśvānarám mātaríśvānam ukthyàm bŕ̥haspátim mánuṣo devátātaye vípraṃ śrótāram átithiṃ raghuṣyádam
stanzas.translation: That Agni, bright, Vaiṣvânara, we invoke for help, and Mâtariṣvan worthy of the song of praise; Br̥ihaspati for man's observance of the Gods, the Singer prompt to hear, the swiftly-moving guest.

translations.griffith: That Agni, bright, Vaiṣvânara, we invoke for help, and Mâtariṣvan worthy of the song of praise; Br̥ihaspati for man's observance of the Gods, the Singer prompt to hear, the swiftly-moving guest.
translations.oldenberg: We call that beautiful Agni to help us, Vaisvânara, Mâtarisvan the praiseworthy 1; we the men (call) Brihaspati 2 for (the worship) of the divine host, the priest who hears us, the. guest who swiftly glides along.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्वो॒ न क्रन्द॒ञ्जनि॑भिः॒ समि॑ध्यते वैश्वान॒रः कु॑शि॒केभि॑र्यु॒गेयु॑गे स नो॑ अ॒ग्निः सु॒वीर्यं॒ स्वश्व्यं॒ दधा॑तु॒ रत्न॑म॒मृते॑षु॒ जागृ॑विः
stanzas.transliteration: áśvo ná krándañ jánibhiḥ sám idhyate vaiśvānaráḥ kuśikébhir yugé-yuge sá no agníḥ suvī́ryaṃ sváśvyaṃ dádhātu rátnam amŕ̥teṣu jā́gr̥viḥ
stanzas.translation: Age after age Vaiṣvânara, neighing like a horse, is kindled with the women by the Kuṣikas. May Agni, he who wakes among Immortal Gods, grant us heroic strength and wealth in noble steeds.

translations.griffith: Age after age Vaiṣvânara, neighing like a horse, is kindled with the women by the Kuṣikas. May Agni, he who wakes among Immortal Gods, grant us heroic strength and wealth in noble steeds.
translations.oldenberg: Vaisvânara, neighing like a horse, is kindled by the women 1, by the Kusikas, from age to age; may this Agni give us abundance in valiant men and in horses and treasures, he who wakes among the immortals.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र य॑न्तु॒ वाजा॒स्तवि॑षीभिर॒ग्नयः॑ शु॒भे सम्मि॑श्लाः॒ पृष॑तीरयुक्षत बृ॒ह॒दुक्षो॑ म॒रुतो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दसः॒ प्र वे॑पयन्ति॒ पर्व॑ताँ॒ अदा॑भ्याः
stanzas.transliteration: prá yantu vā́jās táviṣībhir agnáyaḥ śubhé sámmiślāḥ pŕ̥ṣatīr ayukṣata br̥hadúkṣo marúto viśvávedasaḥ prá vepayanti párvatām̐ ádābhyāḥ
stanzas.translation: Let them go forth, the strong, as flames of fire with might. Gathered for victory they have yoked their spotted deer. Pourers of floods, the Maruts, Masters of all wealth, they who can ne'er be conquered, make the mountains shake.

translations.griffith: Let them go forth, the strong, as flames of fire with might. Gathered for victory they have yoked their spotted deer. Pourers of floods, the Maruts, Masters of all wealth, they who can ne'er be conquered, make the mountains shake.
translations.oldenberg: May the Vâgas 1 come forward, the Agnis with their powers. United 2 they have harnessed the spotted deer for their triumphal procession 3. The Maruts, mightily growing, the all-wealthy, make the mountains tremble, the unbeguiled ones.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्नि॒श्रियो॑ म॒रुतो॑ वि॒श्वकृ॑ष्टय॒ आ त्वे॒षमु॒ग्रमव॑ ईमहे व॒यम् ते स्वा॒निनो॑ रु॒द्रिया॑ व॒र्षनि॑र्णिजः सिं॒हा न हे॒षक्र॑तवः सु॒दान॑वः
stanzas.transliteration: agniśríyo marúto viśvákr̥ṣṭayaḥ- ā́ tveṣám ugrám áva īmahe vayám té svāníno rudríyā varṣánirṇijaḥ siṃhā́ ná heṣákratavaḥ sudā́navaḥ
stanzas.translation: The Maruts, Friends of men, are glorious as the fire: their mighty and resplendent succour we implore. Those storming Sons of Rudra clothed in robes of rain, boon-givers of good gifts, roar as the lions roar.

translations.griffith: The Maruts, Friends of men, are glorious as the fire: their mighty and resplendent succour we implore. Those storming Sons of Rudra clothed in robes of rain, boon-givers of good gifts, roar as the lions roar.
translations.oldenberg: The Maruts who possess the beauty of Agni 1, belong to all races of men. We implore their fierce, strong help. They are tumultuous, the sons of Rudra, clothed in rain, hot-spirited like lions 2, givers of rain.

stanzas.sanskrit: व्रातं॑व्रातं ग॒णंग॑णं सुश॒स्तिभि॑र॒ग्नेर्भामं॑ म॒रुता॒मोज॑ ईमहे पृष॑दश्वासो अनव॒भ्ररा॑धसो॒ गन्ता॑रो य॒ज्ञं वि॒दथे॑षु॒ धीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vrā́taṃ-vrātaṃ gaṇáṃ-gaṇaṃ suśastíbhir agnér bhā́mam marútām ója īmahe pŕ̥ṣadaśvāso anavabhrárādhasaḥ- gántāro yajñáṃ vidátheṣu dhī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: We, band on band and troop following troop, entreat with fair lauds Agni's splendour and the Maruts' might, With spotted deer for steeds, with wealth that never fails, they, wise Ones, come to sacrifice at our gatherings.

translations.griffith: We, band on band and troop following troop, entreat with fair lauds Agni's splendour and the Maruts' might, With spotted deer for steeds, with wealth that never fails, they, wise Ones, come to sacrifice at our gatherings.
translations.oldenberg: We implore with our best praises every host, every troop (of the Maruts) 1, the splendour of Agni, the power of the Maruts. With the spotted deer as horses 2, with gifts that cannot be taken away, they go to the sacrifice wise in the (sacrificial) ordinances 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर॑स्मि॒ जन्म॑ना जा॒तवे॑दा घृ॒तं मे॒ चक्षु॑र॒मृतं॑ म आ॒सन् अ॒र्कस्त्रि॒धातू॒ रज॑सो वि॒मानोऽज॑स्रो घ॒र्मो ह॒विर॑स्मि॒ नाम॑
stanzas.transliteration: agnír asmi jánmanā jātávedāḥ- ghr̥tám me cákṣur amŕ̥tam ma āsán arkás tridhā́tū rájaso vimā́naḥ- -ájasro gharmó havír asmi nā́ma
stanzas.translation: Agni am I who know, by birth, all creatures. Mine eye is butter, in my mouth is nectar. I am light threefold, measurer of the region exhaustless heat am I, named burnt-oblation.

translations.griffith: Agni am I who know, by birth, all creatures. Mine eye is butter, in my mouth is nectar. I am light threefold, measurer of the region exhaustless heat am I, named burnt-oblation.
translations.oldenberg: Agni am I, by birth Gâtavedas. Ghee is my eye; (the drink of) immortality is in my mouth. The threefold song 1 traversing the aerial space, the imperishable Gharma 2, the sacrificial food am I by name.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रि॒भिः प॒वित्रै॒रपु॑पो॒द्ध्य१॒॑र्कं हृ॒दा म॒तिं ज्योति॒रनु॑ प्रजा॒नन् वर्षि॑ष्ठं॒ रत्न॑मकृत स्व॒धाभि॒रादिद्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी पर्य॑पश्यत्
stanzas.transliteration: tribhíḥ pavítrair ápupod dhy àrkáṃ hr̥dā́ matíṃ jyótir ánu prajānán várṣiṣṭhaṃ rátnam akr̥ta svadhā́bhir ā́d íd dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ páry apaśyat
stanzas.translation: Bearing in mind a thought with light accordant, he purified the Sun with three refinings; By his own nature gained the highest treasure, and looked abroad over the earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: Bearing in mind a thought with light accordant, he purified the Sun with three refinings; By his own nature gained the highest treasure, and looked abroad over the earth and heaven.
translations.oldenberg: With three purifying strainers he (Agni) purified the song, with his heart the thought, discovering the light. The mightiest treasure he produced by the powers of his own nature, and then he looked over heaven and earth.

stanzas.sanskrit: श॒तधा॑र॒मुत्स॒मक्षी॑यमाणं विप॒श्चितं॑ पि॒तरं॒ वक्त्वा॑नाम् मे॒ळिं मद॑न्तं पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थे॒ तं रो॑दसी पिपृतं सत्य॒वाच॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: śatádhāram útsam ákṣīyamāṇaṃ vipaścítam pitáraṃ váktvānām meḷím mádantam pitrór upásthe táṃ rodasī pipr̥taṃ satyavā́cam
stanzas.translation: The Spring that fails not with a hundred streamlets, Father inspired of' prayers that men should utter, The Sparkler, joyous in his Parents' bosorn, -him, the Truth-speaker, sate ye, Earth and Heaven.

translations.griffith: The Spring that fails not with a hundred streamlets, Father inspired of' prayers that men should utter, The Sparkler, joyous in his Parents' bosorn, -him, the Truth-speaker, sate ye, Earth and Heaven.
translations.oldenberg: Carry him who is the inexhaustible spring with a hundred rills, who has knowledge of prayers (?), the father of (every speech) that should be uttered, the roaring one 1, gladly excited in the lap of his parents—carry him the truth-speaking across (all dangers), O ye two worlds!

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वो॒ वाजा॑ अ॒भिद्य॑वो ह॒विष्म॑न्तो घृ॒ताच्या॑ दे॒वाञ्जि॑गाति सुम्न॒युः
stanzas.transliteration: prá vo vā́jā abhídyavo havíṣmanto ghr̥tā́cyā devā́ñ jigāti sumnayúḥ
stanzas.translation: IN ladle dropping oil your food goes in oblation up to heaven, Goes to the Gods in search of bliss.

translations.griffith: IN ladle dropping oil your food goes in oblation up to heaven, Goes to the Gods in search of bliss.
translations.oldenberg: Forward (goes) your 1 strength tending heavenward, rich in offerings, with the (ladle) full of ghee. To the gods goes (the worshipper) desirous of their favour.

stanzas.sanskrit: ईळे॑ अ॒ग्निं वि॑प॒श्चितं॑ गि॒रा य॒ज्ञस्य॒ साध॑नम् श्रु॒ष्टी॒वानं॑ धि॒तावा॑नम्
stanzas.transliteration: ī́ḷe agníṃ vipaścítaṃ girā́ yajñásya sā́dhanam śruṣṭīvā́naṃ dhitā́vānam
stanzas.translation: Agni I laud, the Sage inspired, crowner of sacrifice through song, Who listens and gives bounteous gifts.

translations.griffith: Agni I laud, the Sage inspired, crowner of sacrifice through song, Who listens and gives bounteous gifts.
translations.oldenberg: I magnify 1 with prayer Agni who has knowledge of prayers (?), the accomplisher of sacrifice, who hears us, and in whom (manifold wealth) has been laid down.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ श॒केम॑ ते व॒यं यमं॑ दे॒वस्य॑ वा॒जिनः॑ अति॒ द्वेषां॑सि तरेम
stanzas.transliteration: ágne śakéma te vayáṃ yámaṃ devásya vājínaḥ áti dvéṣāṃsi tarema
stanzas.translation: O Agni, if we might obtain control of thee the potent God, Then should we overcome our foes.

translations.griffith: O Agni, if we might obtain control of thee the potent God, Then should we overcome our foes.
translations.oldenberg: O Agni, may we be able to bridle thee the strong god 1; may we overcome (all) hostile powers.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मि॒ध्यमा॑नो अध्व॒रे॒३॒॑ऽग्निः पा॑व॒क ईड्यः॑ शो॒चिष्के॑श॒स्तमी॑महे
stanzas.transliteration: samidhyámāno adhvaré- -agníḥ pāvaká ī́ḍyaḥ śocíṣkeśas tám īmahe
stanzas.translation: Kindled at sacrifices he is Agni, hallower, meet for praise, With flame for hair: to him we seek.

translations.griffith: Kindled at sacrifices he is Agni, hallower, meet for praise, With flame for hair: to him we seek.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, inflamed at the sacrifice, the purifier who should be magnified, whose hair is flame—him we approach (with prayers).

stanzas.sanskrit: पृ॒थु॒पाजा॒ अम॑र्त्यो घृ॒तनि॑र्णि॒क्स्वा॑हुतः अ॒ग्निर्य॒ज्ञस्य॑ हव्य॒वाट्
stanzas.transliteration: pr̥thupā́jā ámartyo ghr̥tánirṇik svā̀hutaḥ agnír yajñásya havyavā́ṭ
stanzas.translation: Immortal Agni, shining far, enrobed with oil, well worshipped, bears The gifts of sacrifice away.

translations.griffith: Immortal Agni, shining far, enrobed with oil, well worshipped, bears The gifts of sacrifice away.
translations.oldenberg: With his broad stream of light the immortal Agni, clothed in ghee, well served with oblations, is the carrier of offerings at the sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं स॒बाधो॑ य॒तस्रु॑च इ॒त्था धि॒या य॒ज्ञव॑न्तः आ च॑क्रुर॒ग्निमू॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ sabā́dho yatásrucaḥ- itthā́ dhiyā́ yajñávantaḥ ā́ cakrur agním ūtáye
stanzas.translation: The priests with ladles lifted up, worshipping here with holy thought, Have brought this Agni for our aid.

translations.griffith: The priests with ladles lifted up, worshipping here with holy thought, Have brought this Agni for our aid.
translations.oldenberg: Holding the (sacrificial) ladles, performing the sacrifice they have with right thought pressingly brought Agni hither 1 for help.

stanzas.sanskrit: होता॑ दे॒वो अम॑र्त्यः पु॒रस्ता॑देति मा॒यया॑ वि॒दथा॑नि प्रचो॒दय॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: hótā devó ámartyaḥ purástād eti māyáyā vidáthāni pracodáyan
stanzas.translation: Immortal, Sacrificer, God, with wondrous power he leads the way, Urging the great assembly on.

translations.griffith: Immortal, Sacrificer, God, with wondrous power he leads the way, Urging the great assembly on.
translations.oldenberg: The Hotri, the immortal god goes in front with his secret power 1, instigating the sacrifices 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: वा॒जी वाजे॑षु धीयतेऽध्व॒रेषु॒ प्र णी॑यते विप्रो॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॒ साध॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: vājī́ vā́jeṣu dhīyate -adhvaréṣu prá ṇīyate vípro yajñásya sā́dhanaḥ
stanzas.translation: Strong, he is set on deeds ofstrength. In sacrifices led in front, As Singer he completes the rite.

translations.griffith: Strong, he is set on deeds ofstrength. In sacrifices led in front, As Singer he completes the rite.
translations.oldenberg: The strong (horse, i. e. Agni) is set at the races. He is led forth at the sacrifices, the priest, the accomplisher of sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: धि॒या च॑क्रे॒ वरे॑ण्यो भू॒तानां॒ गर्भ॒मा द॑धे दक्ष॑स्य पि॒तरं॒ तना॑
stanzas.transliteration: dhiyā́ cakre váreṇyo bhūtā́nāṃ gárbham ā́ dadhe dákṣasya pitáraṃ tánā
stanzas.translation: Excellent, he was made by thought. The Germ of beings have I gained, Yea, and die Sire of active strength.

translations.griffith: Excellent, he was made by thought. The Germ of beings have I gained, Yea, and die Sire of active strength.
translations.oldenberg: He has been produced 1 by prayer, the excellent one. I have established 2 him, the germ of beings, for ever the father of Daksha 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि त्वा॑ दधे॒ वरे॑ण्यं॒ दक्ष॑स्ये॒ळा स॑हस्कृत अग्ने॑ सुदी॒तिमु॒शिज॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ní tvā dadhe váreṇyaṃ dákṣasyeḷā́ sahaskr̥ta ágne sudītím uśíjam
stanzas.translation: Thee have I stablished, Excellent, O strengthened by the sage's prayer, Thee, Agni, longing, nobly bright.

translations.griffith: Thee have I stablished, Excellent, O strengthened by the sage's prayer, Thee, Agni, longing, nobly bright.
translations.oldenberg: I have laid thee down 1, the excellent one, with the nourishment 2 of Daksha, O thou who art produced by power, O Agni, thee the resplendent one, O Usig 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं य॒न्तुर॑म॒प्तुर॑मृ॒तस्य॒ योगे॑ व॒नुषः॑ विप्रा॒ वाजैः॒ समि॑न्धते
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ yantúram aptúram r̥tásya yóge vanúṣaḥ víprā vā́jaiḥ sám indhate
stanzas.translation: Agni, the swift and active One, singers, at time of sacrifice, Eagerly kindle with their food.

translations.griffith: Agni, the swift and active One, singers, at time of sacrifice, Eagerly kindle with their food.
translations.oldenberg: The priests, eager to set to work the Rita 1, kindle with quick strength Agni the governor 2, him who crosses the waters 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊ॒र्जो नपा॑तमध्व॒रे दी॑दि॒वांस॒मुप॒ द्यवि॑ अ॒ग्निमी॑ळे क॒विक्र॑तुम्
stanzas.transliteration: ūrjó nápātam adhvaré dīdivā́ṃsam úpa dyávi agním īḷe kavíkratum
stanzas.translation: Agni the Son of Strength who shines up to the heaven in solemn rites, The wise of heart, I glorify.

translations.griffith: Agni the Son of Strength who shines up to the heaven in solemn rites, The wise of heart, I glorify.
translations.oldenberg: I magnify 1 the child of vigour at this sacrifice, who shines under the heaven, the thoughtful Agni.

stanzas.sanskrit: ई॒ळेन्यो॑ नम॒स्य॑स्ति॒रस्तमां॑सि दर्श॒तः सम॒ग्निरि॑ध्यते॒ वृषा॑
stanzas.transliteration: īḷényo namasyàs tirás támāṃsi darśatáḥ sám agnír idhyate vŕ̥ṣā
stanzas.translation: Meet to be lauded and adored, showing in beauty through the dark, Agni, the Strong, is kindled well.

translations.griffith: Meet to be lauded and adored, showing in beauty through the dark, Agni, the Strong, is kindled well.
translations.oldenberg: He who should be magnified and adored, who is visible through the darkness, Agni, the manly, is kindled 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषो॑ अ॒ग्निः समि॑ध्य॒तेऽश्वो॒ न दे॑व॒वाह॑नः तं ह॒विष्म॑न्त ईळते
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣo agníḥ sám idhyate- -áśvo ná devavā́hanaḥ táṃ havíṣmanta īḷate
stanzas.translation: Agni is kindled as a bull, like a horsebearer of the Gods: Men with oblations worship him.

translations.griffith: Agni is kindled as a bull, like a horsebearer of the Gods: Men with oblations worship him.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, the manly, is kindled, he who draws hither the gods like a horse. The (worshippers) rich in offerings magnify him.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृष॑णं त्वा व॒यं वृ॑ष॒न्वृष॑णः॒ समि॑धीमहि अग्ने॒ दीद्य॑तं बृ॒हत्
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ tvā vayáṃ vr̥ṣan vŕ̥ṣaṇaḥ sám idhīmahi ágne dī́dyatam br̥hát
stanzas.translation: Thee will we kindle as a bull, we who are Bulls ourselves, O Bull. Thee, Agni, shining mightily.

translations.griffith: Thee will we kindle as a bull, we who are Bulls ourselves, O Bull. Thee, Agni, shining mightily.
translations.oldenberg: We the manly ones will kindle thee the manly (god), O manly Agni who shinest mightily.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ जु॒षस्व॑ नो ह॒विः पु॑रो॒ळाशं॑ जातवेदः प्रा॒तः॒सा॒वे धि॑यावसो
stanzas.transliteration: ágne juṣásva no havíḥ puroḷā́śaṃ jātavedaḥ prātaḥsāvé dhiyāvaso
stanzas.translation: AGNI who knowest all, accept our offering and the cake of meal, At dawn's libation, rich in prayer!

translations.griffith: AGNI who knowest all, accept our offering and the cake of meal, At dawn's libation, rich in prayer!
translations.oldenberg: O Agni Gâtavedas, accept graciously our offering, the sacrificial cake at the morning libation, O god who givest wealth for our prayers.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रो॒ळा अ॑ग्ने पच॒तस्तुभ्यं॑ वा घा॒ परि॑ष्कृतः तं जु॑षस्व यविष्ठ्य
stanzas.transliteration: puroḷā́ agne pacatás túbhyaṃ vā ghā páriṣkr̥taḥ táṃ juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
stanzas.translation: Agni, the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee: Accept it, O Most Youthful God.

translations.griffith: Agni, the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee: Accept it, O Most Youthful God.
translations.oldenberg: The sacrificial cake, O Agni, has been baked or made ready for thee: accept it graciously, O youngest (god).

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ वी॒हि पु॑रो॒ळाश॒माहु॑तं ति॒रोअ॑ह्न्यम् सह॑सः सू॒नुर॑स्यध्व॒रे हि॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: ágne vīhí puroḷā́śam ā́hutaṃ tiróahnyam sáhasaḥ sūnúr asy adhvaré hitáḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old: Thou, Son of Strength, art stablished at our sacrifice.

translations.griffith: Agni, enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old: Thou, Son of Strength, art stablished at our sacrifice.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, accept eagerly the sacrificial cake which has been offered, which has stood overnight. Thou art the son of strength, established at the sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: माध्यं॑दिने॒ सव॑ने जातवेदः पुरो॒ळाश॑मि॒ह क॑वे जुषस्व अग्ने॑ य॒ह्वस्य॒ तव॑ भाग॒धेयं॒ न प्र मि॑नन्ति वि॒दथे॑षु॒ धीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mā́dhyaṃdine sávane jātavedaḥ puroḷā́śam ihá kave juṣasva ágne yahvásya táva bhāgadhéyaṃ ná prá minanti vidátheṣu dhī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake, wise, Jâtavedas! Agni, the sages in assemblies never minish the portion due to thee the Mighty.

translations.griffith: Here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake, wise, Jâtavedas! Agni, the sages in assemblies never minish the portion due to thee the Mighty.
translations.oldenberg: At the midday libation, Gâtavedas, accept here graciously the sacrificial cake, O sage. Agni, the wise ones do not diminish at the sacrificial distributions 1 the portion which belongs to thee, the vigorous one 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ तृ॒तीये॒ सव॑ने॒ हि कानि॑षः पुरो॒ळाशं॑ सहसः सून॒वाहु॑तम् अथा॑ दे॒वेष्व॑ध्व॒रं वि॑प॒न्यया॒ धा रत्न॑वन्तम॒मृते॑षु॒ जागृ॑विम्
stanzas.transliteration: ágne tr̥tī́ye sávane hí kā́niṣaḥ puroḷā́śaṃ sahasaḥ sūnav ā́hutam áthā devéṣv adhvaráṃ vipanyáyā dhā́ rátnavantam amŕ̥teṣu jā́gr̥vim
stanzas.translation: O Agni, at the third libation takewith joy the offered cake of sacrifice, thou, Son of Strength. Through skill in song bear to the Gods our sacrifice, watchful and fraught with riches, to Immortal God.

translations.griffith: O Agni, at the third libation takewith joy the offered cake of sacrifice, thou, Son of Strength. Through skill in song bear to the Gods our sacrifice, watchful and fraught with riches, to Immortal God.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, at the third libation take joyfully the sacrificial cake, O son of strength, which has been offered. And in thy admirable way place our wakeful sacrifice, blessed with treasures, before the immortal gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ वृधा॒न आहु॑तिं पुरो॒ळाशं॑ जातवेदः जु॒षस्व॑ ति॒रोअ॑ह्न्यम्
stanzas.transliteration: ágne vr̥dhāná ā́hutim puroḷā́śaṃ jātavedaḥ juṣásva tiróahnyam
stanzas.translation: O waxing Agni, knower, thou, of all, accept our gifts, the cake, And that prepared ere yesterday.

translations.griffith: O waxing Agni, knower, thou, of all, accept our gifts, the cake, And that prepared ere yesterday.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, grown strong, O Gâtavedas, accept graciously our offering, the sacrificial cake which has stood overnight.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्ती॒दम॑धि॒मन्थ॑न॒मस्ति॑ प्र॒जन॑नं कृ॒तम् ए॒तां वि॒श्पत्नी॒मा भ॑रा॒ग्निं म॑न्थाम पू॒र्वथा॑
stanzas.transliteration: ástīdám adhimánthanam ásti prajánanaṃ kr̥tám etā́ṃ viśpátnīm ā́ bhara- -agním manthāma pūrváthā
stanzas.translation: HERE is the gear for friction, here tinder made ready for the spark. Bring thou the Matron: we will rub Agni in ancient fashion forth.

translations.griffith: HERE is the gear for friction, here tinder made ready for the spark. Bring thou the Matron: we will rub Agni in ancient fashion forth.
translations.oldenberg: 1 This is the support on which the rubbing (for producing the fire) is performed 2; the creative organ 3 has been prepared. Bring hither the house-wife 4; let us produce Agni by rubbing in the old way.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒रण्यो॒र्निहि॑तो जा॒तवे॑दा॒ गर्भ॑ इव॒ सुधि॑तो ग॒र्भिणी॑षु दि॒वेदि॑व॒ ईड्यो॑ जागृ॒वद्भि॑र्ह॒विष्म॑द्भिर्मनु॒ष्ये॑भिर॒ग्निः
stanzas.transliteration: aráṇyor níhito jātávedāḥ- gárbha iva súdhito garbhíṇīṣu divé-diva ī́ḍyo jāgr̥vádbhir havíṣmadbhir manuṣyèbhir agníḥ
stanzas.translation: In the two fire-sticks Jâtavedas lieth, even as the well-set germ in pregnant women, Agni who day by day must be exalted by men who watch and worship with oblations.

translations.griffith: In the two fire-sticks Jâtavedas lieth, even as the well-set germ in pregnant women, Agni who day by day must be exalted by men who watch and worship with oblations.
translations.oldenberg: In the two fire-sticks dwells Gâtavedas, as the germ (lies) safe in pregnant women—Agni who should be magnified 1 day by day by wakeful men who bring offerings.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त्ता॒नाया॒मव॑ भरा चिकि॒त्वान्त्स॒द्यः प्रवी॑ता॒ वृष॑णं जजान अ॒रु॒षस्तू॑पो॒ रुश॑दस्य॒ पाज॒ इळा॑यास्पु॒त्रो व॒युने॑ऽजनिष्ट
stanzas.transliteration: uttānā́yām áva bharā cikitvā́n sadyáḥ právītā vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ jajāna aruṣástūpo rúśad asya pā́jaḥ- íḷāyās putró vayúne 'janiṣṭa
stanzas.translation: Lay this with care on that which lies extended: straight hath she borne the Steerwhen made prolific. With his red pillar-radiant is his splendour -in our skilled task is born the Son of Iḷâ.

translations.griffith: Lay this with care on that which lies extended: straight hath she borne the Steerwhen made prolific. With his red pillar-radiant is his splendour -in our skilled task is born the Son of Iḷâ.
translations.oldenberg: Place it 1 skilfully into her who lies extended 2. Having conceived she has quickly given birth to the manly one. He whose summit is red—bright is his splendour—the son of Ilâ has been born in the (due) way 3.

stanzas.sanskrit: इळा॑यास्त्वा प॒दे व॒यं नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्या अधि॑ जात॑वेदो॒ नि धी॑म॒ह्यग्ने॑ ह॒व्याय॒ वोळ्ह॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: íḷāyās tvā padé vayáṃ nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ ádhi jā́tavedo ní dhīmahi- -ágne havyā́ya vóḷhave
stanzas.translation: In Iḷâ's place we set thee down, upon the central point of earth, That, Agni Jâtavedas, thou mayst bear our offerings to the Gods.

translations.griffith: In Iḷâ's place we set thee down, upon the central point of earth, That, Agni Jâtavedas, thou mayst bear our offerings to the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: In the place of Ilâ, on the navel of the earth we will lay thee down, Gâtavedas, that thou, O Agni, mayst carry the offerings (to the gods).

stanzas.sanskrit: मन्थ॑ता नरः क॒विमद्व॑यन्तं॒ प्रचे॑तसम॒मृतं॑ सु॒प्रती॑कम् य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुं प्र॑थ॒मं पु॒रस्ता॑द॒ग्निं न॑रो जनयता सु॒शेव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: mánthatā naraḥ kavím ádvayantam prácetasam amŕ̥taṃ suprátīkam yajñásya ketúm prathamám purástād agníṃ naro janayatā suśévam
stanzas.translation: Rub into life, ye men, the Sage, the guileless, Immortal, very wise and fair to look on. O men, bring forth the most propitious Agni, first ensign of the sacrifice to eastward.

translations.griffith: Rub into life, ye men, the Sage, the guileless, Immortal, very wise and fair to look on. O men, bring forth the most propitious Agni, first ensign of the sacrifice to eastward.
translations.oldenberg: Rub, ye men, the truthful sage, the wise, the immortal, the fair-faced. Bring forth, ye men, Agni, the banner of sacrifice, the first in the front, the gracious one.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदी॒ मन्थ॑न्ति बा॒हुभि॒र्वि रो॑च॒तेऽश्वो॒ न वा॒ज्य॑रु॒षो वने॒ष्वा चि॒त्रो न याम॑न्न॒श्विनो॒रनि॑वृतः॒ परि॑ वृण॒क्त्यश्म॑न॒स्तृणा॒ दह॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: yádī mánthanti bāhúbhir ví rocate- -áśvo ná vājy àruṣó váneṣv ā́ citró ná yā́mann aśvínor ánivr̥taḥ pári vr̥ṇakty áśmanas tŕ̥ṇā dáhan
stanzas.translation: When with their arms they rub him straight he shineth forth like a strong courser, red in colour, in the wood. Bright, checkless, as it were upon the Atvins' path, lie passeth by the stones and burneth up the grass.

translations.griffith: When with their arms they rub him straight he shineth forth like a strong courser, red in colour, in the wood. Bright, checkless, as it were upon the Atvins' path, lie passeth by the stones and burneth up the grass.
translations.oldenberg: When they produce him by rubbing with their arms, he shines forth laming in the wood like a red race-horse. Like the bright one on the path of the Asvins 1 the unrestrained (Agni) spares the stones, burning the grass 2.

stanzas.sanskrit: जा॒तो अ॒ग्नी रो॑चते॒ चेकि॑तानो वा॒जी विप्रः॑ कविश॒स्तः सु॒दानुः॑ यं दे॒वास॒ ईड्यं॑ विश्व॒विदं॑ हव्य॒वाह॒मद॑धुरध्व॒रेषु॑
stanzas.transliteration: jātó agnī́ rocate cékitāno vājī́ vípraḥ kaviśastáḥ sudā́nuḥ yáṃ devā́sa ī́ḍyaṃ viśvavídaṃ havyavā́ham ádadhur adhvaréṣu
stanzas.translation: Agni shines forth when born, observant, mighty, the bountiful, the Singar praised by sages; Whom, as adorable and knowing all things, Gods set at solemn rites as offeringbearer.

translations.griffith: Agni shines forth when born, observant, mighty, the bountiful, the Singar praised by sages; Whom, as adorable and knowing all things, Gods set at solemn rites as offeringbearer.
translations.oldenberg: Agni, when born, shines forth resplendent, the racer, the priest, praised by the sages, the giver of rain, whom the gods placed in the sacrifices, to be magnified, as the omniscient carrier of the sacrificial offerings.

stanzas.sanskrit: सीद॑ होतः॒ स्व उ॑ लो॒के चि॑कि॒त्वान्त्सा॒दया॑ य॒ज्ञं सु॑कृ॒तस्य॒ योनौ॑ दे॒वा॒वीर्दे॒वान्ह॒विषा॑ यजा॒स्यग्ने॑ बृ॒हद्यज॑माने॒ वयो॑ धाः
stanzas.transliteration: sī́da hotaḥ svá u loké cikitvā́n sādáyā yajñáṃ sukr̥tásya yónau devāvī́r devā́n havíṣā yajāsi- ágne br̥hád yájamāne váyo dhāḥ
stanzas.translation: Set thee, O Priest, in, thine own place, observant: lay down the sacrifice in the home of worship. Thou, dear to Gods, shalt serve them with oblation: Agni, give long life to the sacrificer.

translations.griffith: Set thee, O Priest, in, thine own place, observant: lay down the sacrifice in the home of worship. Thou, dear to Gods, shalt serve them with oblation: Agni, give long life to the sacrificer.
translations.oldenberg: Sit down, O Hotri, in the space which is thine, as the knowing one. Place the sacrifice in the abode of good works (i. e. on the altar). Eagerly longing for the gods thou shalt worship the gods by offerings. Agni, bestow mighty vigour on the sacrificer.

stanzas.sanskrit: कृ॒णोत॑ धू॒मं वृष॑णं सखा॒योऽस्रे॑धन्त इतन॒ वाज॒मच्छ॑ अ॒यम॒ग्निः पृ॑तना॒षाट् सु॒वीरो॒ येन॑ दे॒वासो॒ अस॑हन्त॒ दस्यू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: kr̥ṇóta dhūmáṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ sakhāyaḥ- -ásredhanta itana vā́jam ácha ayám agníḥ pr̥tanāṣā́ṭ suvī́ro yéna devā́so ásahanta dásyūn
stanzas.translation: Raise ye a mighty smoke, my fellow-workers! Ye shall attain to wealth without obstruction. This Agni is the battle-winning Hero by whom the Gods have overcome the Dasyus.

translations.griffith: Raise ye a mighty smoke, my fellow-workers! Ye shall attain to wealth without obstruction. This Agni is the battle-winning Hero by whom the Gods have overcome the Dasyus.
translations.oldenberg: Produce a mighty 1 smoke, ye friends. Without fail go forward towards strength. This Agni is the conqueror in battles, rich in valiant men, he by whom the gods have overpowered the Dasyus.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं ते॒ योनि॑र्ऋ॒त्वियो॒ यतो॑ जा॒तो अरो॑चथाः तं जा॒नन्न॑ग्न॒ आ सी॒दाथा॑ नो वर्धया॒ गिरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ te yónir r̥tvíyo yáto jātó árocathāḥ táṃ jānánn agna ā́ sīda- -áthā no vardhayā gíraḥ
stanzas.translation: This is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shonest forth. Knowing this, Agni, sit thee down, and prosper thou the songs we sing.

translations.griffith: This is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shonest forth. Knowing this, Agni, sit thee down, and prosper thou the songs we sing.
translations.oldenberg: This is thy birth-place in due time whence born thou shonest forth; knowing it, O Agni, sit down on it, and make our prayers prosper.

stanzas.sanskrit: तनू॒नपा॑दुच्यते॒ गर्भ॑ आसु॒रो नरा॒शंसो॑ भवति॒ यद्वि॒जाय॑ते मा॒त॒रिश्वा॒ यदमि॑मीत मा॒तरि॒ वात॑स्य॒ सर्गो॑ अभव॒त्सरी॑मणि
stanzas.transliteration: tánūnápād ucyate gárbha āsuró nárāśáṃso bhavati yád vijā́yate mātaríśvā yád ámimīta mātári vā́tasya sárgo abhavat sárīmaṇi
stanzas.translation: As Germ Celestial he is called Tanûnapât, and Narâṣansa born diffused in varied shape. Formed in his Mother he is Mâtariṣvan; he hath, in his course, become the rapid flight of wind.

translations.griffith: As Germ Celestial he is called Tanûnapât, and Narâṣansa born diffused in varied shape. Formed in his Mother he is Mâtariṣvan; he hath, in his course, become the rapid flight of wind.
translations.oldenberg: He is called Tanûnapât as the Asura's germ. Narâsamsa he becomes when he is born, Mâtarisvan when he has been shaped in the mother 1. And he has become the rush of the wind in his swift course 2,

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒नि॒र्मथा॒ निर्म॑थितः सुनि॒धा निहि॑तः क॒विः अग्ने॑ स्वध्व॒रा कृ॑णु दे॒वान्दे॑वय॒ते य॑ज
stanzas.transliteration: sunirmáthā nírmathitaḥ sunidhā́ níhitaḥ kavíḥ ágne svadhvarā́ kr̥ṇu devā́n devayaté yaja
stanzas.translation: With strong attrition rubbed to life, laid down with careful hand, a Sage, Agni, make sacrifices good, and for the pious bring the Gods.

translations.griffith: With strong attrition rubbed to life, laid down with careful hand, a Sage, Agni, make sacrifices good, and for the pious bring the Gods.
translations.oldenberg: Rubbed forth by skilful rubbing, established by skilful establishing, as a sage, O Agni, perform excellent sacrifices. Sacrifice to the gods for him who is devoted to the gods 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अजी॑जनन्न॒मृतं॒ मर्त्या॑सोऽस्रे॒माणं॑ त॒रणिं॑ वी॒ळुज॑म्भम् दश॒ स्वसा॑रो अ॒ग्रुवः॑ समी॒चीः पुमां॑सं जा॒तम॒भि सं र॑भन्ते
stanzas.transliteration: ájījanann amŕ̥tam mártyāso -asremā́ṇaṃ taráṇiṃ vīḷújambham dáśa svásāro agrúvaḥ samīcī́ḥ púmāṃsaṃ jātám abhí sáṃ rabhante
stanzas.translation: Mortals have brought to life the God Immortal, the Conqueror with mighty jaws, unfailing. The sisters ten, unwedded and united, together grasp the Babe, the new-born Infant.

translations.griffith: Mortals have brought to life the God Immortal, the Conqueror with mighty jaws, unfailing. The sisters ten, unwedded and united, together grasp the Babe, the new-born Infant.
translations.oldenberg: The mortals have generated the immortal one, the … 1, advancing one with strong jaws. The ten unwedded sisters 2 united take care of the man (Agni) when he has been born.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र स॒प्तहो॑ता सन॒काद॑रोचत मा॒तुरु॒पस्थे॒ यदशो॑च॒दूध॑नि न नि मि॑षति सु॒रणो॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ यदसु॑रस्य ज॒ठरा॒दजा॑यत
stanzas.transliteration: prá saptáhotā sanakā́d arocata mātúr upásthe yád áśocad ū́dhani ná ní miṣati suráṇo divé-dive yád ásurasya jaṭhárād ájāyata
stanzas.translation: Served by the seven priests, he shone forth from ancient time, when in his Mother's bosom, in her lap, he glowed. Giving delight each day he closeth not his eye, since from the Asura's body hewas brought to life.

translations.griffith: Served by the seven priests, he shone forth from ancient time, when in his Mother's bosom, in her lap, he glowed. Giving delight each day he closeth not his eye, since from the Asura's body hewas brought to life.
translations.oldenberg: He the god of the seven Hotris shone forth from of old, when he flamed up in his mother's lap, at her udder. Day by day the joyous one never closes his eyes, when he has been born from the Asura's (i. e. of the Heaven's?) belly 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒मि॒त्रा॒युधो॑ म॒रुता॑मिव प्र॒याः प्र॑थम॒जा ब्रह्म॑णो॒ विश्व॒मिद्वि॑दुः द्यु॒म्नव॒द्ब्रह्म॑ कुशि॒कास॒ एरि॑र॒ एक॑एको॒ दमे॑ अ॒ग्निं समी॑धिरे
stanzas.transliteration: amitrāyúdho marútām iva prayā́ḥ prathamajā́ bráhmaṇo víśvam íd viduḥ dyumnávad bráhma kuśikā́sa érire- éka-eko dáme agníṃ sám īdhire
stanzas.translation: Even as the Maruts, onslaughts who attack the foe, those born the first of all knew the full power of prayer. The Kuṣikas have made the glorious hymn ascend, and, each one singly in his home, have kindled fire.

translations.griffith: Even as the Maruts, onslaughts who attack the foe, those born the first of all knew the full power of prayer. The Kuṣikas have made the glorious hymn ascend, and, each one singly in his home, have kindled fire.
translations.oldenberg: The onsets of (Agni) when he attacks his enemies, are like those of the Maruts. (He is) the first-born (son) of the sacred spell. They know every (fire) 1. The Kusikas have raised their brilliant spell; they have kindled Agni, every one in his house.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद॒द्य त्वा॑ प्रय॒ति य॒ज्ञे अ॒स्मिन्होत॑श्चिकि॒त्वोऽवृ॑णीमही॒ह ध्रु॒वम॑या ध्रु॒वमु॒ताश॑मिष्ठाः प्रजा॒नन्वि॒द्वाँ उप॑ याहि॒ सोम॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yád adyá tvā prayatí yajñé asmín hótaś cikitvó 'vr̥ṇīmahīhá dhruvám ayā dhruvám utā́śamiṣṭhāḥ prajānán vidvā́m̐ úpa yāhi sómam
stanzas.translation: As we, O Priest observant, have elected thee this day, what time the solemn sacrifice began, So surely hast thou worshipped, surely hast thou toiled: come thou unto the Soma, wise and knowing all.

translations.griffith: As we, O Priest observant, have elected thee this day, what time the solemn sacrifice began, So surely hast thou worshipped, surely hast thou toiled: come thou unto the Soma, wise and knowing all.
translations.oldenberg: After we had chosen thee here to-day, O wise Hotri, while this sacrifice was going on, thou hast firmly sacrificed and firmly laboured. Come to this Soma, expert and knowing!

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒च्छन्ति॑ त्वा सो॒म्यासः॒ सखा॑यः सु॒न्वन्ति॒ सोमं॒ दध॑ति॒ प्रयां॑सि तिति॑क्षन्ते अ॒भिश॑स्तिं॒ जना॑ना॒मिन्द्र॒ त्वदा कश्च॒न हि प्र॑के॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: ichánti tvā somyā́saḥ sákhāyaḥ sunvánti sómaṃ dádhati práyāṃsi títikṣante abhíśastiṃ jánānām índra tvád ā́ káś caná hí praketáḥ
stanzas.translation: THE friends who offer Soma long to find thee: they pour forth Soma and present their viands. They bear unmoved the cursing of the people, for all our wisdom comes from thee, O Indra.

translations.griffith: THE friends who offer Soma long to find thee: they pour forth Soma and present their viands. They bear unmoved the cursing of the people, for all our wisdom comes from thee, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: न ते॑ दू॒रे प॑र॒मा चि॒द्रजां॒स्या तु प्र या॑हि हरिवो॒ हरि॑भ्याम् स्थि॒राय॒ वृष्णे॒ सव॑ना कृ॒तेमा यु॒क्ता ग्रावा॑णः समिधा॒ने अ॒ग्नौ
stanzas.transliteration: ná te dūré paramā́ cid rájāṃsi- ā́ tú prá yāhi harivo háribhyām sthirā́ya vŕ̥ṣṇe sávanā kr̥témā́ yuktā́ grā́vāṇaḥ samidhāné agnaú
stanzas.translation: Not far for thee are mid-air's loftiest regions: start hither, Lord of Bays, with thy Bay Horses. Made for the Firm and Strong are these libations. The pressing-stones are set and fire is kindled.

translations.griffith: Not far for thee are mid-air's loftiest regions: start hither, Lord of Bays, with thy Bay Horses. Made for the Firm and Strong are these libations. The pressing-stones are set and fire is kindled.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रः॑ सु॒शिप्रो॑ म॒घवा॒ तरु॑त्रो म॒हाव्रा॑तस्तुविकू॒र्मिर्ऋघा॑वान् यदु॒ग्रो धा बा॑धि॒तो मर्त्ये॑षु॒ क्व१॒॑ त्या ते॑ वृषभ वी॒र्या॑णि
stanzas.transliteration: índraḥ suśípro maghávā tárutro mahā́vrātas tuvikūrmír ŕ̥ghāvān yád ugró dhā́ bādhitó mártyeṣu kvà tyā́ te vr̥ṣabha vīryā̀ṇi
stanzas.translation: Fair cheeks hath Indra, Maghavan, the Victor, Lord of a great host, Stormer, strong in action. What once thou didst in might when mortals vexed thee,– where now, O Bull, are those thy hero exploits?

translations.griffith: Fair cheeks hath Indra, Maghavan, the Victor, Lord of a great host, Stormer, strong in action. What once thou didst in might when mortals vexed thee,– where now, O Bull, are those thy hero exploits?

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं हि ष्मा॑ च्या॒वय॒न्नच्यु॑ता॒न्येको॑ वृ॒त्रा चर॑सि॒ जिघ्न॑मानः तव॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी पर्व॑ता॒सोऽनु॑ व्र॒ताय॒ निमि॑तेव तस्थुः
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ hí ṣmā cyāváyann ácyutāni- éko vr̥trā́ cárasi jíghnamānaḥ táva dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ párvatāsaḥ- -ánu vratā́ya nímiteva tasthuḥ
stanzas.translation: For, overthrowing what hath ne'er been shaken, thou goest forth alone destroying Vr̥itras. For him who followeth thy Law the mountains and heaven and earth stand as if firmly stablished.

translations.griffith: For, overthrowing what hath ne'er been shaken, thou goest forth alone destroying Vr̥itras. For him who followeth thy Law the mountains and heaven and earth stand as if firmly stablished.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒ताभ॑ये पुरुहूत॒ श्रवो॑भि॒रेको॑ दृ॒ळ्हम॑वदो वृत्र॒हा सन् इ॒मे चि॑दिन्द्र॒ रोद॑सी अपा॒रे यत्सं॑गृ॒भ्णा म॑घवन्का॒शिरित्ते॑
stanzas.transliteration: utā́bhaye puruhūta śrávobhir éko dr̥ḷhám avado vr̥trahā́ sán imé cid indra ródasī apāré yát saṃgr̥bhṇā́ maghavan kāśír ít te
stanzas.translation: Yea, Much-invoked! in safety through thy glories alone thou speakest truth as Vr̥itra's slayer. E'en these two boundless worlds to thee, O Indra, what time thou graspest them, are but a handful.

translations.griffith: Yea, Much-invoked! in safety through thy glories alone thou speakest truth as Vr̥itra's slayer. E'en these two boundless worlds to thee, O Indra, what time thou graspest them, are but a handful.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र सू त॑ इन्द्र प्र॒वता॒ हरि॑भ्यां॒ प्र ते॒ वज्रः॑ प्रमृ॒णन्ने॑तु॒ शत्रू॑न् ज॒हि प्र॑ती॒चो अ॑नू॒चः परा॑चो॒ विश्वं॑ स॒त्यं कृ॑णुहि वि॒ष्टम॑स्तु
stanzas.transliteration: prá sū́ ta indra pravátā háribhyām prá te vájraḥ pramr̥ṇánn etu śátrūn jahí pratīcó anūcáḥ párāco víśvaṃ satyáṃ kr̥ṇuhi viṣṭám astu
stanzas.translation: Forthwith thy Bay steeds down the steep, O Indra, forth, crushing foemen, go thy bolt of thunder! Slay those who meet thee, those who flee, who follow: make all thy promise true; be all completed.

translations.griffith: Forthwith thy Bay steeds down the steep, O Indra, forth, crushing foemen, go thy bolt of thunder! Slay those who meet thee, those who flee, who follow: make all thy promise true; be all completed.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्मै॒ धायु॒रद॑धा॒ मर्त्या॒याभ॑क्तं चिद्भजते गे॒ह्यं१॒॑ सः भ॒द्रा त॑ इन्द्र सुम॒तिर्घृ॒ताची॑ स॒हस्र॑दाना पुरुहूत रा॒तिः
stanzas.transliteration: yásmai dhā́yur ádadhā mártyāya- -ábhaktaṃ cid bhajate gehyàṃ sáḥ bhadrā́ ta indra sumatír ghr̥tā́cī sahásradānā puruhūta rātíḥ
stanzas.translation: The man to whom thou givest as Provider enjoys domestic plenty undivided. Blest, Indra, is thy favour dropping fatness: thy worship, Much-invoked! brings gifts in thousands.

translations.griffith: The man to whom thou givest as Provider enjoys domestic plenty undivided. Blest, Indra, is thy favour dropping fatness: thy worship, Much-invoked! brings gifts in thousands.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒हदा॑नुं पुरुहूत क्षि॒यन्त॑मह॒स्तमि॑न्द्र॒ सं पि॑ण॒क्कुणा॑रुम् अ॒भि वृ॒त्रं वर्ध॑मानं॒ पिया॑रुम॒पाद॑मिन्द्र त॒वसा॑ जघन्थ
stanzas.transliteration: sahádānum puruhūta kṣiyántam ahastám indra sám piṇak kúṇārum abhí vr̥tráṃ várdhamānam píyārum apā́dam indra tavásā jaghantha
stanzas.translation: Thou, Indra, Much-invoked! didst crush to pieces Kuṇâru handless fiend who dwelt with Dânu. Thou with might, Indra, smotest dead the scorner, the footless Vr̥itra as he waxed in vigour.

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, Much-invoked! didst crush to pieces Kuṇâru handless fiend who dwelt with Dânu. Thou with might, Indra, smotest dead the scorner, the footless Vr̥itra as he waxed in vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि सा॑म॒नामि॑षि॒रामि॑न्द्र॒ भूमिं॑ म॒हीम॑पा॒रां सद॑ने ससत्थ अस्त॑भ्ना॒द्द्यां वृ॑ष॒भो अ॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒मर्ष॒न्त्वाप॒स्त्वये॒ह प्रसू॑ताः
stanzas.transliteration: ní sāmanā́m iṣirā́m indra bhū́mim mahī́m apārā́ṃ sádane sasattha ástabhnād dyā́ṃ vr̥ṣabhó antárikṣam árṣantv ā́pas tváyehá prásūtāḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou hast established in her seat, O Indra, the level earth, vast, vigorous, unbounded. The Bull hath propped the heaven and air's mid-region. By thee sent onward let the floods flow hither.

translations.griffith: Thou hast established in her seat, O Indra, the level earth, vast, vigorous, unbounded. The Bull hath propped the heaven and air's mid-region. By thee sent onward let the floods flow hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ला॒तृ॒णो व॒ल इ॑न्द्र व्र॒जो गोः पु॒रा हन्तो॒र्भय॑मानो॒ व्या॑र सु॒गान्प॒थो अ॑कृणोन्नि॒रजे॒ गाः प्राव॒न्वाणीः॑ पुरुहू॒तं धम॑न्तीः
stanzas.transliteration: alātr̥ṇó valá indra vrajó góḥ purā́ hántor bháyamāno vy ā̀ra sugā́n pathó akr̥ṇon niráje gā́ḥ prā́van vā́ṇīḥ puruhūtáṃ dhámantīḥ
stanzas.translation: He who withheld the kine, in silence I yielded in fear before thy blow, O Indra. He made paths easy to drive forth the cattle. Loud-breathing praises helped the Much-invoked One.

translations.griffith: He who withheld the kine, in silence I yielded in fear before thy blow, O Indra. He made paths easy to drive forth the cattle. Loud-breathing praises helped the Much-invoked One.

stanzas.sanskrit: एको॒ द्वे वसु॑मती समी॒ची इन्द्र॒ आ प॑प्रौ पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्याम् उ॒तान्तरि॑क्षाद॒भि नः॑ समी॒क इ॒षो र॒थीः स॒युजः॑ शूर॒ वाजा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: éko dvé vásumatī samīcī́ índra ā́ paprau pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m utā́ntárikṣād abhí naḥ samīké- iṣó rathī́ḥ sayújaḥ śūra vā́jān
stanzas.translation: Indra alone filled full the earth and heaven, the Pair who meet together, rich in treasures. Yea, bring thou near us from the air's mid-region strength, on thy car, and wholesome food, O Hero.

translations.griffith: Indra alone filled full the earth and heaven, the Pair who meet together, rich in treasures. Yea, bring thou near us from the air's mid-region strength, on thy car, and wholesome food, O Hero.

stanzas.sanskrit: दिशः॒ सूर्यो॒ न मि॑नाति॒ प्रदि॑ष्टा दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ हर्य॑श्वप्रसूताः सं यदान॒ळध्व॑न॒ आदिदश्वै॑र्वि॒मोच॑नं कृणुते॒ तत्त्व॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: díśaḥ sū́ryo ná mināti prádiṣṭāḥ- divé-dive háryaśvaprasūtāḥ sáṃ yád ā́naḷ ádhvana ā́d íd áśvair vimócanaṃ kr̥ṇute tát tv àsya
stanzas.translation: Sûrya transgresses not the ordered limits set daily by the Lord of Tawny Coursers. When to the goal he comes, his journey ended, his Steeds he looses: this is Indra's doing.

translations.griffith: Sûrya transgresses not the ordered limits set daily by the Lord of Tawny Coursers. When to the goal he comes, his journey ended, his Steeds he looses: this is Indra's doing.

stanzas.sanskrit: दिदृ॑क्षन्त उ॒षसो॒ याम॑न्न॒क्तोर्वि॒वस्व॑त्या॒ महि॑ चि॒त्रमनी॑कम् विश्वे॑ जानन्ति महि॒ना यदागा॒दिन्द्र॑स्य॒ कर्म॒ सुकृ॑ता पु॒रूणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: dídr̥kṣanta uṣáso yā́mann aktór vivásvatyā máhi citrám ánīkam víśve jānanti mahinā́ yád ā́gād índrasya kárma súkr̥tā purū́ṇi
stanzas.translation: Men gladly in the course of night would look on the broad bright front of the refulgent Morning; And all acknowledge, when she comes in glory, the manifold and goodly works of Indra.

translations.griffith: Men gladly in the course of night would look on the broad bright front of the refulgent Morning; And all acknowledge, when she comes in glory, the manifold and goodly works of Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: महि॒ ज्योति॒र्निहि॑तं व॒क्षणा॑स्वा॒मा प॒क्वं च॑रति॒ बिभ्र॑ती॒ गौः विश्वं॒ स्वाद्म॒ सम्भृ॑तमु॒स्रिया॑यां॒ यत्सी॒मिन्द्रो॒ अद॑धा॒द्भोज॑नाय
stanzas.transliteration: máhi jyótir níhitaṃ vakṣáṇāsu- āmā́ pakváṃ carati bíbhratī gaúḥ víśvaṃ svā́dma sámbhr̥tam usríyāyāṃ yát sīm índro ádadhād bhójanāya
stanzas.translation: A mighty splendour rests upon her bosom: bearing ripe milk the Cow, unripe, advances. All sweetness is collected in the Heifer, sweetness which Indra made for our enjoyment.

translations.griffith: A mighty splendour rests upon her bosom: bearing ripe milk the Cow, unripe, advances. All sweetness is collected in the Heifer, sweetness which Indra made for our enjoyment.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ दृह्य॑ यामको॒शा अ॑भूवन्य॒ज्ञाय॑ शिक्ष गृण॒ते सखि॑भ्यः दु॒र्मा॒यवो॑ दु॒रेवा॒ मर्त्या॑सो निष॒ङ्गिणो॑ रि॒पवो॒ हन्त्वा॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: índra dŕ̥hya yāmakośā́ abhūvan yajñā́ya śikṣa gr̥ṇaté sákhibhyaḥ durmāyávo durévā mártyāso niṣaṅgíṇo ripávo hántvāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: Barring the way they come. Be firm, O Indra; aid friends to sacrifice and him who singeth. These must be slain by thee, malignant mortals, armed with ill arts, our quiverbearing foemen.

translations.griffith: Barring the way they come. Be firm, O Indra; aid friends to sacrifice and him who singeth. These must be slain by thee, malignant mortals, armed with ill arts, our quiverbearing foemen.

stanzas.sanskrit: सं घोषः॑ शृण्वेऽव॒मैर॒मित्रै॑र्ज॒ही न्ये॑ष्व॒शनिं॒ तपि॑ष्ठाम् वृ॒श्चेम॒धस्ता॒द्वि रु॑जा॒ सह॑स्व ज॒हि रक्षो॑ मघवन्र॒न्धय॑स्व
stanzas.transliteration: sáṃ ghóṣaḥ śr̥ṇve 'vamaír amítrair jahī́ ny èṣv aśániṃ tápiṣṭhām vr̥ścém adhástād ví rujā sáhasva jahí rákṣo maghavan randháyasva
stanzas.translation: A cry is beard from enemies most near us: against them send thy fiercest-flaming weapon. Rend them from under, crush them and subdue them. Slay, Maghavan, and make the fiends our booty.

translations.griffith: A cry is beard from enemies most near us: against them send thy fiercest-flaming weapon. Rend them from under, crush them and subdue them. Slay, Maghavan, and make the fiends our booty.

stanzas.sanskrit: उद्वृ॑ह॒ रक्षः॑ स॒हमू॑लमिन्द्र वृ॒श्चा मध्यं॒ प्रत्यग्रं॑ शृणीहि आ कीव॑तः सल॒लूकं॑ चकर्थ ब्रह्म॒द्विषे॒ तपु॑षिं हे॒तिम॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: úd vr̥ha rákṣaḥ sahámūlam indra vr̥ścā́ mádhyam práty ágraṃ śr̥ṇīhi ā́ kī́vataḥ salalū́kaṃ cakartha brahmadvíṣe tápuṣiṃ hetím asya
stanzas.translation: Root up the race of Raksasas, O Indra rend it in front and crush it in the middle. How long hast thou bebaved as one who wavers? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion:

translations.griffith: Root up the race of Raksasas, O Indra rend it in front and crush it in the middle. How long hast thou bebaved as one who wavers? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion:

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॒स्तये॑ वा॒जिभि॑श्च प्रणेतः॒ सं यन्म॒हीरिष॑ आ॒सत्सि॑ पू॒र्वीः रा॒यो व॒न्तारो॑ बृह॒तः स्या॑मा॒स्मे अ॑स्तु॒ भग॑ इन्द्र प्र॒जावा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: svastáye vājíbhiś ca praṇetaḥ sáṃ yán mahī́r íṣa āsátsi pūrvī́ḥ rāyó vantā́ro br̥hatáḥ syāma- -asmé astu bhága indra prajā́vān
stanzas.translation: When borne by strong Steeds for our weal, O Leader, thou seatest thee at many noble viands. May we be winners of abundant riches. May Indra be our wealth with store of children.

translations.griffith: When borne by strong Steeds for our weal, O Leader, thou seatest thee at many noble viands. May we be winners of abundant riches. May Indra be our wealth with store of children.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ भर॒ भग॑मिन्द्र द्यु॒मन्तं॒ नि ते॑ दे॒ष्णस्य॑ धीमहि प्ररे॒के ऊ॒र्व इ॑व पप्रथे॒ कामो॑ अ॒स्मे तमा पृ॑ण वसुपते॒ वसू॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no bhara bhágam indra dyumántaṃ ní te deṣṇásya dhīmahi prareké ūrvá iva paprathe kā́mo asmé tám ā́ pr̥ṇa vasupate vásūnām
stanzas.translation: Bestow on us resplendent wealth. O Indra let us enjoy thine overflow of bounty. Wide as a sea our longing hath expanded, fulfil it, O thou Treasure-Lord of treasures.

translations.griffith: Bestow on us resplendent wealth. O Indra let us enjoy thine overflow of bounty. Wide as a sea our longing hath expanded, fulfil it, O thou Treasure-Lord of treasures.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं कामं॑ मन्दया॒ गोभि॒रश्वै॑श्च॒न्द्रव॑ता॒ राध॑सा प॒प्रथ॑श्च स्व॒र्यवो॑ म॒तिभि॒स्तुभ्यं॒ विप्रा॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ वाहः॑ कुशि॒कासो॑ अक्रन्
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ kā́mam mandayā góbhir áśvaiś candrávatā rā́dhasā papráthaś ca svaryávo matíbhis túbhyaṃ víprāḥ- índrāya vā́haḥ kuśikā́so akran
stanzas.translation: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty skill extend it. Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, Kuṣikas have brought their gift, the singers.

translations.griffith: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty skill extend it. Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, Kuṣikas have brought their gift, the singers.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ गो॒त्रा द॑र्दृहि गोपते॒ गाः सम॒स्मभ्यं॑ स॒नयो॑ यन्तु॒ वाजाः॑ दि॒वक्षा॑ असि वृषभ स॒त्यशु॑ष्मो॒ऽस्मभ्यं॒ सु म॑घवन्बोधि गो॒दाः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no gotrā́ dardr̥hi gopate gā́ḥ sám asmábhyaṃ sanáyo yantu vā́jāḥ divákṣā asi vr̥ṣabha satyáśuṣmo -asmábhyaṃ sú maghavan bodhi godā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Lord of the kine, burst the kine's stable open: cows shall be ours, and strength that wins the booty. Hero, whose might is true, thy home is heaven: to us, O Maghavan, grant gifts of cattle.

translations.griffith: Lord of the kine, burst the kine's stable open: cows shall be ours, and strength that wins the booty. Hero, whose might is true, thy home is heaven: to us, O Maghavan, grant gifts of cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: शास॒द्वह्नि॑र्दुहि॒तुर्न॒प्त्यं॑ गाद्वि॒द्वाँ ऋ॒तस्य॒ दीधि॑तिं सप॒र्यन् पि॒ता यत्र॑ दुहि॒तुः सेक॑मृ॒ञ्जन्त्सं श॒ग्म्ये॑न॒ मन॑सा दध॒न्वे
stanzas.transliteration: śā́sad váhnir duhitúr naptyàṃ gād vidvā́m̐ r̥tásya dī́dhitiṃ saparyán pitā́ yátra duhitúḥ sékam r̥ñján sáṃ śagmyèna mánasā dadhanvé
stanzas.translation: WISE, teaching, following the thought of Order, the sonless gained a grandson from his daughter. Fain, as a sire, to see his child prolific, he sped to meet her with an eager spirit.

translations.griffith: WISE, teaching, following the thought of Order, the sonless gained a grandson from his daughter. Fain, as a sire, to see his child prolific, he sped to meet her with an eager spirit.

stanzas.sanskrit: न जा॒मये॒ तान्वो॑ रि॒क्थमा॑रैक्च॒कार॒ गर्भं॑ सनि॒तुर्नि॒धान॑म् यदी॑ मा॒तरो॑ ज॒नय॑न्त॒ वह्नि॑म॒न्यः क॒र्ता सु॒कृतो॑र॒न्य ऋ॒न्धन्
stanzas.transliteration: ná jāmáye tā́nvo rikthám āraik cakā́ra gárbhaṃ sanitúr nidhā́nam yádī mātáro janáyanta váhnim anyáḥ kartā́ sukŕ̥tor anyá r̥ndhán
stanzas.translation: The Son left not his portion to the brother, he made a home to hold him who should gain, it. What time his Parents gave the Priest his being, of the good pair one acted, one promoted.

translations.griffith: The Son left not his portion to the brother, he made a home to hold him who should gain, it. What time his Parents gave the Priest his being, of the good pair one acted, one promoted.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्ज॑ज्ञे जु॒ह्वा॒३॒॑ रेज॑मानो म॒हस्पु॒त्राँ अ॑रु॒षस्य॑ प्र॒यक्षे॑ म॒हान्गर्भो॒ मह्या जा॒तमे॑षां म॒ही प्र॒वृद्धर्य॑श्वस्य य॒ज्ञैः
stanzas.transliteration: agnír jajñe juhvā̀ réjamāno mahás putrā́m̐ aruṣásya prayákṣe mahā́n gárbho máhy ā́ jātám eṣām mahī́ pravŕ̥d dháryaśvasya yajñaíḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni was born trembling with tongue that flickered, so that the Red's great children should be honoured. Great is their germ, that born of them is mighty, great the Bays' Lord's approach through sacrifices.

translations.griffith: Agni was born trembling with tongue that flickered, so that the Red's great children should be honoured. Great is their germ, that born of them is mighty, great the Bays' Lord's approach through sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि जैत्री॑रसचन्त स्पृधा॒नं महि॒ ज्योति॒स्तम॑सो॒ निर॑जानन् तं जा॑न॒तीः प्रत्युदा॑यन्नु॒षासः॒ पति॒र्गवा॑मभव॒देक॒ इन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: abhí jaítrīr asacanta spr̥dhānám máhi jyótis támaso nír ajānan táṃ jānatī́ḥ práty úd āyann uṣā́saḥ pátir gávām abhavad éka índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Conquering bands upon the Warrior waited: they recognized great light from out the darkness. The conscious Dawns went forth to meet his coming, and the sole Master of the kine was Indra.

translations.griffith: Conquering bands upon the Warrior waited: they recognized great light from out the darkness. The conscious Dawns went forth to meet his coming, and the sole Master of the kine was Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: वी॒ळौ स॒तीर॒भि धीरा॑ अतृन्दन्प्रा॒चाहि॑न्व॒न्मन॑सा स॒प्त विप्राः॑ विश्वा॑मविन्दन्प॒थ्या॑मृ॒तस्य॑ प्रजा॒नन्नित्ता नम॒सा वि॑वेश
stanzas.transliteration: vīḷaú satī́r abhí dhī́rā atr̥ndan prācā́hinvan mánasā saptá víprāḥ víśvām avindan pathyā̀m r̥tásya prajānánn ít tā́ námasā́ viveśa
stanzas.translation: The sages freed them from their firmbuilt prison: the seven priests drove them forward with their spirit. All holy Order's pathway they discovered he, full of knowledge, shared these deeds through worship.

translations.griffith: The sages freed them from their firmbuilt prison: the seven priests drove them forward with their spirit. All holy Order's pathway they discovered he, full of knowledge, shared these deeds through worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒दद्यदी॑ स॒रमा॑ रु॒ग्णमद्रे॒र्महि॒ पाथः॑ पू॒र्व्यं स॒ध्र्य॑क्कः अग्रं॑ नयत्सु॒पद्यक्ष॑राणा॒मच्छा॒ रवं॑ प्रथ॒मा जा॑न॒ती गा॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: vidád yádī sarámā rugṇám ádrer máhi pā́thaḥ pūrvyáṃ sadhryàk kaḥ ágraṃ nayat supády ákṣarāṇām áchā rávam prathamā́ jānatī́ gāt
stanzas.translation: When Saramâ had found the mountain's fissure, that vast and ancient place she plundered thoroughly. In the floods' van she led them forth, light-footed: she who well knew came first unto their lowing.
