translations.griffith: When Saramâ had found the mountain's fissure, that vast and ancient place she plundered thoroughly. In the floods' van she led them forth, light-footed: she who well knew came first unto their lowing.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग॑च्छदु॒ विप्र॑तमः सखी॒यन्नसू॑दयत्सु॒कृते॒ गर्भ॒मद्रिः॑ स॒सान॒ मर्यो॒ युव॑भिर्मख॒स्यन्नथा॑भव॒दङ्गि॑राः स॒द्यो अर्च॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ágachad u vípratamaḥ sakhīyánn ásūdayat sukŕ̥te gárbham ádriḥ sasā́na máryo yúvabhir makhasyánn áthābhavad áṅgirāḥ sadyó árcan
stanzas.translation: Longing for friendship came the noblest singer: the hill poured forth its treasure for the pious. The Hero with young followers fought and conquered, and straightway Angiras was singing praises,

translations.griffith: Longing for friendship came the noblest singer: the hill poured forth its treasure for the pious. The Hero with young followers fought and conquered, and straightway Angiras was singing praises,

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒तःस॑तः प्रति॒मानं॑ पुरो॒भूर्विश्वा॑ वेद॒ जनि॑मा॒ हन्ति॒ शुष्ण॑म् प्र णो॑ दि॒वः प॑द॒वीर्ग॒व्युरर्च॒न्त्सखा॒ सखीँ॑रमुञ्च॒न्निर॑व॒द्यात्
stanzas.transliteration: satáḥ-sataḥ pratimā́nam purobhū́r víśvā veda jánimā hánti śúṣṇam prá ṇo diváḥ padavī́r gavyúr árcan sákhā sákhīm̐r amuñcan nír avadyā́t
stanzas.translation: Peer of each noble thing, yea, all excelling, all creatures doth he know, he slayeth Ṣushṇa. Our leader, fain for war, singing from heaven, as Friend he saved his lovers from dishonour.

translations.griffith: Peer of each noble thing, yea, all excelling, all creatures doth he know, he slayeth Ṣushṇa. Our leader, fain for war, singing from heaven, as Friend he saved his lovers from dishonour.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि ग॑व्य॒ता मन॑सा सेदुर॒र्कैः कृ॑ण्वा॒नासो॑ अमृत॒त्वाय॑ गा॒तुम् इ॒दं चि॒न्नु सद॑नं॒ भूर्ये॑षां॒ येन॒ मासाँ॒ असि॑षासन्नृ॒तेन॑
stanzas.transliteration: ní gavyatā́ mánasā sedur arkaíḥ kr̥ṇvānā́so amr̥tatvā́ya gātúm idáṃ cin nú sádanam bhū́ry eṣāṃ yéna mā́sām̐ ásiṣāsann r̥téna
stanzas.translation: They sate them down with spirit fain for booty, making with hymns a way to life eternal. And this is still their place of frequent session, whereby they sought to gain the months through Order.

translations.griffith: They sate them down with spirit fain for booty, making with hymns a way to life eternal. And this is still their place of frequent session, whereby they sought to gain the months through Order.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒म्पश्य॑माना अमदन्न॒भि स्वं पयः॑ प्र॒त्नस्य॒ रेत॑सो॒ दुघा॑नाः वि रोद॑सी अतप॒द्घोष॑ एषां जा॒ते नि॒ष्ठामद॑धु॒र्गोषु॑ वी॒रान्
stanzas.transliteration: sampáśyamānā amadann abhí svám páyaḥ pratnásya rétaso dúghānāḥ ví ródasī atapad ghóṣa eṣāṃ jāté niṣṭhā́m ádadhur góṣu vīrā́n
stanzas.translation: Drawing the milk of ancient seed prolific, they joyed as they beheld their own possession. Their shout of triumph heated earth and heaven. When the kine showed, they bade the heroes rouse them.

translations.griffith: Drawing the milk of ancient seed prolific, they joyed as they beheld their own possession. Their shout of triumph heated earth and heaven. When the kine showed, they bade the heroes rouse them.

stanzas.sanskrit: स जा॒तेभि॑र्वृत्र॒हा सेदु॑ ह॒व्यैरुदु॒स्रिया॑ असृज॒दिन्द्रो॑ अ॒र्कैः उ॒रू॒च्य॑स्मै घृ॒तव॒द्भर॑न्ती॒ मधु॒ स्वाद्म॑ दुदुहे॒ जेन्या॒ गौः
stanzas.transliteration: sá jātébhir vr̥trahā́ séd u havyaír úd usríyā asr̥jad índro arkaíḥ urūcy àsmai ghr̥távad bhárantī mádhu svā́dma duduhe jényā gaúḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra drove forth the kine, that Vr̥itra-slayer, while hymns of praise rose up and gifts were offered. For him the Cow, noble and far-extending, poured pleasant juices, bringing oil and sweetness.

translations.griffith: Indra drove forth the kine, that Vr̥itra-slayer, while hymns of praise rose up and gifts were offered. For him the Cow, noble and far-extending, poured pleasant juices, bringing oil and sweetness.

stanzas.sanskrit: पि॒त्रे चि॑च्चक्रुः॒ सद॑नं॒ सम॑स्मै॒ महि॒ त्विषी॑मत्सु॒कृतो॒ वि हि ख्यन् वि॒ष्क॒भ्नन्तः॒ स्कम्भ॑नेना॒ जनि॑त्री॒ आसी॑ना ऊ॒र्ध्वं र॑भ॒सं वि मि॑न्वन्
stanzas.transliteration: pitré cic cakruḥ sádanaṃ sám asmai máhi tvíṣīmat sukŕ̥to ví hí khyán viṣkabhnánta skámbhanenā jánitrī ā́sīnā ūrdhváṃ rabhasáṃ ví minvan
stanzas.translation: They made a mansion for their Father, deftly provided him a great and glorious dwelling; With firm support parted and stayed the Parents, and, sitting, fixed him there erected, mighty.

translations.griffith: They made a mansion for their Father, deftly provided him a great and glorious dwelling; With firm support parted and stayed the Parents, and, sitting, fixed him there erected, mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒ही यदि॑ धि॒षणा॑ शि॒श्नथे॒ धात्स॑द्यो॒वृधं॑ वि॒भ्वं१॒॑ रोद॑स्योः गिरो॒ यस्मि॑न्ननव॒द्याः स॑मी॒चीर्विश्वा॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ तवि॑षी॒रनु॑त्ताः
stanzas.transliteration: mahī́ yádi dhiṣáṇā śiśnáthe dhā́t sadyovŕ̥dhaṃ vibhvàṃ ródasyoḥ gíro yásminn anavadyā́ḥ samīcī́r víśvā índrāya táviṣīr ánuttāḥ
stanzas.translation: What time the ample chalice had impelled him, swift waxing, vast, to pierce the earth and heaven,– Him in whom blameless songs are all united: all powers invincible belong to Indra.

translations.griffith: What time the ample chalice had impelled him, swift waxing, vast, to pierce the earth and heaven,– Him in whom blameless songs are all united: all powers invincible belong to Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: मह्या ते॑ स॒ख्यं व॑श्मि श॒क्तीरा वृ॑त्र॒घ्ने नि॒युतो॑ यन्ति पू॒र्वीः महि॑ स्तो॒त्रमव॒ आग॑न्म सू॒रेर॒स्माकं॒ सु म॑घवन्बोधि गो॒पाः
stanzas.transliteration: máhy ā́ te sakhyáṃ vaśmi śaktī́r ā́ vr̥traghné niyúto yanti pūrvī́ḥ máhi stotrám áva ā́ganma sūrér asmā́kaṃ sú maghavan bodhi gopā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: I crave thy powers, I crave thy mighty friendship: full many a team goes to the Vr̥itra-slayer. Great is the laud, we seek the Princes' favour. Be thou, O Maghavan, our guard and keeper.

translations.griffith: I crave thy powers, I crave thy mighty friendship: full many a team goes to the Vr̥itra-slayer. Great is the laud, we seek the Princes' favour. Be thou, O Maghavan, our guard and keeper.

stanzas.sanskrit: महि॒ क्षेत्रं॑ पु॒रु श्च॒न्द्रं वि॑वि॒द्वानादित्सखि॑भ्यश्च॒रथं॒ समै॑रत् इन्द्रो॒ नृभि॑रजन॒द्दीद्या॑नः सा॒कं सूर्य॑मु॒षसं॑ गा॒तुम॒ग्निम्
stanzas.transliteration: máhi kṣétram purú ścandráṃ vividvā́n ā́d ít sákhibhyaś caráthaṃ sám airat índro nŕ̥bhir ajanad dī́dyānaḥ sākáṃ sū́ryam uṣásaṃ gātúm agním
stanzas.translation: He, having found great, splendid, rich dominion, sent life and motion to his friends and lovers. Indra who shone together with the Heroes begot the song, the fire, and Sun and Morning.

translations.griffith: He, having found great, splendid, rich dominion, sent life and motion to his friends and lovers. Indra who shone together with the Heroes begot the song, the fire, and Sun and Morning.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒पश्चि॑दे॒ष वि॒भ्वो॒३॒॑ दमू॑नाः॒ प्र स॒ध्रीची॑रसृजद्वि॒श्वश्च॑न्द्राः मध्वः॑ पुना॒नाः क॒विभिः॑ प॒वित्रै॒र्द्युभि॑र्हिन्वन्त्य॒क्तुभि॒र्धनु॑त्रीः
stanzas.transliteration: apáś cid eṣá vibhvò dámūnāḥ prá sadhrī́cīr asr̥jad viśváścandrāḥ mádhvaḥ punānā́ḥ kavíbhiḥ pavítrair dyúbhir hinvanty aktúbhir dhánutrīḥ
stanzas.translation: Vast, the House-Friend, he set the waters flowing, all-lucid, widely spread, that move together. By the wise cleansings of the meath made holy, through days, and nights they speed the swift streams onward.

translations.griffith: Vast, the House-Friend, he set the waters flowing, all-lucid, widely spread, that move together. By the wise cleansings of the meath made holy, through days, and nights they speed the swift streams onward.

stanzas.sanskrit: अनु॑ कृ॒ष्णे वसु॑धिती जिहाते उ॒भे सूर्य॑स्य मं॒हना॒ यज॑त्रे परि॒ यत्ते॑ महि॒मानं॑ वृ॒जध्यै॒ सखा॑य इन्द्र॒ काम्या॑ ऋजि॒प्याः
stanzas.transliteration: ánu kr̥ṣṇé vásudhitī jihāte ubhé sū́ryasya maṃhánā yájatre pári yát te mahimā́naṃ vr̥jádhyai sákhāya indra kā́myā r̥jipyā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: To thee proceed the dark, the treasure-holders, both of them sanctified by Sûrya's bounty. The while thy ovely storming Friends, O Indra, fail to attain the measure of thy greatness.

translations.griffith: To thee proceed the dark, the treasure-holders, both of them sanctified by Sûrya's bounty. The while thy ovely storming Friends, O Indra, fail to attain the measure of thy greatness.

stanzas.sanskrit: पति॑र्भव वृत्रहन्त्सू॒नृता॑नां गि॒रां वि॒श्वायु॑र्वृष॒भो व॑यो॒धाः आ नो॑ गहि स॒ख्येभिः॑ शि॒वेभि॑र्म॒हान्म॒हीभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ सर॒ण्यन्
stanzas.transliteration: pátir bhava vr̥trahan sūnŕ̥tānāṃ girā́ṃ viśvā́yur vr̥ṣabhó vayodhā́ḥ ā́ no gahi sakhyébhiḥ śivébhir mahā́n mahī́bhir ūtíbhiḥ saraṇyán
stanzas.translation: Be Lord of joyous songs, O Vr̥itra-slayer, Bull dear to all, who gives the power of living. Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, hastening, Mighty One, with mighty succours.

translations.griffith: Be Lord of joyous songs, O Vr̥itra-slayer, Bull dear to all, who gives the power of living. Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, hastening, Mighty One, with mighty succours.

stanzas.sanskrit: तम॑ङ्गिर॒स्वन्नम॑सा सप॒र्यन्नव्यं॑ कृणोमि॒ सन्य॑से पुरा॒जाम् द्रुहो॒ वि या॑हि बहु॒ला अदे॑वीः॒ स्व॑श्च नो मघवन्त्सा॒तये॑ धाः
stanzas.transliteration: tám aṅgirasván námasā saparyán návyaṃ kr̥ṇomi sányase purājā́m drúho ví yāhi bahulā́ ádevīḥ svàś ca no maghavan sātáye dhāḥ
stanzas.translation: Like Angiras I honour him with worship, and renovate old song for him the Ancient. Chase thou the many godless evil creatures, and give us, Maghavan, heaven's light to help m.

translations.griffith: Like Angiras I honour him with worship, and renovate old song for him the Ancient. Chase thou the many godless evil creatures, and give us, Maghavan, heaven's light to help m.

stanzas.sanskrit: मिहः॑ पाव॒काः प्रत॑ता अभूवन्त्स्व॒स्ति नः॑ पिपृहि पा॒रमा॑साम् इन्द्र॒ त्वं र॑थि॒रः पा॑हि नो रि॒षो म॒क्षूम॑क्षू कृणुहि गो॒जितो॑ नः
stanzas.transliteration: míhaḥ pāvakā́ḥ prátatā abhūvan svastí naḥ pipr̥hi pārám āsām índra tváṃ rathiráḥ pāhi no riṣó makṣū́-makṣū kr̥ṇuhi gojíto naḥ
stanzas.translation: Far forth are spread the purifying waters convey thou us across them unto safety. Save us, our Charioteer, from harm, O Indra, soon, very soon, make us win spoil of cattle.

translations.griffith: Far forth are spread the purifying waters convey thou us across them unto safety. Save us, our Charioteer, from harm, O Indra, soon, very soon, make us win spoil of cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: अदे॑दिष्ट वृत्र॒हा गोप॑ति॒र्गा अ॒न्तः कृ॒ष्णाँ अ॑रु॒षैर्धाम॑भिर्गात् प्र सू॒नृता॑ दि॒शमा॑न ऋ॒तेन॒ दुर॑श्च॒ विश्वा॑ अवृणो॒दप॒ स्वाः
stanzas.transliteration: ádediṣṭa vr̥trahā́ gópatir gā́ḥ- antáḥ kr̥ṣṇā́m̐ aruṣaír dhā́mabhir gāt prá sūnŕ̥tā diśámāna r̥téna dúraś ca víśvā avr̥ṇod ápa svā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: His kine their Lord hath shown, e'en Vr̥itra's slayer, through the black hosts he passed with red attendants. Teaching us pleasant things by holy Order, to, us hath he thrown open all his portals.

translations.griffith: His kine their Lord hath shown, e'en Vr̥itra's slayer, through the black hosts he passed with red attendants. Teaching us pleasant things by holy Order, to, us hath he thrown open all his portals.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered. The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered. The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ सोमं॑ सोमपते॒ पिबे॒मं माध्यं॑दिनं॒ सव॑नं॒ चारु॒ यत्ते॑ प्र॒प्रुथ्या॒ शिप्रे॑ मघवन्नृजीषिन्वि॒मुच्या॒ हरी॑ इ॒ह मा॑दयस्व
stanzas.transliteration: índra sómaṃ somapate píbemám mā́dhyaṃdinaṃ sávanaṃ cā́ru yát te praprúthyā śípre maghavann r̥jīṣin vimúcyā hárī ihá mādayasva
stanzas.translation: DRINK thou this Soma, Indra, Lord of Soma; drink thou the draught of noonday which thou Iovest. Puffing thy cheeks, impetuous, liberal Giver, here loose thy two Bay Horses and rejoice thee.

translations.griffith: DRINK thou this Soma, Indra, Lord of Soma; drink thou the draught of noonday which thou Iovest. Puffing thy cheeks, impetuous, liberal Giver, here loose thy two Bay Horses and rejoice thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: गवा॑शिरं म॒न्थिन॑मिन्द्र शु॒क्रं पिबा॒ सोमं॑ ररि॒मा ते॒ मदा॑य ब्र॒ह्म॒कृता॒ मारु॑तेना ग॒णेन॑ स॒जोषा॑ रु॒द्रैस्तृ॒पदा वृ॑षस्व
stanzas.transliteration: gávāśiram manthínam indra śukrám píbā sómaṃ rarimā́ te mádāya brahmakŕ̥tā mā́rutenā gaṇéna sajóṣā rudraís tr̥pád ā́ vr̥ṣasva
stanzas.translation: Quaff it pure, meal-blent, mixt with milk, O Indra; we have poured forth the Soma for thy rapture. Knit with the prayer-fulfilling band of Maruts, yea, with the Rudras, drink till thou art sated;

translations.griffith: Quaff it pure, meal-blent, mixt with milk, O Indra; we have poured forth the Soma for thy rapture. Knit with the prayer-fulfilling band of Maruts, yea, with the Rudras, drink till thou art sated;

stanzas.sanskrit: ये ते॒ शुष्मं॒ ये तवि॑षी॒मव॑र्ध॒न्नर्च॑न्त इन्द्र म॒रुत॑स्त॒ ओजः॑ माध्यं॑दिने॒ सव॑ने वज्रहस्त॒ पिबा॑ रु॒द्रेभिः॒ सग॑णः सुशिप्र
stanzas.transliteration: yé te śúṣmaṃ yé táviṣīm ávardhann árcanta indra marútas ta ójaḥ mā́dhyaṃdine sávane vajrahasta píbā rudrébhiḥ ságaṇaḥ suśipra
stanzas.translation: Those who gave increase to thy strength and vigour; the Maruts singing forth thy might, O Indra. Drink thou, O fair of cheek, whose hand wields thunder, with Rudras banded, at our noon libation.

translations.griffith: Those who gave increase to thy strength and vigour; the Maruts singing forth thy might, O Indra. Drink thou, O fair of cheek, whose hand wields thunder, with Rudras banded, at our noon libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: त इन्न्व॑स्य॒ मधु॑मद्विविप्र॒ इन्द्र॑स्य॒ शर्धो॑ म॒रुतो॒ य आस॑न् येभि॑र्वृ॒त्रस्ये॑षि॒तो वि॒वेदा॑म॒र्मणो॒ मन्य॑मानस्य॒ मर्म॑
stanzas.transliteration: tá ín nv àsya mádhumad vivipre- índrasya śárdho marúto yá ā́san yébhir vr̥trásyeṣitó vivéda- -amarmáṇo mányamānasya márma
stanzas.translation: They, even the Maruts who were there, excited with song the meath-created strength of Indra. By them impelled to act he reached the vitals Of Vr̥itra, though he deemed that none might wound him.

translations.griffith: They, even the Maruts who were there, excited with song the meath-created strength of Indra. By them impelled to act he reached the vitals Of Vr̥itra, though he deemed that none might wound him.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒नु॒ष्वदि॑न्द्र॒ सव॑नं जुषा॒णः पिबा॒ सोमं॒ शश्व॑ते वी॒र्या॑य स आ व॑वृत्स्व हर्यश्व य॒ज्ञैः स॑र॒ण्युभि॑र॒पो अर्णा॑ सिसर्षि
stanzas.transliteration: manuṣvád indra sávanaṃ juṣāṇáḥ píbā sómaṃ śáśvate vīryā̀ya sá ā́ vavr̥tsva haryaśva yajñaíḥ saraṇyúbhir apó árṇā sisarṣi
stanzas.translation: Pleased, like a man, with our libation, Indra, drink, for enduring hero might, the Soma. Lord of Bays, moved by sacrifice come hither: thou with the Swift Ones stirrest floods and waters.

translations.griffith: Pleased, like a man, with our libation, Indra, drink, for enduring hero might, the Soma. Lord of Bays, moved by sacrifice come hither: thou with the Swift Ones stirrest floods and waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॒पो यद्ध॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अत्याँ॑ इव॒ प्रासृ॑जः॒ सर्त॒वाजौ शया॑नमिन्द्र॒ चर॑ता व॒धेन॑ वव्रि॒वांसं॒ परि॑ दे॒वीरदे॑वम्
stanzas.transliteration: tvám apó yád dha vr̥tráṃ jaghanvā́m̐ átyām̐ iva prā́sr̥jaḥ sártavā́jaú śáyānam indra cáratā vadhéna vavrivā́ṃsam pári devī́r ádevam
stanzas.translation: When thou didst loose the streams to run like racers in the swift contest, having smitten Vr̥itra With flying weapon where he lay, O Indra, and, godless, kept the Goddesses encompassed.

translations.griffith: When thou didst loose the streams to run like racers in the swift contest, having smitten Vr̥itra With flying weapon where he lay, O Indra, and, godless, kept the Goddesses encompassed.

stanzas.sanskrit: यजा॑म॒ इन्नम॑सा वृ॒द्धमिन्द्रं॑ बृ॒हन्त॑मृ॒ष्वम॒जरं॒ युवा॑नम् यस्य॑ प्रि॒ये म॒मतु॑र्य॒ज्ञिय॑स्य॒ न रोद॑सी महि॒मानं॑ म॒माते॑
stanzas.transliteration: yájāma ín námasā vr̥ddhám índram br̥hántam r̥ṣvám ajáraṃ yúvānam yásya priyé mamátur yajñíyasya ná ródasī mahimā́nam mamā́te
stanzas.translation: With reverence let us worship mighty Indra, great and sublime, eternal, everyouthful, Whose greatness the dear world-halves have not measured, no, nor conceived the might of him the Holy.

translations.griffith: With reverence let us worship mighty Indra, great and sublime, eternal, everyouthful, Whose greatness the dear world-halves have not measured, no, nor conceived the might of him the Holy.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑स्य॒ कर्म॒ सुकृ॑ता पु॒रूणि॑ व्र॒तानि॑ दे॒वा न मि॑नन्ति॒ विश्वे॑ दा॒धार॒ यः पृ॑थि॒वीं द्यामु॒तेमां ज॒जान॒ सूर्य॑मु॒षसं॑ सु॒दंसाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrasya kárma súkr̥tā purū́ṇi vratā́ni devā́ ná minanti víśve dādhā́ra yáḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m utémā́ṃ jajā́na sū́ryam uṣásaṃ sudáṃsāḥ
stanzas.translation: Many are Indra's nobly wrought achievements, and none of all the Gods transgress his statutes. He beareth up this earth and heaven, and, doer of marvels, he begot the Sun and Morning.

translations.griffith: Many are Indra's nobly wrought achievements, and none of all the Gods transgress his statutes. He beareth up this earth and heaven, and, doer of marvels, he begot the Sun and Morning.

stanzas.sanskrit: अद्रो॑घ स॒त्यं तव॒ तन्म॑हि॒त्वं स॒द्यो यज्जा॒तो अपि॑बो ह॒ सोम॑म् न द्याव॑ इन्द्र त॒वस॑स्त॒ ओजो॒ नाहा॒ न मासाः॑ श॒रदो॑ वरन्त
stanzas.transliteration: ádrogha satyáṃ táva tán mahitváṃ sadyó yáj jātó ápibo ha sómam ná dyā́va indra tavásas ta ójo nā́hā ná mā́sāḥ śarádo varanta
stanzas.translation: Herein, O Guileless One, is thy true greatness, that soon as born thou drankest up the Soma. Days may not check the power of thee the Mighty, nor the nights, Indra, nor the months, nor autumns.

translations.griffith: Herein, O Guileless One, is thy true greatness, that soon as born thou drankest up the Soma. Days may not check the power of thee the Mighty, nor the nights, Indra, nor the months, nor autumns.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं स॒द्यो अ॑पिबो जा॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ मदा॑य॒ सोमं॑ पर॒मे व्यो॑मन् यद्ध॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी आवि॑वेशी॒रथा॑भवः पू॒र्व्यः का॒रुधा॑याः
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ sadyó apibo jātá indra mádāya sómam paramé vyòman yád dha dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ā́viveśīr áthābhavaḥ pūrvyáḥ kārúdhāyāḥ
stanzas.translation: As soon as thou wast born in highest heaven thou drankest Soma to delight thee, Indra; And when thou hadst pervaded earth and heaven thou wast the first supporter of the singer.

translations.griffith: As soon as thou wast born in highest heaven thou drankest Soma to delight thee, Indra; And when thou hadst pervaded earth and heaven thou wast the first supporter of the singer.

stanzas.sanskrit: अह॒न्नहिं॑ परि॒शया॑न॒मर्ण॑ ओजा॒यमा॑नं तुविजात॒ तव्या॑न् न ते॑ महि॒त्वमनु॑ भू॒दध॒ द्यौर्यद॒न्यया॑ स्फि॒ग्या॒३॒॑ क्षामव॑स्थाः
stanzas.transliteration: áhann áhim pariśáyānam árṇaḥ- ojāyámānaṃ tuvijāta távyān ná te mahitvám ánu bhūd ádha dyaúr yád anyáyā sphigyā̀ kṣā́m ávasthāḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou, puissant God, more mighty, slewest. Ahi showing his strength when couched around the waters. The heaven itself attained not to thy greatness when with one hip of thine the earth was shadowed.

translations.griffith: Thou, puissant God, more mighty, slewest. Ahi showing his strength when couched around the waters. The heaven itself attained not to thy greatness when with one hip of thine the earth was shadowed.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒ज्ञो हि त॑ इन्द्र॒ वर्ध॑नो॒ भूदु॒त प्रि॒यः सु॒तसो॑मो मि॒येधः॑ य॒ज्ञेन॑ य॒ज्ञम॑व य॒ज्ञियः॒ सन्य॒ज्ञस्ते॒ वज्र॑महि॒हत्य॑ आवत्
stanzas.transliteration: yajñó hí ta indra várdhano bhū́d utá priyáḥ sutásomo miyédhaḥ yajñéna yajñám ava yajñíyaḥ sán yajñás te vájram ahihátya āvat
stanzas.translation: Sacrifice, Indra, made thee wax so mighty, the dear oblation with the flowing Soma. O Worshipful, with worship help our worship, for worship helped thy bolt when slaying Ahi.

translations.griffith: Sacrifice, Indra, made thee wax so mighty, the dear oblation with the flowing Soma. O Worshipful, with worship help our worship, for worship helped thy bolt when slaying Ahi.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒ज्ञेनेन्द्र॒मव॒सा च॑क्रे अ॒र्वागैनं॑ सु॒म्नाय॒ नव्य॑से ववृत्याम् यः स्तोमे॑भिर्वावृ॒धे पू॒र्व्येभि॒र्यो म॑ध्य॒मेभि॑रु॒त नूत॑नेभिः
stanzas.transliteration: yajñénéndram ávasā́ cakre arvā́g aínaṃ sumnā́ya návyase vavr̥tyām yá stómebhir vāvr̥dhé pūrvyébhir yó madhyamébhir utá nū́tanebhiḥ
stanzas.translation: With sacrifice and wish have I brought Indra; still for new blessings may I turn him hither, Him magnified by ancient songs and praises, by lauds of later time and days yet recent.

translations.griffith: With sacrifice and wish have I brought Indra; still for new blessings may I turn him hither, Him magnified by ancient songs and praises, by lauds of later time and days yet recent.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒वेष॒ यन्मा॑ धि॒षणा॑ ज॒जान॒ स्तवै॑ पु॒रा पार्या॒दिन्द्र॒मह्नः॑ अंह॑सो॒ यत्र॑ पी॒पर॒द्यथा॑ नो ना॒वेव॒ यान्त॑मु॒भये॑ हवन्ते
stanzas.transliteration: vivéṣa yán mā dhiṣáṇā jajā́na stávai purā́ pā́ryād índram áhnaḥ áṃhaso yátra pīpárad yáthā no nāvéva yā́ntam ubháye havante
stanzas.translation: I have brought forth a song when longing seized me: ere the decisive day will I laud Indra; Then may lie safely bear us over trouble, as in a ship, when both sides invocate him.

translations.griffith: I have brought forth a song when longing seized me: ere the decisive day will I laud Indra; Then may lie safely bear us over trouble, as in a ship, when both sides invocate him.

stanzas.sanskrit: आपू॑र्णो अस्य क॒लशः॒ स्वाहा॒ सेक्ते॑व॒ कोशं॑ सिसिचे॒ पिब॑ध्यै समु॑ प्रि॒या आव॑वृत्र॒न्मदा॑य प्रदक्षि॒णिद॒भि सोमा॑स॒ इन्द्र॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́pūrṇo asya kaláśaḥ svā́hā sékteva kóśaṃ sisice píbadhyai sám u priyā́ ā́vavr̥tran mádāya pradakṣiṇíd abhí sómāsa índram
stanzas.translation: Full is his chalice: Glory! Like a pourer I have filled up the vessel for his drinking. Presented on the right, dear Soma juices have brought us Indra, to rejoice him, hither.

translations.griffith: Full is his chalice: Glory! Like a pourer I have filled up the vessel for his drinking. Presented on the right, dear Soma juices have brought us Indra, to rejoice him, hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: न त्वा॑ गभी॒रः पु॑रुहूत॒ सिन्धु॒र्नाद्र॑यः॒ परि॒ षन्तो॑ वरन्त इ॒त्था सखि॑भ्य इषि॒तो यदि॒न्द्रा दृ॒ळ्हं चि॒दरु॑जो॒ गव्य॑मू॒र्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: ná tvā gabhīráḥ puruhūta síndhur nā́drayaḥ pári ṣánto varanta itthā́ sákhibhya iṣitó yád indra- -ā́ dr̥ḷháṃ cid árujo gávyam ūrvám
stanzas.translation: Not the deep-flowing flood, O Much-invoked One! not hills that compass thee about restrain thee, Since here incited, for thy friends, O Indra, thou breakest e'en the firm built stall of cattle.

translations.griffith: Not the deep-flowing flood, O Much-invoked One! not hills that compass thee about restrain thee, Since here incited, for thy friends, O Indra, thou breakest e'en the firm built stall of cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र पर्व॑तानामुश॒ती उ॒पस्था॒दश्वे॑ इव॒ विषि॑ते॒ हास॑माने गावे॑व शु॒भ्रे मा॒तरा॑ रिहा॒णे विपा॑ट् छुतु॒द्री पय॑सा जवेते
stanzas.transliteration: prá párvatānām uśatī́ upásthād áśve iva víṣite hā́samāne gā́veva śubhré mātárā rihāṇé vípāṭ chutudrī́ páyasā javete
stanzas.translation: FORTH from the bosom of the mountains, eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending, Like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling, Vipâṣ and Ṣutudrî speed down their waters.

translations.griffith: FORTH from the bosom of the mountains, eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending, Like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling, Vipâṣ and Ṣutudrî speed down their waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रे॑षिते प्रस॒वं भिक्ष॑माणे॒ अच्छा॑ समु॒द्रं र॒थ्ये॑व याथः स॒मा॒रा॒णे ऊ॒र्मिभिः॒ पिन्व॑माने अ॒न्या वा॑म॒न्यामप्ये॑ति शुभ्रे
stanzas.transliteration: índreṣite prasavám bhíkṣamāṇe áchā samudráṃ rathyèva yāthaḥ samārāṇé ūrmíbhiḥ pínvamāne anyā́ vām anyā́m ápy eti śubhre
stanzas.translation: Impelled by Indra whom ye pray to urge you, ye move as 'twere on chariots to the ocean. Flowing together, swelling with your billows, O lucid Streams, each of you seeks the other.

translations.griffith: Impelled by Indra whom ye pray to urge you, ye move as 'twere on chariots to the ocean. Flowing together, swelling with your billows, O lucid Streams, each of you seeks the other.

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॒ सिन्धुं॑ मा॒तृत॑मामयासं॒ विपा॑शमु॒र्वीं सु॒भगा॑मगन्म व॒त्समि॑व मा॒तरा॑ संरिहा॒णे स॑मा॒नं योनि॒मनु॑ सं॒चर॑न्ती
stanzas.transliteration: áchā síndhum mātŕ̥tamām ayāsaṃ vípāśam urvī́ṃ subhágām aganma vatsám iva mātárā saṃrihāṇé samānáṃ yónim ánu saṃcárantī
stanzas.translation: I have attained the most maternal River, we have approached Vipâṣ, the broad, the blessed. Licking as 'twere their calf the pair of Mothers flow onward to their common home together.

translations.griffith: I have attained the most maternal River, we have approached Vipâṣ, the broad, the blessed. Licking as 'twere their calf the pair of Mothers flow onward to their common home together.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ना व॒यं पय॑सा॒ पिन्व॑माना॒ अनु॒ योनिं॑ दे॒वकृ॑तं॒ चर॑न्तीः न वर्त॑वे प्रस॒वः सर्ग॑तक्तः किं॒युर्विप्रो॑ न॒द्यो॑ जोहवीति
stanzas.transliteration: enā́ vayám páyasā pínvamānāḥ- ánu yóniṃ devákr̥taṃ cárantīḥ ná vártave prasaváḥ sárgataktaḥ kiṃyúr vípro nadyò johavīti
stanzas.translation: We two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which Gods have made us. Our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion. What would the singer, calling to the Rivers?

translations.griffith: We two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which Gods have made us. Our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion. What would the singer, calling to the Rivers?

stanzas.sanskrit: रम॑ध्वं मे॒ वच॑से सो॒म्याय॒ ऋता॑वरी॒रुप॑ मुहू॒र्तमेवैः॑ प्र सिन्धु॒मच्छा॑ बृह॒ती म॑नी॒षाव॒स्युर॑ह्वे कुशि॒कस्य॑ सू॒नुः
stanzas.transliteration: rámadhvam me vácase somyā́ya ŕ̥tāvarīr úpa muhūrtám évaiḥ prá síndhum áchā br̥hatī́ manīṣā́- -avasyúr ahve kuśikásya sūnúḥ
stanzas.translation: Linger a little at my friendly bidding rest, Holy Ones, a moment in your journey. With hymn sublime soliciting your favour Kuṣika's son hath called unto the River.

translations.griffith: Linger a little at my friendly bidding rest, Holy Ones, a moment in your journey. With hymn sublime soliciting your favour Kuṣika's son hath called unto the River.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॑ अ॒स्माँ अ॑रद॒द्वज्र॑बाहु॒रपा॑हन्वृ॒त्रं प॑रि॒धिं न॒दीना॑म् दे॒वो॑ऽनयत्सवि॒ता सु॑पा॒णिस्तस्य॑ व॒यं प्र॑स॒वे या॑म उ॒र्वीः
stanzas.transliteration: índro asmā́m̐ aradad vájrabāhur ápāhan vr̥trám paridhíṃ nadī́nām devò 'nayat savitā́ supāṇís tásya vayám prasavé yāma urvī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra who wields the thunder dug our channels: he smote down Vr̥itra, him who stayed our currents. Savitar, God, the lovely-handed, led us, and at his sending forth we flow expanded.

translations.griffith: Indra who wields the thunder dug our channels: he smote down Vr̥itra, him who stayed our currents. Savitar, God, the lovely-handed, led us, and at his sending forth we flow expanded.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒वाच्यं॑ शश्व॒धा वी॒र्यं१॒॑ तदिन्द्र॑स्य॒ कर्म॒ यदहिं॑ विवृ॒श्चत् वि वज्रे॑ण परि॒षदो॑ जघा॒नाय॒न्नापोऽय॑नमि॒च्छमा॑नाः
stanzas.transliteration: pravā́cyaṃ śaśvadhā́ vīryàṃ tád índrasya kárma yád áhiṃ vivr̥ścát ví vájreṇa pariṣádo jaghāna- -ā́yann ā́pó 'yanam ichámānāḥ
stanzas.translation: That hero deed of Indra must be lauded for ever that he rent Ahi in pieces. He smote away the obstructors with his thunder, and eager for their course forth flowed the waters.

translations.griffith: That hero deed of Indra must be lauded for ever that he rent Ahi in pieces. He smote away the obstructors with his thunder, and eager for their course forth flowed the waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒तद्वचो॑ जरित॒र्मापि॑ मृष्ठा॒ आ यत्ते॒ घोषा॒नुत्त॑रा यु॒गानि॑ उ॒क्थेषु॑ कारो॒ प्रति॑ नो जुषस्व॒ मा नो॒ नि कः॑ पुरुष॒त्रा नम॑स्ते
stanzas.transliteration: etád váco jaritar mā́pi mr̥ṣṭhāḥ- ā́ yát te ghóṣān úttarā yugā́ni ukthéṣu kāro práti no juṣasva mā́ no ní kaḥ puruṣatrā́ námas te
stanzas.translation: Never forget this word of thine, O singer, which future generations shall reecho. In hymns, O bard, show us thy loving kindness. Humble us not mid men. To thee be honour!

translations.griffith: Never forget this word of thine, O singer, which future generations shall reecho. In hymns, O bard, show us thy loving kindness. Humble us not mid men. To thee be honour!

stanzas.sanskrit: ओ षु स्व॑सारः का॒रवे॑ शृणोत य॒यौ वो॑ दू॒रादन॑सा॒ रथे॑न नि षू न॑मध्वं॒ भव॑ता सुपा॒रा अ॑धोअ॒क्षाः सि॑न्धवः स्रो॒त्याभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ó ṣú svasāraḥ kāráve śr̥ṇota yayaú vo dūrā́d ánasā ráthena ní ṣū́ namadhvam bhávatā supārā́ḥ- adhoakṣā́ḥ sindhavaḥ srotyā́bhiḥ
stanzas.translation: List quickly, Sisters, to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon. Bow lowly down; be easy to be traversed stay, Rivers, with your floods below our axles.

translations.griffith: List quickly, Sisters, to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon. Bow lowly down; be easy to be traversed stay, Rivers, with your floods below our axles.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॑ कारो शृणवामा॒ वचां॑सि य॒याथ॑ दू॒रादन॑सा॒ रथे॑न नि ते॑ नंसै पीप्या॒नेव॒ योषा॒ मर्या॑येव क॒न्या॑ शश्व॒चै ते॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te kāro śr̥ṇavāmā vácāṃsi yayā́tha dūrā́d ánasā ráthena ní te naṃsai pīpyānéva yóṣā máryāyeva kanyā̀ śaśvacaí te
stanzas.translation: Yea, we will listen to thy words, O singer. With wain and car from far away thou comest. Low, like a nursing mother, will I bend me, and yield me as a maiden to her lover.

translations.griffith: Yea, we will listen to thy words, O singer. With wain and car from far away thou comest. Low, like a nursing mother, will I bend me, and yield me as a maiden to her lover.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद॒ङ्ग त्वा॑ भर॒ताः सं॒तरे॑युर्ग॒व्यन्ग्राम॑ इषि॒त इन्द्र॑जूतः अर्षा॒दह॑ प्रस॒वः सर्ग॑तक्त॒ आ वो॑ वृणे सुम॒तिं य॒ज्ञिया॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: yád aṅgá tvā bharatā́ḥ saṃtáreyur gavyán grā́ma iṣitá índrajūtaḥ árṣād áha prasaváḥ sárgataktaḥ- ā́ vo vr̥ṇe sumatíṃ yajñíyānām
stanzas.translation: Soon as the Bharatas have fared across thee, the warrior band, urged on and sped by Indra, Then let your streams flow on in rapid motion. I crave your favour who deserve our worship.

translations.griffith: Soon as the Bharatas have fared across thee, the warrior band, urged on and sped by Indra, Then let your streams flow on in rapid motion. I crave your favour who deserve our worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: अता॑रिषुर्भर॒ता ग॒व्यवः॒ समभ॑क्त॒ विप्रः॑ सुम॒तिं न॒दीना॑म् प्र पि॑न्वध्वमि॒षय॑न्तीः सु॒राधा॒ आ व॒क्षणाः॑ पृ॒णध्वं॑ या॒त शीभ॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: átāriṣur bharatā́ gavyávaḥ sám ábhakta vípraḥ sumatíṃ nadī́nām prá pinvadhvam iṣáyantīḥ surā́dhāḥ- ā́ vakṣáṇāḥ pr̥ṇádhvaṃ yātá śī́bham
stanzas.translation: The warrior host, the Bharatas, fared over the singer won the favour of the Rivers. Swell with your billows, hasting, pouring riches. Fill full your channels, and roll swiftly onward.

translations.griffith: The warrior host, the Bharatas, fared over the singer won the favour of the Rivers. Swell with your billows, hasting, pouring riches. Fill full your channels, and roll swiftly onward.

stanzas.sanskrit: उद्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिः शम्या॑ ह॒न्त्वापो॒ योक्त्रा॑णि मुञ्चत मादु॑ष्कृतौ॒ व्ये॑नसा॒घ्न्यौ शून॒मार॑ताम्
stanzas.transliteration: úd va ūrmíḥ śámyā hantu- ā́po yóktrāṇi muñcata mā́duṣkr̥tau vyènasā- -aghnyaú śū́nam ā́ratām
stanzas.translation: So let your wave bear up the pins, and ye, O Waters, spare the thongs; And never may the pair of Bulls, harmless and sinless, waste away.

translations.griffith: So let your wave bear up the pins, and ye, O Waters, spare the thongs; And never may the pair of Bulls, harmless and sinless, waste away.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रः॑ पू॒र्भिदाति॑र॒द्दास॑म॒र्कैर्वि॒दद्व॑सु॒र्दय॑मानो॒ वि शत्रू॑न् ब्रह्म॑जूतस्त॒न्वा॑ वावृधा॒नो भूरि॑दात्र॒ आपृ॑ण॒द्रोद॑सी उ॒भे
stanzas.transliteration: índraḥ pūrbhíd ā́tirad dā́sam arkaír vidádvasur dáyamāno ví śátrūn bráhmajūtas tanvā̀ vāvr̥dhānó bhū́ridātra ā́pr̥ṇad ródasī ubhé
stanzas.translation: FORT-RENDER, Lord of Wealth, dispelling foemen, Indra with lightnings hath o'ercome the Dâsa. Impelled by prayer and waxen great in body, he hath filled earth and heaven, the Bounteous Giver.

translations.griffith: FORT-RENDER, Lord of Wealth, dispelling foemen, Indra with lightnings hath o'ercome the Dâsa. Impelled by prayer and waxen great in body, he hath filled earth and heaven, the Bounteous Giver.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒खस्य॑ ते तवि॒षस्य॒ प्र जू॒तिमिय॑र्मि॒ वाच॑म॒मृता॑य॒ भूष॑न् इन्द्र॑ क्षिती॒नाम॑सि॒ मानु॑षीणां वि॒शां दैवी॑नामु॒त पू॑र्व॒यावा॑
stanzas.transliteration: makhásya te taviṣásya prá jūtím íyarmi vā́cam amŕ̥tāya bhū́ṣan índra kṣitīnā́m asi mā́nuṣīṇāṃ viśā́ṃ daívīnām utá pūrvayā́vā
stanzas.translation: I stimulate thy zeal, the Strong, the Hero decking my song of praise forth; Immortal. O Indra, thou art equally the Leader of heavenly hosts and human generations.

translations.griffith: I stimulate thy zeal, the Strong, the Hero decking my song of praise forth; Immortal. O Indra, thou art equally the Leader of heavenly hosts and human generations.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्रम॑वृणो॒च्छर्ध॑नीतिः॒ प्र मा॒यिना॑ममिना॒द्वर्प॑णीतिः अह॒न्व्यं॑समु॒शध॒ग्वने॑ष्वा॒विर्धेना॑ अकृणोद्रा॒म्याणा॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: índro vr̥trám avr̥ṇoc chárdhanītiḥ prá māyínām aminād várpaṇītiḥ áhan vyàṃsam uśádhag váneṣu- āvír dhénā akr̥ṇod rāmyā́ṇām
stanzas.translation: Leading, his band Indra encompassed Vr̥itra; weak grew the wily leader of enchanters. He who burns fierce in forests slaughtered Vyansa, and made the Milch-kine of the nights apparent.

translations.griffith: Leading, his band Indra encompassed Vr̥itra; weak grew the wily leader of enchanters. He who burns fierce in forests slaughtered Vyansa, and made the Milch-kine of the nights apparent.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रः॑ स्व॒र्षा ज॒नय॒न्नहा॑नि जि॒गायो॒शिग्भिः॒ पृत॑ना अभि॒ष्टिः प्रारो॑चय॒न्मन॑वे के॒तुमह्ना॒मवि॑न्द॒ज्ज्योति॑र्बृह॒ते रणा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: índraḥ svarṣā́ janáyann áhāni jigā́yośígbhiḥ pŕ̥tanā abhiṣṭíḥ prā́rocayan mánave ketúm áhnām ávindaj jyótir br̥haté ráṇāya
stanzas.translation: Indra, light-winner, days' Creator, conquered, victorious, hostile bands with those who loved him. For man the days' bright ensign he illumined, and found the light for his joy and gladness.

translations.griffith: Indra, light-winner, days' Creator, conquered, victorious, hostile bands with those who loved him. For man the days' bright ensign he illumined, and found the light for his joy and gladness.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒स्तुजो॑ ब॒र्हणा॒ आ वि॑वेश नृ॒वद्दधा॑नो॒ नर्या॑ पु॒रूणि॑ अचे॑तय॒द्धिय॑ इ॒मा ज॑रि॒त्रे प्रेमं वर्ण॑मतिरच्छु॒क्रमा॑साम्
stanzas.transliteration: índras tújo barháṇā ā́ viveśa nr̥vád dádhāno náryā purū́ṇi ácetayad dhíya imā́ jaritré prémáṃ várṇam atirac chukrám āsām
stanzas.translation: Forward to fiercely falling blows pressed Indra, herolike doing many hero exploits. These holy songs he taught the bard who gaised him, and widely spread these Dawns' resplendent colour.

translations.griffith: Forward to fiercely falling blows pressed Indra, herolike doing many hero exploits. These holy songs he taught the bard who gaised him, and widely spread these Dawns' resplendent colour.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हो म॒हानि॑ पनयन्त्य॒स्येन्द्र॑स्य॒ कर्म॒ सुकृ॑ता पु॒रूणि॑ वृ॒जने॑न वृजि॒नान्त्सं पि॑पेष मा॒याभि॒र्दस्यूँ॑र॒भिभू॑त्योजाः
stanzas.transliteration: mahó mahā́ni panayanty asya- índrasya kárma súkr̥tā purū́ṇi vr̥jánena vr̥jinā́n sám pipeṣa māyā́bhir dásyūm̐r abhíbhūtyojāḥ
stanzas.translation: They laud the mighty acts of him the Mighty, the many glorious deeds performed by Indra. He in his strength, with all-surpassing prowess, through wondrous arts crushed the malignant Dasyus.

translations.griffith: They laud the mighty acts of him the Mighty, the many glorious deeds performed by Indra. He in his strength, with all-surpassing prowess, through wondrous arts crushed the malignant Dasyus.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒धेन्द्रो॑ म॒ह्ना वरि॑वश्चकार दे॒वेभ्यः॒ सत्प॑तिश्चर्षणि॒प्राः वि॒वस्व॑तः॒ सद॑ने अस्य॒ तानि॒ विप्रा॑ उ॒क्थेभिः॑ क॒वयो॑ गृणन्ति
stanzas.transliteration: yudhéndro mahnā́ várivaś cakāra devébhyaḥ sátpatiś carṣaṇiprā́ḥ vivásvataḥ sádane asya tā́ni víprā ukthébhiḥ kaváyo gr̥ṇanti
stanzas.translation: Lord of the brave, Indra who rules the people gave freedom to the Gods by might and battle. Wise singers glorify with chanted praises these his achievements in Vivasvan's dwelling.

translations.griffith: Lord of the brave, Indra who rules the people gave freedom to the Gods by might and battle. Wise singers glorify with chanted praises these his achievements in Vivasvan's dwelling.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्रा॒साहं॒ वरे॑ण्यं सहो॒दां स॑स॒वांसं॒ स्व॑र॒पश्च॑ दे॒वीः स॒सान॒ यः पृ॑थि॒वीं द्यामु॒तेमामिन्द्रं॑ मद॒न्त्यनु॒ धीर॑णासः
stanzas.transliteration: satrāsā́haṃ váreṇyaṃ sahodā́ṃ sasavā́ṃsaṃ svàr apáś ca devī́ḥ sasā́na yáḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m utémā́m índram madanty ánu dhī́raṇāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: Excellent, Conqueror, the victory-giver, the winner of the light and Godlike Waters, He who hath won this broad earth and this heaven, -in Indra they rejoice who love devotions.

translations.griffith: Excellent, Conqueror, the victory-giver, the winner of the light and Godlike Waters, He who hath won this broad earth and this heaven, -in Indra they rejoice who love devotions.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒सानात्याँ॑ उ॒त सूर्यं॑ ससा॒नेन्द्रः॑ ससान पुरु॒भोज॑सं॒ गाम् हि॒र॒ण्यय॑मु॒त भोगं॑ ससान ह॒त्वी दस्यू॒न्प्रार्यं॒ वर्ण॑मावत्
stanzas.transliteration: sasā́nā́tyām̐ utá sū́ryaṃ sasāna- -índraḥ sasāna purubhójasaṃ gā́m hiraṇyáyam utá bhógaṃ sasāna hatvī́ dásyūn prā́ryaṃ várṇam āvat
stanzas.translation: He gained possession of the Sun and Horses, Indra obtained the Cow who feedeth many. Treasure of gold he won; he smote the Dasyus, and gave protection to the Aryan colour.

translations.griffith: He gained possession of the Sun and Horses, Indra obtained the Cow who feedeth many. Treasure of gold he won; he smote the Dasyus, and gave protection to the Aryan colour.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ ओष॑धीरसनो॒दहा॑नि॒ वन॒स्पतीँ॑रसनोद॒न्तरि॑क्षम् बि॒भेद॑ व॒लं नु॑नु॒दे विवा॒चोऽथा॑भवद्दमि॒ताभिक्र॑तूनाम्
stanzas.transliteration: índra óṣadhīr asanod áhāni vánaspátīm̐r asanod antárikṣam bibhéda valáṃ nunudé vívācaḥ- -áthābhavad damitā́bhíkratūnām
stanzas.translation: He took the plants and days for his possession; he gained the forest trees and air's mid-region. Vala he cleft, and chased away opponents: thus was he tamer of the overweening.

translations.griffith: He took the plants and days for his possession; he gained the forest trees and air's mid-region. Vala he cleft, and chased away opponents: thus was he tamer of the overweening.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers treasures.

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers treasures.

stanzas.sanskrit: तिष्ठा॒ हरी॒ रथ॒ आ यु॒ज्यमा॑ना या॒हि वा॒युर्न नि॒युतो॑ नो॒ अच्छ॑ पिबा॒स्यन्धो॑ अ॒भिसृ॑ष्टो अ॒स्मे इन्द्र॒ स्वाहा॑ ररि॒मा ते॒ मदा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: tíṣṭhā hárī rátha ā́ yujyámānā yāhí vāyúr ná niyúto no ácha píbāsy ándho abhísr̥ṣṭo asmé índra svā́hā rarimā́ te mádāya
stanzas.translation: MOUNT the Bay Horses to thy chariot harnessed, and come to us like Vâyu with his coursers. Thou, hastening to us, shalt drink the Soma. Hail, Indra. We have poured it for thy rapture.

translations.griffith: MOUNT the Bay Horses to thy chariot harnessed, and come to us like Vâyu with his coursers. Thou, hastening to us, shalt drink the Soma. Hail, Indra. We have poured it for thy rapture.

stanzas.sanskrit: उपा॑जि॒रा पु॑रुहू॒ताय॒ सप्ती॒ हरी॒ रथ॑स्य धू॒र्ष्वा यु॑नज्मि द्र॒वद्यथा॒ सम्भृ॑तं वि॒श्वत॑श्चि॒दुपे॒मं य॒ज्ञमा व॑हात॒ इन्द्र॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: úpājirā́ puruhūtā́ya sáptī hárī ráthasya dhūrṣv ā́ yunajmi dravád yáthā sámbhr̥taṃ viśvátaś cid úpemáṃ yajñám ā́ vahāta índram
stanzas.translation: For him, the God who is invoked by many, the two swift Bay Steeds to the pole I harness, That they in fleet course may bring Indra hither, e'en to this sacrifice arranged completely.

translations.griffith: For him, the God who is invoked by many, the two swift Bay Steeds to the pole I harness, That they in fleet course may bring Indra hither, e'en to this sacrifice arranged completely.

stanzas.sanskrit: उपो॑ नयस्व॒ वृष॑णा तपु॒ष्पोतेम॑व॒ त्वं वृ॑षभ स्वधावः ग्रसे॑ता॒मश्वा॒ वि मु॑चे॒ह शोणा॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे स॒दृशी॑रद्धि धा॒नाः
stanzas.transliteration: úpo nayasva vŕ̥ṣaṇā tapuṣpā́- -utém ava tváṃ vr̥ṣabha svadhāvaḥ grásetām áśvā ví mucehá śóṇā divé-dive sadŕ̥śīr addhi dhānā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Bring the strong Steeds who drink the warm libation, and, Bull of Godlike nature, be thou gracious. Let thy Steeds eat; set free thy Tawny Horses, and roasted grain like this consume thou daily.

translations.griffith: Bring the strong Steeds who drink the warm libation, and, Bull of Godlike nature, be thou gracious. Let thy Steeds eat; set free thy Tawny Horses, and roasted grain like this consume thou daily.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब्रह्म॑णा ते ब्रह्म॒युजा॑ युनज्मि॒ हरी॒ सखा॑या सध॒माद॑ आ॒शू स्थि॒रं रथं॑ सु॒खमि॑न्द्राधि॒तिष्ठ॑न्प्रजा॒नन्वि॒द्वाँ उप॑ याहि॒ सोम॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: bráhmaṇā te brahmayújā yunajmi hárī sákhāyā sadhamā́da āśū́ sthiráṃ ráthaṃ sukhám indrādhitíṣṭhan prajānán vidvā́m̐ úpa yāhi sómam
stanzas.translation: Those who are yoked by prayer I harness, fleet friendly Bays who take their joy together. Mounting thy firm and easy car, O Indra, wise and all-knowing come thou to the Soma.

translations.griffith: Those who are yoked by prayer I harness, fleet friendly Bays who take their joy together. Mounting thy firm and easy car, O Indra, wise and all-knowing come thou to the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा ते॒ हरी॒ वृष॑णा वी॒तपृ॑ष्ठा॒ नि री॑रम॒न्यज॑मानासो अ॒न्ये अ॒त्याया॑हि॒ शश्व॑तो व॒यं तेऽरं॑ सु॒तेभिः॑ कृणवाम॒ सोमैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ te hárī vŕ̥ṣaṇā vītápr̥ṣṭhā ní rīraman yájamānāso anyé atyā́yāhi śáśvato vayáṃ te- -áraṃ sutébhiḥ kr̥ṇavāma sómaiḥ
stanzas.translation: No other worshippers must stay beside them thy Bays, thy vigorous and smooth-backed Coursers. Pass by them all and hasten onward hither: with Soma pressed we will prepare to feast thee.

translations.griffith: No other worshippers must stay beside them thy Bays, thy vigorous and smooth-backed Coursers. Pass by them all and hasten onward hither: with Soma pressed we will prepare to feast thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: तवा॒यं सोम॒स्त्वमेह्य॒र्वाङ्छ॑श्वत्त॒मं सु॒मना॑ अ॒स्य पा॑हि अ॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे ब॒र्हिष्या नि॒षद्या॑ दधि॒ष्वेमं ज॒ठर॒ इन्दु॑मिन्द्र
stanzas.transliteration: távāyáṃ sómas tvám éhy arvā́ṅ -śaśvattamáṃ sumánā asyá pāhi asmín yajñé barhíṣy ā́ niṣádyā dadhiṣvémáṃ jaṭhára índum indra
stanzas.translation: Thine is this Sorna: hasten to approach it. Drink thou thereof, benevolent, and cease not. Sit on the sacred grass at this our worship, and take these drops into thy belly, Indra.

translations.griffith: Thine is this Sorna: hasten to approach it. Drink thou thereof, benevolent, and cease not. Sit on the sacred grass at this our worship, and take these drops into thy belly, Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्ती॒र्णं ते॑ ब॒र्हिः सु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ सोमः॑ कृ॒ता धा॒ना अत्त॑वे ते॒ हरि॑भ्याम् तदो॑कसे पुरु॒शाका॑य॒ वृष्णे॑ म॒रुत्व॑ते॒ तुभ्यं॑ रा॒ता ह॒वींषि॑
stanzas.transliteration: stīrṇáṃ te barhíḥ sutá indra sómaḥ kr̥tā́ dhānā́ áttave te háribhyām tádokase puruśā́kāya vŕ̥ṣṇe marútvate túbhyaṃ rātā́ havī́ṃṣi
stanzas.translation: The grass is strewn for thee, pressed is the Soma; the grain is ready for thy Bays to feed on. To thee who lovest them, the very mighty, strong, girt by Maruts, are these gifts presented.

translations.griffith: The grass is strewn for thee, pressed is the Soma; the grain is ready for thy Bays to feed on. To thee who lovest them, the very mighty, strong, girt by Maruts, are these gifts presented.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं नरः॒ पर्व॑ता॒स्तुभ्य॒मापः॒ समि॑न्द्र॒ गोभि॒र्मधु॑मन्तमक्रन् तस्या॒गत्या॑ सु॒मना॑ ऋष्व पाहि प्रजा॒नन्वि॒द्वान्प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ अनु॒ स्वाः
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ náraḥ párvatās túbhyam ā́paḥ sám indra góbhir mádhumantam akran tásyāgátyā sumánā r̥ṣva pāhi prajānán vidvā́n pathyā̀ ánu svā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: This the sweet draught, with cows, the men, the mountains, the waters, Indra, have for thee made ready. Come, drink thereof, Sublime One, friendly-minded, foreseeing, knowing well the ways thou goest.

translations.griffith: This the sweet draught, with cows, the men, the mountains, the waters, Indra, have for thee made ready. Come, drink thereof, Sublime One, friendly-minded, foreseeing, knowing well the ways thou goest.

stanzas.sanskrit: याँ आभ॑जो म॒रुत॑ इन्द्र॒ सोमे॒ ये त्वामव॑र्ध॒न्नभ॑वन्ग॒णस्ते॑ तेभि॑रे॒तं स॒जोषा॑ वावशा॒नो॒३॒॑ऽग्नेः पि॑ब जि॒ह्वया॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र
stanzas.transliteration: yā́m̐ ā́bhajo marúta indra sóme yé tvā́m ávardhann ábhavan gaṇás te tébhir etáṃ sajóṣā vāvaśānáḥ- -agnéḥ piba jihváyā sómam indra
stanzas.translation: The Maruts, they with whom thou sharedst Soma, Indra, who made thee strong and were thine army,– With these accordant, eagerly desirous drink thou this Soma with the tongue of Agni.

translations.griffith: The Maruts, they with whom thou sharedst Soma, Indra, who made thee strong and were thine army,– With these accordant, eagerly desirous drink thou this Soma with the tongue of Agni.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ पिब॑ स्व॒धया॑ चित्सु॒तस्या॒ग्नेर्वा॑ पाहि जि॒ह्वया॑ यजत्र अ॒ध्व॒र्योर्वा॒ प्रय॑तं शक्र॒ हस्ता॒द्धोतु॑र्वा य॒ज्ञं ह॒विषो॑ जुषस्व
stanzas.transliteration: índra píba svadháyā cit sutásya- -agnér vā pāhi jihváyā yajatra adhvaryór vā práyataṃ śakra hástād -hótur vā yajñáṃ havíṣo juṣasva
stanzas.translation: Drink, Indra, of the juice by thine own nature, or by the tongue of Agni, O thou Holy. Accept the sacrificial gift, O Ṣakra, from the Adhvaryu's hand or from the Hotar's.

translations.griffith: Drink, Indra, of the juice by thine own nature, or by the tongue of Agni, O thou Holy. Accept the sacrificial gift, O Ṣakra, from the Adhvaryu's hand or from the Hotar's.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who.gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who.gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मामू॒ षु प्रभृ॑तिं सा॒तये॑ धाः॒ शश्व॑च्छश्वदू॒तिभि॒र्याद॑मानः सु॒तेसु॑ते वावृधे॒ वर्ध॑नेभि॒र्यः कर्म॑भिर्म॒हद्भिः॒ सुश्रु॑तो॒ भूत्
stanzas.transliteration: imā́m ū ṣú prábhr̥tiṃ sātáye dhāḥ śáśvac-chaśvad ūtíbhir yā́damānaḥ suté-sute vāvr̥dhe várdhanebhir yáḥ kármabhir mahádbhiḥ súśruto bhū́t
stanzas.translation: WITH constant succours, fain thyself to share it, make this oblation which we bring effective. Grown great through strengthening gifts at each libation, he hath become renowned by mighty exploits.

translations.griffith: WITH constant succours, fain thyself to share it, make this oblation which we bring effective. Grown great through strengthening gifts at each libation, he hath become renowned by mighty exploits.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमाः॑ प्र॒दिवो॒ विदा॑ना ऋ॒भुर्येभि॒र्वृष॑पर्वा॒ विहा॑याः प्र॒य॒म्यमा॑ना॒न्प्रति॒ षू गृ॑भा॒येन्द्र॒ पिब॒ वृष॑धूतस्य॒ वृष्णः॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāya sómāḥ pradívo vídānāḥ- r̥bhúr yébhir vŕ̥ṣaparvā víhāyāḥ prayamyámānān práti ṣū́ gr̥bhāya- -índra píba vŕ̥ṣadhūtasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: For Indra were the Somas erst- discovered, whereby he grew strong-jointed, vast, and skilful. Indra , take quickly these presented juices: drink of the strong, that which the strong have shaken.

translations.griffith: For Indra were the Somas erst- discovered, whereby he grew strong-jointed, vast, and skilful. Indra , take quickly these presented juices: drink of the strong, that which the strong have shaken.

stanzas.sanskrit: पिबा॒ वर्ध॑स्व॒ तव॑ घा सु॒तास॒ इन्द्र॒ सोमा॑सः प्रथ॒मा उ॒तेमे यथापि॑बः पू॒र्व्याँ इ॑न्द्र॒ सोमाँ॑ ए॒वा पा॑हि॒ पन्यो॑ अ॒द्या नवी॑यान्
stanzas.transliteration: píbā várdhasva táva ghā sutā́saḥ- índra sómāsaḥ prathamā́ utémé yáthā́pibaḥ pūrvyā́m̐ indra sómām̐ evā́ pāhi pányo adyā́ návīyān
stanzas.translation: Drink and wax great. Thine are the juices, Indra, both Somas of old time and these we bring thee. Even as thou drankest, Indra, earlier Somas, so drink to-day, a new guest, meet for praises.

translations.griffith: Drink and wax great. Thine are the juices, Indra, both Somas of old time and these we bring thee. Even as thou drankest, Indra, earlier Somas, so drink to-day, a new guest, meet for praises.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हाँ अम॑त्रो वृ॒जने॑ विर॒प्श्यु१॒॑ग्रं शवः॑ पत्यते धृ॒ष्ण्वोजः॑ नाह॑ विव्याच पृथि॒वी च॒नैनं॒ यत्सोमा॑सो॒ हर्य॑श्व॒मम॑न्दन्
stanzas.transliteration: mahā́m̐ ámatro vr̥jáne virapśī́- -ugráṃ śávaḥ patyate dhr̥ṣṇv ójaḥ nā́ha vivyāca pr̥thivī́ canaínaṃ yát sómāso háryaśvam ámandan
stanzas.translation: Great and impetuous, mighty-voiced in battle, surpassing power is his, and strength resistless. Him the broad earth hath never comprehended when Somas cheered the Lord of Tawny Coursers.

translations.griffith: Great and impetuous, mighty-voiced in battle, surpassing power is his, and strength resistless. Him the broad earth hath never comprehended when Somas cheered the Lord of Tawny Coursers.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हाँ उ॒ग्रो वा॑वृधे वी॒र्या॑य स॒माच॑क्रे वृष॒भः काव्ये॑न इन्द्रो॒ भगो॑ वाज॒दा अ॑स्य॒ गावः॒ प्र जा॑यन्ते॒ दक्षि॑णा अस्य पू॒र्वीः
stanzas.transliteration: mahā́m̐ ugró vāvr̥dhe vīryā̀ya samā́cakre vr̥ṣabháḥ kā́vyena índro bhágo vājadā́ asya gā́vaḥ prá jāyante dákṣiṇā asya pūrvī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Mighty and strong he waxed for hero exploit: the Bull was furnished a Sage's wisdom. Indra is our kind Lord; his steers have vigour; his cows are many with abundant offspring.

translations.griffith: Mighty and strong he waxed for hero exploit: the Bull was furnished a Sage's wisdom. Indra is our kind Lord; his steers have vigour; his cows are many with abundant offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र यत्सिन्ध॑वः प्रस॒वं यथाय॒न्नापः॑ समु॒द्रं र॒थ्ये॑व जग्मुः अत॑श्चि॒दिन्द्रः॒ सद॑सो॒ वरी॑या॒न्यदीं॒ सोमः॑ पृ॒णति॑ दु॒ग्धो अं॒शुः
stanzas.transliteration: prá yát síndhavaḥ prasaváṃ yáthā́yann ā́paḥ samudráṃ rathyèva jagmuḥ átaś cid índraḥ sádaso várīyān yád īṃ sómaḥ pr̥ṇáti dugdhó aṃśúḥ
stanzas.translation: As floods according to their stream flow onward, so to the sea, as borne on cars, the waters. Vaster is Indra even than his dwelling, what time the stalk milked out, the Soma, fills him.

translations.griffith: As floods according to their stream flow onward, so to the sea, as borne on cars, the waters. Vaster is Indra even than his dwelling, what time the stalk milked out, the Soma, fills him.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मु॒द्रेण॒ सिन्ध॑वो॒ याद॑माना॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमं॒ सुषु॑तं॒ भर॑न्तः अं॒शुं दु॑हन्ति ह॒स्तिनो॑ भ॒रित्रै॒र्मध्वः॑ पुनन्ति॒ धार॑या प॒वित्रैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: samudréṇa síndhavo yā́damānāḥ- índrāya sómaṃ súṣutam bhárantaḥ aṃśúṃ duhanti hastíno bharítrair mádhvaḥ punanti dhā́rayā pavítraiḥ
stanzas.translation: Eager to mingle with the sea, the rivers carry the well-pressed Soma juice to Indra. They drain the stalk out with their arms, quick-banded, and cleanse it with a stream of mead and filters.

translations.griffith: Eager to mingle with the sea, the rivers carry the well-pressed Soma juice to Indra. They drain the stalk out with their arms, quick-banded, and cleanse it with a stream of mead and filters.

stanzas.sanskrit: ह्र॒दा इ॑व कु॒क्षयः॑ सोम॒धानाः॒ समी॑ विव्याच॒ सव॑ना पु॒रूणि॑ अन्ना॒ यदिन्द्रः॑ प्रथ॒मा व्याश॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अ॑वृणीत॒ सोम॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: hradā́ iva kukṣáyaḥ somadhā́nāḥ sám ī vivyāca sávanā purū́ṇi ánnā yád índraḥ prathamā́ vy ā́śa vr̥tráṃ jaghanvā́m̐ avr̥ṇīta sómam
stanzas.translation: Like lakes appear his flanks filled full with Soma: yea, he contains libations in abundance. When Indra had consumed the first sweet viands, he, after slaying Vr̥itra, claimed the Soma.

translations.griffith: Like lakes appear his flanks filled full with Soma: yea, he contains libations in abundance. When Indra had consumed the first sweet viands, he, after slaying Vr̥itra, claimed the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ तू भ॑र॒ माकि॑रे॒तत्परि॑ ष्ठाद्वि॒द्मा हि त्वा॒ वसु॑पतिं॒ वसू॑नाम् इन्द्र॒ यत्ते॒ माहि॑नं॒ दत्र॒मस्त्य॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्ध॑र्यश्व॒ प्र य॑न्धि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ tū́ bhara mā́kir etát pári ṣṭhād vidmā́ hí tvā vásupatiṃ vásūnām índra yát te mā́hinaṃ dátram ásti- asmábhyaṃ tád dharyaśva prá yandhi
stanzas.translation: Then bring thou hither, and let none prevent it: we know thee well, the Lord of wealth and treasure. That splendid gift which is thine own, O Indra, vouchsafe to us, Lord of the Tawny Coursers.

translations.griffith: Then bring thou hither, and let none prevent it: we know thee well, the Lord of wealth and treasure. That splendid gift which is thine own, O Indra, vouchsafe to us, Lord of the Tawny Coursers.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मे प्र य॑न्धि मघवन्नृजीषि॒न्निन्द्र॑ रा॒यो वि॒श्ववा॑रस्य॒ भूरेः॑ अ॒स्मे श॒तं श॒रदो॑ जी॒वसे॑ धा अ॒स्मे वी॒राञ्छश्व॑त इन्द्र शिप्रिन्
stanzas.transliteration: asmé prá yandhi maghavann r̥jīṣinn índra rāyó viśvávārasya bhū́reḥ asmé śatáṃ śarádo jīváse dhāḥ- asmé vīrā́ñ cháśvata indra śiprin
stanzas.translation: O Indra, Maghavan, impetuous mover, grant us abundant wealth that brings all blessings. Give us a hundred autumns for our lifetime: give us, O fair-checked Indra, store of heroes.

translations.griffith: O Indra, Maghavan, impetuous mover, grant us abundant wealth that brings all blessings. Give us a hundred autumns for our lifetime: give us, O fair-checked Indra, store of heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: वार्त्र॑हत्याय॒ शव॑से पृतना॒षाह्या॑य च इन्द्र॒ त्वा व॑र्तयामसि
stanzas.transliteration: vā́rtrahatyāya śávase pr̥tanāṣā́hyāya ca índra tvā́ vartayāmasi
stanzas.translation: O INDRA, for the strength that slays Vr̥itra and conquers in the fight, We turn thee hitherward to us.

translations.griffith: O INDRA, for the strength that slays Vr̥itra and conquers in the fight, We turn thee hitherward to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्वा॒चीनं॒ सु ते॒ मन॑ उ॒त चक्षुः॑ शतक्रतो इन्द्र॑ कृ॒ण्वन्तु॑ वा॒घतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: arvācī́naṃ sú te máno utá cákṣuḥ śatakrato índra kr̥ṇvántu vāghátaḥ
stanzas.translation: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, may those who praise thee hitherward. Direct thy spirit and thine eye.

translations.griffith: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, may those who praise thee hitherward. Direct thy spirit and thine eye.

stanzas.sanskrit: नामा॑नि ते शतक्रतो॒ विश्वा॑भिर्गी॒र्भिरी॑महे इन्द्रा॑भिमाति॒षाह्ये॑
stanzas.transliteration: nā́māni te śatakrato víśvābhir gīrbhír īmahe índrābhimātiṣā́hye
stanzas.translation: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, with all our songs we invocate Thy names for triumph over foes.

translations.griffith: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, with all our songs we invocate Thy names for triumph over foes.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रु॒ष्टु॒तस्य॒ धाम॑भिः श॒तेन॑ महयामसि इन्द्र॑स्य चर्षणी॒धृतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: puruṣṭutásya dhā́mabhiḥ śaténa mahayāmasi índrasya carṣaṇīdhŕ̥taḥ
stanzas.translation: We strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise, Of Indra who supports mankind.

translations.griffith: We strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise, Of Indra who supports mankind.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रं॑ वृ॒त्राय॒ हन्त॑वे पुरुहू॒तमुप॑ ब्रुवे भरे॑षु॒ वाज॑सातये
stanzas.transliteration: índraṃ vr̥trā́ya hántave puruhūtám úpa bruve bháreṣu vā́jasātaye
stanzas.translation: For Vr̥itra's slaughter I address Indra whom many invocate, To win us booty in the wars.

translations.griffith: For Vr̥itra's slaughter I address Indra whom many invocate, To win us booty in the wars.

stanzas.sanskrit: वाजे॑षु सास॒हिर्भ॑व॒ त्वामी॑महे शतक्रतो इन्द्र॑ वृ॒त्राय॒ हन्त॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: vā́jeṣu sāsahír bhava tvā́m īmahe śatakrato índra vr̥trā́ya hántave
stanzas.translation: In battles be victorious. We seek thee, Lord of Hundred Powers, Indra, that Vr̥itra may be slain.

translations.griffith: In battles be victorious. We seek thee, Lord of Hundred Powers, Indra, that Vr̥itra may be slain.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यु॒म्नेषु॑ पृत॒नाज्ये॑ पृत्सु॒तूर्षु॒ श्रवः॑सु च इन्द्र॒ साक्ष्वा॒भिमा॑तिषु
stanzas.transliteration: dyumnéṣu pr̥tanā́jye pr̥tsutū́rṣu śrávassu ca índra sā́kṣvābhímātiṣu
stanzas.translation: In splendid combats of the hosts, in glories where the fight is won. Indra, be victor over foes.

translations.griffith: In splendid combats of the hosts, in glories where the fight is won. Indra, be victor over foes.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒ष्मिन्त॑मं न ऊ॒तये॑ द्यु॒म्निनं॑ पाहि॒ जागृ॑विम् इन्द्र॒ सोमं॑ शतक्रतो
stanzas.transliteration: śuṣmíntamaṃ na ūtáye dyumnínam pāhi jā́gr̥vim índra sómaṃ śatakrato
stanzas.translation: Drink thou the Soma for our help, bright, vigilant, exceeding strong, O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers.

translations.griffith: Drink thou the Soma for our help, bright, vigilant, exceeding strong, O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒न्द्रि॒याणि॑ शतक्रतो॒ या ते॒ जने॑षु प॒ञ्चसु॑ इन्द्र॒ तानि॑ त॒ आ वृ॑णे
stanzas.transliteration: indriyā́ṇi śatakrato yā́ te jáneṣu pañcásu índra tā́ni ta ā́ vr̥ṇe
stanzas.translation: O Ṣatakratu, powers which thou mid the Five Races hast displayed These, Indra, do I claim of thee.

translations.griffith: O Ṣatakratu, powers which thou mid the Five Races hast displayed These, Indra, do I claim of thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग॑न्निन्द्र॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हद्द्यु॒म्नं द॑धिष्व दु॒ष्टर॑म् उत्ते॒ शुष्मं॑ तिरामसि
stanzas.transliteration: ágann indra śrávo br̥hád dyumnáṃ dadhiṣva duṣṭáram út te śúṣmaṃ tirāmasi
stanzas.translation: Indra, great glory hast thou gained. Win splendid fame which none may mar We make thy might perpetual.

translations.griffith: Indra, great glory hast thou gained. Win splendid fame which none may mar We make thy might perpetual.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्वा॒वतो॑ न॒ आ ग॒ह्यथो॑ शक्र परा॒वतः॑ उ॒ लो॒को यस्ते॑ अद्रिव॒ इन्द्रे॒ह तत॒ आ ग॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: arvāváto na ā́ gahi- átho śakra parāvátaḥ ulokó yás te adrivaḥ- índrehá táta ā́ gahi
stanzas.translation: Come to us either from anear, Or, Ṣakra, come from far away. Indra, wherever be thy home, come to us thence, O Thunder-armed.

translations.griffith: Come to us either from anear, Or, Ṣakra, come from far away. Indra, wherever be thy home, come to us thence, O Thunder-armed.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि तष्टे॑व दीधया मनी॒षामत्यो॒ न वा॒जी सु॒धुरो॒ जिहा॑नः अ॒भि प्रि॒याणि॒ मर्मृ॑श॒त्परा॑णि क॒वीँरि॑च्छामि सं॒दृशे॑ सुमे॒धाः
stanzas.transliteration: abhí táṣṭeva dīdhayā manīṣā́m átyo ná vājī́ sudhúro jíhānaḥ abhí priyā́ṇi mármr̥śat párāṇi kavī́m̐r ichāmi saṃdŕ̥śe sumedhā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: HASTING like some strong courser good at drawing, a thought have I imagined like a workman. Pondering what is dearest and most noble, I long to see the sages full of wisdom.

translations.griffith: HASTING like some strong courser good at drawing, a thought have I imagined like a workman. Pondering what is dearest and most noble, I long to see the sages full of wisdom.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒नोत पृ॑च्छ॒ जनि॑मा कवी॒नां म॑नो॒धृतः॑ सु॒कृत॑स्तक्षत॒ द्याम् इ॒मा उ॑ ते प्र॒ण्यो॒३॒॑ वर्ध॑माना॒ मनो॑वाता॒ अध॒ नु धर्म॑णि ग्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: inótá pr̥cha jánimā kavīnā́m manodhŕ̥taḥ sukŕ̥tas takṣata dyā́m imā́ u te praṇyò várdhamānāḥ- mánovātā ádha nú dhármaṇi gman
stanzas.translation: Ask of the sages' mighty generations firm-minded and devout they framed the heaven. These are thy heart-sought strengthening directions, and they have come to be sky's upholders.

translations.griffith: Ask of the sages' mighty generations firm-minded and devout they framed the heaven. These are thy heart-sought strengthening directions, and they have come to be sky's upholders.

stanzas.sanskrit: नि षी॒मिदत्र॒ गुह्या॒ दधा॑ना उ॒त क्ष॒त्राय॒ रोद॑सी॒ सम॑ञ्जन् सं मात्रा॑भिर्ममि॒रे ये॒मुरु॒र्वी अ॒न्तर्म॒ही समृ॑ते॒ धाय॑से धुः
stanzas.transliteration: ní ṣīm íd átra gúhyā dádhānāḥ- utá kṣatrā́ya ródasī sám añjan sám mā́trābhir mamiré yemúr urvī́ antár mahī́ sámr̥te dhā́yase dhuḥ
stanzas.translation: Assuming in this world mysterious natures, they decked the heaven and earth for high dominion, Measured with measures, fixed their broad expanses, set the great worlds apart held firm for safety.

translations.griffith: Assuming in this world mysterious natures, they decked the heaven and earth for high dominion, Measured with measures, fixed their broad expanses, set the great worlds apart held firm for safety.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒तिष्ठ॑न्तं॒ परि॒ विश्वे॑ अभूष॒ञ्छ्रियो॒ वसा॑नश्चरति॒ स्वरो॑चिः म॒हत्तद्वृष्णो॒ असु॑रस्य॒ नामा वि॒श्वरू॑पो अ॒मृता॑नि तस्थौ
stanzas.transliteration: ātíṣṭhantam pári víśve abhūṣañ -śríyo vásānaś carati svárociḥ mahát tád vŕ̥ṣṇo ásurasya nā́ma- -ā́ viśvárūpo amŕ̥tāni tasthau
stanzas.translation: Even as he mounted up they all adorned him: self-luminous he travels clothed in splendour. That is the Bull's, the Asura's mighty figure: he, omniform, hath reached the eternal waters.

translations.griffith: Even as he mounted up they all adorned him: self-luminous he travels clothed in splendour. That is the Bull's, the Asura's mighty figure: he, omniform, hath reached the eternal waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: असू॑त॒ पूर्वो॑ वृष॒भो ज्याया॑नि॒मा अ॑स्य शु॒रुधः॑ सन्ति पू॒र्वीः दिवो॑ नपाता वि॒दथ॑स्य धी॒भिः क्ष॒त्रं रा॑जाना प्र॒दिवो॑ दधाथे
stanzas.transliteration: ásūta pū́rvo vr̥ṣabhó jyā́yān imā́ asya śurúdhaḥ santi pūrvī́ḥ dívo napātā vidáthasya dhībhíḥ kṣatráṃ rājānā pradívo dadhāthe
stanzas.translation: First the more ancient Bull engendered offspring; these are his many draughts that lent him vigour. From days of old ye Kings, two Sons of Heaven, by hymns of sacrifice have won dominion.

translations.griffith: First the more ancient Bull engendered offspring; these are his many draughts that lent him vigour. From days of old ye Kings, two Sons of Heaven, by hymns of sacrifice have won dominion.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रीणि॑ राजाना वि॒दथे॑ पु॒रूणि॒ परि॒ विश्वा॑नि भूषथः॒ सदां॑सि अप॑श्य॒मत्र॒ मन॑सा जग॒न्वान्व्र॒ते ग॑न्ध॒र्वाँ अपि॑ वा॒युके॑शान्
stanzas.transliteration: trī́ṇi rājānā vidáthe purū́ṇi pári víśvāni bhūṣathaḥ sádāṃsi ápaśyam átra mánasā jaganvā́n vraté gandharvā́m̐ ápi vāyúkeśān
stanzas.translation: Three seats ye Sovrans, in the Holy synod, many, yea, all, ye honour with your presence. There saw I, going thither in the spirit, Gandharvas in their course with wind-blown tresses.

translations.griffith: Three seats ye Sovrans, in the Holy synod, many, yea, all, ye honour with your presence. There saw I, going thither in the spirit, Gandharvas in their course with wind-blown tresses.

stanzas.sanskrit: तदिन्न्व॑स्य वृष॒भस्य॑ धे॒नोरा नाम॑भिर्ममिरे॒ सक्म्यं॒ गोः अ॒न्यद॑न्यदसु॒र्यं१॒॑ वसा॑ना॒ नि मा॒यिनो॑ ममिरे रू॒पम॑स्मिन्
stanzas.transliteration: tád ín nv àsya vr̥ṣabhásya dhenór ā́ nā́mabhir mamire sákmyaṃ góḥ anyád-anyad asuryàṃ vásānāḥ- ní māyíno mamire rūpám asmin
stanzas.translation: That same companionship of her, the Milch-cow, here with the strong Bull's divers forms they stablished. Enduing still some new celestial figure, the skilful workers shaped a form around him.

translations.griffith: That same companionship of her, the Milch-cow, here with the strong Bull's divers forms they stablished. Enduing still some new celestial figure, the skilful workers shaped a form around him.

stanzas.sanskrit: तदिन्न्व॑स्य सवि॒तुर्नकि॑र्मे हिर॒ण्ययी॑म॒मतिं॒ यामशि॑श्रेत् आ सु॑ष्टु॒ती रोद॑सी विश्वमि॒न्वे अपी॑व॒ योषा॒ जनि॑मानि वव्रे
stanzas.transliteration: tád ín nv àsya savitúr nákir me hiraṇyáyīm amátiṃ yā́m áśiśret ā́ suṣṭutī́ ródasī viśvaminvé ápīva yóṣā jánimāni vavre
stanzas.translation: Let no one here debar me from enjoying the golden light which Savitar diffuses. He covers both all-fostering worlds with praises even as a woman cherishes her children.

translations.griffith: Let no one here debar me from enjoying the golden light which Savitar diffuses. He covers both all-fostering worlds with praises even as a woman cherishes her children.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒वं प्र॒त्नस्य॑ साधथो म॒हो यद्दैवी॑ स्व॒स्तिः परि॑ णः स्यातम् गो॒पाजि॑ह्वस्य त॒स्थुषो॒ विरू॑पा॒ विश्वे॑ पश्यन्ति मा॒यिनः॑ कृ॒तानि॑
stanzas.transliteration: yuvám pratnásya sādhatho mahó yád daívī svastíḥ pári ṇaḥ syātam gopā́jihvasya tasthúṣo vírūpā víśve paśyanti māyínaḥ kr̥tā́ni
stanzas.translation: Fulfil, ye twain, his work, the Great, the Ancient: as heavenly blessing keep your guard around us. All the wise Gods behold his varied actions who stands erect, whose voice is like a herdsman's.

translations.griffith: Fulfil, ye twain, his work, the Great, the Ancient: as heavenly blessing keep your guard around us. All the wise Gods behold his varied actions who stands erect, whose voice is like a herdsman's.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रं॑ म॒तिर्हृ॒द आ व॒च्यमा॒नाच्छा॒ पतिं॒ स्तोम॑तष्टा जिगाति या जागृ॑विर्वि॒दथे॑ श॒स्यमा॒नेन्द्र॒ यत्ते॒ जाय॑ते वि॒द्धि तस्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: índram matír hr̥dá ā́ vacyámānā- -áchā pátiṃ stómataṣṭā jigāti yā́ jā́gr̥vir vidáthe śasyámānā- -índra yát te jā́yate viddhí tásya
stanzas.translation: To Indra from the heart the hymn proceedeth, to him the Lord, recited, built with praises; The wakening song sung forth in holy synod: that which is born for thee, O Indra, notice.

translations.griffith: To Indra from the heart the hymn proceedeth, to him the Lord, recited, built with praises; The wakening song sung forth in holy synod: that which is born for thee, O Indra, notice.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वश्चि॒दा पू॒र्व्या जाय॑माना॒ वि जागृ॑विर्वि॒दथे॑ श॒स्यमा॑ना भ॒द्रा वस्त्रा॒ण्यर्जु॑ना॒ वसा॑ना॒ सेयम॒स्मे स॑न॒जा पित्र्या॒ धीः
stanzas.transliteration: diváś cid ā́ pūrvyā́ jā́yamānā ví jā́gr̥vir vidáthe śasyámānā bhadrā́ vástrāṇy árjunā vásānā séyám asmé sanajā́ pítryā dhī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Born from the heaven e'en in the days aforetime, wakening, sting aloud in holy synod, Auspicious, clad in white and shining raiment, this is the ancient hymn of our forefathers.

translations.griffith: Born from the heaven e'en in the days aforetime, wakening, sting aloud in holy synod, Auspicious, clad in white and shining raiment, this is the ancient hymn of our forefathers.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒मा चि॒दत्र॑ यम॒सूर॑सूत जि॒ह्वाया॒ अग्रं॒ पत॒दा ह्यस्था॑त् वपूं॑षि जा॒ता मि॑थु॒ना स॑चेते तमो॒हना॒ तपु॑षो बु॒ध्न एता॑
stanzas.transliteration: yamā́ cid átra yamasū́r asūta jihvā́yā ágram pátad ā́ hy ásthāt vápūṃṣi jātā́ mithunā́ sacete tamohánā tápuṣo budhná étā
stanzas.translation: The Mother of the Twins hath borne Twin Children: my tongue's tip raised itself and rested silent. Killing the darkness at the light's foundation, the Couple newly born attain their beauty.

translations.griffith: The Mother of the Twins hath borne Twin Children: my tongue's tip raised itself and rested silent. Killing the darkness at the light's foundation, the Couple newly born attain their beauty.

stanzas.sanskrit: नकि॑रेषां निन्दि॒ता मर्त्ये॑षु॒ ये अ॒स्माकं॑ पि॒तरो॒ गोषु॑ यो॒धाः इन्द्र॑ एषां दृंहि॒ता माहि॑नावा॒नुद्गो॒त्राणि॑ ससृजे दं॒सना॑वान्
stanzas.transliteration: nákir eṣāṃ ninditā́ mártyeṣu yé asmā́kam pitáro góṣu yodhā́ḥ índra eṣāṃ dr̥ṃhitā́ mā́hināvān úd gotrā́ṇi sasr̥je daṃsánāvān
stanzas.translation: Not one is found among them, none of mortals, to blame our sires who fought to win the cattle. Their strengthener was Indra the Majestic he spread their stalls of kine the Wonder-Worker.

translations.griffith: Not one is found among them, none of mortals, to blame our sires who fought to win the cattle. Their strengthener was Indra the Majestic he spread their stalls of kine the Wonder-Worker.

stanzas.sanskrit: सखा॑ ह॒ यत्र॒ सखि॑भि॒र्नव॑ग्वैरभि॒ज्ञ्वा सत्व॑भि॒र्गा अ॑नु॒ग्मन् स॒त्यं तदिन्द्रो॑ द॒शभि॒र्दश॑ग्वैः॒ सूर्यं॑ विवेद॒ तम॑सि क्षि॒यन्त॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sákhā ha yátra sákhibhir návagvair abhijñv ā́ sátvabhir gā́ anugmán satyáṃ tád índro daśábhir dáśagvaiḥ sū́ryaṃ viveda támasi kṣiyántam
stanzas.translation: Where as a Friend with friendly men, Navagvas, with heroes, on his knees he sought the cattle. There, verily with ten Daṣagvas Indra found the Sun lying hidden in the darkness.

translations.griffith: Where as a Friend with friendly men, Navagvas, with heroes, on his knees he sought the cattle. There, verily with ten Daṣagvas Indra found the Sun lying hidden in the darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॒ मधु॒ सम्भृ॑तमु॒स्रिया॑यां प॒द्वद्वि॑वेद श॒फव॒न्नमे॒ गोः गुहा॑ हि॒तं गुह्यं॑ गू॒ळ्हम॒प्सु हस्ते॑ दधे॒ दक्षि॑णे॒ दक्षि॑णावान्
stanzas.transliteration: índro mádhu sámbhr̥tam usríyāyām padvád viveda śaphávan náme góḥ gúhā hitáṃ gúhyaṃ gūḷhám apsú- háste dadhe dákṣiṇe dákṣiṇāvān
stanzas.translation: Indra found meath collected in the milch-cow, by foot and hoof, in the cow's place of pasture. That which lay secret, hidden in the waters, he held in his right hand, the rich rewarder.

translations.griffith: Indra found meath collected in the milch-cow, by foot and hoof, in the cow's place of pasture. That which lay secret, hidden in the waters, he held in his right hand, the rich rewarder.

stanzas.sanskrit: ज्योति॑र्वृणीत॒ तम॑सो विजा॒नन्ना॒रे स्या॑म दुरि॒ताद॒भीके॑ इ॒मा गिरः॑ सोमपाः सोमवृद्ध जु॒षस्वे॑न्द्र पुरु॒तम॑स्य का॒रोः
stanzas.transliteration: jyótir vr̥ṇīta támaso vijānánn āré syāma duritā́d abhī́ke imā́ gíraḥ somapāḥ somavr̥ddha juṣásvendra purutámasya kāróḥ
stanzas.translation: He took the light, discerning it from darkness: may we be far removed from all misfortune. These songs, O Soma-drinker, cheered by Soma, Indra, accept from thy most zealous poet.

translations.griffith: He took the light, discerning it from darkness: may we be far removed from all misfortune. These songs, O Soma-drinker, cheered by Soma, Indra, accept from thy most zealous poet.

stanzas.sanskrit: ज्योति॑र्य॒ज्ञाय॒ रोद॑सी॒ अनु॑ ष्यादा॒रे स्या॑म दुरि॒तस्य॒ भूरेः॑ भूरि॑ चि॒द्धि तु॑ज॒तो मर्त्य॑स्य सुपा॒रासो॑ वसवो ब॒र्हणा॑वत्
stanzas.transliteration: jyótir yajñā́ya ródasī ánu ṣyād āré syāma duritásya bhū́reḥ bhū́ri cid dhí tujató mártyasya supārā́so vasavo barháṇāvat
stanzas.translation: Let there be light through both the worlds for worship: may we be far from most overwhelming evil. Great woe comes even from the hostile mortal, piled up; but good at rescue are the Vasus.

translations.griffith: Let there be light through both the worlds for worship: may we be far from most overwhelming evil. Great woe comes even from the hostile mortal, piled up; but good at rescue are the Vasus.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑ त्वा वृष॒भं व॒यं सु॒ते सोमे॑ हवामहे स पा॑हि॒ मध्वो॒ अन्ध॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: índra tvā vr̥ṣabháṃ vayáṃ suté sóme havāmahe sá pāhi mádhvo ándhasaḥ
stanzas.translation: THEE, Indra, we invoke, the Bull, what time the Soma is expressed. So drink thou of the savoury juice.

translations.griffith: THEE, Indra, we invoke, the Bull, what time the Soma is expressed. So drink thou of the savoury juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑ क्रतु॒विदं॑ सु॒तं सोमं॑ हर्य पुरुष्टुत पिबा वृ॑षस्व॒ तातृ॑पिम्
stanzas.transliteration: índra kratuvídaṃ sutáṃ sómaṃ harya puruṣṭuta píbā́ vr̥ṣasva tā́tr̥pim
stanzas.translation: Indra, whom many laud, accept the strength-conferring Soma juice: Quaff, pour down drink that satisfies.

translations.griffith: Indra, whom many laud, accept the strength-conferring Soma juice: Quaff, pour down drink that satisfies.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ प्र णो॑ धि॒तावा॑नं य॒ज्ञं विश्वे॑भिर्दे॒वेभिः॑ ति॒र स्त॑वान विश्पते
stanzas.transliteration: índra prá ṇo dhitā́vānaṃ yajñáṃ víśvebhir devébhiḥ tirá stavāna viśpate
stanzas.translation: Indra, with all the Gods promote our wealth-bestowing sacrifice, Thou highly-lauded Lord of men.

translations.griffith: Indra, with all the Gods promote our wealth-bestowing sacrifice, Thou highly-lauded Lord of men.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ सोमाः॑ सु॒ता इ॒मे तव॒ प्र य॑न्ति सत्पते क्षयं॑ च॒न्द्रास॒ इन्द॑वः
stanzas.transliteration: índra sómāḥ sutā́ imé táva prá yanti satpate kṣáyaṃ candrā́sa índavaḥ
stanzas.translation: Lord of the brave, to thee proceed these drops of Soma juice expressed, The bright drops to thy dwelling-place.

translations.griffith: Lord of the brave, to thee proceed these drops of Soma juice expressed, The bright drops to thy dwelling-place.

stanzas.sanskrit: द॒धि॒ष्वा ज॒ठरे॑ सु॒तं सोम॑मिन्द्र॒ वरे॑ण्यम् तव॑ द्यु॒क्षास॒ इन्द॑वः
stanzas.transliteration: dadhiṣvā́ jaṭháre sutáṃ sómam indra váreṇyam táva dyukṣā́sa índavaḥ
stanzas.translation: Within thy belly, Indra, take juice, Soma the most excellent: Thine are the drops celestial.

translations.griffith: Within thy belly, Indra, take juice, Soma the most excellent: Thine are the drops celestial.

stanzas.sanskrit: गिर्व॑णः पा॒हि नः॑ सु॒तं मधो॒र्धारा॑भिरज्यसे इन्द्र॒ त्वादा॑त॒मिद्यशः॑
stanzas.transliteration: gírvaṇaḥ pāhí naḥ sutám mádhor dhā́rābhir ajyase índra tvā́dātam íd yáśaḥ
stanzas.translation: Drink our libation, Lord of hymns: with streams of meath thou art bedewed Our glory, Indra, is thy gift.

translations.griffith: Drink our libation, Lord of hymns: with streams of meath thou art bedewed Our glory, Indra, is thy gift.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि द्यु॒म्नानि॑ व॒निन॒ इन्द्रं॑ सचन्ते॒ अक्षि॑ता पी॒त्वी सोम॑स्य वावृधे
stanzas.transliteration: abhí dyumnā́ni vanínaḥ- índraṃ sacante ákṣitā pītvī́ sómasya vāvr̥dhe
stanzas.translation: To Indra go the treasures of the worshipper, which never fail: He drinks the Soma and is strong

translations.griffith: To Indra go the treasures of the worshipper, which never fail: He drinks the Soma and is strong

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्वा॒वतो॑ न॒ आ ग॑हि परा॒वत॑श्च वृत्रहन् इ॒मा जु॑षस्व नो॒ गिरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: arvāváto na ā́ gahi- parāvátaś ca vr̥trahan imā́ juṣasva no gíraḥ
stanzas.translation: From far away, from near at hand, O Vr̥itra-slayer, come to us: Accept the songs we sing to thee.

translations.griffith: From far away, from near at hand, O Vr̥itra-slayer, come to us: Accept the songs we sing to thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद॑न्त॒रा प॑रा॒वत॑मर्वा॒वतं॑ च हू॒यसे॑ इन्द्रे॒ह तत॒ आ ग॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: yád antarā́ parāvátam arvāvátaṃ ca hūyáse índrehá táta ā́ gahi
stanzas.translation: When from the space between the near and far thou art invoked by us, Thence, Indra. come thou hitherward.

translations.griffith: When from the space between the near and far thou art invoked by us, Thence, Indra. come thou hitherward.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ तू न॑ इन्द्र म॒द्र्य॑ग्घुवा॒नः सोम॑पीतये हरि॑भ्यां याह्यद्रिवः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ tū́ na indra madryàg -huvānáḥ sómapītaye háribhyāṃ yāhy adrivaḥ
stanzas.translation: INVOKED to drink the Soma juice, come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-armed Come, Indra, hitherward to me.

translations.griffith: INVOKED to drink the Soma juice, come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-armed Come, Indra, hitherward to me.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्तो होता॑ न ऋ॒त्विय॑स्तिस्ति॒रे ब॒र्हिरा॑नु॒षक् अयु॑ज्रन्प्रा॒तरद्र॑यः
stanzas.transliteration: sattó hótā na r̥tvíyas tistiré barhír ānuṣák áyujran prātár ádrayaḥ
stanzas.translation: Our priest is seated, true to time; the grass is regularly strewn; The pressing-stones were set at morn.

translations.griffith: Our priest is seated, true to time; the grass is regularly strewn; The pressing-stones were set at morn.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मा ब्रह्म॑ ब्रह्मवाहः क्रि॒यन्त॒ आ ब॒र्हिः सी॑द वी॒हि शू॑र पुरो॒ळाश॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: imā́ bráhma brahmavāhaḥ kriyánta ā́ barhíḥ sīda vīhí śūra puroḷā́śam
stanzas.translation: These prayers, O thou who hearest prayer are offered: seat thee on the grass. Hero, enjoy the offered cake.
