translations.griffith: These prayers, O thou who hearest prayer are offered: seat thee on the grass. Hero, enjoy the offered cake.

stanzas.sanskrit: रा॒र॒न्धि सव॑नेषु ण ए॒षु स्तोमे॑षु वृत्रहन् उ॒क्थेष्वि॑न्द्र गिर्वणः
stanzas.transliteration: rārandhí sávaneṣu ṇaḥ- eṣú stómeṣu vr̥trahan ukthéṣv indra girvaṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: O Vr̥itra-slayer, be thou pleased with these libations, with these hymns, Song-loving Indra, with our lauds.

translations.griffith: O Vr̥itra-slayer, be thou pleased with these libations, with these hymns, Song-loving Indra, with our lauds.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒तयः॑ सोम॒पामु॒रुं रि॒हन्ति॒ शव॑स॒स्पति॑म् इन्द्रं॑ व॒त्सं न मा॒तरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: matáyaḥ somapā́m urúṃ rihánti śávasas pátim índraṃ vatsáṃ ná mātáraḥ
stanzas.translation: Our hymns caress the Lord of Strength, vast, drinker of the Soma's juice, Indra, as mother-cows their calf.

translations.griffith: Our hymns caress the Lord of Strength, vast, drinker of the Soma's juice, Indra, as mother-cows their calf.

stanzas.sanskrit: स म॑न्दस्वा॒ ह्यन्ध॑सो॒ राध॑से त॒न्वा॑ म॒हे न स्तो॒तारं॑ नि॒दे क॑रः
stanzas.transliteration: sá mandasvā hy ándhaso rā́dhase tanvā̀ mahé ná stotā́raṃ nidé karaḥ
stanzas.translation: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence: Yield not thy singer to reproach.

translations.griffith: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence: Yield not thy singer to reproach.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यमि॑न्द्र त्वा॒यवो॑ ह॒विष्म॑न्तो जरामहे उ॒त त्वम॑स्म॒युर्व॑सो
stanzas.transliteration: vayám indra tvāyávo havíṣmanto jarāmahe utá tvám asmayúr vaso
stanzas.translation: We, Indra, dearly loving thee, bearing oblation, sing thee hymns Thou, Vasu, dearly lovest us.

translations.griffith: We, Indra, dearly loving thee, bearing oblation, sing thee hymns Thou, Vasu, dearly lovest us.

stanzas.sanskrit: मारे अ॒स्मद्वि मु॑मुचो॒ हरि॑प्रिया॒र्वाङ्या॑हि इन्द्र॑ स्वधावो॒ मत्स्वे॒ह
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ré asmád ví mumuco háripriyārvā́ṅ yāhi índra svadhāvo mátsvehá
stanzas.translation: O thou to whom thy Bays are dear, loose not thy Horses far from us: Here glad thee, Indra, Lord divine.

translations.griffith: O thou to whom thy Bays are dear, loose not thy Horses far from us: Here glad thee, Indra, Lord divine.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्वाञ्चं॑ त्वा सु॒खे रथे॒ वह॑तामिन्द्र के॒शिना॑ घृ॒तस्नू॑ ब॒र्हिरा॒सदे॑
stanzas.transliteration: arvā́ñcaṃ tvā sukhé ráthe váhatām indra keśínā ghr̥tásnū barhír āsáde
stanzas.translation: May long-maned Coursers, dropping oil, bring thee on swift car hitherward, Indra, to seat thee on the grass.

translations.griffith: May long-maned Coursers, dropping oil, bring thee on swift car hitherward, Indra, to seat thee on the grass.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॑ नः सु॒तमा ग॑हि॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र॒ गवा॑शिरम् हरि॑भ्यां॒ यस्ते॑ अस्म॒युः
stanzas.transliteration: úpa naḥ sutám ā́ gahi sómam indra gávāśiram háribhyāṃ yás te asmayúḥ
stanzas.translation: COME to the juice that we have pressed, to Sorna, Indra, bleat with milk: Come, favouring us, thy Bay-drawn car!

translations.griffith: COME to the juice that we have pressed, to Sorna, Indra, bleat with milk: Come, favouring us, thy Bay-drawn car!

stanzas.sanskrit: तमि॑न्द्र॒ मद॒मा ग॑हि बर्हिः॒ष्ठां ग्राव॑भिः सु॒तम् कु॒विन्न्व॑स्य तृ॒प्णवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tám indra mádam ā́ gahi barhiṣṭhā́ṃ grā́vabhiḥ sutám kuvín nv àsya tr̥pṇávaḥ
stanzas.translation: Come, Indra, to this gladdening drink, placed on the grass, pressed out with stones: Wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof?

translations.griffith: Come, Indra, to this gladdening drink, placed on the grass, pressed out with stones: Wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof?

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑मि॒त्था गिरो॒ ममाच्छा॑गुरिषि॒ता इ॒तः आ॒वृते॒ सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: índram itthā́ gíro máma- -áchāgur iṣitā́ itáḥ āvŕ̥te sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: To Indra have my songs of praise gone forth, thus rapidly sent hence, To turn him to the Soma-draught.

translations.griffith: To Indra have my songs of praise gone forth, thus rapidly sent hence, To turn him to the Soma-draught.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रं॒ सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॒ स्तोमै॑रि॒ह ह॑वामहे उ॒क्थेभिः॑ कु॒विदा॒गम॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: índraṃ sómasya pītáye stómair ihá havāmahe ukthébhiḥ kuvíd āgámat
stanzas.translation: Hither with songs of praise we call Indra to drink the Soma juice: Will he not come to us by lauds?

translations.griffith: Hither with songs of praise we call Indra to drink the Soma juice: Will he not come to us by lauds?

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ सोमाः॑ सु॒ता इ॒मे तान्द॑धिष्व शतक्रतो ज॒ठरे॑ वाजिनीवसो
stanzas.transliteration: índra sómāḥ sutā́ imé tā́n dadhiṣva śatakrato jaṭháre vājinīvaso
stanzas.translation: Indra, these Somas are expressed. Take them within thy belly, Lord Of Hundred Powers, thou Prince of Wealth.

translations.griffith: Indra, these Somas are expressed. Take them within thy belly, Lord Of Hundred Powers, thou Prince of Wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒द्मा हि त्वा॑ धनंज॒यं वाजे॑षु दधृ॒षं क॑वे अधा॑ ते सु॒म्नमी॑महे
stanzas.transliteration: vidmā́ hí tvā dhanaṃjayáṃ vā́jeṣu dadhr̥ṣáṃ kave ádhā te sumnám īmahe
stanzas.translation: We know thee winner of the spoil, and resolute in battles, Sage! Therefore thy blessing we implore.

translations.griffith: We know thee winner of the spoil, and resolute in battles, Sage! Therefore thy blessing we implore.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ममि॑न्द्र॒ गवा॑शिरं॒ यवा॑शिरं च नः पिब आ॒गत्या॒ वृष॑भिः सु॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: imám indra gávāśiraṃ yávāśiraṃ ca naḥ piba āgátyā vŕ̥ṣabhiḥ sutám
stanzas.translation: Borne hither by thy Stallions, drink, Indra, this juice which we have pressed, Mingled with barley and with milk.

translations.griffith: Borne hither by thy Stallions, drink, Indra, this juice which we have pressed, Mingled with barley and with milk.

stanzas.sanskrit: तुभ्येदि॑न्द्र॒ स्व ओ॒क्ये॒३॒॑ सोमं॑ चोदामि पी॒तये॑ ए॒ष रा॑रन्तु ते हृ॒दि
stanzas.transliteration: túbhyéd indra svá okyè sómaṃ codāmi pītáye eṣá rārantu te hr̥dí
stanzas.translation: Indra, for thee, in thine own place, I urge the Soma for thy draught: Deep in thy heart let it remain,

translations.griffith: Indra, for thee, in thine own place, I urge the Soma for thy draught: Deep in thy heart let it remain,

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑ प्र॒त्नमि॑न्द्र हवामहे कु॒शि॒कासो॑ अव॒स्यवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ sutásya pītáye pratnám indra havāmahe kuśikā́so avasyávaḥ
stanzas.translation: We call on thee, the Ancient One, Indra, to drink the Soma juice, We Kuṣikas who seek thine aid.

translations.griffith: We call on thee, the Ancient One, Indra, to drink the Soma juice, We Kuṣikas who seek thine aid.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ या॑ह्य॒र्वाङुप॑ वन्धुरे॒ष्ठास्तवेदनु॑ प्र॒दिवः॑ सोम॒पेय॑म् प्रि॒या सखा॑या॒ वि मु॒चोप॑ ब॒र्हिस्त्वामि॒मे ह॑व्य॒वाहो॑ हवन्ते
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yāhy arvā́ṅ úpa vandhureṣṭhā́s távéd ánu pradívaḥ somapéyam priyā́ sákhāyā ví mucópa barhís tvā́m imé havyavā́ho havante
stanzas.translation: MOUNTED upon thy chariot-seat approach us: thine is the Sorna-draught from days aforetime. Loose for the sacred grass thy dear companions. These men who bring oblation call thee hither.

translations.griffith: MOUNTED upon thy chariot-seat approach us: thine is the Sorna-draught from days aforetime. Loose for the sacred grass thy dear companions. These men who bring oblation call thee hither.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ या॑हि पू॒र्वीरति॑ चर्ष॒णीराँ अ॒र्य आ॒शिष॒ उप॑ नो॒ हरि॑भ्याम् इ॒मा हि त्वा॑ म॒तयः॒ स्तोम॑तष्टा॒ इन्द्र॒ हव॑न्ते स॒ख्यं जु॑षा॒णाः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yāhi pūrvī́r áti carṣaṇī́r ā́m̐ aryá āśíṣa úpa no háribhyām imā́ hí tvā matáya stómataṣṭāḥ- índra hávante sakhyáṃ juṣāṇā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Come our true Friend, passing by many people; come with thy two Bay Steeds to our devotions; For these our hymns are calling thee, O Indra, hymns formed for praise, soliciting thy friendship.

translations.griffith: Come our true Friend, passing by many people; come with thy two Bay Steeds to our devotions; For these our hymns are calling thee, O Indra, hymns formed for praise, soliciting thy friendship.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ य॒ज्ञं न॑मो॒वृधं॑ स॒जोषा॒ इन्द्र॑ देव॒ हरि॑भिर्याहि॒ तूय॑म् अ॒हं हि त्वा॑ म॒तिभि॒र्जोह॑वीमि घृ॒तप्र॑याः सध॒मादे॒ मधू॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no yajñáṃ namovŕ̥dhaṃ sajóṣāḥ- índra deva háribhir yāhi tū́yam aháṃ hí tvā matíbhir jóhavīmi ghr̥táprayāḥ sadhamā́de mádhūnām
stanzas.translation: Pleased, with thy Bay Steeds, Indra, God, come quickly to this our sacrifice that heightens worship; For with my thoughts, presenting oil to feed thee, I call thee to the feast of sweet libations.

translations.griffith: Pleased, with thy Bay Steeds, Indra, God, come quickly to this our sacrifice that heightens worship; For with my thoughts, presenting oil to feed thee, I call thee to the feast of sweet libations.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ च॒ त्वामे॒ता वृष॑णा॒ वहा॑तो॒ हरी॒ सखा॑या सु॒धुरा॒ स्वङ्गा॑ धा॒नाव॒दिन्द्रः॒ सव॑नं जुषा॒णः सखा॒ सख्युः॑ शृणव॒द्वन्द॑नानि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ ca tvā́m etā́ vŕ̥ṣaṇā váhāto hárī sákhāyā sudhúrā sváṅgā dhānā́vad índraḥ sávanaṃ juṣāṇáḥ sákhā sákhyuḥ śr̥ṇavad vándanāni
stanzas.translation: Yea, let thy two Bay Stallions bear thee hither, well limbed and good to draw, thy dear companions. Pleased with the corn-blent offering which we bring thee, may Indra, Friend, hear his friend's adoration.

translations.griffith: Yea, let thy two Bay Stallions bear thee hither, well limbed and good to draw, thy dear companions. Pleased with the corn-blent offering which we bring thee, may Indra, Friend, hear his friend's adoration.

stanzas.sanskrit: कु॒विन्मा॑ गो॒पां कर॑से॒ जन॑स्य कु॒विद्राजा॑नं मघवन्नृजीषिन् कु॒विन्म॒ ऋषिं॑ पपि॒वांसं॑ सु॒तस्य॑ कु॒विन्मे॒ वस्वो॑ अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ शिक्षाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: kuvín mā gopā́ṃ kárase jánasya kuvíd rā́jānam maghavann r̥jīṣin kuvín ma ŕ̥ṣim papivā́ṃsaṃ sutásya kuvín me vásvo amŕ̥tasya śíkṣāḥ
stanzas.translation: Wilt thou not make me guardian of the people, make me, impetuous Maghavan, their ruler? Make me a R̥ishi having drunk of Soma? Wilt thou not give me wealth that lasts for ever?

translations.griffith: Wilt thou not make me guardian of the people, make me, impetuous Maghavan, their ruler? Make me a R̥ishi having drunk of Soma? Wilt thou not give me wealth that lasts for ever?

stanzas.sanskrit: आ त्वा॑ बृ॒हन्तो॒ हर॑यो युजा॒ना अ॒र्वागि॑न्द्र सध॒मादो॑ वहन्तु प्र ये द्वि॒ता दि॒व ऋ॒ञ्जन्त्याताः॒ सुस॑म्मृष्टासो वृष॒भस्य॑ मू॒राः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ tvā br̥hánto hárayo yujānā́ḥ- arvā́g indra sadhamā́do vahantu prá yé dvitā́ divá r̥ñjánty ā́tāḥ súsammr̥ṣṭāso vr̥ṣabhásya mūrā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Yoked to thy chariot, led thy tall Bays, Indra, companions of thy banquet, bear thee hither, Who from of old press to heaven's farthest limits, the Bull's impetuous and well-groomed Horses.

translations.griffith: Yoked to thy chariot, led thy tall Bays, Indra, companions of thy banquet, bear thee hither, Who from of old press to heaven's farthest limits, the Bull's impetuous and well-groomed Horses.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ पिब॒ वृष॑धूतस्य॒ वृष्ण॒ आ यं ते॑ श्ये॒न उ॑श॒ते ज॒भार॑ यस्य॒ मदे॑ च्या॒वय॑सि॒ प्र कृ॒ष्टीर्यस्य॒ मदे॒ अप॑ गो॒त्रा व॒वर्थ॑
stanzas.transliteration: -índra píba vŕ̥ṣadhūtasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ ā́ yáṃ te śyená uśaté jabhā́ra yásya máde cyāváyasi prá kr̥ṣṭī́r yásya máde ápa gotrā́ vavártha
stanzas.translation: Drink of the strong pressed out by strong ones, Indra, that which the Falcon brought thee when thou longedst; In whose wild joy thou stirrest up the people, in whose wild joy thou didst unbar the cow-stalls.

translations.griffith: Drink of the strong pressed out by strong ones, Indra, that which the Falcon brought thee when thou longedst; In whose wild joy thou stirrest up the people, in whose wild joy thou didst unbar the cow-stalls.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Indra, Makhavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Indra, Makhavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं ते॑ अस्तु हर्य॒तः सोम॒ आ हरि॑भिः सु॒तः जु॒षा॒ण इ॑न्द्र॒ हरि॑भिर्न॒ आ ग॒ह्या ति॑ष्ठ॒ हरि॑तं॒ रथ॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ te astu haryatáḥ sóma ā́ háribhiḥ sutáḥ juṣāṇá indra háribhir na ā́ gahi- ā́ tiṣṭha háritaṃ rátham
stanzas.translation: May this delightsome Soma be expressed for thee by tawny stones. Joying thereat, O Indra, with thy Bay Steeds come:. ascend thy golden-coloured car.

translations.griffith: May this delightsome Soma be expressed for thee by tawny stones. Joying thereat, O Indra, with thy Bay Steeds come:. ascend thy golden-coloured car.

stanzas.sanskrit: ह॒र्यन्नु॒षस॑मर्चयः॒ सूर्यं॑ ह॒र्यन्न॑रोचयः वि॒द्वाँश्चि॑कि॒त्वान्ह॑र्यश्व वर्धस॒ इन्द्र॒ विश्वा॑ अ॒भि श्रियः॑
stanzas.transliteration: haryánn uṣásam arcayaḥ sū́ryaṃ haryánn arocayaḥ vidvā́ṃś cikitvā́n haryaśva vardhase- índra víśvā abhí śríyaḥ
stanzas.translation: In love thou madest Ushas glow, in love thou madest Sûrya shine. Thou, Indra, knowing, thinking, Lord of Tawny Steeds, above all glories waxest great.

translations.griffith: In love thou madest Ushas glow, in love thou madest Sûrya shine. Thou, Indra, knowing, thinking, Lord of Tawny Steeds, above all glories waxest great.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यामिन्द्रो॒ हरि॑धायसं पृथि॒वीं हरि॑वर्पसम् अधा॑रयद्ध॒रितो॒र्भूरि॒ भोज॑नं॒ ययो॑र॒न्तर्हरि॒श्चर॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: dyā́m índro háridhāyasam pr̥thivī́ṃ hárivarpasam ádhārayad dharítor bhū́ri bhójanaṃ yáyor antár háriś cárat
stanzas.translation: The heaven with streams of golden hue, earth with her tints of green and gold- The golden Pair yield Indra plenteous nourishment: between them moves the golden One.

translations.griffith: The heaven with streams of golden hue, earth with her tints of green and gold- The golden Pair yield Indra plenteous nourishment: between them moves the golden One.

stanzas.sanskrit: ज॒ज्ञा॒नो हरि॑तो॒ वृषा॒ विश्व॒मा भा॑ति रोच॒नम् हर्य॑श्वो॒ हरि॑तं धत्त॒ आयु॑ध॒मा वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोर्हरि॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: jajñānó hárito vŕ̥ṣā víśvam ā́ bhāti rocanám háryaśvo háritaṃ dhatta ā́yudham ā́ vájram bāhvór hárim
stanzas.translation: When born to life the golden Bull illumines all the realm of light. He takes his golden weapon, Lord of Tawny Steeds, the golden thunder in his arms.

translations.griffith: When born to life the golden Bull illumines all the realm of light. He takes his golden weapon, Lord of Tawny Steeds, the golden thunder in his arms.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॑ ह॒र्यन्त॒मर्जु॑नं॒ वज्रं॑ शु॒क्रैर॒भीवृ॑तम् अपा॑वृणो॒द्धरि॑भि॒रद्रि॑भिः सु॒तमुद्गा हरि॑भिराजत
stanzas.transliteration: índro haryántam árjunaṃ vájraṃ śukraír abhī́vr̥tam ápāvr̥ṇod dháribhir ádribhiḥ sutám úd gā́ háribhir ājata
stanzas.translation: The bright, the well-loved thunderbolt, girt with the bright, Indra disclosed, Disclosed the Soma juice pressed out by tawny stones, with tawny steeds drave forth the kine.

translations.griffith: The bright, the well-loved thunderbolt, girt with the bright, Indra disclosed, Disclosed the Soma juice pressed out by tawny stones, with tawny steeds drave forth the kine.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ म॒न्द्रैरि॑न्द्र॒ हरि॑भिर्या॒हि म॒यूर॑रोमभिः मा त्वा॒ के चि॒न्नि य॑म॒न्विं न पा॒शिनोऽति॒ धन्वे॑व॒ ताँ इ॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ mandraír indra háribhir yāhí mayū́raromabhiḥ mā́ tvā ké cin ní yaman víṃ ná pāśínaḥ- -áti dhánveva tā́m̐ ihi
stanzas.translation: COME hither, Indra, with Bay Steeds, joyous, with tails like peacocks' plumes. Let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird: pass o'er them as o'er desert lands.

translations.griffith: COME hither, Indra, with Bay Steeds, joyous, with tails like peacocks' plumes. Let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird: pass o'er them as o'er desert lands.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृ॒त्र॒खा॒दो व॑लंरु॒जः पु॒रां द॒र्मो अ॒पाम॒जः स्थाता॒ रथ॑स्य॒ हर्यो॑रभिस्व॒र इन्द्रो॑ दृ॒ळ्हा चि॑दारु॒जः
stanzas.transliteration: vr̥trakhādó valaṃrujáḥ purā́ṃ darmó apā́m ajáḥ sthā́tā ráthasya háryor abhisvaré- índro dr̥ḷhā́ cid ārujáḥ
stanzas.translation: He who slew Vr̥itra, burst the cloud, brake the strongholds and drave the floods, Indra who mounts his chariot at his Bay Steeds' cry, shatters e'en things that stand most firm.

translations.griffith: He who slew Vr̥itra, burst the cloud, brake the strongholds and drave the floods, Indra who mounts his chariot at his Bay Steeds' cry, shatters e'en things that stand most firm.

stanzas.sanskrit: ग॒म्भी॒राँ उ॑द॒धीँरि॑व॒ क्रतुं॑ पुष्यसि॒ गा इ॑व प्र सु॑गो॒पा यव॑सं धे॒नवो॑ यथा ह्र॒दं कु॒ल्या इ॑वाशत
stanzas.transliteration: gambhīrā́m̐ udadhī́m̐r iva krátum puṣyasi gā́ iva prá sugopā́ yávasaṃ dhenávo yathā hradáṃ kulyā́ ivāśata
stanzas.translation: Like pools of water deep and full, like kine thou cherishest thy might; Like the milch-cows that go well-guarded to the mead, like water-brooks that reach the lake.

translations.griffith: Like pools of water deep and full, like kine thou cherishest thy might; Like the milch-cows that go well-guarded to the mead, like water-brooks that reach the lake.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ न॒स्तुजं॑ र॒यिं भ॒रांशं॒ न प्र॑तिजान॒ते वृ॒क्षं प॒क्वं फल॑म॒ङ्कीव॑ धूनु॒हीन्द्र॑ स॒म्पार॑णं॒ वसु॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ nas tújaṃ rayím bhara- -áṃśaṃ ná pratijānaté vr̥kṣám pakvám phálam aṅkī́va dhūnuhi- -índra sampā́raṇaṃ vásu
stanzas.translation: Bring thou us wealth with power to strike, our share, 'gainst him who calls it his. Shake, Indra, as with hooks, the tree for ripened fruit, for wealth to satisfy our wish.

translations.griffith: Bring thou us wealth with power to strike, our share, 'gainst him who calls it his. Shake, Indra, as with hooks, the tree for ripened fruit, for wealth to satisfy our wish.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्व॒युरि॑न्द्र स्व॒राळ॑सि॒ स्मद्दि॑ष्टिः॒ स्वय॑शस्तरः स वा॑वृधा॒न ओज॑सा पुरुष्टुत॒ भवा॑ नः सु॒श्रव॑स्तमः
stanzas.transliteration: svayúr indra svarā́ḷ asi smáddiṣṭiḥ sváyaśastaraḥ sá vāvr̥dhāná ójasā puruṣṭuta bhávā naḥ suśrávastamaḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra, self-ruling Lord art thou, good Leader, of most glorious fame. So, waxen in thy strength, O thou whom many praise, be thou most swift to hear our call.

translations.griffith: Indra, self-ruling Lord art thou, good Leader, of most glorious fame. So, waxen in thy strength, O thou whom many praise, be thou most swift to hear our call.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒ध्मस्य॑ ते वृष॒भस्य॑ स्व॒राज॑ उ॒ग्रस्य॒ यूनः॒ स्थवि॑रस्य॒ घृष्वेः॑ अजू॑र्यतो व॒ज्रिणो॑ वी॒र्या॒३॒॑णीन्द्र॑ श्रु॒तस्य॑ मह॒तो म॒हानि॑
stanzas.transliteration: yudhmásya te vr̥ṣabhásya svarā́jaḥ- ugrásya yū́na sthávirasya ghŕ̥ṣveḥ ájūryato vajríṇo vīryā̀ṇi- -índra śrutásya maható mahā́ni
stanzas.translation: OF thee, the Bull, the Warrior, Sovran Ruler, joyous and fierce, ancient and ever youthful, The undecaying One who wields the thunder, renowned and great, great are the exploits, Indra.

translations.griffith: OF thee, the Bull, the Warrior, Sovran Ruler, joyous and fierce, ancient and ever youthful, The undecaying One who wields the thunder, renowned and great, great are the exploits, Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हाँ अ॑सि महिष॒ वृष्ण्ये॑भिर्धन॒स्पृदु॑ग्र॒ सह॑मानो अ॒न्यान् एको॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॒ स यो॒धया॑ च क्ष॒यया॑ च॒ जना॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: mahā́m̐ asi mahiṣa vŕ̥ṣṇyebhir dhanaspŕ̥d ugra sáhamāno anyā́n éko víśvasya bhúvanasya rā́jā sá yodháyā ca kṣayáyā ca jánān
stanzas.translation: Great art thou, Mighty Lord, through manly vigour, O fierce One, gathering spoil, subduing others, Thyself alone the universe's Sovran: so send forth men to combat and to rest them.

translations.griffith: Great art thou, Mighty Lord, through manly vigour, O fierce One, gathering spoil, subduing others, Thyself alone the universe's Sovran: so send forth men to combat and to rest them.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र मात्रा॑भी रिरिचे॒ रोच॑मानः॒ प्र दे॒वेभि॑र्वि॒श्वतो॒ अप्र॑तीतः प्र म॒ज्मना॑ दि॒व इन्द्रः॑ पृथि॒व्याः प्रोरोर्म॒हो अ॒न्तरि॑क्षादृजी॒षी
stanzas.transliteration: prá mā́trābhī ririce rócamānaḥ prá devébhir viśváto ápratītaḥ prá majmánā divá índraḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ prórór mahó antárikṣād r̥jīṣī́
stanzas.translation: He hath surpassed all measure in his brightness, yea, and the Gods, for none may be his equal. Impetuous Indra in his might cxccedcth wide vast mid-air and heaven and earth together.

translations.griffith: He hath surpassed all measure in his brightness, yea, and the Gods, for none may be his equal. Impetuous Indra in his might cxccedcth wide vast mid-air and heaven and earth together.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒रुं ग॑भी॒रं ज॒नुषा॒भ्यु१॒॑ग्रं वि॒श्वव्य॑चसमव॒तं म॑ती॒नाम् इन्द्रं॒ सोमा॑सः प्र॒दिवि॑ सु॒तासः॑ समु॒द्रं न स्र॒वत॒ आ वि॑शन्ति
stanzas.transliteration: urúṃ gabhīráṃ janúṣābhy ùgráṃ viśvávyacasam avatám matīnā́m índraṃ sómāsaḥ pradívi sutā́saḥ samudráṃ ná sraváta ā́ viśanti
stanzas.translation: To Indra, even as rivers to the ocean, flow forth from days of old the Soma juices; To him wide deep and mighty from his birth-time, the well of holy thoughts, aIl-comprehending.

translations.griffith: To Indra, even as rivers to the ocean, flow forth from days of old the Soma juices; To him wide deep and mighty from his birth-time, the well of holy thoughts, aIl-comprehending.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं सोम॑मिन्द्र पृथि॒वीद्यावा॒ गर्भं॒ न मा॒ता बि॑भृ॒तस्त्वा॒या तं ते॑ हिन्वन्ति॒ तमु॑ ते मृजन्त्यध्व॒र्यवो॑ वृषभ॒ पात॒वा उ॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ sómam indra pr̥thivī́dyā́vā gárbhaṃ ná mātā́ bibhr̥tás tvāyā́ táṃ te hinvanti tám u te mr̥janti- adhvaryávo vr̥ṣabha pā́tavā́ u
stanzas.translation: The Soma, Indra, which the earth and heaven bear for thee as a mother bears her infant, This they send forth to thee, this, vigorous Hero! Adhvaryus purify for thee to drink of.

translations.griffith: The Soma, Indra, which the earth and heaven bear for thee as a mother bears her infant, This they send forth to thee, this, vigorous Hero! Adhvaryus purify for thee to drink of.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒रुत्वाँ॑ इन्द्र वृष॒भो रणा॑य॒ पिबा॒ सोम॑मनुष्व॒धं मदा॑य आ सि॑ञ्चस्व ज॒ठरे॒ मध्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिं त्वं राजा॑सि प्र॒दिवः॑ सु॒ताना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: marútvām̐ indra vr̥ṣabhó ráṇāya píbā sómam anuṣvadhám mádāya ā́ siñcasva jaṭháre mádhva ūrmíṃ tváṃ rā́jāsi pradívaḥ sutā́nām
stanzas.translation: DRINK, Indra, Marut-girt, as Bull, the Soma, for joy, for rapture even as thou listest. Pour down the flood of meath within thy belly: thou from of old art King of Soma juices.

translations.griffith: DRINK, Indra, Marut-girt, as Bull, the Soma, for joy, for rapture even as thou listest. Pour down the flood of meath within thy belly: thou from of old art King of Soma juices.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒जोषा॑ इन्द्र॒ सग॑णो म॒रुद्भिः॒ सोमं॑ पिब वृत्र॒हा शू॑र वि॒द्वान् ज॒हि शत्रूँ॒रप॒ मृधो॑ नुद॒स्वाथाभ॑यं कृणुहि वि॒श्वतो॑ नः
stanzas.transliteration: sajóṣā indra ságaṇo marúdbhiḥ sómam piba vr̥trahā́ śūra vidvā́n jahí śátrūm̐r ápa mŕ̥dho nudasva- -áthā́bhayaṃ kr̥ṇuhi viśváto naḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra, accordant, with the banded Maruts, drink Soma, Hero, as wise Vr̥itra-slayer. Slay thou our foemen, drive away assailants and make us safe on every side from danger.

translations.griffith: Indra, accordant, with the banded Maruts, drink Soma, Hero, as wise Vr̥itra-slayer. Slay thou our foemen, drive away assailants and make us safe on every side from danger.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त ऋ॒तुभि॑र्ऋतुपाः पाहि॒ सोम॒मिन्द्र॑ दे॒वेभिः॒ सखि॑भिः सु॒तं नः॑ याँ आभ॑जो म॒रुतो॒ ये त्वान्वह॑न्वृ॒त्रमद॑धु॒स्तुभ्य॒मोजः॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá r̥túbhir r̥tupāḥ pāhi sómam índra devébhiḥ sákhibhiḥ sutáṃ naḥ yā́m̐ ā́bhajo marúto yé tvā́nu- áhan vr̥trám ádadhus túbhyam ójaḥ
stanzas.translation: And, drinker at due seasons, drink in season, Indra, with friendly Gods, our pressed-out Soma. The Maruts following, whom thou madest sharers, gave thee the victory, and thou slewest Vr̥itra.

translations.griffith: And, drinker at due seasons, drink in season, Indra, with friendly Gods, our pressed-out Soma. The Maruts following, whom thou madest sharers, gave thee the victory, and thou slewest Vr̥itra.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये त्वा॑हि॒हत्ये॑ मघव॒न्नव॑र्ध॒न्ये शा॑म्ब॒रे ह॑रिवो॒ ये गवि॑ष्टौ ये त्वा॑ नू॒नम॑नु॒मद॑न्ति॒ विप्राः॒ पिबे॑न्द्र॒ सोमं॒ सग॑णो म॒रुद्भिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yé tvāhihátye maghavann ávardhan yé śāmbaré harivo yé gáviṣṭau yé tvā nūnám anumádanti víprāḥ píbendra sómaṃ ságaṇo marúdbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Drink Soma, Indra, banded with the Maruts who, Maghavan, strengthened thee at Ahi's slaughter, 'Gainst Ṣambara, Lord of Bays! in winning cattle, and now rejoice in thee, the holy Singers.

translations.griffith: Drink Soma, Indra, banded with the Maruts who, Maghavan, strengthened thee at Ahi's slaughter, 'Gainst Ṣambara, Lord of Bays! in winning cattle, and now rejoice in thee, the holy Singers.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒रुत्व॑न्तं वृष॒भं वा॑वृधा॒नमक॑वारिं दि॒व्यं शा॒समिन्द्र॑म् वि॒श्वा॒साह॒मव॑से॒ नूत॑नायो॒ग्रं स॑हो॒दामि॒ह तं हु॑वेम
stanzas.transliteration: marútvantaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ vāvr̥dhānám ákavāriṃ divyáṃ śāsám índram viśvāsā́ham ávase nū́tanāya- -ugráṃ sahodā́m ihá táṃ huvema
stanzas.translation: The Bull whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the celestial Ruler, Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.

translations.griffith: The Bull whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the celestial Ruler, Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒द्यो ह॑ जा॒तो वृ॑ष॒भः क॒नीनः॒ प्रभ॑र्तुमाव॒दन्ध॑सः सु॒तस्य॑ सा॒धोः पि॑ब प्रतिका॒मं यथा॑ ते॒ रसा॑शिरः प्रथ॒मं सो॒म्यस्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: sadyó ha jātó vr̥ṣabháḥ kanī́naḥ prábhartum āvad ándhasaḥ sutásya sādhóḥ piba pratikāmáṃ yáthā te rásāśiraḥ prathamáṃ somyásya
stanzas.translation: SOON as the young Bull sprang into existence he longed to taste the pressed-out Soma's liquor. Drink thou thy fill, according to thy longing, first, of the goodly mixture blent with Soma.

translations.griffith: SOON as the young Bull sprang into existence he longed to taste the pressed-out Soma's liquor. Drink thou thy fill, according to thy longing, first, of the goodly mixture blent with Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: यज्जाय॑था॒स्तदह॑रस्य॒ कामें॒ऽशोः पी॒यूष॑मपिबो गिरि॒ष्ठाम् तं ते॑ मा॒ता परि॒ योषा॒ जनि॑त्री म॒हः पि॒तुर्दम॒ आसि॑ञ्च॒दग्रे॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáj jā́yathās tád áhar asya kā́me -aṃśóḥ pīyū́ṣam apibo giriṣṭhā́m táṃ te mātā́ pári yóṣā jánitrī maháḥ pitúr dáma ā́siñcad ágre
stanzas.translation: That day when thou wast born thou, fain to taste it, drankest the plant's milk which the mountains nourish. That milk thy Mother first, the Dame who bare thee, poured for thee in thy mighty Father's dwelling.

translations.griffith: That day when thou wast born thou, fain to taste it, drankest the plant's milk which the mountains nourish. That milk thy Mother first, the Dame who bare thee, poured for thee in thy mighty Father's dwelling.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒प॒स्थाय॑ मा॒तर॒मन्न॑मैट्ट ति॒ग्मम॑पश्यद॒भि सोम॒मूधः॑ प्र॒या॒वय॑न्नचर॒द्गृत्सो॑ अ॒न्यान्म॒हानि॑ चक्रे पुरु॒धप्र॑तीकः
stanzas.transliteration: upasthā́ya mātáram ánnam aiṭṭa tigmám apaśyad abhí sómam ū́dhaḥ prayāváyann acarad gŕ̥tso anyā́n mahā́ni cakre purudhápratīkaḥ
stanzas.translation: Desiring food he came unto his Mother, and on her breast beheld the pungent Soma. Wise, he moved on, keeping aloof the others, and wrought great exploits in his varied aspects.

translations.griffith: Desiring food he came unto his Mother, and on her breast beheld the pungent Soma. Wise, he moved on, keeping aloof the others, and wrought great exploits in his varied aspects.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒ग्रस्तु॑रा॒षाळ॒भिभू॑त्योजा यथाव॒शं त॒न्वं॑ चक्र ए॒षः त्वष्टा॑र॒मिन्द्रो॑ ज॒नुषा॑भि॒भूया॒मुष्या॒ सोम॑मपिबच्च॒मूषु॑
stanzas.transliteration: ugrás turāṣā́ḷ abhíbhūtyojāḥ- yathāvaśáṃ tanvàṃ cakra eṣáḥ tváṣṭāram índro janúṣābhibhū́ya- -āmúṣyā sómam apibac camū́ṣu
stanzas.translation: Fierce, quickly conquering, of surpassing vigour, he framed his body even as he listed. E'en from his birth-time Indra conquered Tvashṭar, bore off the Soma and in beakers drank it.

translations.griffith: Fierce, quickly conquering, of surpassing vigour, he framed his body even as he listed. E'en from his birth-time Indra conquered Tvashṭar, bore off the Soma and in beakers drank it.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: शंसा॑ म॒हामिन्द्रं॒ यस्मि॒न्विश्वा॒ आ कृ॒ष्टयः॑ सोम॒पाः काम॒मव्य॑न् यं सु॒क्रतुं॑ धि॒षणे॑ विभ्वत॒ष्टं घ॒नं वृ॒त्राणां॑ ज॒नय॑न्त दे॒वाः
stanzas.transliteration: śáṃsā mahā́m índraṃ yásmin víśvāḥ- ā́ kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ somapā́ḥ kā́mam ávyan yáṃ sukrátuṃ dhiṣáṇe vibhvataṣṭáṃ ghanáṃ vr̥trā́ṇāṃ janáyanta devā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: GREAT Indra will I laud, in whom all people who drink the Soma have attained their longing; Whom, passing wise, Gods, Heaven and Earth, engendered, formed by a Master's hand, to crush the Vr̥itras.

translations.griffith: GREAT Indra will I laud, in whom all people who drink the Soma have attained their longing; Whom, passing wise, Gods, Heaven and Earth, engendered, formed by a Master's hand, to crush the Vr̥itras.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं नु नकिः॒ पृत॑नासु स्व॒राजं॑ द्वि॒ता तर॑ति॒ नृत॑मं हरि॒ष्ठाम् इ॒नत॑मः॒ सत्व॑भि॒र्यो ह॑ शू॒षैः पृ॑थु॒ज्रया॑ अमिना॒दायु॒र्दस्योः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ nú nákiḥ pŕ̥tanāsu svarā́jaṃ dvitā́ tárati nŕ̥tamaṃ hariṣṭhā́m inátamaḥ sátvabhir yó ha śūṣaíḥ pr̥thujráyā aminād ā́yur dásyoḥ
stanzas.translation: Whom, most heroic, borne by Tawny Coursers, verily none subdueth in the battle; Who, reaching far, most vigorous, hath shortened the Dasyu's life with Warriors bold of spirit.

translations.griffith: Whom, most heroic, borne by Tawny Coursers, verily none subdueth in the battle; Who, reaching far, most vigorous, hath shortened the Dasyu's life with Warriors bold of spirit.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒हावा॑ पृ॒त्सु त॒रणि॒र्नार्वा॑ व्यान॒शी रोद॑सी मे॒हना॑वान् भगो॒ न का॒रे हव्यो॑ मती॒नां पि॒तेव॒ चारुः॑ सु॒हवो॑ वयो॒धाः
stanzas.transliteration: sahā́vā pr̥tsú taráṇir nā́rvā vyānaśī́ ródasī mehánāvān bhágo ná kāré hávyo matīnā́m pitéva cā́ruḥ suhávo vayodhā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Victor in fight, swift mover like a warhorse, pervading both worlds, rainer down of blessings, To he invoked in war like Bhaga, Father, as 'twere, of hymns, fair, prompt to hear, strength-giver.

translations.griffith: Victor in fight, swift mover like a warhorse, pervading both worlds, rainer down of blessings, To he invoked in war like Bhaga, Father, as 'twere, of hymns, fair, prompt to hear, strength-giver.

stanzas.sanskrit: ध॒र्ता दि॒वो रज॑सस्पृ॒ष्ट ऊ॒र्ध्वो रथो॒ न वा॒युर्वसु॑भिर्नि॒युत्वा॑न् क्ष॒पां व॒स्ता ज॑नि॒ता सूर्य॑स्य॒ विभ॑क्ता भा॒गं धि॒षणे॑व॒ वाज॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: dhartā́ divó rájasas pr̥ṣṭá ūrdhvó rátho ná vāyúr vásubhir niyútvān kṣapā́ṃ vastā́ janitā́ sū́ryasya víbhaktā bhāgáṃ dhiṣáṇeva vā́jam
stanzas.translation: Supporting heaven, the high back of the region, his car is Vâyu with his team of Vasus. Illumining the nights, the Sun's creator, like Dhishaṇâ he deals forth strength and riches.

translations.griffith: Supporting heaven, the high back of the region, his car is Vâyu with his team of Vasus. Illumining the nights, the Sun's creator, like Dhishaṇâ he deals forth strength and riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers treasure.

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers treasure.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रः॒ स्वाहा॑ पिबतु॒ यस्य॒ सोम॑ आ॒गत्या॒ तुम्रो॑ वृष॒भो म॒रुत्वा॑न् ओरु॒व्यचाः॑ पृणतामे॒भिरन्नै॒रास्य॑ ह॒विस्त॒न्व१॒॑ः काम॑मृध्याः
stanzas.transliteration: índraḥ svā́hā pibatu yásya sómaḥ- āgátyā túmro vr̥ṣabhó marútvān óruvyácāḥ pr̥ṇatām ebhír ánnair ā́sya havís tanvàḥ kā́mam r̥dhyāḥ
stanzas.translation: LET Indra drink, All-hail! for his is Soma,– the mighty Bull come, girt by Maruts, hither. Far-reaching, let him fill him with these viands, and let our offering sate his body's longing.

translations.griffith: LET Indra drink, All-hail! for his is Soma,– the mighty Bull come, girt by Maruts, hither. Far-reaching, let him fill him with these viands, and let our offering sate his body's longing.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॑ सप॒र्यू ज॒वसे॑ युनज्मि॒ ययो॒रनु॑ प्र॒दिवः॑ श्रु॒ष्टिमावः॑ इ॒ह त्वा॑ धेयु॒र्हर॑यः सुशिप्र॒ पिबा॒ त्व१॒॑स्य सुषु॑तस्य॒ चारोः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te saparyū́ javáse yunajmi yáyor ánu pradívaḥ śruṣṭím ā́vaḥ ihá tvā dheyur hárayaḥ suśipra píbā tv àsyá súṣutasya cā́roḥ
stanzas.translation: I yoke thy pair of trusty Steeds for swiftness, whose faithful service from of old thou lovest. Here, fair of cheek! let thy Bay Coursers place thee: drink of this lovely welleffused libation.

translations.griffith: I yoke thy pair of trusty Steeds for swiftness, whose faithful service from of old thou lovest. Here, fair of cheek! let thy Bay Coursers place thee: drink of this lovely welleffused libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: गोभि॑र्मिमि॒क्षुं द॑धिरे सुपा॒रमिन्द्रं॒ ज्यैष्ठ्या॑य॒ धाय॑से गृणा॒नाः म॒न्दा॒नः सोमं॑ पपि॒वाँ ऋ॑जीषि॒न्त्सम॒स्मभ्यं॑ पुरु॒धा गा इ॑षण्य
stanzas.transliteration: góbhir mimikṣúṃ dadhire supārám índraṃ jyaíṣṭhyāya dhā́yase gr̥ṇānā́ḥ mandānáḥ sómam papivā́m̐ r̥jīṣin sám asmábhyam purudhā́ gā́ iṣaṇya
stanzas.translation: With milk they made Indra their good Preserver, lauding for help and rule the bounteous rainer. Impetuous God, when thou hast drunk the Soma, enraptured send us cattle in abundance.

translations.griffith: With milk they made Indra their good Preserver, lauding for help and rule the bounteous rainer. Impetuous God, when thou hast drunk the Soma, enraptured send us cattle in abundance.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं कामं॑ मन्दया॒ गोभि॒रश्वै॑श्च॒न्द्रव॑ता॒ राध॑सा प॒प्रथ॑श्च स्व॒र्यवो॑ म॒तिभि॒स्तुभ्यं॒ विप्रा॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ वाहः॑ कुशि॒कासो॑ अक्रन्
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ kā́mam mandayā góbhir áśvaiś candrávatā rā́dhasā papráthaś ca svaryávo matíbhis túbhyaṃ víprāḥ- índrāya vā́haḥ kuśikā́so akran
stanzas.translation: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty still extend it. Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, the Kuṣikas have brought their gift, the singers.

translations.griffith: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty still extend it. Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, the Kuṣikas have brought their gift, the singers.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām
stanzas.translation: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

translations.griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered; The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: च॒र्ष॒णी॒धृतं॑ म॒घवा॑नमु॒क्थ्य१॒॑मिन्द्रं॒ गिरो॑ बृह॒तीर॒भ्य॑नूषत वा॒वृ॒धा॒नं पु॑रुहू॒तं सु॑वृ॒क्तिभि॒रम॑र्त्यं॒ जर॑माणं दि॒वेदि॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: carṣaṇīdhŕ̥tam maghávānam ukthyàm índraṃ gíro br̥hatī́r abhy ànūṣata vāvr̥dhānám puruhūtáṃ suvr̥ktíbhir ámartyaṃ járamāṇaṃ divé-dive
stanzas.translation: HIGH hymns have sounded forth the praise of Maghavan, supporter of mankind, of Indra meet for lauds; Him who hath waxen great, invoked with beauteous songs, Immortal One, whose praise each day is sung aloud.

translations.griffith: HIGH hymns have sounded forth the praise of Maghavan, supporter of mankind, of Indra meet for lauds; Him who hath waxen great, invoked with beauteous songs, Immortal One, whose praise each day is sung aloud.

stanzas.sanskrit: श॒तक्र॑तुमर्ण॒वं शा॒किनं॒ नरं॒ गिरो॑ म॒ इन्द्र॒मुप॑ यन्ति वि॒श्वतः॑ वा॒ज॒सनिं॑ पू॒र्भिदं॒ तूर्णि॑म॒प्तुरं॑ धाम॒साच॑मभि॒षाचं॑ स्व॒र्विद॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: śatákratum arṇaváṃ śākínaṃ náraṃ gíro ma índram úpa yanti viśvátaḥ vājasánim pūrbhídaṃ tū́rṇim aptúraṃ dhāmasā́cam abhiṣā́caṃ svarvídam
stanzas.translation: To Indra from all sides go forth my songs of praise, the Lord of Hundred Powers, strong, Hero, like the sea, Swift, winner of the booty, breaker-down of forts, faithful and ever-glorious, finder of the light.

translations.griffith: To Indra from all sides go forth my songs of praise, the Lord of Hundred Powers, strong, Hero, like the sea, Swift, winner of the booty, breaker-down of forts, faithful and ever-glorious, finder of the light.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒क॒रे वसो॑र्जरि॒ता प॑नस्यतेऽने॒हसः॒ स्तुभ॒ इन्द्रो॑ दुवस्यति वि॒वस्व॑तः॒ सद॑न॒ आ हि पि॑प्रि॒ये स॑त्रा॒साह॑मभिमाति॒हनं॑ स्तुहि
stanzas.transliteration: ākaré vásor jaritā́ panasyate -anehása stúbha índro duvasyati vivásvataḥ sádana ā́ hí pipriyé satrāsā́ham abhimātihánaṃ stuhi
stanzas.translation: Where battle's spoil is piled the singer winneth praise, for Indra taketh care of matchless worshippers. He in Vivasvan's dwelling findeth his delight: praise thou the ever-conquering slayer of the foe.

translations.griffith: Where battle's spoil is piled the singer winneth praise, for Indra taketh care of matchless worshippers. He in Vivasvan's dwelling findeth his delight: praise thou the ever-conquering slayer of the foe.

stanzas.sanskrit: नृ॒णामु॑ त्वा॒ नृत॑मं गी॒र्भिरु॒क्थैर॒भि प्र वी॒रम॑र्चता स॒बाधः॑ सं सह॑से पुरुमा॒यो जि॑हीते॒ नमो॑ अस्य प्र॒दिव॒ एक॑ ईशे
stanzas.transliteration: nr̥ṇā́m u tvā nŕ̥tamaṃ gīrbhír ukthaír abhí prá vīrám arcatā sabā́dhaḥ sáṃ sáhase purumāyó jihīte námo asya pradíva éka īśe
stanzas.translation: Thee, valorous, most heroic of the heroes, shall the priests glorify with songg and praises. Full of all wondrous power he goes to conquest: worship is his, sole Lord from days aforetime.

translations.griffith: Thee, valorous, most heroic of the heroes, shall the priests glorify with songg and praises. Full of all wondrous power he goes to conquest: worship is his, sole Lord from days aforetime.

stanzas.sanskrit: पू॒र्वीर॑स्य नि॒ष्षिधो॒ मर्त्ये॑षु पु॒रू वसू॑नि पृथि॒वी बि॑भर्ति इन्द्रा॑य॒ द्याव॒ ओष॑धीरु॒तापो॑ र॒यिं र॑क्षन्ति जी॒रयो॒ वना॑नि
stanzas.transliteration: pūrvī́r asya niṣṣídho mártyeṣu purū́ vásūni pr̥thivī́ bibharti índrāya dyā́va óṣadhīr utā́po rayíṃ rakṣanti jīráyo vánāni
stanzas.translation: Abundant are the gifts he gives to mortals: for him the earth bears a rich store of treasures. The heavens, the growing plants, the living waters, the forest trees preserve their wealth for Indra.

translations.griffith: Abundant are the gifts he gives to mortals: for him the earth bears a rich store of treasures. The heavens, the growing plants, the living waters, the forest trees preserve their wealth for Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: तुभ्यं॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ गिर॑ इन्द्र॒ तुभ्यं॑ स॒त्रा द॑धिरे हरिवो जु॒षस्व॑ बो॒ध्या॒३॒॑पिरव॑सो॒ नूत॑नस्य॒ सखे॑ वसो जरि॒तृभ्यो॒ वयो॑ धाः
stanzas.transliteration: túbhyam bráhmāṇi gíra indra túbhyaṃ satrā́ dadhire harivo juṣásva bodhy ā̀pír ávaso nū́tanasya sákhe vaso jaritŕ̥bhyo váyo dhāḥ
stanzas.translation: To thee, O Indra, Lord of Bays, for ever are offered prayers and songs: accept them gladly. As Kinsman think thou of some fresh assistance; good Friend, give strength and life to those who praise thee.

translations.griffith: To thee, O Indra, Lord of Bays, for ever are offered prayers and songs: accept them gladly. As Kinsman think thou of some fresh assistance; good Friend, give strength and life to those who praise thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑ मरुत्व इ॒ह पा॑हि॒ सोमं॒ यथा॑ शार्या॒ते अपि॑बः सु॒तस्य॑ तव॒ प्रणी॑ती॒ तव॑ शूर॒ शर्म॒न्ना वि॑वासन्ति क॒वयः॑ सुय॒ज्ञाः
stanzas.transliteration: índra marutva ihá pāhi sómaṃ yáthā śāryāté ápibaḥ sutásya táva práṇītī táva śūra śármann ā́ vivāsanti kaváyaḥ suyajñā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Here, Indra, drink thou Soma with the Maruts, as thou didst drink the juice beside Saryata. Under thy guidance, in thy keeping, Hero, the singers serve, skilled in fair sacrifices.

translations.griffith: Here, Indra, drink thou Soma with the Maruts, as thou didst drink the juice beside Saryata. Under thy guidance, in thy keeping, Hero, the singers serve, skilled in fair sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: स वा॑वशा॒न इ॒ह पा॑हि॒ सोमं॑ म॒रुद्भि॑रिन्द्र॒ सखि॑भिः सु॒तं नः॑ जा॒तं यत्त्वा॒ परि॑ दे॒वा अभू॑षन्म॒हे भरा॑य पुरुहूत॒ विश्वे॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá vāvaśāná ihá pāhi sómam marúdbhir indra sákhibhiḥ sutáṃ naḥ jātáṃ yát tvā pári devā́ ábhūṣan mahé bhárāya puruhūta víśve
stanzas.translation: So eagerly desirous drink the Soma, our juice, O Indra, with thy friends the Maruts, Since at thy birth all Deities adorned thee for the great fight, O thou invoked of many.

translations.griffith: So eagerly desirous drink the Soma, our juice, O Indra, with thy friends the Maruts, Since at thy birth all Deities adorned thee for the great fight, O thou invoked of many.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒प्तूर्ये॑ मरुत आ॒पिरे॒षोऽम॑न्द॒न्निन्द्र॒मनु॒ दाति॑वाराः तेभिः॑ सा॒कं पि॑बतु वृत्रखा॒दः सु॒तं सोमं॑ दा॒शुषः॒ स्वे स॒धस्थे॑
stanzas.transliteration: aptū́rye maruta āpír eṣó -ámandann índram ánu dā́tivārāḥ tébhiḥ sākám pibatu vr̥trakhādáḥ sutáṃ sómaṃ dāśúṣaḥ své sadhásthe
stanzas.translation: He was your comrade in your zeal, O Maruts: they, rich in noble gifts, rejoiced in Indra. With them together let the Vr̥itra-slayer drink in his home the worshipper's libation.

translations.griffith: He was your comrade in your zeal, O Maruts: they, rich in noble gifts, rejoiced in Indra. With them together let the Vr̥itra-slayer drink in his home the worshipper's libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दं ह्यन्वोज॑सा सु॒तं रा॑धानां पते पिबा॒ त्व१॒॑स्य गि॑र्वणः
stanzas.transliteration: idáṃ hy ánv ójasā sutáṃ rādhānām pate píbā tv àsyá girvaṇaḥ
stanzas.translation: So, Lord of affluent gifts, this juice hath been pressed for thee with strength Drink of it, thou who lovest song.

translations.griffith: So, Lord of affluent gifts, this juice hath been pressed for thee with strength Drink of it, thou who lovest song.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्ते॒ अनु॑ स्व॒धामस॑त्सु॒ते नि य॑च्छ त॒न्व॑म् स त्वा॑ ममत्तु सो॒म्यम्
stanzas.transliteration: yás te ánu svadhā́m ásat suté ní yacha tanvàm sá tvā mamattu somyám
stanzas.translation: Incline thy body to this juice which suits thy Godlike nature well: May it cheer thee who lovest it.

translations.griffith: Incline thy body to this juice which suits thy Godlike nature well: May it cheer thee who lovest it.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र ते॑ अश्नोतु कु॒क्ष्योः प्रेन्द्र॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ शिरः॑ प्र बा॒हू शू॑र॒ राध॑से
stanzas.transliteration: prá te aśnotu kukṣyóḥ préndra bráhmaṇā śíraḥ prá bāhū́ śūra rā́dhase
stanzas.translation: Brave Indra, let it work through both thy flanks, and through thy head by prayer, And through thine arms, to prosper us.

translations.griffith: Brave Indra, let it work through both thy flanks, and through thy head by prayer, And through thine arms, to prosper us.

stanzas.sanskrit: धा॒नाव॑न्तं कर॒म्भिण॑मपू॒पव॑न्तमु॒क्थिन॑म् इन्द्र॑ प्रा॒तर्जु॑षस्व नः
stanzas.transliteration: dhānā́vantaṃ karambhíṇam apūpávantam ukthínam índra prātár juṣasva naḥ
stanzas.translation: INDRA, accept at break of day our Soma mixt with roasted corn, With groats with cake, with eulogies.

translations.griffith: INDRA, accept at break of day our Soma mixt with roasted corn, With groats with cake, with eulogies.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रो॒ळाशं॑ पच॒त्यं॑ जु॒षस्वे॒न्द्रा गु॑रस्व च तुभ्यं॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ सिस्रते
stanzas.transliteration: puroḷā́śam pacatyàṃ juṣásvendrā́ gurasva ca túbhyaṃ havyā́ni sisrate
stanzas.translation: Accept, O Indra, and enjoy the well-dressed sacrificial cake: Oblations are poured forth to thee.

translations.griffith: Accept, O Indra, and enjoy the well-dressed sacrificial cake: Oblations are poured forth to thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रो॒ळाशं॑ च नो॒ घसो॑ जो॒षया॑से॒ गिर॑श्च नः व॒धू॒युरि॑व॒ योष॑णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: puroḷā́śaṃ ca no gháso joṣáyāse gíraś ca naḥ vadhūyúr iva yóṣaṇām
stanzas.translation: Consume our sacrificial cake, accept the songs of praise we sing, As he who woes accepts his bride.

translations.griffith: Consume our sacrificial cake, accept the songs of praise we sing, As he who woes accepts his bride.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रो॒ळाशं॑ सनश्रुत प्रातःसा॒वे जु॑षस्व नः इन्द्र॒ क्रतु॒र्हि ते॑ बृ॒हन्
stanzas.transliteration: puroḷā́śaṃ sanaśruta prātaḥsāvé juṣasva naḥ índra krátur hí te br̥hán
stanzas.translation: Famed from of old, accept the cake at our libation poured at dawn, Forgreat, O Indra, is thy power.

translations.griffith: Famed from of old, accept the cake at our libation poured at dawn, Forgreat, O Indra, is thy power.

stanzas.sanskrit: माध्यं॑दिनस्य॒ सव॑नस्य धा॒नाः पु॑रो॒ळाश॑मिन्द्र कृष्वे॒ह चारु॑म् प्र यत्स्तो॒ता ज॑रि॒ता तूर्ण्य॑र्थो वृषा॒यमा॑ण॒ उप॑ गी॒र्भिरीट्टे॑
stanzas.transliteration: mā́dhyaṃdinasya sávanasya dhānā́ḥ puroḷā́śam indra kr̥ṣvehá cā́rum prá yát stotā́ jaritā́ tū́rṇyartho vr̥ṣāyámāṇa úpa gīrbhír ī́ṭṭe
stanzas.translation: Let roasted corn of our midday libation, and sacrificial cake here please thee, Indra, What time the lauding singer, keen of purpose and eager as a bull, with hymns implores thee.

translations.griffith: Let roasted corn of our midday libation, and sacrificial cake here please thee, Indra, What time the lauding singer, keen of purpose and eager as a bull, with hymns implores thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: तृ॒तीये॑ धा॒नाः सव॑ने पुरुष्टुत पुरो॒ळाश॒माहु॑तं मामहस्व नः ऋ॒भु॒मन्तं॒ वाज॑वन्तं त्वा कवे॒ प्रय॑स्वन्त॒ उप॑ शिक्षेम धी॒तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tr̥tī́ye dhānā́ḥ sávane puruṣṭuta puroḷā́śam ā́hutam māmahasva naḥ r̥bhumántaṃ vā́javantaṃ tvā kave práyasvanta úpa śikṣema dhītíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: At the third sacrifice, O thou whom many praise, give glory to the roasted corn and holy cake. With offered viands and with songs may we assist thee, Sage, whom Vâja and the R̥ibhus wait upon.

translations.griffith: At the third sacrifice, O thou whom many praise, give glory to the roasted corn and holy cake. With offered viands and with songs may we assist thee, Sage, whom Vâja and the R̥ibhus wait upon.

stanzas.sanskrit: पू॒ष॒ण्वते॑ ते चकृमा कर॒म्भं हरि॑वते॒ हर्य॑श्वाय धा॒नाः अ॒पू॒पम॑द्धि॒ सग॑णो म॒रुद्भिः॒ सोमं॑ पिब वृत्र॒हा शू॑र वि॒द्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: pūṣaṇváte te cakr̥mā karambháṃ hárivate háryaśvāya dhānā́ḥ apūpám addhi ságaṇo marúdbhiḥ sómam piba vr̥trahā́ śūra vidvā́n
stanzas.translation: The groats have we prepared for thee with Pûshan, corn for thee, Lord of Bay Steeds, with thy horses. Eat thou the meal-cake, banded with the Maruts, wise Hero, Vr̥itra-slayer, drink the Soma.

translations.griffith: The groats have we prepared for thee with Pûshan, corn for thee, Lord of Bay Steeds, with thy horses. Eat thou the meal-cake, banded with the Maruts, wise Hero, Vr̥itra-slayer, drink the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रति॑ धा॒ना भ॑रत॒ तूय॑मस्मै पुरो॒ळाशं॑ वी॒रत॑माय नृ॒णाम् दि॒वेदि॑वे स॒दृशी॑रिन्द्र॒ तुभ्यं॒ वर्ध॑न्तु त्वा सोम॒पेया॑य धृष्णो
stanzas.transliteration: práti dhānā́ bharata tū́yam asmai puroḷā́śaṃ vīrátamāya nr̥ṇā́m divé-dive sadŕ̥śīr indra túbhyaṃ várdhantu tvā somapéyāya dhr̥ṣṇo
stanzas.translation: Bring forth the roasted corn to meet him quickly, cake for the bravest Hero mid the heroes. Indra, may hymns accordant with thee daily strengthen thee, Bold One, for the draught of Soma.

translations.griffith: Bring forth the roasted corn to meet him quickly, cake for the bravest Hero mid the heroes. Indra, may hymns accordant with thee daily strengthen thee, Bold One, for the draught of Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑पर्वता बृह॒ता रथे॑न वा॒मीरिष॒ आ व॑हतं सु॒वीराः॑ वी॒तं ह॒व्यान्य॑ध्व॒रेषु॑ देवा॒ वर्धे॑थां गी॒र्भिरिळ॑या॒ मद॑न्ता
stanzas.transliteration: índrāparvatā br̥hatā́ ráthena vāmī́r íṣa ā́ vahataṃ suvī́rāḥ vītáṃ havyā́ny adhvaréṣu devā várdhethāṃ gīrbhír íḷayā mádantā
stanzas.translation: ON a high car, O Parvata and Indra, bring pleasant viands, with brave heroes, hither. Enjoy the gifts, Gods, at our sacrifices wax strong by hymns, rejoice in our oblation.

translations.griffith: ON a high car, O Parvata and Indra, bring pleasant viands, with brave heroes, hither. Enjoy the gifts, Gods, at our sacrifices wax strong by hymns, rejoice in our oblation.

stanzas.sanskrit: तिष्ठा॒ सु कं॑ मघव॒न्मा परा॑ गाः॒ सोम॑स्य॒ नु त्वा॒ सुषु॑तस्य यक्षि पि॒तुर्न पु॒त्रः सिच॒मा र॑भे त॒ इन्द्र॒ स्वादि॑ष्ठया गि॒रा श॑चीवः
stanzas.transliteration: tíṣṭhā sú kam maghavan mā́ párā gāḥ sómasya nú tvā súṣutasya yakṣi pitúr ná putráḥ sícam ā́ rabhe te- índra svā́diṣṭhayā girā́ śacīvaḥ
stanzas.translation: Stay still, O Maghavan, advance no farther. a draught of well-pressed Soma will I give thee. With sweetest song I grasp, O Mighty Indra, thy garment's hem as a child grasps his father's.

translations.griffith: Stay still, O Maghavan, advance no farther. a draught of well-pressed Soma will I give thee. With sweetest song I grasp, O Mighty Indra, thy garment's hem as a child grasps his father's.

stanzas.sanskrit: शंसा॑वाध्वर्यो॒ प्रति॑ मे गृणी॒हीन्द्रा॑य॒ वाहः॑ कृणवाव॒ जुष्ट॑म् एदं ब॒र्हिर्यज॑मानस्य सी॒दाथा॑ च भूदु॒क्थमिन्द्रा॑य श॒स्तम्
stanzas.transliteration: śáṃsāvādhvaryo práti me gr̥ṇīhi- -índrāya vā́haḥ kr̥ṇavāva júṣṭam édám barhír yájamānasya sīda- -áthā ca bhūd ukthám índrāya śastám
stanzas.translation: Adhvaryu, sing we both; sing thou in answer: make we a laud acceptable to Indra. Upon this sacrificer's grass he seated: to Indra shall our eulogy be uttered.

translations.griffith: Adhvaryu, sing we both; sing thou in answer: make we a laud acceptable to Indra. Upon this sacrificer's grass he seated: to Indra shall our eulogy be uttered.

stanzas.sanskrit: जा॒येदस्तं॑ मघव॒न्त्सेदु॒ योनि॒स्तदित्त्वा॑ यु॒क्ता हर॑यो वहन्तु य॒दा क॒दा च॑ सु॒नवा॑म॒ सोम॑म॒ग्निष्ट्वा॑ दू॒तो ध॑न्वा॒त्यच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: jāyéd ástam maghavan séd u yónis tád ít tvā yuktā́ hárayo vahantu yadā́ kadā́ ca sunávāma sómam agníṣ ṭvā dūtó dhanvāty ácha
stanzas.translation: A wife, O Maghavan is home and dwelling: so let thy Bay Steeds yoked convey thee hither. Whenever we press out for thee the Soma, let Agni as our Herald speed to call thee.

translations.griffith: A wife, O Maghavan is home and dwelling: so let thy Bay Steeds yoked convey thee hither. Whenever we press out for thee the Soma, let Agni as our Herald speed to call thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: परा॑ याहि मघव॒न्ना च॑ या॒हीन्द्र॑ भ्रातरुभ॒यत्रा॑ ते॒ अर्थ॑म् यत्रा॒ रथ॑स्य बृह॒तो नि॒धानं॑ वि॒मोच॑नं वा॒जिनो॒ रास॑भस्य
stanzas.transliteration: párā yāhi maghavann ā́ ca yāhi- -índra bhrātar ubhayátrā te ártham yátrā ráthasya br̥ható nidhā́naṃ vimócanaṃ vājíno rā́sabhasya
stanzas.translation: Depart, O Maghavan;again come hither: both there and here thy goat is Indra, Brother, Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and where thqu loosest thy loud-neighing Courser.

translations.griffith: Depart, O Maghavan;again come hither: both there and here thy goat is Indra, Brother, Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and where thqu loosest thy loud-neighing Courser.

stanzas.sanskrit: अपाः॒ सोम॒मस्त॑मिन्द्र॒ प्र या॑हि कल्या॒णीर्जा॒या सु॒रणं॑ गृ॒हे ते॑ यत्रा॒ रथ॑स्य बृह॒तो नि॒धानं॑ वि॒मोच॑नं वा॒जिनो॒ दक्षि॑णावत्
stanzas.transliteration: ápāḥ sómam ástam indra prá yāhi kalyāṇī́r jāyā́ suráṇaṃ gr̥hé te yátrā ráthasya br̥ható nidhā́naṃ vimócanaṃ vājíno dákṣiṇāvat
stanzas.translation: Thou hast drunk Soma, Indra, turn thee homeward; thy joy is in thy home, thy racious Consort; Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and thy strong Courser is set free with guerdon.

translations.griffith: Thou hast drunk Soma, Indra, turn thee homeward; thy joy is in thy home, thy racious Consort; Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and thy strong Courser is set free with guerdon.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मे भो॒जा अङ्गि॑रसो॒ विरू॑पा दि॒वस्पु॒त्रासो॒ असु॑रस्य वी॒राः वि॒श्वामि॑त्राय॒ दद॑तो म॒घानि॑ सहस्रसा॒वे प्र ति॑रन्त॒ आयुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: imé bhojā́ áṅgiraso vírūpāḥ- divás putrā́so ásurasya vīrā́ḥ viśvā́mitrāya dádato maghā́ni sahasrasāvé prá tiranta ā́yuḥ
stanzas.translation: Bounteous are these, Angirases, Virûpas: the Asura's Heroes and the Sons of Heaven. They, giving store of wealth to Viṣvâmitra, prolong his life through countless Soma-pressings.

translations.griffith: Bounteous are these, Angirases, Virûpas: the Asura's Heroes and the Sons of Heaven. They, giving store of wealth to Viṣvâmitra, prolong his life through countless Soma-pressings.

stanzas.sanskrit: रू॒पंरू॑पं म॒घवा॑ बोभवीति मा॒याः कृ॑ण्वा॒नस्त॒न्वं१॒॑ परि॒ स्वाम् त्रिर्यद्दि॒वः परि॑ मुहू॒र्तमागा॒त्स्वैर्मन्त्रै॒रनृ॑तुपा ऋ॒तावा॑
stanzas.transliteration: rūpáṃ-rūpam maghávā bobhavīti māyā́ḥ kr̥ṇvānás tanvàm pári svā́m trír yád diváḥ pári muhūrtám ā́gāt svaír mántrair ánr̥tupā r̥tā́vā
stanzas.translation: Maghavan weareth every shape at pleasure, effecting magic changes in his body, Holy One, drinker out of season, coming thrice, in a moment, through fit prayers, from heaven.

translations.griffith: Maghavan weareth every shape at pleasure, effecting magic changes in his body, Holy One, drinker out of season, coming thrice, in a moment, through fit prayers, from heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हाँ ऋषि॑र्देव॒जा दे॒वजू॒तोऽस्त॑भ्ना॒त्सिन्धु॑मर्ण॒वं नृ॒चक्षाः॑ वि॒श्वामि॑त्रो॒ यदव॑हत्सु॒दास॒मप्रि॑यायत कुशि॒केभि॒रिन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mahā́m̐ ŕ̥ṣir devajā́ devájūtaḥ- -ástabhnāt síndhum arṇaváṃ nr̥cákṣāḥ viśvā́mitro yád ávahat sudā́sam ápriyāyata kuśikébhir índraḥ
stanzas.translation: The mighty sage, God-born and God-incited, who looks on men, restrained the billowy river. When Viṣvâmitra was Sudâs's escort, then Indra through the Kuṣikas grew friendly.

translations.griffith: The mighty sage, God-born and God-incited, who looks on men, restrained the billowy river. When Viṣvâmitra was Sudâs's escort, then Indra through the Kuṣikas grew friendly.

stanzas.sanskrit: हं॒सा इ॑व कृणुथ॒ श्लोक॒मद्रि॑भि॒र्मद॑न्तो गी॒र्भिर॑ध्व॒रे सु॒ते सचा॑ दे॒वेभि॑र्विप्रा ऋषयो नृचक्षसो॒ वि पि॑बध्वं कुशिकाः सो॒म्यं मधु॑
stanzas.transliteration: haṃsā́ iva kr̥ṇutha ślókam ádribhir mádanto gīrbhír adhvaré suté sácā devébhir viprā r̥ṣayo nr̥cakṣaso ví pibadhvaṃ kuśikāḥ somyám mádhu
stanzas.translation: Like swans, prepare a song of praise with pressing-stones, glad in your hymns with juice poured forth in sacrifice. Ye singers, with the Gods, sages who look on men, ye Kutikas drink up the Soma's savoury meath.

translations.griffith: Like swans, prepare a song of praise with pressing-stones, glad in your hymns with juice poured forth in sacrifice. Ye singers, with the Gods, sages who look on men, ye Kutikas drink up the Soma's savoury meath.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॒ प्रेत॑ कुशिकाश्चे॒तय॑ध्व॒मश्वं॑ रा॒ये प्र मु॑ञ्चता सु॒दासः॑ राजा॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॑ङ्घन॒त्प्रागपा॒गुद॒गथा॑ यजाते॒ वर॒ आ पृ॑थि॒व्याः
stanzas.transliteration: úpa préta kuśikāś cetáyadhvam áśvaṃ rāyé prá muñcatā sudā́saḥ rā́jā vr̥tráṃ jaṅghanat prā́g ápāg údag áthā yajāte vára ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Come forward, Kuṣikas, and be attentive; let loose Sudâs's horse to win him riches. East, west, and north, let the King slay the foeman, then at earth's choicest place perform his worship.

translations.griffith: Come forward, Kuṣikas, and be attentive; let loose Sudâs's horse to win him riches. East, west, and north, let the King slay the foeman, then at earth's choicest place perform his worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: य इ॒मे रोद॑सी उ॒भे अ॒हमिन्द्र॒मतु॑ष्टवम् वि॒श्वामि॑त्रस्य रक्षति॒ ब्रह्मे॒दं भार॑तं॒ जन॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yá imé ródasī ubhé ahám índram átuṣṭavam viśvā́mitrasya rakṣati bráhmedám bhā́rataṃ jánam
stanzas.translation: Praises to Indra have I sung, sustainer of this earth and heaven. This prayer of Viṣvâmitra keeps secure the race of Bharatas.

translations.griffith: Praises to Indra have I sung, sustainer of this earth and heaven. This prayer of Viṣvâmitra keeps secure the race of Bharatas.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒श्वामि॑त्रा अरासत॒ ब्रह्मेन्द्रा॑य व॒ज्रिणे॑ कर॒दिन्नः॑ सु॒राध॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: viśvā́mitrā arāsata bráhméndrāya vajríṇe kárad ín naḥ surā́dhasaḥ
stanzas.translation: The Viṣvâmitras have sung forth this prayer to Indra Thunder-aimed: So let him make us prosperous.

translations.griffith: The Viṣvâmitras have sung forth this prayer to Indra Thunder-aimed: So let him make us prosperous.

stanzas.sanskrit: किं ते॑ कृण्वन्ति॒ कीक॑टेषु॒ गावो॒ नाशिरं॑ दु॒ह्रे न त॑पन्ति घ॒र्मम् आ नो॑ भर॒ प्रम॑गन्दस्य॒ वेदो॑ नैचाशा॒खं म॑घवन्रन्धया नः
stanzas.transliteration: kíṃ te kr̥ṇvanti kī́kaṭeṣu gā́vo nā́śíraṃ duhré ná tapanti gharmám ā́ no bhara prámagandasya védo naicāśākhám maghavan randhayā naḥ
stanzas.translation: Among the Kîkaṭas what do thy cattle? They pour no milky draught, they heat no caldron. Bring thou to us the wealth of Pramaganda; give up to us, O Maghavan, the low-born.

translations.griffith: Among the Kîkaṭas what do thy cattle? They pour no milky draught, they heat no caldron. Bring thou to us the wealth of Pramaganda; give up to us, O Maghavan, the low-born.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒स॒र्प॒रीरम॑तिं॒ बाध॑माना बृ॒हन्मि॑माय ज॒मद॑ग्निदत्ता आ सूर्य॑स्य दुहि॒ता त॑तान॒ श्रवो॑ दे॒वेष्व॒मृत॑मजु॒र्यम्
stanzas.transliteration: sasarparī́r ámatim bā́dhamānā br̥hán mimāya jamádagnidattā ā́ sū́ryasya duhitā́ tatāna śrávo devéṣv amŕ̥tam ajuryám
stanzas.translation: Sasarparî, the gift of Jamadagnis, hath lowed with mighty voice dispelling famine. The Daughter of the Sun hath spread our glory among the Gods, imperishable, deathless.

translations.griffith: Sasarparî, the gift of Jamadagnis, hath lowed with mighty voice dispelling famine. The Daughter of the Sun hath spread our glory among the Gods, imperishable, deathless.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒स॒र्प॒रीर॑भर॒त्तूय॑मे॒भ्योऽधि॒ श्रवः॒ पाञ्च॑जन्यासु कृ॒ष्टिषु॑ सा प॒क्ष्या॒३॒॑ नव्य॒मायु॒र्दधा॑ना॒ यां मे॑ पलस्तिजमद॒ग्नयो॑ द॒दुः
stanzas.transliteration: sasarparī́r abharat tū́yam ebhyaḥ- -ádhi śrávaḥ pā́ñcajanyāsu kr̥ṣṭíṣu sā́ pakṣyā̀ návyam ā́yur dádhānā yā́m me palastijamadagnáyo dadúḥ
stanzas.translation: Sasarparî brought glory speedily to these, over the generations of the Fivefold Race; Daughter of Paksa, she bestows new vital power, she whom the ancient Jamadagnis gave to me.

translations.griffith: Sasarparî brought glory speedily to these, over the generations of the Fivefold Race; Daughter of Paksa, she bestows new vital power, she whom the ancient Jamadagnis gave to me.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्थि॒रौ गावौ॑ भवतां वी॒ळुरक्षो॒ मेषा वि व॑र्हि॒ मा यु॒गं वि शा॑रि इन्द्रः॑ पात॒ल्ये॑ ददतां॒ शरी॑तो॒ररि॑ष्टनेमे अ॒भि नः॑ सचस्व
stanzas.transliteration: sthiraú gā́vau bhavatāṃ vīḷúr ákṣo méṣā́ ví varhi mā́ yugáṃ ví śāri índraḥ pātalyè dadatāṃ śárītor áriṣṭaneme abhí naḥ sacasva
stanzas.translation: Strong be the pair of oxen, firm the axles, let not the pole slip nor the yoke be broken. May Indra, keep the yoke-pins from decaying: attend us, thou whose fellies are uninjured.

translations.griffith: Strong be the pair of oxen, firm the axles, let not the pole slip nor the yoke be broken. May Indra, keep the yoke-pins from decaying: attend us, thou whose fellies are uninjured.

stanzas.sanskrit: बलं॑ धेहि त॒नूषु॑ नो॒ बल॑मिन्द्रान॒ळुत्सु॑ नः बलं॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय जी॒वसे॒ त्वं हि ब॑ल॒दा असि॑
stanzas.transliteration: bálaṃ dhehi tanū́ṣu no bálam indrānaḷútsu naḥ bálaṃ tokā́ya tánayāya jīváse tváṃ hí baladā́ ási
stanzas.translation: O Indra, give our bodies strength, strength to the bulls who draw the wains, Strength to our seed and progeny that they may live, for thou art he who giveth strength.

translations.griffith: O Indra, give our bodies strength, strength to the bulls who draw the wains, Strength to our seed and progeny that they may live, for thou art he who giveth strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि व्य॑यस्व खदि॒रस्य॒ सार॒मोजो॑ धेहि स्पन्द॒ने शिं॒शपा॑याम् अक्ष॑ वीळो वीळित वी॒ळय॑स्व॒ मा यामा॑द॒स्मादव॑ जीहिपो नः
stanzas.transliteration: abhí vyayasva khadirásya sā́ram ójo dhehi spandané śiṃśápāyām ákṣa vīḷo vīḷita vīḷáyasva mā́ yā́mād asmā́d áva jīhipo naḥ
stanzas.translation: Enclose thee in the heart of Khayar timber, in the car wrought of Ṣinṣapâ put firmness. Show thyself strong, O Axle, fixed and strengthened: throw us not from the car whereon we travel.

translations.griffith: Enclose thee in the heart of Khayar timber, in the car wrought of Ṣinṣapâ put firmness. Show thyself strong, O Axle, fixed and strengthened: throw us not from the car whereon we travel.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यम॒स्मान्वन॒स्पति॒र्मा च॒ हा मा च॑ रीरिषत् स्व॒स्त्या गृ॒हेभ्य॒ आव॒सा आ वि॒मोच॑नात्
stanzas.transliteration: ayám asmā́n vánaspátir mā́ ca hā́ mā́ ca rīriṣat svasty ā́ gr̥hébhya ā́- -avasā́ ā́ vimócanāt
stanzas.translation: Let not this sovran of the wood leave us forlorn or injure us. Safe may we be until we reach our homes and rest us and unyoke.

translations.griffith: Let not this sovran of the wood leave us forlorn or injure us. Safe may we be until we reach our homes and rest us and unyoke.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॒तिभि॑र्बहु॒लाभि॑र्नो अ॒द्य या॑च्छ्रे॒ष्ठाभि॑र्मघवञ्छूर जिन्व यो नो॒ द्वेष्ट्यध॑रः॒ सस्प॑दीष्ट॒ यमु॑ द्वि॒ष्मस्तमु॑ प्रा॒णो ज॑हातु
stanzas.transliteration: índrotíbhir bahulā́bhir no adyá yācchreṣṭhā́bhir maghavañ chūra jinva yó no dvéṣṭy ádharaḥ sás padīṣṭa yám u dviṣmás tám u prāṇó jahātu
stanzas.translation: With various aids this day come to us, Indra, with best aids speed us, Maghavan, thou Hero. Let him who hatcth us fall headlong downward: him whom we hate let vital breath abandon.

translations.griffith: With various aids this day come to us, Indra, with best aids speed us, Maghavan, thou Hero. Let him who hatcth us fall headlong downward: him whom we hate let vital breath abandon.

stanzas.sanskrit: प॒र॒शुं चि॒द्वि त॑पति शिम्ब॒लं चि॒द्वि वृ॑श्चति उ॒खा चि॑दिन्द्र॒ येष॑न्ती॒ प्रय॑स्ता॒ फेन॑मस्यति
stanzas.transliteration: paraśúṃ cid ví tapati śimbaláṃ cid ví vr̥ścati ukhā́ cid indra yéṣantī práyastā phénam asyati
stanzas.translation: He heats his very axe, and then cuts a mere Semal blossom off. O Indra, like a caldron cracked and seething, so he pours out foam.

translations.griffith: He heats his very axe, and then cuts a mere Semal blossom off. O Indra, like a caldron cracked and seething, so he pours out foam.

stanzas.sanskrit: न साय॑कस्य चिकिते जनासो लो॒धं न॑यन्ति॒ पशु॒ मन्य॑मानाः नावा॑जिनं वा॒जिना॑ हासयन्ति॒ न ग॑र्द॒भं पु॒रो अश्वा॑न्नयन्ति
stanzas.transliteration: ná sā́yakasya cikite janāso lodháṃ nayanti páśu mányamānāḥ nā́vājinaṃ vājínā hāsayanti ná gardabhám puró áśvān nayanti
stanzas.translation: Men notice not the arrow, O ye people; they bring the red beast deeming it a bullock. A sluggish steed men run not with the courser, nor ever lead an ass before a charger.

translations.griffith: Men notice not the arrow, O ye people; they bring the red beast deeming it a bullock. A sluggish steed men run not with the courser, nor ever lead an ass before a charger.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒म इ॑न्द्र भर॒तस्य॑ पु॒त्रा अ॑पपि॒त्वं चि॑कितु॒र्न प्र॑पि॒त्वम् हि॒न्वन्त्यश्व॒मर॑णं॒ न नित्यं॒ ज्या॑वाजं॒ परि॑ णयन्त्या॒जौ
stanzas.transliteration: imá indra bharatásya putrā́ḥ- apapitváṃ cikitur ná prapitvám hinvánty áśvam áraṇaṃ ná nítyaṃ jyā̀vājam pári ṇayanty ājaú
stanzas.translation: These men, the sons of Bharata, O Indra, regard not severance or close connexion. They urge their own steed as it were another's, and take him, swift as the bow's string, to battle.

translations.griffith: These men, the sons of Bharata, O Indra, regard not severance or close connexion. They urge their own steed as it were another's, and take him, swift as the bow's string, to battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं म॒हे वि॑द॒थ्या॑य शू॒षं शश्व॒त्कृत्व॒ ईड्या॑य॒ प्र ज॑भ्रुः शृ॒णोतु॑ नो॒ दम्ये॑भि॒रनी॑कैः शृ॒णोत्व॒ग्निर्दि॒व्यैरज॑स्रः
stanzas.transliteration: imám mahé vidathyā̀ya śūṣáṃ śáśvat kŕ̥tva ī́ḍyāya prá jabhruḥ śr̥ṇótu no dámyebhir ánīkaiḥ śr̥ṇótv agnír divyaír ájasraḥ
stanzas.translation: To him adorable, mighty, meet for synods, this strengthening hymn, unceasing, have they offered. May Agni hear us with his homely splendours, hear us, Eternal One, with heavenly lustre.

translations.griffith: To him adorable, mighty, meet for synods, this strengthening hymn, unceasing, have they offered. May Agni hear us with his homely splendours, hear us, Eternal One, with heavenly lustre.

stanzas.sanskrit: महि॑ म॒हे दि॒वे अ॑र्चा पृथि॒व्यै कामो॑ म इ॒च्छञ्च॑रति प्रजा॒नन् ययो॑र्ह॒ स्तोमे॑ वि॒दथे॑षु दे॒वाः स॑प॒र्यवो॑ मा॒दय॑न्ते॒ सचा॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: máhi mahé divé arcā pr̥thivyaí kā́mo ma icháñ carati prajānán yáyor ha stóme vidátheṣu devā́ḥ saparyávo mādáyante sácāyóḥ
stanzas.translation: To mighty Heaven and Earth I sing forth loudly: my wish goes out desirous and well knowing Both, at whose laud in synods, showing favour, the Gods rejoice them with the living mortal.

translations.griffith: To mighty Heaven and Earth I sing forth loudly: my wish goes out desirous and well knowing Both, at whose laud in synods, showing favour, the Gods rejoice them with the living mortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒वोर्ऋ॒तं रो॑दसी स॒त्यम॑स्तु म॒हे षु णः॑ सुवि॒ताय॒ प्र भू॑तम् इ॒दं दि॒वे नमो॑ अग्ने पृथि॒व्यै स॑प॒र्यामि॒ प्रय॑सा॒ यामि॒ रत्न॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yuvór r̥táṃ rodasī satyám astu mahé ṣú ṇaḥ suvitā́ya prá bhūtam idáṃ divé námo agne pr̥thivyaí saparyā́mi práyasā yā́mi rátnam
stanzas.translation: O Heaven and Earth, may your great law he faithful: he ye our leaders for our high advantage. To Heaven and Earth I offer this my homage, with food, O Agni, as I pray for riches.

translations.griffith: O Heaven and Earth, may your great law he faithful: he ye our leaders for our high advantage. To Heaven and Earth I offer this my homage, with food, O Agni, as I pray for riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒तो हि वां॑ पू॒र्व्या आ॑विवि॒द्र ऋता॑वरी रोदसी सत्य॒वाचः॑ नर॑श्चिद्वां समि॒थे शूर॑सातौ ववन्दि॒रे पृ॑थिवि॒ वेवि॑दानाः
stanzas.transliteration: utó hí vām pūrvyā́ āvividré- ŕ̥tāvarī rodasī satyavā́caḥ náraś cid vāṃ samithé śū́rasātau vavandiré pr̥thivi vévidānāḥ
stanzas.translation: Yea, holy Heaven and Earth, the ancient sages whose word was ever true had power to find you; And brave men in the fightwhere heroes conquer, O Earth, have known you well and paid you honour.

translations.griffith: Yea, holy Heaven and Earth, the ancient sages whose word was ever true had power to find you; And brave men in the fightwhere heroes conquer, O Earth, have known you well and paid you honour.

stanzas.sanskrit: को अ॒द्धा वे॑द॒ क इ॒ह प्र वो॑चद्दे॒वाँ अच्छा॑ प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ का समे॑ति ददृ॑श्र एषामव॒मा सदां॑सि॒ परे॑षु॒ या गुह्ये॑षु व्र॒तेषु॑
stanzas.transliteration: kó addhā́ veda ká ihá prá vocad devā́m̐ áchā pathyā̀ kā́ sám eti dádr̥śra eṣām avamā́ sádāṃsi páreṣu yā́ gúhyeṣu vratéṣu
stanzas.translation: What pathway leadeth to the Gods? Who knoweth this of a truth, and who will now declare it? Seen are their lowest dwelling-places only, but they are in remote and secret regions.

translations.griffith: What pathway leadeth to the Gods? Who knoweth this of a truth, and who will now declare it? Seen are their lowest dwelling-places only, but they are in remote and secret regions.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒विर्नृ॒चक्षा॑ अ॒भि षी॑मचष्ट ऋ॒तस्य॒ योना॒ विघृ॑ते॒ मद॑न्ती नाना॑ चक्राते॒ सद॑नं॒ यथा॒ वेः स॑मा॒नेन॒ क्रतु॑ना संविदा॒ने
stanzas.transliteration: kavír nr̥cákṣā abhí ṣīm acaṣṭa r̥tásya yónā víghr̥te mádantī nā́nā cakrāte sádanaṃ yáthā véḥ samānéna krátunā saṃvidāné
stanzas.translation: The Sage who looketh on mankind hath viewed them bedewed, rejoicing in the seat of Order. They make a home as for a bird, though parted, with one same will finding themselves together.

translations.griffith: The Sage who looketh on mankind hath viewed them bedewed, rejoicing in the seat of Order. They make a home as for a bird, though parted, with one same will finding themselves together.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मा॒न्या वियु॑ते दू॒रेअ॑न्ते ध्रु॒वे प॒दे त॑स्थतुर्जाग॒रूके॑ उ॒त स्वसा॑रा युव॒ती भव॑न्ती॒ आदु॑ ब्रुवाते मिथु॒नानि॒ नाम॑
stanzas.transliteration: samānyā́ víyute dūréante dhruvé padé tasthatur jāgarū́ke utá svásārā yuvatī́ bhávantī ā́d u bruvāte mithunā́ni nā́ma
stanzas.translation: Partners though parted, with far-distant limits, on one firm place both stand for ever watchful, And, being young for evermore, as sisters, speak to each other names that are united.

translations.griffith: Partners though parted, with far-distant limits, on one firm place both stand for ever watchful, And, being young for evermore, as sisters, speak to each other names that are united.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वेदे॒ते जनि॑मा॒ सं वि॑विक्तो म॒हो दे॒वान्बिभ्र॑ती॒ न व्य॑थेते एज॑द्ध्रु॒वं प॑त्यते॒ विश्व॒मेकं॒ चर॑त्पत॒त्रि विषु॑णं॒ वि जा॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: víśvéd eté jánimā sáṃ vivikto mahó devā́n bíbhratī ná vyathete éjad dhruvám patyate víśvam ékaṃ cárat patatrí víṣuṇaṃ ví jātám
stanzas.translation: All living things they part and keep asunder; though bearing up the mighty Gods they reel not. One All is Lord of what is fixed and moving, that walks, that flies, this multiform creation.

translations.griffith: All living things they part and keep asunder; though bearing up the mighty Gods they reel not. One All is Lord of what is fixed and moving, that walks, that flies, this multiform creation.

stanzas.sanskrit: सना॑ पुरा॒णमध्ये॑म्या॒रान्म॒हः पि॒तुर्ज॑नि॒तुर्जा॒मि तन्नः॑ दे॒वासो॒ यत्र॑ पनि॒तार॒ एवै॑रु॒रौ प॒थि व्यु॑ते त॒स्थुर॒न्तः
stanzas.transliteration: sánā purāṇám ádhy emy ārā́t- maháḥ pitúr janitúr jāmí tán naḥ devā́so yátra panitā́ra évair uraú pathí vyùte tasthúr antáḥ
stanzas.translation: Afar the Ancient from of old I ponder, our kinship with our mighty Sire and Father,– Singing the praise whereof the Gods by custom stand on the spacious far-extended pathway.

translations.griffith: Afar the Ancient from of old I ponder, our kinship with our mighty Sire and Father,– Singing the praise whereof the Gods by custom stand on the spacious far-extended pathway.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं स्तोमं॑ रोदसी॒ प्र ब्र॑वीम्यृदू॒दराः॑ शृणवन्नग्निजि॒ह्वाः मि॒त्रः स॒म्राजो॒ वरु॑णो॒ युवा॑न आदि॒त्यासः॑ क॒वयः॑ पप्रथा॒नाः
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ stómaṃ rodasī prá bravīmi- r̥dūdárāḥ śr̥ṇavann agnijihvā́ḥ mitráḥ samrā́jo váruṇo yúvānaḥ- ādityā́saḥ kaváyaḥ paprathānā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: This laud, O Heaven and Earth, to you I utter: let the kind-hearted hear, whose tongue is Agni, Young, Sovran Rulers, Varuṇa and Mitra, the wise and very glorious Âdityas.

translations.griffith: This laud, O Heaven and Earth, to you I utter: let the kind-hearted hear, whose tongue is Agni, Young, Sovran Rulers, Varuṇa and Mitra, the wise and very glorious Âdityas.

stanzas.sanskrit: हिर॑ण्यपाणिः सवि॒ता सु॑जि॒ह्वस्त्रिरा दि॒वो वि॒दथे॒ पत्य॑मानः दे॒वेषु॑ च सवितः॒ श्लोक॒मश्रे॒राद॒स्मभ्य॒मा सु॑व स॒र्वता॑तिम्
stanzas.transliteration: híraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā́ sujihvás trír ā́ divó vidáthe pátyamānaḥ devéṣu ca savitaḥ ślókam áśrer ā́d asmábhyam ā́ suva sarvátātim
stanzas.translation: The fair-tongued Savitar, the golden-handed, comes thrice from heaven as Lord in our assembly. Bear to the Gods this song of praise, and send us, then, Savitar, complete and perfect safety.

translations.griffith: The fair-tongued Savitar, the golden-handed, comes thrice from heaven as Lord in our assembly. Bear to the Gods this song of praise, and send us, then, Savitar, complete and perfect safety.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒कृत्सु॑पा॒णिः स्ववाँ॑ ऋ॒तावा॑ दे॒वस्त्वष्टाव॑से॒ तानि॑ नो धात् पू॒ष॒ण्वन्त॑ ऋभवो मादयध्वमू॒र्ध्वग्रा॑वाणो अध्व॒रम॑तष्ट
stanzas.transliteration: sukŕ̥t supāṇíḥ svávām̐ r̥tā́vā devás tváṣṭā́vase tā́ni no dhāt pūṣaṇvánta r̥bhavo mādayadhvam ūrdhvágrāvāṇo adhvarám ataṣṭa
stanzas.translation: Deft worker, skiful-handed, helpful, holy, may Tvashṭar, God, give us these things to aid us, Take your delight, Ye R̥ibhus joined with Pûshan: ye have prepared the rite with stones adjusted.

translations.griffith: Deft worker, skiful-handed, helpful, holy, may Tvashṭar, God, give us these things to aid us, Take your delight, Ye R̥ibhus joined with Pûshan: ye have prepared the rite with stones adjusted.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒द्युद्र॑था म॒रुत॑ ऋष्टि॒मन्तो॑ दि॒वो मर्या॑ ऋ॒तजा॑ता अ॒यासः॑ सर॑स्वती शृणवन्य॒ज्ञिया॑सो॒ धाता॑ र॒यिं स॒हवी॑रं तुरासः
stanzas.transliteration: vidyúdrathā marúta r̥ṣṭimánto divó máryā r̥tájātā ayā́saḥ sárasvatī śr̥ṇavan yajñíyāso dhā́tā rayíṃ sahávīraṃ turāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: Borne on their flashing car, the spear-armed Maruts, the nimble Youths of Heaven, the Sons of Order, The Holy, and Sarasvatî, shall hear us: ye Mighty, give us wealth with noble offspring.

translations.griffith: Borne on their flashing car, the spear-armed Maruts, the nimble Youths of Heaven, the Sons of Order, The Holy, and Sarasvatî, shall hear us: ye Mighty, give us wealth with noble offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: विष्णुं॒ स्तोमा॑सः पुरुद॒स्मम॒र्का भग॑स्येव का॒रिणो॒ याम॑नि ग्मन् उ॒रु॒क्र॒मः क॑कु॒हो यस्य॑ पू॒र्वीर्न म॑र्धन्ति युव॒तयो॒ जनि॑त्रीः
stanzas.transliteration: víṣṇuṃ stómāsaḥ purudasmám arkā́ḥ- bhágasyeva kāríṇo yā́mani gman urukramáḥ kakuhó yásya pūrvī́r ná mardhanti yuvatáyo jánitrīḥ
stanzas.translation: To Vishṇu rich in marvels, songs And praises shall go as singers on the road of Bhaga,– The Chieftain of the Mighty Stride, whose Mothers, the many young Dames, never disregard him.

translations.griffith: To Vishṇu rich in marvels, songs And praises shall go as singers on the road of Bhaga,– The Chieftain of the Mighty Stride, whose Mothers, the many young Dames, never disregard him.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॒ विश्वै॑र्वी॒र्यै॒३॒॑ः पत्य॑मान उ॒भे आ प॑प्रौ॒ रोद॑सी महि॒त्वा पु॒रं॒द॒रो वृ॑त्र॒हा धृ॒ष्णुषे॑णः सं॒गृभ्या॑ न॒ आ भ॑रा॒ भूरि॑ प॒श्वः
stanzas.transliteration: índro víśvair vīryaìḥ pátyamānaḥ- ubhé ā́ paprau ródasī mahitvā́ puraṃdaró vr̥trahā́ dhr̥ṣṇúṣeṇaḥ saṃgŕ̥bhyā na ā́ bharā bhū́ri paśváḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra, who rules through all his powers heroic, hath with his majesty filled earth and heaven. Lord of brave hosts, Fort-crusher, Vr̥itra-slayer, gather thou up and bring us store of cattle.

translations.griffith: Indra, who rules through all his powers heroic, hath with his majesty filled earth and heaven. Lord of brave hosts, Fort-crusher, Vr̥itra-slayer, gather thou up and bring us store of cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: नास॑त्या मे पि॒तरा॑ बन्धु॒पृच्छा॑ सजा॒त्य॑म॒श्विनो॒श्चारु॒ नाम॑ यु॒वं हि स्थो र॑यि॒दौ नो॑ रयी॒णां दा॒त्रं र॑क्षेथे॒ अक॑वै॒रद॑ब्धा
stanzas.transliteration: nā́satyā me pitárā bandhupŕ̥chā sajātyàm aśvínoś cā́ru nā́ma yuváṃ hí sthó rayidaú no rayīṇā́ṃ dātráṃ rakṣethe ákavair ádabdhā
stanzas.translation: My Sires are the Nâsatyas, kind tokinsmen: the Aṣvins' kinship is a glorious title. For ye are they who give us store of riches: ye guard your gift uncheated by the bounteous.

translations.griffith: My Sires are the Nâsatyas, kind tokinsmen: the Aṣvins' kinship is a glorious title. For ye are they who give us store of riches: ye guard your gift uncheated by the bounteous.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हत्तद्वः॑ कवय॒श्चारु॒ नाम॒ यद्ध॑ देवा॒ भव॑थ॒ विश्व॒ इन्द्रे॑ सख॑ ऋ॒भुभिः॑ पुरुहूत प्रि॒येभि॑रि॒मां धियं॑ सा॒तये॑ तक्षता नः
stanzas.transliteration: mahát tád vaḥ kavayaś cā́ru nā́ma yád dha devā bhávatha víśva índre sákha r̥bhúbhiḥ puruhūta priyébhir imā́ṃ dhíyaṃ sātáye takṣatā naḥ
stanzas.translation: This is, ye Wise, your great and glorious title, that all ye Deities abide in Indra. Friend, Much-invoked! art thou with thy dear R̥ibhus: fashion ye this our hymn for our advantage.

translations.griffith: This is, ye Wise, your great and glorious title, that all ye Deities abide in Indra. Friend, Much-invoked! art thou with thy dear R̥ibhus: fashion ye this our hymn for our advantage.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्य॒मा णो॒ अदि॑तिर्य॒ज्ञिया॒सोऽद॑ब्धानि॒ वरु॑णस्य व्र॒तानि॑ यु॒योत॑ नो अनप॒त्यानि॒ गन्तोः॑ प्र॒जावा॑न्नः पशु॒माँ अ॑स्तु गा॒तुः
stanzas.transliteration: aryamā́ ṇo áditir yajñíyāsaḥ- ádabdhāni váruṇasya vratā́ni yuyóta no anapatyā́ni gántoḥ prajā́vān naḥ paśumā́m̐ astu gātúḥ
stanzas.translation: Aryaman, Aditi deserve our worship: the laws of Varuṇa remain unbroken. The lot of childlessness remove ye from us, and let our course be rich in kine and offspring.

translations.griffith: Aryaman, Aditi deserve our worship: the laws of Varuṇa remain unbroken. The lot of childlessness remove ye from us, and let our course be rich in kine and offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वानां॑ दू॒तः पु॑रु॒ध प्रसू॒तोऽना॑गान्नो वोचतु स॒र्वता॑ता शृ॒णोतु॑ नः पृथि॒वी द्यौरु॒तापः॒ सूर्यो॒ नक्ष॑त्रैरु॒र्व१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षम्
stanzas.transliteration: devā́nāṃ dūtáḥ purudhá prásūtaḥ- -ánāgān no vocatu sarvátātā śr̥ṇótu naḥ pr̥thivī́ dyaúr utā́paḥ sū́ryo nákṣatrair urv àntárikṣam
stanzas.translation: May the Gods' envoy, sent to many a quarter, proclaim us sinless for our perfect safety. May Earth and Heaven, the Sun, the waters, hear us, and the wide firmament and constellations.

translations.griffith: May the Gods' envoy, sent to many a quarter, proclaim us sinless for our perfect safety. May Earth and Heaven, the Sun, the waters, hear us, and the wide firmament and constellations.

stanzas.sanskrit: शृ॒ण्वन्तु॑ नो॒ वृष॑णः॒ पर्व॑तासो ध्रु॒वक्षे॑मास॒ इळ॑या॒ मद॑न्तः आ॒दि॒त्यैर्नो॒ अदि॑तिः शृणोतु॒ यच्छ॑न्तु नो म॒रुतः॒ शर्म॑ भ॒द्रम्
stanzas.transliteration: śr̥ṇvántu no vŕ̥ṣaṇaḥ párvatāso dhruvákṣemāsa íḷayā mádantaḥ ādityaír no áditiḥ śr̥ṇotu yáchantu no marútaḥ śárma bhadrám
stanzas.translation: Hear us the mouatains which distil the rain-drops, and, resting firm, rejoice in freshening moisture. May Aditi with the Âdityas hear us, and Maruts grant us their auspicious shelter.

translations.griffith: Hear us the mouatains which distil the rain-drops, and, resting firm, rejoice in freshening moisture. May Aditi with the Âdityas hear us, and Maruts grant us their auspicious shelter.

stanzas.sanskrit: सदा॑ सु॒गः पि॑तु॒माँ अ॑स्तु॒ पन्था॒ मध्वा॑ देवा॒ ओष॑धीः॒ सं पि॑पृक्त भगो॑ मे अग्ने स॒ख्ये न मृ॑ध्या॒ उद्रा॒यो अ॑श्यां॒ सद॑नं पुरु॒क्षोः
stanzas.transliteration: sádā sugáḥ pitumā́m̐ astu pánthāḥ- mádhvā devā óṣadhīḥ sám pipr̥kta bhágo me agne sakhyé ná mr̥dhyāḥ- úd rāyó aśyāṃ sádanam purukṣóḥ
stanzas.translation: Soft be our path for ever, well-provisioned: with pleasant meath, O Gods, the herbs besprinkle. Safe be my bliss, O Agni, in thy friendship: may I attain the seat of foodful. riches,
